title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: ...and harmony has been maintained in Equestria for generations since. Hmm... Elements of Harmony. I know I've heard of those before... but where?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Oh, sorry, girls... I've got a lot of studying to catch up on.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: I know I've heard of the Elements of Harmony.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Ow!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Spike! Spi-ike! Spike?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: There you are. Quick, find me that old copy of Predictions and Prophecies. What's that for?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Well, it was a gift for Moon Dancer, but...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Oh Spike, you know we don't have time for that sort of thing.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: But we're on a break!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: No, no, no... no, no, no! [grunts] Spike!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: It's over here!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Ah! Elements, Elements, E, E, E... Aha! Elements of Harmony, see: Mare in the Moon?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Mare in the Moon? But that's just an old ponies' tale.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Mare, mare... aha! The Mare in the Moon, myth from olden pony times. A powerful pony who wanted to rule Equestria, defeated by the Elements of Harmony and imprisoned in the moon. Legend has it that on the longest day of the thousandth year, the stars will aid in her escape, and she will bring about nighttime eternal! [gasp] Spike! Do you know what this means?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: No<U+0097> whoa!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Ow!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Take a note please, to the Princess.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Okie dokie.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: My dearest teacher, my continuing studies of pony magic have led me to discover that we are on the precipice of disaster!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Hold on. Preci... preci...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Threshold.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Threh...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Uh, brink? Ugh, that something really bad is about to happen! For you see, the mythical Mare in the Moon is in fact Nightmare Moon, and she's about to return to Equestria, and bring with her eternal night! Something must be done to make sure this terrible prophecy does not come true. I await your quick response. Your faithful student, Twilight Sparkle.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Twi... light Spar... kle. Got it!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Great! Send it.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Now?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Of course!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Uh, I dunno, Twilight, Princess Celestia's a little busy getting ready for the Summer Sun Celebration. And it's like, the day after tomorrow.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: That's just it, Spike. The day after tomorrow is the thousandth year of the Summer Sun Celebration! It's imperative that the Princess is told right away!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Impera... impera...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Important!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Whoa!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Okay, okay! [inhale] There, it's on its way. But I wouldn't hold your breath...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Oh, I'm not worried, Spike. The Princess trusts me completely. In all the years she's been my mentor she's never once doubted me.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: See? I knew she would want to take immediate action.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: [clears throat] My dearest, most faithful student Twilight. You know that I value your diligence and that I trust you completely.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Mm-hm!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: ...but you simply must stop reading those dusty old books!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: My dear Twilight, there is more to a young pony's life than studying, so I'm sending you to supervise the preparations for the Summer Sun Celebration in this year's location: Ponyville. And, I have an even more essential task for you to complete: make some friends!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Look on the bright side, Twilight. The Princess arranged for you to stay in a library. Doesn't that make you happy?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Yes, yes it does. You know why? Because I'm right! I'll check on the preparations as fast as I can, then get to the library to find some proof of Nightmare Moon's return.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Then... when will you make friends, like the Princess said?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: She said to check on preparations. I am her student, and I'll do my royal duty, but the fate of Equestria does not rest on me making friends.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Thank you, sirs.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Maybe the ponies in Ponyville have interesting things to talk about. Come on, Twilight, just try!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Um... hello?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Well, that was interesting all right.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Yeehaw!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: [sigh] Let's get this over with... Good afternoon. My name is Twilight Sparkle<U+0097>

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Friends? Actually, I<U+0097>

dialog: So, what can I do you for?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1

dialog: We sure as sugar are! Would you care to sample some?

dialog: As long as it doesn't take too long...

dialog: Thanks, but I really need to hurry<U+0097>

dialog: This here's Apple Fritter. Apple Bumpkin. Red Gala. Red Delicious, Golden Delicious, Caramel Apple, Apple Strudel, Apple Tart, Baked Apples, Apple Brioche, Apple Cinnamon Crisp... [deep breath] Big McIntosh, Apple Bloom and Granny Smith. Up'n'attem, Granny Smith, we got guests.

dialog: [snort] Wha..? Soup's on? I'm up, here I come, ahm comin'...

dialog: Why, I'd say you're already part of the family!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: [spit] [nervous laughter] Okay, well, I can see the food situation is handled, so we'll be on our way.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Aren't you gonna stay for brunch?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Sorry, but we have an awful lot to do...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: ...fine.

dialog: Food's all taken care of, next is weather.

dialog: Ugh... I ate too much pie...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Well, she's not doing a very good job, is she?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Nng.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Nnnn.

dialog: [laughter] Lemme help you.

dialog: Let me guess. You're Rainbow Dash.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: The one and only. Why, you heard of me?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: I heard you were supposed to be keeping the sky clear. [sigh] I'm Twilight Sparkle, and the Princess sent me to check on the weather.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Yeah, yeah, that'll be a snap. I'll do it in a jiffy. Just as soon as I'm done practicing.

dialog: Practicing for what?

dialog: The Wonderbolts! They're gonna perform at the Celebration tomorrow, and I'm gonna show 'em my stuff!

dialog: The Wonderbolts?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Yep!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: The most talented flyers in all of Equestria?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: That's them!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Pfft! Please. They'd never accept a Pegasus who can't even keep the sky clear for one measly day.

dialog: Hey, I could clear this sky in ten seconds flat.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Prove it.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: [sounds of exertion] Loop-de-loop around, and wham! What'd I say? Ten. Seconds. Flat. I'd never leave Ponyville hanging. [sheep baaing] [chuckles] You should see the look on your face. Ha! You're a laugh, Twilight Sparkle. I can't wait to hang out some more.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Rrgh.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Wait! It's kinda pretty once you get used to it!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Decorations. Beautiful...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Yes, the d<e9>cor is coming along nicely. This ought'a be quick. I'll be at the library in no time. Beautiful indeed.

dialog: Not the d<e9>cor, her!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: No, no, no, oh! Goodness no.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: How are my spines? Are they straight?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Good afternoon<U+0097>

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Just a moment, please! I'm 'in the zone', as it were. Oh, yes! Sparkle always does the trick, does it not? Why, Rarity, you are a talent. Now, um, how can I help yo<U+0097> [yelp] Oh my stars, darling! Whatever happened to your coiffure?!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: Oh, you mean my mane? Well, it's a long story. I'm just here to check on the decorations, and then I'll be out of your hair!

dialog: Out of my hair? What about your hair?!

dialog: Wait! Where are we going?! Help!

dialog: [wincing] I've... been sent... from Canterlot... to<U+0097>

dialog: Huh?

dialog: Oh, yes, please!

dialog: Gyah!

dialog: No I don't<U+0097> whoa!

dialog: Poor thing, you simply must get into bed...

dialog: Yes, yes, we'll get right on that. Well, g'night!

dialog: Huh. Rude much?

dialog: Surprise!

dialog: Hi, I'm Pinkie Pie, and I threw this party just for you! Were you surprised? Were ya? Were ya? Huh huh huh?

dialog: Very surprised. Libraries are supposed to be quiet.

dialog: Well, that's silly! What kind of welcome party would this be if it were quiet? I mean, duh, bo-ring! Y'see, I saw you when you first got here, remember? You were all "hello" and I was all [deep gasp], remember? Y'see I've never saw you before and if I've never saw you before that means you're new, 'cause I know everypony, and I mean everypony in Ponyville!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: And if you're new, that meant you haven't met anyone yet, and if you haven't met anyone yet, you must not have any friends, and if you don't have any friends then you must be lonely, and that made me so sad, then I had an idea, and that's why I went [deep gasp]! I must throw a great big ginormous super-duper spectacular welcome party and invite everyone in Ponyville! See? And now you have lots and lots of friends!

"Legend has it that on the longest day of the thousandth year, the stars will aid in her escape, and she will bring about everlasting night." I hope the Princess was right... I hope it really is just an old pony tale...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: C'mon, Twilight, it's time to watch the sunrise!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 1
dialog: In just a few moments, our town will witness the magic of the sunrise, and celebrate this, the longest day of the year! And now, it is my great honor to introduce to you the ruler of our land, the very pony who gives us the sun and the moon each and every day, the good, the wise, the bringer of harmony to all of Equestria...

dialog: Huh?

dialog: [muffled] Whoa there, Nelly...

dialog: I did. And I know who you are. You're the Mare in the Moon <U+0096> Nightmare Moon!

dialog: Then what is?

dialog: She said, "Pinkie, you gotta stand up tall Learn to face your fears You'll see that they can't hurt you Just laugh to make them disappear."

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: So, giggle at the ghostly Guffaw at the grossly Crack up at the creepy Whoop it up with the weepy Chortle at the kooky Snortle at the spooky

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: How are we gonna cross this?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Huh?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Excuse me, sir. Why are you crying?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh, give me a break.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: That's what all the fuss is about?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Why, of course it is. How can you be so insensitive? Oh, just look at him. Such lovely luminescent scales.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: And your expertly coiffed mane.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Your fabulous manicure.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: All ruined without your beautiful mustache.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I simply cannot let such a crime against fabulosity go uncorrected.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Rarity, what are you-

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: You look smashing.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh, Rarity, your beautiful tail...

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh. It's fine, my dear. Short tails are in this season. Besides, it'll grow back.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: So would the mustache.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [gasp] We can cross now. Let's go. Ah!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: There it is, the ruin that holds The Elements of Harmony. We made it!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Twilight, wait for us!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: We're almost there. Whoa!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: What's with you and falling off cliffs today?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [sighs] Now what?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Duh.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh yeah.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Who's there?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I ain't scared of you! Show yourself!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Who?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Really?! I mean... Oh yeah, me. Hey, uh, you wouldn't mind telling the Wonderbolts that, would ya? 'cause I've been trying to get into that group for like, ever.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Yep.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Yes.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Yes, [chuckle] it's all true.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: WOOHOO! Sign me up. Just let me tie this bridge real quick and then we have a deal.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Rainbow, what's taking so long? Oh no. Rainbow! Don't listen to them.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: You... Thank you! For the offer, I mean, but I'm afraid I have to say no.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: See? I'd never leave my friends hangin'.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Whoa.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Come on, Twilight. Isn't this what you've been waitin' for?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: The Elements of Harmony, we've found them. Careful, careful!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: One, two, three, four... There's only five!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Where's the sixth?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: The book said: when the five are present, a spark will cause the sixth Element to be revealed.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: What in the hay is that supposed to mean?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I'm not sure, but I have an idea. Stand back. I don't know what will happen.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Come on now, y'all. She needs to concentrate.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Aah!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: The Elements!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Twilight, where are you?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Look!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Come on!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [gasp] Hmph!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: You're kidding. You're kidding, right?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [groan] Just one spark. Come on, come on. Aah!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: No, no!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [gasp] But... where's the sixth Element?!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [gasp] You think you can destroy The Elements of Harmony just like that? Well, you're wrong, because the spirits of The Elements of Harmony are right here.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: What?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Applejack, who reassured me when I was in doubt, represents the spirit of... honesty! Fluttershy, who tamed the manticore with her compassion, represents the spirit of... kindness! Pinkie Pie, who banished fear by giggling in the face of danger, represents the spirit of... laughter! Rarity, who calmed a sorrowful serpent with a meaningful gift represents the spirit of... generosity! And Rainbow Dash, who could not abandon her friends for her own heart's desire represents the spirit of... loyalty! The spirits of these five ponies got us through every challenge you threw at us.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: You still don't have the sixth Element! The spark didn't work!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: But it did! A different kind of spark. I felt it the very moment I realized how happy I was to hear you, to see you, how much I cared about you. The spark ignited inside me when I realized that you all... are my friends! You see, Nightmare Moon, when those Elements are ignited by the... the spark, that resides in the heart of us all, it creates the sixth element: the element of... magic!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Nooo! Nooo!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Ugh, my head.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Everypony okay?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh, thank goodness.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Why Rarity, it's so lovely.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I know! I'll never part with it again.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: No. Your necklace. It looks just like your cutie mark.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: What? Ooh. So does yours.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Look at mine! Look at mine!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Aw yeah.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Gee, Twilight! I thought you were just spoutin' a lot of hooey, but I reckon we really do represent the elements of friendship.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Indeed you do.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [gasps] Princess Celestia.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Twilight Sparkle, my faithful student. I knew you could do it.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: But... you told me it was all an old pony tale.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I told you that you needed to make some friends, nothing more. I saw the signs of Nightmare Moon's return, and I knew it was you who had the magic inside to defeat her, but you could not unleash it until you let true friendship into your heart. Now if only another will as well. Princess Luna!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: It has been a thousand years since I have seen you like this. Time to put our differences behind us. We were meant to rule together, little sister.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Will you accept my friendship?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Whoa!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I'm so sorry! I missed you so much, big sister!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: I've missed you, too.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: [blows her nose] [sobs] Hey, you know what this calls for?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: A party!

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Why so glum, my faithful student? Are you not happy that your quest is complete and you can return to your studies in Canterlot?

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: That's just it. Just when I learned how wonderful it is to have friends, I have to leave them.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Spike, take a note, please. I, Princess Celestia, hereby decree that the unicorn Twilight Sparkle shall take on a new mission for Equestria. She must continue to study the magic of friendship. She must report to me her findings from her new home in Ponyville.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Oh thank you, Princess Celestia! I'll study harder than ever before.

title: Friendship is Magic, part 2
dialog: Isn't this exciting? Are you excited cause I'm excited I've never been so excited, well, except for the time that I went [deep gasp] but I mean really-

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No problem at all, Applejack. I'm glad the goal is lunchtime. All this hard work is making me hungry.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I know, right?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Ooh-wee, Spike. You've been lounging on my back all morning while we worked.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Exactly. You two are taking so long, I missed snack-time.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [stomach grumbles] [laughs nervously] Eh, I guess we better get some food.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Nope. Worm. A-ha!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh Spike, that looks delicious.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Spike.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: It's a letter from Princess Celestia.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [clears throat] Hear ye, hear ye. Her Grand Royal Highness, Princess Celestia of Equestria, is pleased to announce the Grand Galloping Gala to be held in the magnificent capital city of Canterlot, on the 21st day of, eh, yadda yadda yadda, cordially extends an invitation to Twilight Sparkle plus one guest.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Woo-hoo!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [burp] Look, two tickets.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Wow, great! I've never been to the gala. Have you, Spike?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No, and I plan to keep it that way. I don't want any of that girly frilly frou-frou nonsense.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Aw, come on Spike. A dance would be nice.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Nice? It's a heap good more than just nice. I'd love to go. Land sakes, if I had an apple stand set up, ponies would be chowin' our tasty vittles 'til the cows came home. Do you have any idea how much business I could drum up for Sweet Apple Acres? Why, with all that money, we could do a heap of fixin' up 'round here. We could replace that saggy old roof, and Big McIntosh could replace that saggy old plow, and Granny Smith could replace that saggy old hip.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Why, I'd give my left hind leg to go to that gala.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, well in that case, would you like to--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Whoa! [crash] Ugh. Are we talking about the Grand Galloping Gala?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Rainbow Dash. You told me you were too busy to help me harvest apples. What were you busy doing? Spyin'?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No, I was busy napping, and I just happened to hear that you have an extra ticket?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Yeah, but--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: YES! This is so awesome. The Wonderbolts perform at the Grand Galloping Gala every year. I can see it now. Everyone would be watching the sky. Their eyes riveted on the Wonderbolts, but then in would fly Rainbow Dash!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I would draw their attention with my Super Speed Strut.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Then, I would mesmerize 'em with my Fantastic Filly Flash. And for my grand finale, the Buccaneer Blaze! The ponies would go wild!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: The Wonderbolts would insist that my signature moves be incorporated into their routine, and then welcome me as their newest member.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Hold on just one pony pickin' minute here. [spit] I asked for that ticket first.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: So? That doesn't mean you own it.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, yeah? Well I challenge you to a hoof-wrestle. Winner gets the ticket.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Girls, these are my tickets, I'll decide who gets it, thank you very much. Whoever has the best reason to go should get the ticket, don't you think?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Drummin' up business for the farm?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: A chance to audition for the Wonderbolts?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Money t' fix Granny's hip.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Living the dream.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh my, those were all pretty good reasons, aren't they? [stomach rumbles] [chuckles] Listen to that, I am starving. I don't know about you, but I can't make important decisions on an empty stomach, so I'll, uh, think about it over lunch and get back to you two, okay?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: So, who you gonna give the ticket to, Twilight?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I don't know Spike, but I really can't think straight when I'm hungry, so where should we eat?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [crash] Gah! Bats! Bats on my face! Help! Wait, these aren't... tickets to the Grand Galloping Gala?! It's the most amazing incredible tremendous super-fun wonderful terrifically humongous party in all of Equestria! I've always always always wanted to go!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh the Grand Galloping Gala is the best place for me Oh the Grand Galloping Gala is the best place for me Hip hip Hooray! It's the best place for me For Pinkie...

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: With decorations like streamers and fairy-lights and pinwheels and pi<f1>atas and pin-cushions. With goodies like sugar cubes and sugar canes and sundaes and sun-beams and sarsaparilla. And I get to play my favorite-est of favorite fantabulous games like Pin the Tail on the Pony!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh the Grand Galloping Gala is the best place for me Oh the Grand Galloping Gala is the best place for me 'Cause it's the most galarrific superly-terrific gala ever In the whole galaxy Wheee!!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh thank you, Twilight, it's the most wonderful-est gift ever.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Um, actually--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [gasp] Are these what I think they are?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Uh--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Yes, yes, yes! Twilight's taking me to the Grand Galloping Gala in Canterlot.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: The gala? I design ensembles for the gala every year, but I've never had the opportunity to attend. Oh, the society, the culture, the glamour! It's where I truly belong, and where I'm destined to meet him.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Him! ... Who?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Him. I would stroll through the gala, and everyone would wonder, "Who is that mysterious mare?" They would never guess that I was just a simple pony from little old Ponyville. Why, I would cause such a sensation that I would be invited for an audience with Princess Celestia herself, and the princess would be so taken with the style and elegance that she would introduce me to him, her nephew: the most handsome, eligible unicorn stallion in Canterlot. Our eyes would meet, our hearts would melt. Our courtship would be magnificent. He would ask for my hoof in marriage, and of course I would say, "Yes!" We would have a royal wedding, befitting a princess, which is [giggles] what I would become upon marrying him, the stallion of my dreams.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, I simply cannot believe you would invite Pinkie Pie so she can... party, and prevent me from meeting my true love. How could you? Hmph.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Hey!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [gasp] Angel, these are perfect.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Uh, listen guys, I haven't decided who to give the extra ticket to.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Um, excuse me, Twilight. I would just like to ask, I mean, if it would be all right, if you haven't given it to someone else--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: You? You want to go to the gala?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, no. I mean, yes, or, actually, kind of. You see, it's not so much the Grand Galloping Gala as it is the wondrous private gated garden that surrounds the dance. The flowers are said to be the most beautiful and fragrant in all of Equestria. For the night of the gala, and that night alone, would they all be in bloom... and that's just the flora! Don't get me started on the fauna. There's loons and toucans and bitterns, oh my! Hummingbirds that can really hum, and buzzards that can really buzz. White-blue jays, and red jays, and green jays, pink jays and pink flamingos!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Gee, Fluttershy, it sounds... beautiful...?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Wait just a minute.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Rainbow Dash! Were you following me?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No. I mean, yes. I mean, maybe. Look, it doesn't matter. I couldn't risk a goody-four-shoes like you giving that ticket away to just anybody.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Wait just another minute.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Applejack, were you following me too?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No. I was followin' this one to make sure she didn't try any funny business. Still trying to take mah ticket.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Your ticket?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: But Twilight's taking me.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: QUIET!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: And then I said, "Oatmeal, are you craz--" oh.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Girls, there's no use in arguing.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: But Twilight-

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Eh! This is my decision, and I'm gonna make it on my own, and I certainly can't think straight with all this noise... [stomach rumbles] not to mention hunger. Now go on, shoo.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: And don't worry, I'll figure this out... somehow.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I CAN'T DECIDE!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, he just wants to take your order.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh. I would love a daffodil and daisy sandwich.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Do you have any rubies? No? Okay. I'll have the hay fries, extra crispy.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: What do you think, Spike?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I think we have to try another restaurant. I mean, I like grass just fine, but would it hurt anybody to offer some gemstones?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I mean about the Gala and the ticket and who I should take.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh. You're still on that?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Spike, listen. How do I choose? And when I do choose, will the other four be mad at me? I mean, I could give up my ticket and give away two, but that would still leave three disappointed ponies. What if I--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh thank you. This looks so good. I'm sure everything will be much clearer once I eat.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: It's not raining... What's going on?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Hi there, best friend forever I've ever ever had. Enjoying the sunny weather?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Rainbow Dash, what are you doing?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Whaddya mean? I just saw the smartest, most generous pony about to get rained on, so I thought I'd kick a hole in the clouds to keep her dry so she could dine in peace, that's all.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Rainbow, you're not trying to get extra consideration for the extra ticket by doing me extra special favors, are you?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Me? No no no, of course not.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Uh-huh.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Seriously, I'd do it for anypony. [gulp] Heh heh, eh.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Rainbow, I am not comfortable accepting unwanted favors, so I'd appreciate it if you close up that rain cloud right now.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, it's raining.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No, really?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Come with me before you catch a cold.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Heh heh, oops, sorry.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh no, it's quite all right. After all, we are... the best of friends, are we not? And you know what the best of friends do?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Uh...

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Makeovers!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Ugh, Rarity, ow, this really isn't fixing it. I mean, thank you but, ooh, that's too tight.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: There. Oh, you're simply darling.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Uh, yeah, it is kinda pretty, isn't it?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: And you. Oh Spike, I have a dandy little outfit for the dashing gent.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: D-ah, ow, oh, hey, wow, watch it, whoa!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [giggles] Oh, Spike.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Now you just need a hat.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Ugh, I told you, I don't want any part of this girly gala gunk. See you back at the library.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [laughs] Oh, who needs him anyway. This is all about you, and how fabulous you'll look at the Grand Galloping Gala.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Wait, the Grand--

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [gasp] And oh, my goodness, what a coincidence. I happen to have an ensemble of my own that matches yours to a T. We would be the belles of the ball, you and I. Everyone would be clamoring for our attention. All eyes would be on us, and then everyone would finally know, the most beautiful, most talented, most sophisticated pony in all of Equestria is Rarity the unicorn. Ah, [nervous laughter] and Twilight Sparkle, of course.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I see what's going on. You're just buttering me up so I give you the extra ticket. Well it's not gonna work. You're going to have to wait for my decision just like everyone else. Now if you'll excuse me, I've been trying all day just to get some lunch.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Did somepony say lunch?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: You've got to be kidding me!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I got apple pie, apple fritters, apple tarts, apple dumplings, apple crisps, apple crumblers, and apple Brown Betty. Uh, the dessert, not my auntie. What do you say there, best friend?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Is that a yes?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No. No. I don't know who I'm giving the ticket to, and all these favors aren't making it any easier to decide. In fact, I'm less sure now than I was this morning. Ugh!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: So, that's a maybe?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Ugh, I never thought being showered with favors would be so aggravating.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: [gasp] Fluttershy, not you too?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, well, hello Twilight. I hope you don't mind, but we're all doing a little spring cleaning for you.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: It's summer.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, well, better late than never, right? It was Angel's idea.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: You're not doing this for the ticket, are you?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh no, I'm doing this because you're my very best friend. Right, Angel? Oh, yes, we are just doing this for the ticket.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: No, no, no! Well, this was all very nice of you and Angel, but I'm not accepting any extra favors until I've made my final decision, so I'm going to have to ask you to leave.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight is my bestest friend Whoopie, whoopie!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Pinkie...

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: She's the cutest, smartest, all around best pony, pony!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Pinkie.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I bet if I throw a super-duper fun party, party!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Pinkie!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: She'll give her extra ticket to the Gala to me!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: PIIINKIIIE!!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Yes, Twilight?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: At least the other ponies tried to be subtle about the ticket.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Oh, you didn't know? Twilight has an extra ticket to the Grand Galloping Gala!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: What are we gonna do?

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: We're... gonna... run!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Ugh... Warn me next time you're gonna do that.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I didn't even know it was gonna happen. Now quick, lock the doors. Yaaaargh! I can't decide, I just can't decide. It's important to all of you and I just can't stand to disappoint any of you, and giving me gifts and doing me favors won't make any difference, because you're all my friends and I wanna make you all happy and I can't, I just can't!

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, sugar, I didn't mean to put so much pressure on you, and if it helps, I don't want the ticket anymore. You can give it to somepony else. I won't feel bad, I promise.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Me too. I feel just awful that I made you feel so awful.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: And me too. It's no fun upsetting your friends.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, it was unfair of me to try to force you as I did.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Yes! That means the ticket is mine. Ha ha, [sing-song voice] I got the ticket, I got the ticket-- you know, I haven't perfected my signature moves for the Wonderbolts anyway. I don't need that ticket either.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: We all got so gun-ho about going to the gala that we couldn't see how un-gun-ho we were making you.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Spike, take down a note. Dear Princess Celestia,

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: I've learned that one of the joys of friendship is sharing your blessings, but when there's not enough blessings to go around, having more than your friends can make you feel pretty awful. So, though I appreciate the invitation, I will be returning both tickets to the Grand Galloping Gala.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: If my friends can't all go, I don't wanna go either.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Twilight, you don't have to do that.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Nope. I've made up my mind. Spike, you can send the letter now.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Now you won't get to go to the gala either.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: It's okay, girls. I couldn't possibly enjoy myself without my best friends there with me, so I would rather not go at all.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Hgh... hgh... urk... urk...

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Well wallop my withers, Spike. Isn't that just like a boy? Can't handle the least bit of sentiment.

title: The Ticket Master
dialog: Whoa Nelly!

title: Boast Busters
dialog: That wasn't an ursa major. It was a baby, an ursa minor.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: That was just a baby?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: And it wasn't rampaging. It was just cranky because someone woke it up.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Well, if that was an ursa minor, then what's an ursa major like?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: You don't wanna know.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Huh. You may have vanquished an ursa minor, but you will never have the amazing, show-stopping ability of the Great and Powerful Trixie!

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Why, that little...

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Just let her go. Maybe someday she'll learn her lesson. Now, about you two.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Ah [nervous laughter]. Uh, we're sorry that we woke up the ursa minor.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: We just wanted to see some awesome magic.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Yeah! And the way you vanquished that ursa minor was awesome!

title: Boast Busters
dialog: We deserve whatever punishment you give us.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: For starters, you can clean up this mess. And... What do you think, Spike? Should I give them number twenty five?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Oh, twenty five! Yes! And I think I deserve it, too.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: I think you're right.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Dear Princess Celestia,

title: Boast Busters
dialog: I have learned a very valuable lesson about friendship: I was so afraid of being thought of as a show-off that I was hiding a part of who I am. My friends helped me realize that it's okay to be proud of your talents, and there are times when it's appropriate to show them off... Especially when you're standing up for your friends.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: So, you finally admit that you're the most talented unicorn in all of Ponyville?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Well, yeah, but it's nothing to brag about. So, uh, how did it go with Rarity?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Eh, she didn't go for the mustache.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: You know, Spike, that mustache has nothing to do with who you really are. Maybe you should just try being yourself.

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Or... Maybe the mustache wasn't enough. Maybe if I had a mustache and a beard?

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Uh, not this again!

title: Boast Busters
dialog: Okay, imagine me with a nice, long, Fu Manchu type beard. Or maybe a goatee. Oh, no, a soul patch right on my chin!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, goodness. Are you okay?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Are you coughing because there's a carrot stuck in your throat?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Because you need some water?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: [gasp] Because of that giant cloud of scary black smoke? I'll take that as a... yes.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Don't be such a scaredy-pony. It's just me, future Equestria ball-bouncing record holder. Three forty six, three forty seven...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: This calls for a celebration!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, no, Pinkie Pie, this is no time for celebration. This is a time for panic, for--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ooo! I'm going to need balloons! One for every pony in Ponyville!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: There's-- there's smoke. And-- and where there's smoke, there's fire. And--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Let's see, that's one, two, three, four...

dialog: Three hundred fifty four...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Five, six...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Three hundred fifty five, no, wait...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Seven.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Pinkie Pie! Now I have to start over.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: We're all going to have to start over, in a new village. 'Cause ours is gonna be--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Hey, Rainbow Dash, wait up!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, please, this is an emergency. I-I need everypony to--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Listen up! Smoke is spreading over all of Equestria.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: That's what I've been trying to--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: But don't worry, I've just received a letter from Princess Celestia informing me that it is not coming from a fire.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, thank goodness.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: It's coming from a dragon.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: A... d-dragon?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: What in the name of all things cinnamon swirled is a full-grown dragon doing here in Equestria?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Sleeping.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: According to Princess Celestia, he's taking a nap. His snoring is what's causing all this smoke.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: He should really see a doctor. That doesn't sound healthy at all.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Well, at least he's not snoring fire. What are we meant to do about it?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I'll tell you what we're meant to do. Give him the boot. Take that. And that!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: We need to encourage him to take a nap somewhere else. Princess Celestia has given us this mission, and we must not fail. If we do, Equestria will be covered in smoke for the next one hundred years.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Hmph. Talk about getting your beauty sleep.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: All right everypony, I need you to gather supplies quickly. We've got a long journey ahead of us. Let's meet back here in less than an hour.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Okay, girls, you heard her. The fate of Equestria is in our hooves. Do we have what it takes?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Um, actually...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Raaah!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Yaaa!

dialog: [laughter] Oh, I mean, grrr!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ewww! Much better. Onward!

dialog: Let's go!

dialog: All right girls, listen up. I'm mapping out the fastest route, but we've all got to keep a good pace if we expect to make it up the mountain by nightfall.

dialog: M-m-mountain?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: The dragon is in that cave at the very top.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Looks pretty cold up there.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: You bet it is. The higher you go, the chillier it gets.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Good thing I brought my scarf.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ooo! Pretty!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Heh, oh yeah. That'll keep you nice and cozy.

dialog: [gulp] Um, excuse me, Twilight? I know you're busy, but...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Uh-huh. Well, we could go this way.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: But if I could just have a second...

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Uh-huh. No, we want to avoid that.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: So, um, I was thinking that, um, maybe I should just stay here in Ponyville.

dialog: Uh-huh.

dialog: Oh! Good. I'll stay here and--

dialog: I don't think I--

dialog: Oh, and don't worry about your little friends in the meadow. Spike's got it covered while you're gone.

dialog: You can count on me! Oooh! Hey! Hey! Wait!

dialog: I don't really think he's up to the task. Maybe... But... But... no!

dialog: Are you sure you want Fluttershy to come along? I mean, that pony's afraid of her own shadow. She's just going to slow us down.

dialog: Oh, she's just a little nervous. Once we get going, I'm sure she'll be fine.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: All right girls, move out!

dialog: Whoa. What was that?

dialog: That is what it sounds like when a dragon snores.

dialog: It-- it's so... high!

dialog: Well, it is a mountain. I'm going to fly up there and check it out! Wah!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Hold on, now. I think we should all go up together. Safety in numbers and all.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, all right.

dialog: I hear the only thing that sparkles more than a dragon's scales are the jewels they use to build their nests. Ooo, if I play my cards right, I might be able to convince him to part with a few!

dialog: Girls! This is no laughing matter! Fluttershy, you're the expert on wild creatures. What do you think the dragon will be like? Fluttershy?

dialog: Hey! What are you waiting for? An invitation?

dialog: Ooo, I think I have one in my bag!

dialog: I-it's so... so... steep.

dialog: Well, it is a cliff. You could just, oh, I don't know, fly up here?

dialog: Come on, Fluttershy, you can do it. Flap those wings!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ugh.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Uh, we don't have time for this. What are you doing?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I'll need this if I'm going to take her around the mountain another way.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: [groan] Around the mountain? That's going to take them forever.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Don't worry, Twi. We'll be there lickety-split.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Whoo-hoo! I win again!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ugh. That's thirty-five games in a row. Best of seventy-one?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Told you it was going to take them forever.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Your turn, Fluttershy.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: But... it's so... wide.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Come on, Fluttershy, we should be much farther along by now.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: You could just leap on over.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I don't know.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: There's nothing to be afraid of. It's just a hop, skip and a jump. See?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: It's not very far Just move your little rump You can make it if you try with a hop, skip and jump

title: Dragonshy
dialog: We don't have time for this.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: A hop, skip and jump, Just move your little rump, A hop, skip and jump, A hop, skip and jump, A hop, skip and jump, A hop skip and jump, A hop skip and jump!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: O-okay. Here I go. A hop.

dialog: That's it.

dialog: Skip.

dialog: Just don't look down.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ugh.

dialog: I guess I forgot to jump.

dialog: [whispers] Let's keep it down. According to my map, we're entering an avalanche zone. The smallest peep could cause a huge rock slide.

dialog: An... an ava... ava...

dialog: Shhh!

dialog: AVALA--!

dialog: Oh no! Help! Ooh!

dialog: Oh my! [stops coughing] Everypony okay?

dialog: Eugh. Blech.

dialog: Whoo-hoo! Let's do it again!

dialog: Uh! This is why a girl always packs extra accessories. Oh, please tell me I brought the tiara that goes with this.

dialog: Uh, think we got bigger problems than making sure our hair bows match our horseshoes.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: [sigh] Sorry.

dialog: Aw, no big whoop, sugarcube.

dialog: Yeah, we'll just have to [sigh] climb over.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Wha! Wha...

dialog: My apologies.

dialog: Not your fault.

dialog: [sigh] Still think it was a good idea to bring Fluttershy along?

dialog: Rarity and Pinkie Pie, you'll create a diversion to distract the dragon if things get a little hairy in there.

dialog: Applejack, you're ready with the apples in case he decides to attack. But it shouldn't come to that, because Fluttershy will do what she needs to do to wake him up, and between the two of us, we should be able to get him to understand why he needs to go. Is everypony ready?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Okay then, we're goin' in. So, what is the best way to wake up a sleeping dragon without upsetting him? Fluttershy? Oh, come on! Come on! [grunt] We have to do this! [grunt] Now! Every [grunts] second longer that dragon [grunts] sleeps is another [grunts] acre of Equestria that is covered in [grunts] smoke. Ooh!

dialog: I-- I-- I can't go in the cave.

dialog: I'm scared of [mumble].

dialog: I'm scared of dragons!

dialog: But Fluttershy. You have a wonderful talent dealing with all kinds of animals.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Yes, because they're not dragons.

dialog: Oh come on! We've seen you walk right up to a horrible manticore like it was nothing.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Yes, because he wasn't a dragon.

dialog: Spike is a dragon. You're not scared of him.

dialog: Yes, because he's not a huge, gigantic, terrifying, enormous, teeth-gnashing, sharp-scale having, horn-wearing, smoke-snoring, could eat a pony in one bite, totally all grown-up dragon!

dialog: But, if you're so afraid of dragons, why didn't you say something before we came all the way up here?

dialog: I was afraid to.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Ugh.

dialog: All of us are scared of that dragon.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I'm not!

dialog: Almost all of us are scared of that dragon, but we've got a job to do. So, get in there with Twilight and show her what you're made of.

dialog: I-- I-- I just... can't.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, Fluttershy.

dialog: Mr. Dragon.

dialog: Mr. Dragon.

dialog: Oh, good, you're awake. Please allow me to introduce myself. My name is Twilight--

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Augh! Puh! Sparkle, and my friends and I are residents here in Equestria. Ponyville, to be exact. We've come here to ask that you find another spot to take your nap. It's just that you seem to be doing an awful lot of snoring, and every time you do you send out a terrible cloud of smoke. [coughs] Equestria simply can't survive a hundred years in a dark haze. You understand, don't you?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: So much for [coughs] persuading him.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Now what?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: [coughs] Obviously, this situation just calls for a little "pony charm". Allow me, girls. I'm so sorry to interrupt. [clears throat] But I couldn't possibly head back home without mentioning what handsome scales you have. And those scales have to be hidden away in some silly cave for a hundred years?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Personally, I think you should skip the snoozing and be out there, showing them off. Hmm. Obviously, I would be more than happy to keep an eye on your jewels while you're gone.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I was this close to getting that diamond.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: You mean... getting rid of that dragon?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Oh, yeah... sure.

dialog: What in tarnation...?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Darling, you look ridiculous.

dialog: Exactly! Sharing a laugh is a sure-fire way to get someone on your side! Hi!

dialog: Apparently he doesn't like laughing, heh. Or sharing.

dialog: All right, that's it. We tried persuasion, charm, whatever it is Pinkie Pie does.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: It's time to stop wasting time! I'm going in!

dialog: Rainbow, no!

dialog: Heh. Sorry.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Who-o-o-o-o-a!

title: Dragonshy
dialog: How dare you... How dare you! Listen here, mister. Just because you're big doesn't mean you get to be a bully! You may have huge teeth, and sharp scales, and snore smoke, and breathe fire. But you do not-- I repeat-- You do not! Hurt! My! Friends! You got that?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Well?

dialog: And I am very sorry about that. But you're bigger than she is, and you should know better. You should also know better than to take a nap where your snoring can become a health hazard to other creatures.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Don't you 'but I' me, mister. Now what do you have to say for yourself? I said, what do you have to say for yourself?

title: Dragonshy
dialog: There, there. No need to cry. You're not a bad dragon, you just made a bad decision. Now go pack your things. You just need to find a new place to sleep. That's all.

dialog: [pant] I said come back here! Ooh! How does Fluttershy put up with you furry little things?

dialog: Spike, take a letter.

dialog: [sigh] With pleasure.

title: Dragonshy
dialog: Dear Princess Celestia,

title: Dragonshy
dialog: I am happy to report that the dragon has departed our fair country, and that it was my good friend, Fluttershy, who convinced him to go. This adventure has taught me to never lose faith in your friends. They can be an amazing source of strength, and can help you overcome even your greatest fears.

dialog: Twilight! You gotta come see this! She's just five away from a new pony record!

dialog: Dragon!

dialog: [pants] Why are you laughing? That awful dragon is back!

dialog: Pinkie Pie, you scared me! I mean, uh, you... broke my concentration.

dialog: Hmm. Hah! Perfect.

dialog: [spit] Just take the broken limbs down, Rarity. Don't y'all care about nothin' other than prettifyin'?

dialog: Somepony has to. You were making an absolute mess of the town square, Applejack.

dialog: Yeah, well, the storm's gonna make an even bigger mess if we don't prune all these loose branches so they don't tumble down on anypony.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I simply cannot imagine why the Pegasus ponies would schedule a dreadful downpour this evening and ruin what could have been a glorious sunny day.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [sigh] Think more practical-like, will ya? They accidentally skipped a scheduled sprinkle last week, so we need a doozy of a downpour to make up for it, is all.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh no! My wonderfully styled mane shall be ruined!

dialog: Ya shoulda hurried up and finished the job already.

dialog: Oh! Ah! Oh! Ph! It's coming down too fast! Ah! Oh! Oh! Ah! Help me!

dialog: Uh, there. Hunker down to yer heart's content whilst I finish things.

dialog: [pant] Oh, no, no, no!

dialog: What now?

dialog: I prefer not to get my hooves muddy.

dialog: Guh. There is just no pleasin' ya, is there? Everything's got to be just so.

dialog: [scoff] Well, and how does muddying my hooves serve any useful purpose?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Y'all wouldn't know useful if it came up and bit'cha.

dialog: [laugh] That doesn't even make any sense.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Does so.

dialog: Does not.

dialog: Does so infinity. Hah.

dialog: Does not infinity plus one. Heh. What say we go our separate ways before one of us says something she will regret?

dialog: I reckon y'all are gonna say something you'll regret first.

dialog: On the contrary, I believe it shall most certainly be you who says something you will regret first.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I'm not sayin' anythin'.

dialog: Nor am I.

dialog: Y'all just be on yer way, then.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: After you!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Perhaps we should stick together for now and find some shelter.

dialog: Uh-huh, perhaps we should. And fast.

dialog: Heh. Nice and dry under here, sorta.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh! Unacceptable.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Applejack! Rarity! Applejack! Rarity!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Come inside girls, quick.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Whoa, nelly. Is inside a tree really the best place to be in a lightning storm?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: It is if you have a magical lightning rod protecting your home like I do. Come on in!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hah! We are most grateful for your invitation.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Thank ya kindly for yer hospitality.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Uh, do be a polite house guest and go wash up please, won't you?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [grumble] If I gotta spend one more second with that fussbudget Rarity today, I can't be held responsible for what I'm gonna do.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Some storm, huh? The Pegasus ponies sure have outdone themselves this time. I hope you and Applejack don't have any trouble getting home.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: It may indeed be a problem.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Well, you're welcome to stay if need be. Spike is away in Canterlot on royal business. I'm home all alone tonight. [gasp] You and Applejack should totally sleep over! We'll have a slumber party! I've always wanted one of those.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh! Uh, goodness. Uh, I do believe I have another engagement scheduled for this evening that completely slipped my mind until just now. [nervous laugh] Ah, silly me, I can't possibly stay here all night -- with Applejack. [reading] Slumber 101: All You've Ever Wanted to Know About Slumber Parties But Were Afraid to Ask.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: My own personal copy. It's a fantastic reference guide. You should see the table of contents. I've been waiting for a chance to use it, and today is the day! This is gonna be so great!

dialog: [gasp] What in tarnation... Now wait just a goll-darn minute. Ya make me wash the mud off my hooves, but it's okay for y'all to have mud all over yer faces?

dialog: Silly! This is called a mud mask. It's to refresh and rejuvenate your complexion.

dialog: We're giving each other makeovers! Eee-hee! We have to do it, it says so in the book.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Slumber 101: Everything You... Oh hey, heh, would'ja look at the time. I gotta skidaddle on home quick. I'm powerful late for, uh, fer somethin'. Uh, g'night. [cry] Or maybe I'll sit here for a spell.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hurray slumber party!

dialog: Blahch. What in the world is this for?

dialog: [sigh] To reduce the puffiness around one's eyes, of course.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hee-hee! Isn't this exciting? We'll do everything by the book, and that will make my slumber party officially fun.

dialog: Did you hear that, Applejack? You certainly would not want to do anything that would ruin Twilight's very first slumber party, would you?

dialog: Of course not, 'n you wouldn't either, I reckon?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: So do we have an agreement?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh! Gross! You know, there's messy and there's just plain rude.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: You know, there's fussy, 'n there's just plain gettin' on my nerves.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Fortunately, I can get along with anypony, no matter how difficult she may be.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh yeah? Well, I'm the "get-alongin-est" pony you're ever gonna meet.

dialog: That's not even a word.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: This is going to be the bestest slumber party ever! Yay!

dialog: So, how are you getting along over there, Applejack?

dialog: Just fine, Rarity.

dialog: This is so awesome! [giggle] Makeovers, check. Ooh, it says here we have to tell ghost stories. Who wants to go first?

dialog: Me! I'd like to tell y'all the terrifying tale of the prissy ghost who drove everypony crazy with her unnecessary neatness. Oo-oo! I'm sure y'all are familiar with that one?

dialog: Never heard of it, but I have a much better one. It's the horrifying story of the messy, inconsiderate ghost who irritated everypony within a hundred miles! Oo-oo!

dialog: That's not a real story. You made it up.

dialog: It is a ghost story, they're all made up.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I've got one! This story is called The Legend of The Headless Horse. It was a dark and stormy night, just like this one. And three ponies were having a slumber party, just like this one...

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: ...and just when the last pony thought she was safe, there, standing right behind her, just inches away was--The Headless Horse!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ghost story, check. Now, who wants s'mores?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ooo!

dialog: [sigh] You could at least say excuse me.

dialog: Aw, I was just about to, but you interrupted me. Pardon.

dialog: S'mores, check. Now the next item of fun we have to do is Truth or Dare.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I dare Applejack to do something carefully and neatly for a change.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh yeah? Well I dare Rarity ta lighten up and stop obsessin' over every last little detail, for a change.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I think the truth of the matter is that somepony could stand to pay a little more attention to details.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: And I think the truth is somepony oughta quit with her fussin' so the rest of us can get things done.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Um, I don't think this is how the game's supposed to work. You have to give an honest answer to any question or do whatever anypony dares you to do.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I dares you to step outside and let your precious, tidy mane get ruined again.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: You have to. It's the rule.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hah!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Okay. I dare Applejack to play dress-up in a frou-frou, glittery, lacey outfit.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [gasp] Happy?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Um, do I ever get a turn?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I dare ya to enter the next rodeo when it comes to town.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I dare you not to enter the next rodeo that comes to town.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I dare ya to not comb your mane a hundred times before bed.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: And I dare you to comb yours just once.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I, uh, I think we should check off Truth or Dare and move on. Let's see what our next fun-fun-fun thing is, shall we? Hm, what does this mean? Pillow fight?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh, I get it! Pillow, fight! Fun! Ugh. Ah. Uh, girls? Maybe we should take it down a notch?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I will if she will.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [gasp] She started it.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [spit] Maybe we should just call it a night and get some sleep?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Keep your muddy hooves on your side of the bed.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: My hooves ain't muddy.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: They were. There might still be a little on them.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: There ain't. See?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Eww!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Now who's bein' inconsiderate?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I have to make the bed again so the blanket will be right. Get up.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hey!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ah ah ah! You'll ruin it. You have to do it like this. Mm, uh, ooh, u-u-u-uh, uh, ah.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Yeah, that's not gonna happen. Geronimo!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hey!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ah.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: You did that on purpose.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Um, yeah?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Get up so I can fix it again.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: M-mmm!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I ain't budgin'.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: You will if you want any blankets.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Give it back!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I will not!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Yes, you will!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Won't!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Will!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Won't!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Will!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Won't!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Will!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Enough! It says right here that the number one thing you're supposed to do at a slumber party is have fun, and thanks to you two I can't check that off!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I've been tryin' my darndest to get along.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: No, it is I who have been trying my best.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: No, it was me.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: No, it was I.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Me!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I hope you're happy, both of you. You've ruined my very first slumber party. The makeover, the s'mores, Truth or Dare, the pillow fight... I mean, is there anything else that could possibly go wrong?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Sorry I asked.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ya see? That's why we needed to take down all those loose branches in town, not spiffy 'em up.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: But I--

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Outta my way, missy! Time's a-wastin'.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Wait! Stop! Don't!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: No waitin'! No stoppin'! Doin'! And that, my friends, is what we call gettin' 'er done.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [cries] I tried to tell you it would come crashing down in here.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Well, ya shoulda tried harder. [sigh] I'm mighty sorry, Twilight.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: It's... Well, it's not okay. There's a giant tree branch in the middle of my bedroom, and the book doesn't say anything about having a giant tree branch at your slumber party. Or at least I haven't found that entry yet. Ooh... ah!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: What in tarnation are y'all doin' over there?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Cleaning up this mess somepony made. Who was that again? Oh, right, that's you.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: We gotta do somethin'!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Baking... BFFs... Brothers... There's nothing in here about branches.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [grunts] Rarity, for pony's sake, stop sweatin' the small stuff and help me get rid of this thing! I said hussle over here and help me! Look, I'm sorry, all right?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: What was that?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I said I'm sorry! I shoulda listened to you when you noticed where this here branch would end up. Yer annoyin' attention to detail would'a saved us from this whole mess. But right now, ya need to stop bein' so dang fussy pickin' up all the little things and help me move the one big thing in here that actually matters! Please!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Uh. Uh, but I'll get all icky.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Consarnit! What the... eh... you... I mean, yes, ickiness is often a side effect of hard work. But y'all need to get over it, on account I just can't fix this mess I made myself. I need your help.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh. Let's do this.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Well, they do have a section about backyard slumber parties. Is that what we're doing right now? Does this count as camping?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: U-ugh. Oh, I look awful.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Better?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Hmph, thanks.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh, pretty! Where did these come from? They're not in the book either.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Is it bigger than a barn?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [laugh] Nope.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Is it smaller than a saddle?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [laugh] No! Only three of your twenty questions left!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [sigh] We're never gonna guess what you're thinkin' of, it could be anythin'.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are we getting warmer?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Why? Is it too cold in here for you? I can turn up the heat.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: She means are we gettin' any closer with our guesses?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh! No. And that technically counted as a question, so only two more left!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Is it... a six-legged pony with a purple polka-dotted mane and shootin' stars comin' out of his eyes?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Who flies through the air all over the world to hide magic, sparkly eggs?

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: That's it!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: No. [chuckle] It's that. But it was just so nice to see you two finally getting along, I wanted you to be able to win together.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: See? We could have been having fun like this all along.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: If only somepony hadn't been so persnickety.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Well, maybe she wouldn't have been if somepony else hadn't been so sloppy.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Sorry for being such a pain in the patootie.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh, no, I'm sure I was much worse.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: That's kind of ya to say, but I'm the one who's sorry.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Oh, I'm much more sorry than you are.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Ugh. Are not.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are too.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are not!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are too.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are not.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Are too.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: I declare my first slumber party a success!

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Have fun, check.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Now take two steps to your left. Uh, no, my left.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: [laughter] Sorry.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: Dear Princess Celestia,

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: It's hard to believe that two ponies who seem to have so little in common could ever get along. But I found out that if you embrace each other's differences, you just might be surprised to discover a way to be friends after all.

title: Look Before You Sleep
dialog: So, who's up for another slumber party tomorrow night? Ugh. How about a week from Thursday? Oh, how about two weeks from Saturday? A month from now?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Wow, what a gorgeous day!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Rainbow Dash must have gotten up early for once and cleared all the clouds away.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: I bet all of Ponyville is going to be out enjoying the sunshine. What? Where is everypony?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Is it some sort of pony holiday?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Not that I know of.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Not more than usual.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Is it... zombies?!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Uh... not very likely.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Not likely... but possible?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Psst! Twilight! Spike! Come here! Come! Here! Hurry! Before she gets you!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Who?! The zombie pony?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Z-Zombie pony?!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Spike! There are no zombie ponies. Pinkie, what are you doing here alone in the dark?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: I'm not alone in the dark.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [gasp] Okay then, what are you all doing here in the dark?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: We're hidin' from her!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Did you see her Twilight? Did you see... Zecora?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Apple Bloom! I told you never to say that name.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Well, I saw her glance this way...

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Glance evilly this way.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: ... And then a bunch of you flip out for no good reason.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: No good reason? You call protectin' yer kin no good reason? Why, as soon as my sister saw Zecora ridin' into town, she started shakin' in her lil' horseshoes.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [shakily] Did not!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: So I swept her up and brought her here.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: I walked here myself!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: For safe keepin'.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Applejack, I'm not a baby! I can take care of myself!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Not from that creepy Zecora.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: She's mysterious.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Sinister.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And spoooooky!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Will you cut that out?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Just look at those stripes! So garish!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: She's a zebra.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: A zebra, and her stripes aren't a fashion choice Rarity, they're what she was born with.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Born where? I've never seen a pony like that in these parts, 'cept... her!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Well, she's probably not from here, and she's not a pony. My books say that zebras come from a faraway land. But I've never seen her in Ponyville. Where does she live?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: That's just it, she lives in... the Everfree Forest!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Spike!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Uh, sorry.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: The Everfree Forest just ain't natural. The plants grow...

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Animals care for themselves...

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And the clouds move...

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And that wicked enchantress Zecora lives there doing her evil... stuff! She's so evil I even wrote a song about her!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Here we go...

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: She's an evil enchantress She does evil dances And if you look deep in her eyes She'll put you in trances Then what will she do? She'll mix up an evil brew Then she'll gobble you up In a big tasty stew Soooo... Watch out!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Wow. Catchy.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: It's a work in progress.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: This is all just a lot of gossip and rumors. Now tell me; what exactly have you actually seen Zecora do?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Well... Once a month, she comes into Ponyville.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [dramatically] Oooooh.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Then, she lurks by the stores.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [dramatically] Oh, my.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And then, she digs at the ground.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [dramatically] Good gracious! [normal tone] Okay, I'm sorry. But how is any of this bad? Maybe she comes to town to visit?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Yeah! Maybe she's just tryin' to be neighborly.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And maybe she's not lurking by the stores, maybe she's going to them, lurk free, to do some shopping?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Yeah! Everypony likes to shop. You know what I think?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Apple Bloom! Hush and let the big ponies talk.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [under breath] I am a big pony!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: W-what about digging at the ground? You've got to admit that's weird.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: What if she's digging for innocent creatures?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: I am sure there is an explanation for everything Zecora does. And if anypony here were actually brave enough to approach her, she would find out the truth.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: You ponies are being ridiculous!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Well, I heard that Zecora eats hay.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Pinkie, I eat hay; you eat hay!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Yeah, but I heard it's the evil way she eats hay.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Hey! Where's Apple Bloom?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: The door's open.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: She went outside!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And Zecora's still out there.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [sigh] That silly lil' filly! I told her to stay put!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Spike, you stay here in case Apple Bloom comes back.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Will do!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Apple Bloom?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: You get back here right now!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Beware! Beware, you pony folk! Those leaves of blue are not a joke!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Y-you keep your creepy mumbo-jumbo to yourself, ya hear?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: [sighs] Oh brother.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Beware! Beware!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Yeah, back at ya, Zecora! You and your lame curse are the ones who better beware!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: And you! Why couldn't you just listen to yer big sister?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Who knows what kind of nasty curse Zecora could have just put on you?

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: You guys, there's no such thing as curses!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Well, that's interesting to hear coming from Miss Magic Pants herself.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: My magic, real magic, comes from within. It's a skill you're born with. Curses are artificial, fake magic. It's conjured with potions and incantations; all smoke and mirrors meant to scare. But curses have no real power, they're just an old pony tale.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Just you wait, Twilight. You're gonna learn that some pony tales really are true.

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: She's an evil enchantress, she does evil dances!

title: Bridle Gossip
dialog: Beware! Beware!
