dialog: Ooh, can't forget to capture all these memories for Granny's album! Huh. Nothin' all that memorable there. Or there. Or there. C'mon, Applejack, think. You gotta kick this thing up a notch! Hm...

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: I get that my big sis wants this to be like a super-awesome reunion, but that was ridiculous!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: I thought we'd never get a minute to just hang out!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: And your minute's up! Your fellow Apples are waitin' for you to join them.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Applejack, I haven't had any time with Babs! We were so busy with that obstacle course, we didn't even get to talk!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: There'll be plenty of time to bond with Babs when we do the hayride.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Hayride?

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Alright, everypony! Step right up, take a seat, and leave the drivin' to these stallions! Now, I know y'all've been workin' real hard makin' some awesome memories. And in all of our past reunions, we always had a nice and relaxin' hayride around the farm. Which is why I decided to change things up a bit, and try somethin' just a wee bit more excitin'. So let's get this show on the road! Giddy-up!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Where in the world does that girl have us headed? The west orchard?

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Eeyup.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Wowza! Never seen real fruit bats before!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Uh-oh.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Everypony! Jump out!!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: [crying] Ruined. Everythin' is ruined.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh, Granny. I'm so, so sorry.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh, it's alright, child.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: But it's not alright. Just look at this! The barn and all my plans for the perfect family reunion are completely destroyed!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Maybe that's a good thing.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: How can that possibly be a good thing?

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Applejack, you had us so caught up in all the doin', we haven't had a second to enjoy the company of the folks we've been doin' it with!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Really?

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: [sighs] Oh, Granny Smith, here you let me be in charge of creatin' great memories, and the only thing anypony's gonna remember about this reunion... is that it was the worst one we ever had.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh, hey now... everypony's still here, ain't they? Still plenty of time to make good memories! You've just got to give everypony a chance to actually make 'em.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: The family photo! Guess we can't take it in front of the barn this year... unless... Everypony! I have one more activity!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Applejack...

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Trust me, Granny Smith. This'll be one we'll remember for all the right reasons.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Yee-hoo!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Come on, Apple family! Let's get to it! Wee-hoo!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Raise this barn, raise this barn One, two, three, four Together, we can raise this barn One, two, three, four

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Whoo-whee!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Raise this barn, oh, raise this barn One, two, three, four Together, we can raise this barn One, two, three, four

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Come on, Apples! Get 'er done!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Look at us, we're family

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Workin' together thankfully

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: We Apples, we are proud to say

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Bow to your partner, circle right Get down if you're scared of heights Forward back and twirl around That barn's gonna be the best in town

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Yee-haw! Attagirl!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Alright, let's get to it!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Take your brushes, young and old Together, paint it, bright and bold Turn 'em round quick by the left elbow Grab a new partner, here we go

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Yeah!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: I can't wait for the next reunion!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Me neither!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: I mean, obviously we have to get together before then!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: [chuckles] Obviously.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh, you did it, Applejack! You put on a reunion that everypony will remember!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Just had a couple minor hiccups along the way.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Yeah, just a couple.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Ohohoh, that's a good one.

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Oh!

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Dear Princess Celestia,

title: Apple Family Reunion
dialog: Today I learned a great lesson about family, which, if you think about it, is really the first group of friends you ever make. Turns out that when you're with folks you care about, you don't have to do much to make that time memorable. Even the simplest of activities can take on a whole lotta meanin'! And you'll find that you'll remember the "who" long after you've forgotten the "what".

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Huh. That's not that many.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Are you kidding? How are you supposed to read twelve books in one weekend?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Princess Celestia obviously thinks I can or she would never have assigned them to me. I'm not planning on letting her down.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, I hope you're not planning on sleeping then, either.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Actually, Spike, why don't you take the day off?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Really?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Why not? These books are gonna keep me busy for a while.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Hmm... I do have a long list of things I've been dying to do!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: "Touch nose with tongue." Eeeng... done! "Play bongos on my belly."

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Done! "Smell my dirty feet." [sniffs] [sigh] Done! Huh, that didn't take nearly as long as I thought it would.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What to do, what to do...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [gasps] A hot air balloon ride!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [gasps] Oh no! Wait! Runaway balloon! Gah!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [groans] Sorry!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [relieved sigh] That was a close one. I-if I didn't know better, I would swear that I was in the middle of the dark and scary Everfree Forest.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Come 'n' get me, ya big goons! [to Spike] Run!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I'm running! I'm running!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whew!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wow, Applejack! That was amazing! I mean, you rocketed those boulders at them like they were... rockets! Pow, pow, pow pow pow! You saved my life! [softly] You... saved... my life.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Aw, don't mention it, Spike. C'mon, we should be headin' on back, now.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Man, am I lucky you were out here. Uh, why were you out here?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Saw the balloon floatin' by with nopony in it, came out here to investigate. Guess you did too, huh?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh... yeah... I was investigating the runaway hot air balloon too! So, uh, now that the mystery's been solved, let's get outta here, huh?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Thanks for walkin' me home, Spike. That was mighty kind of you. But now I have chores that need tendin' to, so see you later.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What chores? I'll do them!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That's sweet, but you don't have<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's the least I can do! You saved my life! I need to repay the favor.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Shoot, Spike, that's what friends do for each other. You don't need to repay the favor.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yes, I do!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sugar, it's okay, it's not necessary.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Applejack, you don't understand! This is something I really need to do!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, I'd hate to get in the way of doin' somethin' you need to do...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Great! What should I do?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh... Apple Bloom's over yonder givin' little Piggington a bath. I was gonna lend her a hoof, but maybe you could lend her one instead.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: On the double!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Applejack said I could help you!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Great! I could use all the help I can get!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Heh, wait 'til Applejack sees how you sparkle!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ta-da!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Good job, you two.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Applejack, is it okay if I get goin'? I don't wanna be late for my Crusaders meeting. We're gettin' fitted for water skis!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Heh, you definitely don't wanna be late for that.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Water skiin' cutie mark, here I come!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Spike, you can head on out too. I reckon you have repaid me in full so we are officially even Steven.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What? Ohhh no. We aren't even close to being even Steven! Please, Applejack, you must allow me to assist you further!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I dunno, Spike. Just don't feel right to have you, uh, doin' things for me.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Please?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Really, you don't<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Pretty please?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's just not necessary<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Pretty pretty pretty please?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sigh] Oh, all right. You can help Granny Smith and me bake some<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Pies! Pies! I'm helping Applejack make some pies!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh, Spike, little feller, could you get us some more eggs?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh, oops, sorry, Applejack. Lemme get something to clean that up!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] Appreciate all your help today, sugarcube, but... I can take it from here.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Don't be ridiculous! It is my honor and my duty! Today's just the beginning!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What's that now?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You saved my life! [belches] According to the "Spike the Dragon Code", I owe you a life debt and must serve you.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Now, what about Twilight? Doesn't she need your help and such?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [breathes fire] Huh, you're right. I better break the news to Twilight. I just hope she doesn't take it too hard... Be right back!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Come on, Spike, this is your personal, moral, ethical dragon code we're talking about! You have to do this! It's not like you and Twilight won't be friends anymore... but it won't be the same... but it has to be done. Twilight, Applejack just saved my life from horrible, dragon-eating timberwolves!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Mm-hmm...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And, as you are aware, I adhere to my dragon code, and this means I must serve her for the rest of my natural born days! I'm sure you understand.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Mm-hmm...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's... been an honor... being your faithful assistant.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sounds good.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: She said it was okay.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: So, with Twilight's blessing, I'm free to follow my code and serve you until<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, until forever!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Listen, sugarcube, I completely respect your "dragon code"... Truly I do, but I just can't cotton with you permanently servin' me.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Please, Applejack, my dragon code is a part of me! I have to be true to myself! If you don't let me do this, I won't be a noble dragon anymore!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, well, I can't have you feelin' like you're not a noble dragon now, can I?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Great! Then from here on in, your wish is my command.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, uh, okay... I would like you to... hmm... huh... oh! ...Help me take some of the pie you made to...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Rarity?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh, sure, why not?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I helped bake it.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Eugh.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You even look good when you're chewing... [laughs nervously] W-who looks good when they're chewing?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Aren't you gonna have some more?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I... had a big lunch!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's ten in the morning.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Breakfast. A big breakfast.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ohhh. Okay.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Maybe you could take her plate back to the kitchen and wash it off?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: As you wish!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What was that all about?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] I saved Spike from some timberwolves in the Everfree Forest, and now he thinks he has to serve me forever.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [delighted squeal] Oh, what I wouldn't give to have somepony forever in my debt! I'd get them to organize my closets, and give me pedicures, and help me with my sewing and<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Okay, I get it, havin' somepony to do things for you would be a dream come true. But I don't feel right havin' Spike thinkin' he owes me somethin'. You tasted that pie. Sometimes, his help isn't that helpful.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Do you... have a broom I could borrow?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: AJ, Rarity, what's happening?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Applejack saved Spike's life and now he has to serve her forever.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sweet! What are you having him do? Wash your laundry? Clean your room? Help you with your unfinished novel? Mine's about this awesome Pegasus who's the best flyer ever and becomes the captain of the Wonderbolts!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sarcastic] How ever did you come up with that ingeniously woven intricate plot line?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Just came to me.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Thing is, I don't really want him to serve me forever, but I don't know how to get him to stop.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That's easy! Just make him help you with something really, really hard.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I dunno. I don't want him to get hurt.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Puh-lease. He'll quit way before there's even a chance of getting hurt!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [hushed, to Applejack] Leave this to me. [to Spike] Sooo, Spike, Applejack was gonna help me stack some hay so I could practice smashing through it, but I'm feeling extra, extra powerful today.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You are?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, I am. So instead of hay, I'm gonna smash through rocks!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Rocks?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah! A huge tower of rocks! And you're gonna build it!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I am?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, I mean, unless you don't wanna help Applejack...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I do! It is Spike's dragon code!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Then get to it! [to Applejack] Trust me. This is gonna work like a charm!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Huh. I was sure he'd give up after, like, three rocks.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, goodness. If it'd been me, I'd have just pretended I didn't have anything for him to do.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Why didn't I think of that?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [yelling] Is this high enough?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That's plenty high! Come on down, Spike!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Bad news: He actually ended up building the whole rock tower. Good news... [nervously] I've got a rock tower to knock down.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Haha, yeah! You can do it! Haha, hahah, alright, yeah!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That... was... awesome!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wanna do it again, Rainbow Dash? Applejack can rebuild it for you. And when I say "Applejack", I of course mean me!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [dazed] Sure! Why not...?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No! I mean, I don't think Rainbow Dash needs any more of your help. My help. She doesn't need it. Right, Rainbow Dash?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Bbbbrrr. Yeah. I guess I'm good. For now.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And so am I! I just can't think of one more thing I need help with, so you don't have to do anything else.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: W-What do you mean you can't think of anything else I can help with?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Exactly that! There's nothin' else. I don't want you to do anything.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: If I don't help you, how will I know I'm a noble dragon?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, I<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Maybe there's things you need help with, but you don't even realize you need help with!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: If she needed help, I think she'd realize it.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Maybe not! Maybe Applejack needs help realizing what she needs help with. Like... maybe your back itches!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Huuuuh... that does feel... good...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [laughs] See? Or you might need help remembering your favorite song! "The dragon is the finest creature ever, there's more to him than just guarding treasure..."

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I don't think that's her favorite s<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Or... you might need help breathing!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Breathin'? I certainly do not<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: See? There are plenty of things I can help you with, and you don't even have to trouble yourself with thinking of them!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No, I'll think of 'em. Lemme think of 'em.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: As you wish.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Twilight? Twilight, are you there? Twilight!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Agh!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sorry, I didn't mean to scare you.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] No, it's okay, I need to take a break anyway. What's going on?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I know Spike told you that he was gonna follow his dragon code, and serve me forever for savin' him from the timberwolves, and that you were okay with it, but<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wait, what?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: He said he told you all about it. I'm guessin' maybe you were a little distracted when he told you.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Um, maybe a little...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I should've realized you wouldn't have let him go so easily. Well, now that you know what's goin' on, maybe you could talk some sense into him!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, Applejack, I wish I could, but this is dragon code we're talking about. Surely you know how important the dragon code is to a dragon!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I sure am startin' to.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Hm, there's only one other way Spike is gonna fulfill the debt he feels he owes you.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Seventy, seventy-one, seventy-two, seventy-three, seventy-four, seventy-five...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: All right, y'all, here's the deal. Spike needs to save my life.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And you want us to shoot you out of a cannon towards a hornet's nest and give Spike a butterfly net so he can catch you mere seconds before you hit the nest and are stung by a thousand angry hornets! I'll wear this mustache.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No. I am gonna be attacked by a timberwolf!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Can I still wear the mustache?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: When I give the signal, Pinkie Pie and Rarity will come runnin' out of the woods, bein' pursued by the timberwolf. I'll start to run too, but then pretend to get my hoof stuck. I'll ask Spike to help me dislodge it, and he will, and I'll be able to get away from the terrifyin' timberwolf! Havin' saved me from certain doom, Spike will then consider us even. Everybody get it?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I'll do my best.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Mm-hmm.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Just one question.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yes? [beat] No.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] Suit yourself.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [clears throat] We are all ready to play our parts, ahem, but are you sure you are ready to play yours, Applejack?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What d'you mean?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Show us your best "damsel in distress" move.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh... Oh, well, aheh, how's this? Hooooooo.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Absolutely horrendous! Okay, this needs some serious work! Now, first, you must lift your foreleg up to your forehead, like so<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [in distance] Applejack?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No time! Here he comes! Uh... over here, Spike!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [pants] You said you had something else you needed me to do?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, yes, I, I was just hopin' you could maybe, uh, sweep up all those leaves for a compost pile, and<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But of course. Oh, by the way, there are exactly twenty-four million, five hundred and sixty-seven thousand, eight hundred and thirty seven blades of grass at Sweet Apple Acres.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I can't believe you counted every single one of 'em...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You asked me to.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And, as a noble dragon and follower of my dragon code, I<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That was very convincing!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [screaming] Timberwolf! [sobbing] We are doomed!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [to Applejack] See? Like that.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [unconvincingly] Oh no! I seem to have got my hoof caught in between two rocks! I cannot run away! I am a damsel in distress! Help me, Spike!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wait a minute.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No, no, don't wait a minute. Save me from the terrifyin' timberwolf!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, he would be terrifying if he wasn't a fake! You got the clomping on his claws...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...The roar was spot on, and the detail on his face is pretty good. But you forgot one thing: his breath! You could smell a real timberwolf's breath from a mile<U+0096> [sniffs] [laughs] Too late, I'm already on<U+0096>

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Timberwolf!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Timberwolf!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whooooah!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ow!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh oh... Applejack, come on!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [grunting] I can't! I'm really stuck!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No more messing around! Let's go!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [grunting] Come on...

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Forget it, Spike! You gotta get out of here! Would you just forget your dragon code already and go?!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No! I have to save you!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What happened to you guys back there? Thought you were right behind us!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: My hoof was stuck, and that timberwolf was coming right at me!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wait, you were actually stuck?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Uh-huh!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But Spike picked up a pebble, and rocketed that thing right at the huge timberwolf's mouth, and saved my life!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Aw, it was nothing.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It was somethin' alright! 'Course, I wouldn't've needed help if I hadn't been tryin' to stage a fake timberwolf attack in the first place.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, what was that all about?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] I know this code thing's important to you, but if somethin' like this comes up in the future, think maybe we can go back to my code, say "that's what friends do" and leave it at that? I promise I won't think of you as any less noble.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sounds good to me. But, maybe let's just try to avoid situations where one of us actually needs the other one to save their life?

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You got yourself a deal.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Thanks, Spike.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Happy to help!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Don't know what I'd do without you.

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No, really! I'm really really really happy to help you!

title: Spike at Your Service
writer: Merriwether Williams; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [laughs] Oh...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I love it when Princess Celestia comes to Ponyville! I got my hooves shined just like Rarity for the occasion. Ya like?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I certainly do!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I'm surprised she's not here yet.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [sighs] I wonder what's taking so long?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And where are Applejack and Fluttershy?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy's detained helping Applejack with a mishap at Sweet Apple Acres. They'll be along.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: But, I still don't get why the Princess would be so late.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: She's bringing an important visitor. That could be part of it.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: A visitor who's important and slow.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Maybe it's somepony so terribly important, she still had many more terribly important things to do before she got here.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [gasp] Maybe the visitor has a deer antler, a goat leg, a bat wing, and a snake tail!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Yeah, right. That's Discord.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Why in the wide, wide world of Equestria would Princess Celestia bring along someone like that?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: M-m-maybe you should ask... her!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Huh?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: With all due respect, Princess Celestia, how could you bring Discord here?! [clears throat] Your majesty.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I'm fully aware that the last time Discord was here, he created serious havoc.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: If by "serious havoc" you mean "turning Ponyville into the chaos capital of the world"...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: ...and tricking us all into being the opposite of our true selves...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And making yummy delicious chocolate milk rain all over the place without a single dollop of whipped cream to go with it anywhere in sight! Not a single dollop!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Yes, I understand. But I have use for Discord's magic if it can be reformed to serve good instead of evil. This is why I've brought Discord here, because I believe that you are the ponies who can help him do just that.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: This will never work! This is a disaster! How will we ever control him?! We're doomed!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Need I remind you that you are the ponies who turned him back into stone like this in the first place?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I suppose we can just use the Elements of Harmony against him again if it gets out of hand.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Uh, w-w-we probably need a volunteer to run away from here right away to get them. I'll do it!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: No need, Spike. I have them right here, and I've cast a spell so Discord can't take them and hide them again. Now where is Fluttershy? I believe she may know best how to begin reforming Discord.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy? Really?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: What's he goin' on about now?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Good news. Mr. Beaverton Beaverteeth has agreed to take his dam apart and move it.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Well, it's about time. My apple trees are so waterlogged, I can practically hear 'em gargle!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: But he says first you'll have to apologize for calling him "a nuisance".

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Apologize? He's lucky I didn't call him a varmint!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [gasps] Mr. Beaverton Beaverteeth! Such language!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fine, fine. I apologize.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [sighs] Thanks, Fluttershy. Don't know what I would've done without you.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Glad I could help.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hey, slackers! Double time it on over to Ponyville, would ya?! We're all waiting on you!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I realize that this is a tall order, but I wouldn't ask if I weren't confident you could get him to use magic obediently of his own free will.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And... you really think I'll know best how to do that?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I do. Now, I must return to Canterlot for Equestria's royal summit. You may release Discord when ready.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Okay, ponies, guess it's time to get started. Let's just hope this releasing spell works.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Or... let's not.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: We'd best keep our elements on at all times 'til further notice.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: What do you think you're doing?!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [gasps] Make that bunny cute again! Now!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh... [sniggers] He's adorable the way he is.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [blows raspberry] You know what else is adorable? You ponies truly believe that you can reform me, and that you're putting your faith in this one here to make it happen. Makes me wanna pinch your little horsey cheeks...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: How'd you know about that?!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Being turned to stone doesn't keep me from hearing every word Celestia says. Although I admit it makes rolling my eyes a challenge.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Well, unless you want us to turn you back to stone, you'll zap those animals back the way they were, pronto!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, you wouldn't dare turn me back to stone and risk disappointing your precious princess.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Try us, "Dip-cord"!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You think you can treat poor defenseless animals like that and get away with it?!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You go, Fluttershy!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You'd best watch your step, buster, or I'll give you... the Stare!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: If it turns out we need to use our elements against you, I'm sure we can convince Princess Celestia it was for a good reason!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, dear.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: He may be horrible, but that doesn't mean we have to act the same way. We should at least try to be hospitable. [to Angel] You don't mind giving up your favorite spot on the couch, do you, Angel Bunny?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, I'm sorry about Angel. Are you alright?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, yes. Thank you, Fluttershy, for your concern. If only your pony friends could be as considerate...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Don't listen to him, Fluttershy! He's just trying to drive a wedge between us like he always does.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Now why in the world would I ever try to do a thing like that?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: So we can't unite and use the Elements of Harmony against you, that's why!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I never thought of that...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You big liar!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Now, look who's a liar. Anyone can plainly see that I'm not big at all.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I can't watch...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: We'll be outside.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You sure you're okay with this?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I know it's not gonna be easy, but Princess Celestia's counting on me. And... I think I actually know what to do.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You do?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I think the key is to befriend him. Being kind to him and letting him be my house guest is probably the best way to do that.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And you really think that'll work?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I think it's worth a try.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Okay, but if you need us, all you need to do is whisper "help", and we'll be back here with our elements. [to Discord] So watch that goat-legged step of yours, pal!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Wh-what?! Look at me! I'm practically reformed already.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: She's really alright with him staying there?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: That's what she said.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Personally, I think we should come up with a backup plan, in case this whole "befriending" business doesn't work out.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Rainbow Dash is right. This is Discord we are talking about, girls. It wouldn't be a bad idea to have another trick up our sleeves.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And I think I know just the trick.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Discord? Oh, there you are. Listen, Discord, I just want to make sure you know that if there's anything I can do to<U+0096> uh, umm, are you eating... paper?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Well, um... I'm just heading out, so you just make yourself at home while I'm gone.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Buh-bye, have a nice time! Everything is fine here. Bye bye... Bye bye...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You like carrots, Angel? I'm playing your owner for a fool! [laughs] How d'ya like them carrots?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: That's weird. The spell I had in mind isn't in here. Spike, where are the other books I asked you to pull?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Right here, Twilight.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I really want to have a reforming spell up and running pronto.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: But what if he makes the Elements of Harmony disappear like he did last time?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Princess Celestia cast a spell protecting them, remember? Uh-oh.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: What's wrong?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [eating] Are you sure this isn't overdoing it? You said to make myself at home while you were gone, but I wouldn't want to overstep my bounds.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Nngh... I did say that, so... if this makes you more comfortable... by all means, please feel free.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh. Well, it does, very much so. You're so very kind, my dear Fluttershy. I always knew that you were the understanding one, not like those nasty friends of yours.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [gasps] My friends aren't nasty!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy! Fluttershy, can you hear me?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Goodness! I hear Twilight!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy, what's going on? Are you okay?!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: We're fine. Everything's going great. Isn't it, Angel?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: We've come to get you away from Discord! He's just terrible and, from the looks of it, completely out of control!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, but you're wrong! We're making great progress!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I'm earning his trust by giving him a little space to be himself.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hate to break it to ya, but he used that "space to be himself" to tear out all the reforming spells from the library!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: That does explain the paper eating...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: He ate them?! Ugggghhhh!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: But we aren't gonna need a spell. He's already really considering being reformed! He said so.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: And you believed him?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: If I'm going to be his friend, I have to start by giving him the benefit of the doubt! Tell you what. Bring all the ponies over for a dinner party this evening, and I'll bet his manners will have really improved by then. I'll even get him to put the cottage back on the ground first.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [sighs] Alright. Dinner it is.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Ugh, I can't believe we're having a dinner party with Discord!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: This evening is sure to be a disaster. Glad I didn't bother wearing my fanciest outfit.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy thinks this is the way to reform Discord and asked us to give it a chance.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, our pony guests! [upper class voice] We're so delighted that you've come. Please, do come in.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: See what a beautiful job he did helping? Discord set the entire table himself. I'm so proud.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: May I take your... [clears throat] hats, ladies?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hang on to your elements, girls. It's gonna be a bumpy night.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: As you all know, Princess Celestia hoped we'd help Discord use his magic for good instead of evil.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Pinkie Pie, care for some gravy?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You bet!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Allow me.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, what a cute little gravy boat you are! Yes you are! Yes you are!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: That's one creepy little gravy boat if you ask me.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, come on now, Dashie. You're not even giving this a chance.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hey! That's hot!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Whoops! [chuckles] I'm so sorry!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: He did that on purpose!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, well, I don't know about that. Mistakes happen. Oh, look, everypony, dancing candles!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I'm not falling for that! Discord's just trying to distract us from<U+0096>

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [grunts] Hey! Knock it off! I suppose that's another "mistake"?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: No, I think you just made them mad.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: There's something fishy going on.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Discord?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Well, it's hardly my fault if the soup tureen finds the term "something fishy" to be offensive.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Not the dress! Not the dress!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: That tureen's only doin' what you're makin' it do!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Now let's not jump to any conclusions.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy! Can't you see what he's doing? He's playing innocent with you so you'll never agree to use the Elements of Harmony against him!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, well, that's a bit harsh, isn't it?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You see what I'm saying, right, Fluttershy? Fluttershy!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You know what I see? I see that Discord's far from perfect, but I also see none of you giving him a chance!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: What's gotten into you?! Why do you keep cutting him so much slack?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Because that's what friends do.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: We're friends?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Why, of course! I can't remember my house ever being this lively before you came along.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh... Well, I've... never really had a friend before.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Well, now you do!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Now is not a good time, Angel. We're having a dinner party.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hold up! I-I think he's tryin' to tell us somethin'!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, oh, oh! Sweet Apple Acres?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Flooding at Sweet Apple Acres! And we all know who's behind that now, don't we?!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Who, me?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, give it a rest! What do you think of your "friend" now, Fluttershy?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I've never seen the floodin' this bad! They've built dams 'round here before, but never like this! What's goin' on?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [gasps] Such language! [sighs] It's no use. They won't listen to a word I say!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You see Discord's behind all this, right?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, of course I do! Do you all think I'm a silly, gullible fool?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I've just been trying to gain his friendship any way I can, so he'd come to trust and listen to me!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Hey there, Fluttershy, you want a turn? The water's great!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Time to see if it worked.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Fluttershy, oh, there you are. A sight for sore eyes.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: As you can see, there's a big mess down here at Sweet Apple Acres.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, yes. Awful business, that. Mm.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: It is awful. This is Applejack's home, and it's being destroyed by innocent creatures who would never be acting this way if it weren't for your reckless behavior. You need to fix this.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, yes, very well, I will fix it. I only ask one thing in return.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Yes?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I ask that you never use your Element of Harmony against me. As a sign of our friendship.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I will never use my Element of Harmony against you.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Discord! That's not fixing it! Why, I oughta...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Where are you going? What's wrong, pal?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Don't call me your pal!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Oh, pfft, come skating with me, and we'll let bygones be bygones.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Here you go, Fluttershy! Game on!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: He fixes this or he goes back to being stone! Princess Celestia will understand!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I made a promise not to use my element against him, and I'm going to keep it.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [growls] Not. Your. Friend!

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Who cares? I can do whatever I want, whenever I want. I'm Discord, the master of chaos! You think you can boss Discord around? You think I'm just going to turn all this back because you say so? Because if I don't, I'll lose the one friend I ever had? [pause] Oh. Oh. Well played, Fluttershy. Well played.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: I like it better my way, but... I guess when you're friends, you can't always have things exactly your way all the time, eh?

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Yes, Princess, I'm ready to use my magic for good instead of evil. [under his breath] Most of the time.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Congratulations on your success, ponies. I definitely sense a big change in Discord. [to Twilight] I'll leave the Elements of Harmony with you, Twilight. Just in case.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: You were right when you said Fluttershy would be the one to find the way to reform Discord. By treating Discord as a friend, she got him to realize that friendship was actually important to him. And something that, once he had, he didn't want to lose.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: Go on. Say it...

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: [groans] Alright. [quickly] Friendship is magic.

title: Keep Calm and Flutter On
writer: Dave Polsky; story by Teddy Antonio
dialog: See? He can be a real sweetheart once you get to know him.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Who are you hooing at?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I know, they're delicious.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Now you see 'em, now you don't. [chewing] [belches] Mm! [singing] This is how you make a jewel cake: stir in some gems, and then you bake. [chewing] Mm-hmm! Gonna, eat, eat it up! Gonna<U+0096> [gasps] What happened to all my jewels?! [drums claws] I had a bowl full of them here, and now I don't! Which means somebody took 'em!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Who? That's what I'm asking, who?! Who took my jewels?! Oh. I'm who. This cake was gonna be so good! Why? [thump] Why?! [gulps] Whyyyyyyyyy???!!!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [singing] I have no jewels... I have no cake... I'm a sad little dragon... With nothing to<U+0096>

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: ...is it?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh! Oh goodness, I-I hope I'm not interrupting anything.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Well... I do have this cake to not bake...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh... sorry, it's a bad time.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Uh, inside joke. Talk to me.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: It's just that... Princess Cadance needs us to do a great job welcoming the Head of the Equestria Games when she visits the Crystal Empire tomorrow<U+0096>

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, I know all about that. As if I wouldn't be any help at welcoming...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, I don't know what was I thinking. Of course you might be upset for not being invited, and... here I am coming to ask you for a favor. You were probably going to say no anyway. All I had to offer you in exchange was one little jewel.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: What was that?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [yelps] All I have is this jewel.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [slurp] That's a really big one. A really big, juicy, perfect-for-a-cake-topper jewel.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Does this mean you'll do it?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Yeah... Sure...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, thank you, thank you! So while I'm gone, you'll take care of Angel, and tomorrow is Tuesday, which is his tail-fluffing day, and it's really important for him to look good.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Wait, what? You want me to take care of him?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, well, yes. But if it's too much trouble, I can always see if there is somepony else.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Uhh... We already agreed on the whole jewel thing, so I'll just...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Thank you, thank you, thank you! Angel, aren't you just so excited?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: See you tomorrow.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: You know... She's not the only pony with a pet that might need some watching...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: All I'm saying is, if Fluttershy thought that her beloved little friend shouldn't be left alone while you're busy in the Crystal Empire, then maybe that's just something to think about.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Tch! Tank's not some fuzzy little bunny. He can take care of himself.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: He's a strong, fearless, and totally together pet.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Alright. You can watch him, but only because... uh... Tank's got a strict flying regimen, and-and someone needs to make sure that he doesn't slack off while I'm gone.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: You know... the two of us are very diligent.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Okay, whatever.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Yes, yes, more importantly, as for Opal, she likes to eat every thirty six and a half minutes, you groom her with her silken brush, head to toe...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: ...Oh, and don't forget to pooch her pillow out in the middle, that's where she likes it. And the temperature in the room should always be exactly eighty one point four degrees. That's the only way she can get to sleep.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: And, um... hmm... oh, good, so thanks for your help and good luck to you.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: A-hem... I think the dragon was expecting a little something for his efforts.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Almost as beautiful as the pony who gave it to me...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Shouldn't you be critter-proofing the library or something? Tank has a tendency to<U+0096>

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Critter-proofing. Yeah, I'll get right on that. [chuckles] Three down, three to go.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: What's that you said, Gummy? Uh-huh. Well, you're just gonna have to ask Pinkie Pie about that one.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Ask me, ask me!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Go ahead, ask her!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Of course you can have another cupcake! Mm? Mm-hm? Yeah? Why didn't you say so? I'll get you a bigger pond immediately.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I think what Gummy's trying to say is<U+0096>

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I think what Gummy's trying to say is that he'd like a little Spike time.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Who wouldn't?! Spike time is the best!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Alas, it doesn't come cheap.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: All I'm saying is you might wanna think about a helmet. You only want to get hit in the head by a flying turtle... once.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: A thousand plus carats of pure deliciousness...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Looks like you got a regular pet day care in here, Spike. You'll still be able to get some good play time with Winona like you said though, won't ya? She tends to get a little wild if she doesn't get her exercise.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Exercise. Sure, of course.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Whoa!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I don't remember seeing critters on the invite list.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: That's 'cause we're leavin' them here with Spike. He's gonna do a little critter-sittin' for us.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, really?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: So sorry I'm late. Silly bunny had hidden his brush. Be sure you get plenty on his tail, or it won't get as poofy as he likes it.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: No, no no no. I love you more. No, I love you more! I love you more!!!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, I promise it'll be okay. I'll fluff your tail twice next week. Three times?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Oh, I know. It's a chilly eighty one point two in here. Spike, take care of this, would you please?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: You got it! So, uhh... What are you thinking about that hooting little friend of yours? Suppose you want me to keep an eye on him too.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: That would be nice. You sure you don't already have your hands full?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Nah, pshaw. I'll be fine. But, uh, just between you and me, I gotta give priority to the... paying customers.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [sigh] You absolutely sure you can do this?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Of course. Wouldn't have agreed to it if I couldn't. Piece of cake. Speaking of cake, I got a little something I need to attend to.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Yeah, like keeping an eye on a house full of critters.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [slurp] Uh, yeah, uh, that was totally what I was talking about. Relax. Go to your welcoming thing in the Crystal Empire. Spike's got it all under control.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Alright, sidekicks, front and center!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: There are six of you, but there's only one right here in front of me... Gah! Two! And what I say goes!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Spike, the boss of you, that's who. One, two, three! Nngh, come on, number four!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Whoa! Guh...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: One, two, three, four, five... Argh, who's missing?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Angel.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: All I wanted were some jewels. Big, juicy, delicious jewels. Now what do I have? A missing rabbit and<U+0096>

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Awww, little fluffy Angel Bunny-kins! You're so cute! The natural weaves in his fluff are to die for!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Isn't Angel just the cutest thing you've ever seen?!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [to Angel] Look, you don't wanna be with me. I'd rather not chase you around all over the place when I could be enjoying some jewel cake. Watch me solve both of our problems. [to the Cutie Mark Crusaders] Y'know, I'm supposed to be watching him, but you all have just hit it off so well that maybe, maybe I could let you take care of him instead.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: We would, but we've got some major Crusaders business planned for today!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Major. We're getting our skydiving cutie marks today!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Ha! Yeah!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Well, I suppose, if you've got other plans... It's just, you're so good with them. Like get-a-cutie-mark-for-bunny-sitting good?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: A bunny-sittin' cutie mark...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: That would be adorable!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: He does seem to like us.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: And we haven't exactly figured out how we're gonna pull off this whole skydivin' thing.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: You know what? As hard as it's gonna be for me part with these little guys, I think you should probably just take all of them. If you ask me, nngh, the more critters you take care of, the more chances you have of getting some kind of critter-sitting cutie mark. Am I right or am I right?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Sure!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Yes!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: But wait! How're we gonna take good care of them without treats for when they're good?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: And we'll need beds for when they're tired!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: And toys! They need toys!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: It's an afternoon. They don't need all that stuff. They'll be fine.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: We need to be able to buy them some things! One jewel might be able to cover it all.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Uh... what would I possibly be doing with jewels?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I happen to know for a fact that Applejack gave you a gem to watch Winona, which means...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Obviously, no one around here is getting a cutie mark for kindness toward a poor, hungry little dragon. Take it or leave it.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: We'll take it.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [singing] Gonna put in some flour, and add a little sugar for my five de-li-cious jewels!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [muffled] But pink feathers would look so good with your eyes!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Meh... that bird could use a little color.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [muffled] Has anyone seen Tank's head? Where's his head?!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: What have you done to the turtle?!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Ohh, I totally forgot he could do that. Heh.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Yeah, so, pretty sure critter-sittin' cutie marks are out.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: And our critter-grooming cutie marks probably aren't going to appear anytime soon either.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [groans] Alright, load 'em up. And you can gimme back that jewel I gave you.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Sorry, we don't have it anymore.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: What? Why not?!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: How do you think we paid for the industrial-sized pet hair dryer?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [groans] Oh.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Zecora knows just what to do about all this bad mojo that's floating around you.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I'm thinking a cage and a great big lock might be next.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Zecora can take the bad away if you do just what I say.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Really?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: But before I can do my duty, I am going to need some of your booty.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [sighs] Where are you going?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: You think jewels are what you need, but there's no worse mojo than dragon greed.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Almost there...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: [suspiciously] Mm-hm...

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Just taking good care of everyone's animals. What am I gonna have to do to get this to go away? [sighs] And this is just between you and me, right? No other pony has to hear a word about it?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: A word about what now?

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: This better be important.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Angel.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: All I need is to get on for one minute, grab a bunny, and get off! Promise!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Skydiving cutie marks!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Is three ponies enough? [sighs] At least I have you two left, my delectable little treasures.

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: Crystal Empire?!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I've always wanted to see the Crystal Empire!

title: Just for Sidekicks
dialog: I wish I were dressed for it, but still... [squealing] THE CRYSTAL EMPIRE!

title: Just for Sidekicks
