title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Who, me? It probably got lost in the mail. No biggie, as the foals say. Well, gotta go!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: But we haven't had any of our Tuesday teacakes.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Well, I guess we're just going to have to exclude them from our party this time. Oh, did I say that out loud? I mean, ta-ta.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [snoring] Gemstones... [snoring] Gah!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Where's Twilight?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Uh, she's in Canterlot, helping Princess Celestia with the Gala!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, your first Grand Galloping Gala! The excitement, the anticipation! I wouldn't miss this for all the jewels in Equestria!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Hey!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I don't suppose that, uh, these adorable little cutie pies have their own tickets to the Gross Gruesome Gala, do they?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Ahem! To answer your rather rude question, they're going as our dates, our plus-ones.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [singsong] We're plus-ones!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [singsong] We're plus ones! We're plus-ones!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Yes, yes, yes, I believe I got that!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Yeah!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Have a wonderful, special, fantastic day! Oh, hi, Discord. Want some cake?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I can give you a list of all the flavors we have in order of most delicious to incredibly, unbelievably delicious!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Actually, Pinkie Pie, who are you taking to... I mean, do you... eugh, oh, you know what? I am famished. I'll take all the cakes.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: All of them?! He wants all of the cakes!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Well, I'll need all my energy when I'm dancing at the Gala, if I decide to go that is. Oh, by the way, are you bringing anypony?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, of course! I was gonna ask my mom, because she's, you know, my mom, but it turned out she didn't want to go, so I started asking around and around and around, and I couldn't think of anypony, and I was about to just go by myself, and I realized, of course! Who loves fancy exciting affairs more than anypony else? My sister Maud!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You know what? Cancel my order.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You want none of the cakes now?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [laughing] Oh, my, you are funny!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I guess every being in Equestria is funny today.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, how rude of me. Tree Hugger, this is Discord. Discord, Tree Hugger.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: My vibe?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: It's a compliment.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, well, I'm sure it is. Well, I must be off.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Have fun at the Gala!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: "Oh, Tree Hugger. You're such a great friend. So much funnier than unfunny old Discord!"

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: "No, no, here. Take my plus-one. I insist. Before somepony else thinks he's my friend and expects to be asked instead. What's that? You're worried Discord might be upset?" Not a problem! I can make more new friends anytime I want. It's not as if any of this actually mattered! I don't even want to go to the Gala anyway!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Are you perhaps looking for me?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: My ticket to the Grand Galloping Gala! I was invited after all!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [grimly] Why is this so late?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I must say, it's been very nice having you take over some of the planning responsibilities for this year's Gala.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Anything I can do to make it easier on you.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Thank you, Twilight. I am quite looking forward to just enjoying the Gala for once.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Good evening, everypony! What a glorious affair!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: He does have a yen for shiny things, the rascal.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I'll take care of this.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [hushed] What are you doing here with... that?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Now, now, now. The Smooze may be an "it", but it's an it with a heart of, well, blob.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: This night is extremely important to me, Discord. [through gritted teeth] Keep it under control!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Yes, yes, yes, of course. Tell me, have you seen Fluttershy anywhere?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: We're here! We're here! We made it to the Gala!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Wow.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, Fluttershy. I didn't see you there.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: How did you even know to look for an aura on a waterfall?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Discord! I thought you weren't coming!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: No. I actually never said that. But funny how you remembered it that way. Anyway, good to see you. Tree Friend, is it? Your name is slipping my mind right now. How strange.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You've gotta be kidding. You don't remember me?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Yes, well, as I was saying, it's just great to be here with my oldest, bestest friend.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Am I really your oldest, bestest friend?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You? [laughs] Of course not! You think I don't have other friends? I'm centuries old! I was talking about the Smooze! Smooze Face, the Smoozinator <U+0096> well, I mean that's what we called him back in college. Smooze! I would like you to meet Fluttershy and, um, hmm... Tree... how'd you say it... Tree Embrace?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [giggles] I can't believe I've never heard you speak of the Smooze before. Sounds like you two are so close.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Well, I'm glad you got that, because that's what is true. We are.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Very close.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: That's wonderful! The four of us should go out to dinner sometime!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: We should all go out to dinner sometime?! Have you no heart?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, oh! It looks like somepony wants to mingle. We'll be back in a bit.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, okay. Treezie and I would love to talk to you more later!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Treezie? Really? Sort of a juvenile nickname, don't you think?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Smoozie! Wait up!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Now, listen, Smooze. I need to make this a party of one for a little while. Just stay out here until I come for you.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Exactly!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Uhh... I think we're gonna go hit the dance floor.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Fluttershy, tell the Hugs here about the time that we went to the store and came back with two cakes instead of one, because that's how crazy we are when we're together.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Um, we went to the store and bought two cakes.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh. Well, you kind of left out all the fun and frivolity there. But I'm sure you got it, Tree Hugger.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: We like each other. That was the point! I'm actually pretty lukewarm about cake.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [muffled screaming] Let me in!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [gasps for breath] That creature took my jewels!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Discord! I thought I told you to keep your friend under control!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, please. I have better things to do than to watch that thing all night. [laughs nervously] What I mean to say is, that thing is a dear, dear friend, and I'll make sure that the ooze, uh, that he can't help but secrete doesn't get on anypony else.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Thank you. It's alright, everypony. Let's just get back to enjoying this magical evening!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [to the Smooze] You are making me look like a fool in front of Fluttershy. I'll be back when the Gala is over.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [laughing] Oh, Tree Hugger, I've never known anypony as funny as you!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Check, check, check. Is this thing on? Good evening, fillies and germs! I just flew into Canterlot, and wow, are my interspecies parts tired!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I've only got these tiny mismatched wings, and even I can fly better than Twilight Sparkle! Am I right? Pchoo!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Hey!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [laughs nervously] Uh, well, perhaps you're into more observational humor.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Did you ever notice how you always materialize out of thin air? Why not thick air? What's the deal there?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Tough crowd.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: What is he doing?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I think they're... jokes?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Maud! Jokes!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: My favorite.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: [muffled and out of focus] You might be a Ponyville pony when an ordinary night on the town ends in a lesson about friendship! [in focus] Knock knock!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You're supposed to say "Who's there?"! This is the most basic of jokes!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You're the most basic of jokes.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Good one, Maud!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: What is that?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: None of my magic works on this ooze! Can you stop it?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I'm afraid not!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Discord, how could you bring him here?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, he's not that bad!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, my shoes will be ruined forever!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: That's what you're worried about? Really?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Isn't it, though? And to think, it would never have happened had I come to the Gala as somepony else's plus-one.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You don't know anything about rare creatures. I've known Smooze Face for ages. He's not agitated. He's partying down! Whoo!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Do you even know what you just said?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: It worked!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Way to go, Tree Hugger!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: That was the most magical thing I've ever seen done with animals!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Stop it! Stop it! That's it! I'm done with you, Tree Hugger!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: A skosh? A skosh?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Relax. I'm not going to hurt you. I'm simply going to send you to another dimension. I can't have you interfering in my relationship with Fluttershy anymore!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Discord, stop!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Don't worry, Fluttershy! We'll stop him!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I'm doing her a favor, Fluttershy! It's a lovely dimension! White sand beaches, attentive wait staff... I mean, okay, the humidity isn't great, but where isn't that the case these days?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I don't understand why you're doing this! We were all getting along so well!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: As well as we could, considering you've already stomped all over our friendship by inviting her to the biggest night of the year as if I didn't matter at all!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Did you really think I'd abandon you just because I have a new friend?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Yes, because that's what you did!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: No, Discord! I invited a friend to a party! I didn't abandon you! What if you had a friend that you could discuss chaos-based magic with? Would that mean we weren't friends anymore?!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Uh... [stuttering] No, I suppose not. It would just mean that I'd have different friends for different things... Oh, oh, dear, it looks like I've perhaps overreacted just a skosh.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: More like a lot of skoshes! Tree Hugger, could you give us a minute?

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I'm just so new at this whole friendship thing. It's so much more complicated than it looks.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Do you think maybe you owe somepony an apology? Not me!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Er, Tree Hugger, I'm sorry that you got caught in the middle of my... er, you know... wrath.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Oh, your chakras. [laughs nervously] Fair enough.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I owe you an apology, Smooze. I spent the whole evening thinking about my own feelings and never thinking about yours.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Well, friends! I think I may actually grow to like this multiple-friend thing.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I like it too.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: Hey, it's not a party until somepony spreads magic-resistant ooze uncontrollably over the ballroom! [squee] Come on, Smoozinator! Let's dance!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I'm sorry, Princess Celestia. I thought I could give you a break tonight, but it turns out I was in over my head.

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: You have nothing to apologize for. This has been the most fun Gala in years!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I know, it was a<U+0097>What?! But there was ooze all over the place! And one of the guests threatened to send somepony to another dimension!

title: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
dialog: I know! Can you imagine how dull it would have been if I hadn't invited Discord? Come on! Whoo! The night is still young!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: La, la-la, la-la! La, la-la, la-la, la la-la la-la! This is gonna be so great, Gummy! We have absolutely nothing to do today except bake! I've been waiting for just the right time to finally try Granny Pie's super-special triple-chocolate, fifteen-layer marjolaine recipe! It's gonna be amazing!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Let's see. Nutty meringue, chocolate ganache, praline and nuts, cocoa-flavored buttercream...

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: An hour per layer <U+0096> that's fifteen hours of pure baking bliss!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Okay, Gummy, I think we're ready to start prepping the second layer!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Oh, my gosh! My cutie mark! [gasps] You know what this means?! [hushed] The map!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, Gummy? Could you take over for a bit? Hopefully this'll be quick. I'll just measure the baking powder for you... [squee] ...and when the first layer cools, you can drizzle some of the ganache over it. And don't forget to beat the egg whites for the meringue!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: This is so exciting. The map is summoning you to Griffonstone, the very heart of the griffon kingdom! I don't know if either of you have read "Bygone Griffons of Greatness", but griffons were known to be<U+0097>

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Rude, insensitive bullies?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You mean Gilda?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Yeah, I mean Gilda! When she came to Ponyville, she was a total jerk to all my friends, especially Pinkie Pie!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: She was a bit of a party pooper.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Mm-hmm.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: So, maybe Gilda was a little rude. You still get to go to Griffonstone, and according to this book, it has a rich, fascinating history! [narrating] In ancient times, griffons were known to be as greedy as dragons, always hoarding their bits and other treasures. But all that changed when King Grover found the mysterious golden Idol of Boreas. Legend says the Idol of Boreas was made from the dust of golden sunsets, blown across the mountains by the north winds. Possessing the Idol of Boreas filled the griffons' hearts with pride. It's said that that one great treasure is responsible for turning Griffonstone into the most majestic kingdom of all the land.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: And why do you care so much about griffons anyway?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: It was actually Gilda's visit that made me curious. So I picked up "Bygone Griffons of Greatness", and I've been hooked ever since! And now... [sigh] Now you two get to see Griffonstone with your very own eyes.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Huh? Just me and Rainbow Dash?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hey, you can totally take my place if you want. [yawn] I still have half a nap to finish.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Why don't you just come with us? I mean, you are the Princess of Friendship.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No, no, if the map wanted me to go to the coolest kingdom in all of Equestria and tour the palace and see the actual idol that unites an entire species, which would be super amazing, I'm sure it would've said so. You two can handle whatever the issue is just fine. I'll stay here and do important princessy things. I guess.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well then, come on, Dashie! We're going to Griffonstone!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [sigh] Fine...

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Whatcha reading, Rainbow?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [sighs] Twilight literally wrote a book on what we need to do in Griffonstone.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You mean like a guide on how to figure out what problem we're supposed to fix?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: And then some. It's like Twilight herself in book form. [imitating Twilight] "Always carry plenty of bits. The griffons are sure to help you as long as you share the wealth."

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [swallows] Uh, can I borrow some bits?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [voiceover] Upon arriving in Griffon Gorge, be sure to pause and cast your eyes northerly, up the Hyperborean Mountains, taking in the breathtaking beauty of Griffonstone. Once in Griffonstone proper, go immediately to the palace and introduce yourself to the king. "Bygone Griffons of Greatness" was written a long time ago, and it ends with the coronation of the fourteenth king of the griffons, King Guto. I have no idea who's in charge now. Tell the king you've been sent by the Princess of Friendship, and you're there to help with some sort of problem. If for some reason the king can't help, I'd try the Griffonstone library next. It's a little known secret that if you befriend a librarian, you can usually find out anything. Plus, as a bonus, there's a statue of King Grover outside! [giggles] Photo op! And don't forget to sample some famous griffon scones. They're supposed to be the best.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Aw, Twilight should've come along! Then she could see first-hoof that Griffonstone is...

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: ...a total dump!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Ugh. Maybe the map should've called Rarity instead of us.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Excuse me, sir? This is Griffonstone, right?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, that wasn't very nice.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: See? These griffons are exactly like I'd thought they'd be.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Maybe we should just find the palace so we can ask the king what's going on.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: We don't have a king, losers.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hello, Gilda.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Dash.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Pinkie!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What are you doing here?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, I'm a griffon? What's your excuse, dweebs?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hey! These 'dweebs' are here to help Griffonstone!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Help it what?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well... we're not really sure! But it involves a map and our cutie marks and a problem, and<U+0097>

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Bored now!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well if you don't have a king, could you at least tell us where the Idol of Boreas is?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Ha-ha! Don't tell me you really believe in that thing.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Oh, great. Now you got Grampa Gruff started!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [tearing up] That was the saddest story ever!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No wonder Twilight's book ended with the coronation of King Guto. Who would want to record a history that sad?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: It's not sad! Do we look sad to you?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Pinkie, I think I know why the map sent us here. We need to find the Idol of Boreas and bring glory and pride back to Griffonstone!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Ha-ha. Here we go <U+0096> typical pony hero complex. None of us care about that dumb old idol. Don't you get it? We don't care about anything, and that's the way we like it!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: I think Rainbow Dash is right! The map sent us here to fix some sort of problem!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: The only problem Griffonstone has is you!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, I don't care what she says. We're gonna find that treasure, make Griffonstone cool again, and get back to Ponyville! Come on!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Wait, Rainbow Dash. What about Twilight's advice?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What, taking a bunch of pictures?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: She mentioned finding answers at the library.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Knock yourself out. But when you get bored with Twilight's tour book, I'll be at the Abysmal Abyss finding the Idol of Boreas.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: I'm here to find your missing idol and save Griffonstone!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, I'll need some rope, a grappling hook, and a guide to take me down to the Abysmal Abyss.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hey, Gilda! Word on the street is that Griffonstone has an amazing library chock-full of answers!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Word on what street?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Okay, maybe not this street, but on other streets, your library is the talk of the town.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: The library's right there, so why don't you go inside and leave me alone?!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [gasps] Maybe it's good that Twilight didn't come... [to statue] It's sad what happened to your town, King, but Rainbow Dash can't be right. This can't all be because of a missing hunk of gold. [as King Grover] You are right, Pinkie! And you've got amazing hair! [normal] Aw, King Grover, you old charmer!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [gasps] I know what Griffonstone needs!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Fewer ponies?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Can't sing here!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: But how do you break into uplifting musical numbers with no singing?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Yeah, that's Griffonstone's biggest problem <U+0096> lack of uplifting musical numbers.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well if I can't sing, how about a party? If there's one thing these griffons need, it's a good cheer! Where's your party store?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No party store? Uh, how about cake? Nothing cheers folks up like cake! Where's a bakery?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Ugh.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No singing, no party store, no bakery?! What is this place?!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You're welcome to leave [suddenly yelling] at any time!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, that just takes the cake. Wait, no! It can't take the cake 'cause there is no cake! Or muffins! Or griffon scones!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Oh, we got griffon scones. That's my specialty.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Bits first!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What, you like it? That's my Grampa Gruff's secret recipe.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [with mouth full] Ow! I think I broke a tooth!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, whatever. No refunds. I don't even care anyway. I just want to sell enough of these so that I can leave this lousy town.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [spits] I can help you with that!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, you think you could tighten the strap on my helmet?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [sighs] Never mind, I got it. So how deep is this abyss?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Don't you griffons ever talk about anything but bits?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No wonder Gilda's such a delight.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [chewing] Grampa Gruff's recipe is good, but it's missing one important ingredient.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Don't tell me. "Friendship"?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, no. Baking powder. Lucky for you, I never leave home without it! Now just pop those in the oven, and you'll have griffon scones worth their weight in gold!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Greta!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Aha! I saw that, Gilda! You may act like a gruff, grumbling griffon, but inside you're gracious and great!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What are you talking about?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You just helped your friend up when she got knocked down.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What, her? Greta's just some griffon I know. We don't have friends here! [sighs] I did have a friend once, but you saw how that turned out.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [poink!] [slide whistle noise] Oh, my gosh, I gotta go find Rainbow Dash!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: See ya.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [shouting] You sure we can't just fly down? Whoa! Never mind, totally got my answer there.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Just gotta find that golden idol and get out of this place.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [screaming] Whoooa!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Ow, ooh! My hoof! Help! Throw me another rope!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [in distance] There you are! Forget about finding the idol! I figured out how to solve Griffonstone's real problem <U+0096> scones!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Pinkie Pie, you get back here!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [in distance] Yeah?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [in distance] Can you throw down a rope or something?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [in distance] Lemme look!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: One rope coming up!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: We need help. Don't go anywhere!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [sighs] Where does she think I'm gonna go?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [panicked noises] I hope I don't go anywhere!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Rainbow Dash is stuck on a ledge in the Abysmal Abyss, and I need your help to save her!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Not my problem.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Of course it's your problem! She's your friend!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Used to be.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Can't you remember when she was?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Yeah. Of course.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Maybe she just doesn't want to make you look bad! Hey there, I'm Rainbow Dash! And you are...?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You sure about that? Stick with me, Gilda, and those guys won't give you any more guff. Whoa! You're awesome!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, Gilda, let's show these guys how it's done!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Skybound soars and daring dives,

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Fine. I'll help her. But that doesn't make me her friend.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Duly noted. [to the audience] Except it does!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hang on, loser! I'm coming!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What took you so long, doofus?!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Rainbow Dash! I'm coming for you!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Gotcha!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: I'm slipping!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: The idol!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: You're more important to me than some dumb chunk of gold.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Hugging later, climbing now!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: I'm really sorry about how I treated you two.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Thanks, Gilda.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Apology accepted.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: And I'm just sorry we didn't get your idol back. Now we'll never be able to solve Griffonstone's problem.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: That's what I was trying to tell you! The map didn't send us here to find the lost Idol of Boreas. It sent us here to replace it with something better!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Nothing's better than gold to a griffon.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: That's because you don't have friendship! If you can learn to care about each other again, Griffonstone could be a mightier kingdom than it ever was before! And you don't need some golden idol to do that. You just need each other.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Whoa, Pinkie. That was... really sappy.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Eh, what can I say? That's how I roll. Go on, Gilda! Go make a friend!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: I don't know, Pinkie. You really think these griffons are up for this? We aren't exactly in Ponyville, you know.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Okay, so she was really weirded out until I gave her the scone. Then she tried it and said it tasted good! That's the first nice thing anygriffon's ever said to me!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Whoa, Pinkie. I guess that really was the problem we needed to solve.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Well, we'd better be heading home.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: What? Y-Y-You want me to spread friendship here by myself?! How am I supposed to do that?! I haven't even made one single friend yet!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: No, you haven't. You've made two.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [tearing up] Hugging! Hugging now!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: But you'll come back and visit, right?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Just try and stop us!

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: [to statue] See ya later, you old charmer.

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Uh, Pinkie? Who are you talking to?

title: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone
dialog: Nopony! Come on, let's go home and see how Gummy did with Granny Pie's marjolaine recipe!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I'll never understand the ponies in this town! Everywhere I went, they were all gussied up and lookin' at me funny! Kept asking if I was "nervous"!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Did they forget the wedding is tomorrow?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Oh, maybe they're just as excited for us to be married as I am.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Well, they're going to feel awfully silly when they realize they've got the wrong date. [gasps] The invitations are wrong! This says the wedding is today!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: But I got such a good deal on them...

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Everypony in town got these! The princesses have even RSVP'd!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I told you we should have eloped!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Oh, dear. The caterer, the flowers, the musicians! We've got to move it all to today!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: What?!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Where's my wedding planner?!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Muffin?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I really messed up on those invitations! I feel just awful, Doc!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I told Cranky I could get 'em printed for cheap, but that meant hiring somepony with no experience using a printing press.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Oh, I wish there was a way I could go back in time and fix all this.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Like these? They're pretty.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: How did you learn to make all this stuff anyway?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Yeah. Oh! Because I accidentally sent out invitations for Cranky and Matilda's wedding with today's date instead of tomorrow's!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: The way they're huddled up like that, I'd say it's either a friendship problem or a monster attack.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Maybe it's just a friendship problem, and it'll all be cleared up in half an hour or so.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Where's Pinkie Pie?! I need my wedding planner!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Oh, no! On my wedding day?! Somepony's gotta help me! You!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I need to move an entire wedding from tomorrow to today!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: So you'll do it?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Whoa!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Come on! We better get to the salon before that monster flattens it!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: What am I gonna do? [gasp] Matilda! I feel so bad about the invitations! Is there anything I can do<U+0097>

title: Slice of Life
dialog: FLOWERS!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: So there's no way you can do it?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Okay. Thanks anyway.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I have to admit, when Matilda said we needed this place ready by today, I was a little nervous.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: There is nothing like a best friend, is there?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: What was that?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: What is it this time? A creature from the Everfree Forest?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Did you say bugbear? It found me!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: My name isn't Bon Bon. It's "Special Agent Sweetie Drops". I work for a super-secret anti-monster agency in Canterlot, or at least I did until the bugbear went missing from Tartarus a few years back.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: When it escaped, we had to shutter the whole agency. Every last shred of evidence of the organization's existence was destroyed. Celestia demanded complete deniability.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: It was me who captured the bugbear. I had to go deep cover here in Ponyville and assume the name Bon Bon. I never thought it'd be able to track me, but now it has.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I'm sorry, Lyra! I couldn't tell you for your own protection!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: It was all real. You're my very best friend.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I've got to go find a crowd to blend into before I put you in danger! I'll see you at the wedding.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I need my ring today, no matter the cost! ...As long as it doesn't cost any extra.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Doc! I've finally figured out how I can help! Your flameless fireworks look just like flowers! I'll use them for the wedding!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Oh, there are so many things I'm forgetting! I hope Cranky remembers to tell the musicians! Oh! Oh! I'll never get my mane done in time!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: You do?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: You're Steven Magnet?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: ...You're Steven Magnet.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I'm sorry, Steven. I guess I assumed you were a pony. And I had no idea you had such adventures together.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Really?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: He is the sweetest thing, isn't he? All the stress I've put myself through. All the stress I've put him through. The only thing that matters is that we're together. The wedding isn't the important thing <U+0096> the marriage is.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] What do you mean you left it on the counter?!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] I thought you were bringing it!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] [groans] Well, this is just wonderful!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] I handled the gift for Cadance and Shining Armor! You were supposed to do this one, remember?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] Well, we can't just come to this wedding empty-hoofed!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [sighs] It's alright. He always cries at weddings.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: ...Usually it's not until the wedding starts.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Attention, everypony! Our friends have done it! They've defeated the bugbear!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [to Lyra] Hey.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: So, uh, you didn't happen to mention our earlier conversation about my [hushed through gritted teeth] secret identity [normal] to anypony, did you?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [laughs] That's what best friends are for.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] Next time, you can just bring your own gift, and I'll bring mine.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [hushed] Fine.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Like a million bits!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: I can't believe I lost my hair! I look ridiculous. The love of my life deserves better than this!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Aw, thanks, buddy.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Well, is everypony here?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: All set, Mayor!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Dearly beloved, we are gathered here today to join these two in mare-trimony. As I look around this room, I can only imagine how uncomfortable Cranky must be.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: But I also see so many ponies from all trots of life, brought together by love. Cranky searched all across this great land of ours to find Matilda, and no matter what obstacles kept them apart, love would finally bring them together, just as it has brought all of us together now. It's remarkable to me how a story like Cranky's search for Matilda could fill this room with such a unique collection of ponies! It makes you realize that everypony is the star of their own story. And it's not just the main characters in our stories that make life so rich! It's everypony <U+0096> those who play big parts and those who play small. If it weren't for everypony in this room and many more who couldn't be here today, Cranky and Matilda's lives wouldn't be as full and vibrant as they are.

title: Slice of Life
dialog: And so, in front of all these loved ones... Cranky, do you take this donkey to be your lawfully wedded wife?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: You bet I do!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: And do you, Matilda, take this donkey to be your lawfully wedded husband?

title: Slice of Life
dialog: [tearing up] I do!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Then I'm proud to say, I now pronounce you jack and jenny!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: You know something, girls? We are so lucky to live in this town. I love you all!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Ow! That's where the bugbear bit me!

title: Slice of Life
dialog: Sorry!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Welcome to the Grand Equestria Pony Summit!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You delegates have traveled far and wide to represent your cities as we seek to celebrate and learn from all the unique places that make up our wonderful land of Equestria. At tonight's welcome reception, Princess Cadance will dedicate this beautiful friendship statue made up of gemstones from each of your home cities.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Now I'd like to turn things over to the one who organized the summit: Princess Twilight Sparkle!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tired] Thank you, everypony. With delegates from over fifty cities attending three days of conferences, receptions, and meetings, this is the largest Grand Equestria Pony Summit yet. And let me tell you, putting it all together has led to more than one sleepless night. We're so excited to have you here and to learn more about life all across this great land of ours.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And now my faithful assistant Spike would like to say a few words.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Um, hello, everypony! I'm here to help any way I can. So if there's anything I can do for any of you<U+0097>

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] I guess everypony loves a princess. Hmph.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ugh!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Spike!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Spike?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [muffled] A little help?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Spike, we need you!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Of course! What can I do?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Whoa, what happened to you?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: She's been awake three straight days preparing for the summit. We need to make sure she gets some rest today. She'll never be able to attend the welcome reception in this condition. Can I count on you to see to it that she isn't disturbed?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I promise! I won't let you down!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Perfect.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Not on my watch.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, excuse me? Can you keep it down a little? Oh, no!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'll give you birdseed! Worms! Anything! Just please stop singing before you wake the princess!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh. I can't believe that worked.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hyah!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Uh, hi fellas. Sorry to break up your game, but there's sort of an important diplomatic summit kind of thingy going on, and it involves a princess needing to sleep, and, uh... maybe you could move your game somewhere else?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [strained] Can't you just wait a few hours?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh. Good thing I've got the princesses on my side.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [vibrating yelps] Aw, come on! Excuse me? [shouting] Excuse me, sir! I really need you to<U+0097> [jackhammer stops] <U+0097>stop right now! Oops.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ugh, you couldn't do this yesterday?!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But there is no summit without Princess Twilight, and she needs things to be kept quiet around here. So if you don't mind, I'd<U+0097>

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, hi. Can I help you?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, can you talk a little quieter? And maybe come back later?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Lemme see what I can do.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [snoring] Huh?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Does something need scheduling?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, uh, yeah. Two delegates have speeches booked in the same hall. What do I do?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Okay, no problem. Just put the hay in the apple and eat the candle, hm?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, I need an answer, but Twilight can't even think straight! Oh, my gosh, what am I supposed to do?!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Um, she said that... Well, she said that she... she wants you to... share it?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh? B-but<U+0097>

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Your friend took your seat? Hah, big deal! Why don't you just<U+0097>

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Fine.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh...

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The princess says no friendship should end over a seat. You should forgive your friend!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I could tell these delegates anything as long as they think it came from Twilight. [beat] Alright! Who's next?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: So, how can Princess Twilight be of service?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, as host city, the Canterlot delegation feels it's only right that we should get passes to every meeting and party, yes?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, that doesn't seem fair<U+0097>I mean, Princess Twilight doesn't think that seems fair.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ehhh... yes, yes, very well. It was worth a try though, wasn't it, old chap, hm?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: This is great! I just took care of a whole bunch of stuff that Twilight won't have to worry about when she wakes up! Wonder if anypony else needs the princess's help?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: If I can check a few of these meetings off Twilight's schedule, then when she wakes up, she won't have to think about anything but the reception.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, it says here you have a meeting with Princess Twilight?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Okay, go ahead.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, if it helps, you can call me "Princess Spike". No-no-no, it's alright. The princess asked me to take care of a few things for her. That's why I came to find you.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The princess says so!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'm here for your two o'clock!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I speak for the Princess.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Actually, Twilight still needs her rest, and her no-noise policy is still in effect for a few more hours. Sorry.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hey, Spike. What's going on?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, you know, just settin' 'em up and knockin' 'em down!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What do you mean?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Not only have I kept things quiet so Twilight could sleep, I also took care of all her afternoon meetings so she won't have to worry about them when she wakes up.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Are you sure she'd want you doing that? There are so many things to keep track of at this summit.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Nah, don't worry. I got it covered. I know Twilight so well, it's easy to make decisions like her!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, okay. Well, thank you for keeping Twilight's stress level down. As long as that's the real reason you're doing it.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, why else would I be doing it?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You're not enjoying speaking for Twilight a little bit?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] [vibrating] By order of the princess.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [through gritted teeth] By order of the princess...!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It sure is, but it's also hard work, isn't it?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Eh, it's not so bad.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Spike, I'm concerned you might be abusing your relationship with Twilight.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What are you talking about? I'm a great princess<U+0097>I mean, Twilight's a great princess! And I've been working hard to help her! When two delegates had a falling out, I'm the one who fixed their friendship! I listened to that pony drone on about gems for forty-five minutes so Twilight wouldn't have to! I moved a polo match away from the tower so she could sleep! And I didn't even eat that delicious looking statue! I'm a decision-making master!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Okay. So maybe I did get a little carried away making decisions. But it's not like anything bad happened.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: This is unexpected!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'll go shut off the main! You get rid of the water!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, bless me...

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, my! What is the meaning of this?!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, uh, you see, there was this polo game, and<U+0097>

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How could you let a water main burst on Canterlot's most important day?!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, what about these trees?! I ordered them trimmed to avoid just such a situation!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Why would the princess make such horrible decisions?! This all could have been prevented!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Please, everypony, listen! I'm so sorry all this happened!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What are you apologizing for? These were Princess Twilight's awful decisions!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'll not let Princess Twilight give Canterlot a bad name in the eyes of Equestria! Come on, everypony! Let's go give her a piece of our minds!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Please! You've got it all wrong!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [panting] Wait! I mean, [hushed] wait!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What is it now?! There's an angry mob here that demands satisfaction!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's just that, uh, we don't want to wake the princess, do we?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [muffled] Princess, we must speak at once!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: She is SLEEPING!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yawns] I'm glad you're here, Spike. We've got a lot to do! Do you know if the water main was fixed?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, you seem well-rested.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I haven't slept like that since I was a filly!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You haven't? Well, at least I got one thing right. And it was the one thing Cadance asked of me. Maybe I did do a good job today!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Fancy Pants, what's wrong?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Don't play games with me, Princess! You know why I'm here!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Is this about the special privileges you wanted? Because this seems a little extreme!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The special privileges?! The last thing on my mind is special privileges!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What's going on, Spike?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Um... you needed to sleep. And Princess Cadance told me you weren't to be disturbed. And there was this bird, and, well... long story short, I made a few decisions on your behalf.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: A few decisions?!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, maybe more than a few, but I had good intentions! Honest! Until I... didn't anymore. I'm sorry, Twilight. I guess I got a little carried away. It-it just felt so good to have ponies caring about my opinions on such important matters. I guess I was just enjoying feeling like a princess.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, Spike, one of the most important things a princess can do is realize when she's made a mistake and fix it.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How do I do that?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You could start with them.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Uh, hi there, everypony. So I guess I owe you all a pretty big apology. It's funny. Here we are at a summit that brings together ponies from all across Equestria, and all I could think about was myself. You all came here to celebrate the things that make each of our cities so unique and special. But instead of getting into the spirit of things like all of you, I used my friend's position to make myself feel good.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The Canterlot ruby goes here, old sport.

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Does this mean you forgive me?

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Quite. Just like how all our cities make up the beautiful land of Equestria!

title: Princess Spike
writer: Neal Dusedau; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I hereby dedicate the Citizens of Equestria statue to everypony who plays their part, no matter how big or how small!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You look nervous. There's no reason to be nervous. Nothing to worry about. Everything's gonna be fine!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Twilight, tell those butterflies in your tummy to beat it! Making new friends is always fun.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ohhhh...

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: They're probably just as nervous as you are.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You've been plannin' this shindig for weeks. You know everything about these fellers. It's gonna be dandy.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [inhales] [exhales] You're right. Remember, Equestria and Yakyakistan haven't opened their borders for hundreds of moons. In fact, Yakyakistan is so far north of the Crystal Mountains, nopony's even been there! Imagine the look on Princess Celestia's face when she finds out we made friends with a yak prince! [nervous laugh] I'm calm! I'm calm...

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ponies! Greetings, ponies!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Prince Rutherford, your Majesty. On behalf of all of us, I welcome you to Equestria.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Me honored. Yaks hope for great friendship between ponies and yaks. [echoing] Friends for a thousand moons!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You must be hungry after a long journey.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We've prepared a banquet of traditional yak foods.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: If things not perfect, yaks get mad. Yaks always get mad when things not perfect!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sniffs] [chewing] [spits] This no taste like yak food! Fake pony food make yaks mad!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Is it okay to be nervous now?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Them yaks sure have a funny way of sayin' "howdy."

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: They're different, that's all. Very... different.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I think they broke my record for most stuff broken in under a minute. I mean, they even broke the trophy.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: All we have to do is show them how great it can be to have friends before Princess Celestia arrives for the friendship party tonight. Now, who read the seven-volume cross-indexed history of Yakyakistan I recommended?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Um... I-I had a thing...

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pretty sure that's what fur's always for, Pinkie Pie.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I know! Yaks are so cool!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie, can you show them around town? I know you have to plan the friendship party too, but it would really help make them feel welcome.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Don't worry. They'll be in good hooves with me.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Remember, we want to make sure Equestria feels like home. That means doing everything we can to make this place feel like Yakyakistan.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No problem!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Good. Let's get out there and make some new friends!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We know y'all are noble warriors who avoid the so-called finer things, so me and my family would be honored if you rested here in the barn during your visit.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Applejack and I made hay beds like you're used to back in Yakyakistan.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hmm... This perfect.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You can snooze here all afternoon, 'cause you're gonna need a lot of energy for my party tonight!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] That wasn't so hard.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Wait! This not yak hay!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, we didn't have actual hay from Yakyakistan, but we tried our best to make it just like yours.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Not perfect! Yaks destroy!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie, what do we do?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And now, for your entertainment pleasure... Presenting animals, Yakyakistan style!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Animals cute.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh. Thank goodness.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Wait. These antlers lie! These not Yakyakistani animals! Yaks smash!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Okay, well... There's still other things we can do. I think.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Yes! These are some of my favorite materials. Very rare, imported from the Crystal Empire to match your northern sensibilities. I hope you'll find them<U+0097>

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: ...delicious.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: This no taste like yak fabric! Yaks destroy!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Everything's gonna be fine. You'll just... make it up to them. Somehow.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Listen up! Tell your faces to hold onto their frowns, 'cause they're about to get turned upside-down!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hold your frown, face!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hit it, Rainbow Dash!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Just like Yakyakistan snow, right? Because snow is snow, no matter where it comes from.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [slurp] This not yak snow!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Seriously?! ...Seriously?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Y'know... it's goin' okay.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Satisfactory, I'd say.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It could be better.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [whispering] It's not very good.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's a disaster!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie, tonight's Yakyakistan theme party is more important than ever! You'll make them forget all about this afternoon, right? Because if it's not perfect, they're gonna smash everything! And I'm not sure how much more smashing this visit can take!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I definitely will! I think. Maybe...?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You're the best gosh-darn party planner in Equestria.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You'll show 'em a good time!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You can do it!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We have absolute confidence in your abilities, Pinkie Pie.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's going to be my most happy-tacular party ever! I hope!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Why are your eyes darting around like that?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie, I don't know what we'd do without you<U+0097>

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Me either! Gotta go!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [hyperventilating] Gummy, what am I gonna do? I had all this amazing stuff planned for the party, but they're gonna hate it! There's no way to make Equestria feel like Yakyakistan. They're just too sensitive! Even Fluttershy made them mad! Fluttershy! Oh... I need a new idea, and I need it now. How am I supposed to make this party feel like Yakyakistan without actually going there and bringing something back?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And this is Sugarcube Corner. They're working hard to make your traditional Yakyakistan cake.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Vanilla extract balance very tricky.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Do you mind, um, waiting here for one moment?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How's tonight's party coming? I'm doing what I can, but it's really up to you at this point! ...Pinkie? Where are you?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [teeth chattering] Did you find her?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Angel and I searched the forest, but...

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Aerial recon turned up nothing either.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I searched the farm inside and out. No Pinkie Pie. But I did find a set of Granny Smith's dentures under the house, so... not a complete loss.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: She's simply vanished!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But the party! It's all we have left! What are we gonna do?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [reading] "Don't worry. I'll be back in time for the party. Love, Pinkie Pie." If Pinkie Pie says she'll be back in time for the party, she'll be back. We have to trust her. Right? [nervous laugh] No reason to freak out!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Don't worry, Twilight.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: When it comes to parties, I think she knows what she's doin'.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [inhales] [exhales] You're right. Let's just focus on keeping the yaks happy 'til she's back.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Piece o' cake.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The cake!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Mrs. One bite, and you'll be transported right back to Yakyakistan. [nervous laugh] I hope.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [chewing] Hmm... Ponies too heavy on vanilla extract!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We've never needed a party so badly.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And so my quest begins. I know what you're thinking. "Why go to Yakyakistan alone, Pinkie Pie?" Because I'm the party planner. This burden falls on my rump and my rump alone. If I want a great party, I gotta climb the mountains north of the Crystal Empire, find Yakyakistan, and come back with something authentic! Know what I mean?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Did we go the wrong way? Where's all the snow? Please tell me this is magical sand-colored snow. [spits] Nope. Sand. Definitely sand.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Curse you, sheep! Thanks for you help, conductor.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Cherry Jubilee!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How are you? You look amazing! I need help.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Have you heard of Yakyakistan? Do you have any idea how I can get there?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Counting cherries? How many?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Whoa!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And so my quest resumes. As I stare across the endless desert, I tell myself I will soon triumphantly enter the homeland of our noble guests and return with a prize to make the best party they've ever seen. Know what I mean?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Cherry? Ravine. Ravine!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Wake up! Wake up! [grunting] Stooooop!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: That's what I said.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Music beautiful. Much soul.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Phew!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] When Twilight told me to stall<U+0097> I-I mean, entertain you, I thought there's no way I could<U+0097>

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Spike!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We demand party! Party now or yaks no friends!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No! Just a little longer!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No more longer! We leave now! Yak go to train, return with more yaks! We declare war!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No Pinkie Pie? What's this?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Heh-heh. We panicked and tried to plan our own party.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's sort of panic-themed.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The yaks are going home! This is awful! I wanted to surprise Princess Celestia. Now the only surprise is that I may have just started a war.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: There we were, face-to-face with Falling Pony Ravine. Down, down, down! And then, suddenly... Pow! We were rescued mid-air by the Wonderbolts! And then they gave me a ride to Manehattan, I joined a traveling band, we played some shows here and there, got popular, almost made it big until creative differences tore us apart. And that's when I knew I had to get back on with my journey to the Crystal Empire, the gateway to Yakyakistan! And so here I am. It was a major adventure that took most of the afternoon. Know what I mean?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
