dialog: This is it. The northern boundary of the Crystal Empire. Beyond lies Yakyakistan. Nopony who's attempted this climb has ever returned. Are you sure you have to do this?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I do.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Good luck, Pinkie Pie.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How could she be so late to the party? This isn't like her.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'm sure she's trying her best.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie's tougher than she looks.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hi! My name is Pinkie Pie! I'm looking for Yakyakistan. You know, faraway land, lots of yaks? Maybe you've heard of it?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Whoa-ho-ho! Slow down! I can't understand a word you're saying<U+0097>

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yelps] There it is! Yakyakistan!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ugh. Is everypony alright?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I can't tell if my eyes are open or closed.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I think I can see a little bit.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Gah! Nope.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Look at these! Pinkie Pie's made files for everypony in town!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: With exactly what kind of parties we like.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie has a secret party-planning cave?! How cool is this?!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [reading] "Twilight Sparkle likes vanilla ice cream, red balloons, dancing..."

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: That's right!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: "But she's afraid of quesadillas."

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No, I'm not! They're just so... [shudders] cheesy.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [fading in] ...oooooooo! No! I'm all the way back where I started! Gummy, I was this close to helping Twilight befriend the yaks. Now I've just let everypony down.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hmm?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Looky here. It's notes for the party she wants to throw for her folks' fiftieth anniversary. But they ain't nearly that old! Huh. She's already plannin' their one-hundredth too. And their five-hundredth?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I had no idea she worked so hard on her parties.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: She may be more organized than you, Twilight.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Let's not get carried away.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I just wish Pinkie Pie were here so we could tell her how much we all appreciate her hard work.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tearing up] Thank you! Thank you! I love you too! All of you!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You're back!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I tried to go to Yakyakistan so I could bring something back for my party. But at the last second, I made a mistake. [sighs] I worked harder on this party than any party ever. But I'm still just a big failure.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pinkie Pie, you're not a failure.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What matters is how hard you tried.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Who else would've gone all across Equestria to plan one party?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: You know... the trip was really hard. But everypony I met along the way was so helpful. I just wish the yaks could see how friendly and wonderful and great Equestria really is! [gasps] I just got the best party idea ever!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's too late. The yaks left on the last train.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Um, no, they didn't. [squeals] Trust me! There are a whole lot of sheep out there!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: So, um, do we walk back up the slide or... or what?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I never thought I'd say this, but... thank you, sheep! And now, if it's okay with you, it's party time!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Wow, Pinkie. This came together quick, even for you.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What can I say? I'm good at what I do. Prince Rutherford, every time we tried to make something in Equestria feel like Yakyakistan, we couldn't get it right. When I got back from my adventure, I realized something. We shouldn't try to make Equestria feel like your home. We should try to make you feel at home in Equestria. And that means showing you why we love it here, so you'll love it too.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pink pony work hard to make yaks feel at home. Now yaks happy. No declare war.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ponies and yaks... friends?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: For a thousand moons?

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: For a thousand moons!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I am very impressed, princess.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Heh. Just doing my best to spread friendship.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And you did a wonderful job of it. You and your friends.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Pink pony, you understand yaks now.

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Aww, come here, you!

title: Party Pooped
writer: Nick Confalone; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [strained] Wow! Too strong! Okay, okay, okay!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [sighs] You know the worst thing about you being the Princess of Friendship? The dishes.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Thanks for taking care of that, Spike. After three events in one week, I really needed to relax with a good book.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: It's kinda funny, isn't it? All these ponies comin' to you for advice about friendship?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What's funny about that?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You know, 'cause you used to be famous for being such a bad friend.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What are you talking about? I had good friends in Canterlot.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Come on, Twilight. Look at the wall. D'ya see any photos from before we moved to Ponyville? And look at you now <U+0096> the Princess of Friendship.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [gasps] This is a disaster! All my old friends! I can't remember any of their names right now! But do you really think that they think I'm a bad friend?!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Well, I only meant that you've come so far. You're a great friend now and<U+0097>

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh, I feel terrible! I've gotta make it up to them! Pack a bag, Spike! We're going to Canterlot! And make a list of my friends' names.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Aw. Me and my big mouth.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Come on, Twilight. You're getting worked up about nothin'.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: The only logical place to start is at the beginning.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh. It's exactly how we left it! [blows] Look! It's Predictions and Prophecies! And it's still open to the Elements of Harmony!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: And here's that present I was gonna give Moon Dancer! Huh. Guess she won't be needing that. Hey, look! The rest of it's still here!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: How could I have let this happen?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Come on, Twilight. Princess Celestia gave you an assignment. Nopony could blame you for that.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: But look at the way I left this place. It's a total mess! Just like how I left my friendships.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I've gotta make it up toooo... uh...

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh! Uh, Minuette, Twinkleshine, Lemon Hearts, Lyra Heartstrings, and Moon Dancer.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Yeah. Them.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Spike! Come on! We've got work to do!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [groans] Have you been awake all night?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I did a little research, and I think I know where we can find Minuette! That is one of my friends, right?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Uh, it's not too late to forget I opened my big mouth.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: No, Spike, I'm glad you opened your big mouth. These ponies have probably been suffering ever since I left. Wondering why their supposed friend would treat them so badly!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Minuette?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Of course! My old friends!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: This is perfect! I can apologize to all three of them at once!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Let's hope they're not as traumatized as Minuette.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You did?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Well, uh, you see... [sighs] I came to apologize.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Before I left Canterlot, I didn't really appreciate my friends. And that's because I didn't know how important friendship was. But I've learned so much since I moved to Ponyville. I learned what it means to be a good friend and that I certainly wasn't one to the three of you. So for all the pain I caused you, I am truly sorry.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [gasps] It's our old science lab! I have so many great memories of this place!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Whatever happened to Moon Dancer?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Yeah, you know, our other friend.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Moon Dancer?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What do you want? I'm trying to study.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: It's us! Your old friends!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Ugh!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Exactly how I used to be.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [sighs] Come on, Twilight! We've been watching her for three days! Library, house, library, house. That's it!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Nopony looks at her or says hello or even gives her a smile. It's like she doesn't even exist. Was she always like this?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh, sorry, girls... I've got a lot of studying to catch up on.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I had no idea that party was so important to her. I've gotta find a way to make it up to her!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [gasps] [feigned surprise] Oh, my gosh! Moon Dancer?! Is that<U+0097>

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Moon Dancer, can I talk to you for a min<U+0097>

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Shh! What is this?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Eh, a bubble of silence. I haven't seen you in a while and I thought it might be nice to catch up.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: For what purpose?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You know, 'cause we're friends.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I'm really sorry to bother you. I was just hoping we would go outside and talk for a bit.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] I'm sorry I skipped your party.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [growls] [whispering] Why won't you leave me alone? I'm trying to study! You've got the wrong pony! I don't have parties!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] You did once. And I was so caught up in my own studying that I didn't take your feelings into account.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] Look, Twilight Twinkle<U+0097>

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] Sparkle.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] Whatever! I just need to be alone so I can study without some crazy pony trying to make friends, all right?!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] Fine!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [whispering] Wait. How did you get into my book like that?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I've been studying a new studying technique. I can only do it for a few minutes, but you'd be amazed how much you can pick up when you're actually in a book!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: It's one of Hayscartes' methods.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You know Hayscartes?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Of course! He's a genius!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I have a copy of his Treatise on Ponies, you know.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What is this place?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: This is where I used to live. You mean, I never had you over?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Wow! A first edition of Principles of Magic! Hey, didn't I give this to you?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Maybe?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I did! Look, I even wrote something! "To my friend, Twilight Sparkle. Thanks for introducing me to the classics." I can see by the fact that you left it here that it meant a lot to you.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Look, I didn't bring you over here for even more poignant reminders of what a bad friend I was. I brought you here to give you this. You can come here whenever you want and study to your heart's content.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Really?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: But first, you've gotta do something for me.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Have dinner with our old friends tonight.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I can't. I'm reorganizing my biology scrolls.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I've been spending a lot of time with Minuette, Twinkleshine, and Lemon Hearts since I've been back. They really miss you.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Look! I already told you! The last thing I need is a bunch of ridiculous friend-making keeping me from studying!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Moon Dancer, wait! A wise pony once taught me that there's more to life than dusty old books!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I tried friendship and it's just not for me. Now, if you'll excuse me...

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What if I taught you Hayscartes' method?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Science, magic, history, economics, pottery. Things like that.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: No.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Can I go now?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Moon Dancer, please.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Slumber 101? I've read that.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh! [chuckles] Really? Well, uh, did you know Lemon Hearts here works at the Canterlot palace?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Ugh!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Moon Dancer! [teleportation zap] You've gotta give friendship a chance!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Dah! I gave friendship a chance a long time ago! It didn't work out then <U+0096> it isn't gonna work out now!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Twilight, are you all right?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: No. No, I'm not.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: W-Where are you goin'?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I don't know, Spike. I really messed this one up. That party was everything to her. I can only imagine what it must've felt like when I didn't show up.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Thank you so much for coming!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Is Twilight coming?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh. Okay.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Sure...

title: Amending Fences
dialog: If there was only a way to undo the damage... I know what I need to do. And I know just who can help me.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Wheeeeeeeee!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [laughing] Whoooooaaa!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: That was awesome! We gotta go flying more often, Twilight!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I did head home. But not to throw in the towel. I went to get my secret weapon. Minuette, meet<U+0097>

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Hi, Minuette! Twilight, you didn't say Minuette would be here!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You two know each other?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh, sure! She was one of Cadance's bridesmaids! We hang out all the time when she's in Ponyville! Didn't you know that? Ha! And you call yourself the Princess of Friendship! Twilight briefed me on the way here. We'll need fifteen bags of confetti and as many hooves as we can get.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: And what are we gonna do?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Just come with me.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Ooh! A Brief History of the Wagon Harness! Huh? The Life and Times of Morari the Maneless?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: What is this?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: It's a party. For you.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Surprise!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Come on in!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Thanks but no thanks. I don't do parties.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I know. And I think it's my fault. Back when we were in school together, you invited me to a party. I was so focused on my studies that I didn't show up.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Big deal!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: It was a big deal. And now that I realize how important friendship is, I'd like to make up for my mistake with a new party. A party in honor of my friend Moon Dancer! Please, you've got to let me make this up to you.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: And you think this is gonna do it, huh?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Uh, yes?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: You're right. This party can't make up for the way I hurt you. But please, don't let my mistake be the reason you can't be friends with anypony else.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [sobs, sniffles] What? That's the librarian! The bookseller! My sister!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I'm sorry, Moon Dancer. I've faced magical creatures, the end of Equestria, all sorts of things. But seeing how my actions affected you, that was one of the worst feelings I've ever had.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: [sobs] Thank you, Twilight. I never realized how much I needed to hear that. Now come on, everypony! Let's party! Right?

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Right!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: I think it's time for us to go, Moon Dancer.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Thank you for helping me make some new friends. Even if they are my old friends.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Oh. We'll come back and visit soon.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: That would be great! You've still gotta teach me that Hayscartes technique!

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Deal.

title: Amending Fences
dialog: Um, Moon Dancer? It got kinda banged up, but here's a little something I wanted to give you back at your first party.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Princess Luna's turning into Nightmare Moon again!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Yeah? Well, we've got the cure for that!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [gasps] What? My dream ended... happily? That. Cannot. Happen!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ooh, this is amazing!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yawns] [tired throughout] Yeah, Rarity. Thanks for setting all this up.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tired throughout] A grooming day for our pets really was a great idea.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tired throughout] Oh, my! Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't get my normal beauty sleep last night...

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tired throughout] You know... [yawns] I didn't sleep well either.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [tired throughout] Mm-hmm.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh-huh.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I'm totally beat too!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: All right, Winona. Time for your brushin'.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oops. I guess I'm too plumb tuckered out to do this right.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yawns] I even went to bed early last night... but then I had a really scary nightmare.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, only, you know, I didn't think mine was that scary!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, mine sure was. There was this blue smoke monster and... what?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I dreamt about a blue smoke thingy too!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: So what? Probably just a coincidence.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: That's an awfully big coincidence.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh. I wonder why I didn't have that nightmare. I slept great!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: So then, what could've given us all the same nightmare?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I don't know, but I do know who might. Spike, could you send a scroll to Princess Luna?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Sure! All set!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Dear Princess Luna, last night my friends and I all dreamt of a creature made of blue smoke. I'm sure you're very busy, but [yawns] when you have the chance, please let me know if you have any idea what it could mean. Yours, [yawns] Princess Twilight Sparkle. You can leave out the yawns.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Which of you saw the creature of blue smoke in your nightmare?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Wow. That was fast.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We all did.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Not me!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: So you've encountered the smoke monster too?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The Tantabus is a creature of my nightmares. It escaped from my slumbers yesterday.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But how did it get into ours?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The Tantabus is like a parasite. My dreams must no longer be enough for it. Now it seeks others to infect and corrupt. It must have learned of you six from seeing you in my dream.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Uh, so Smokey gave us bad dreams. No biggie.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I saw that the Tantabus had grown more powerful, but I did not realize that power was enough to enable it to escape my dreams. If its power grows, it could very well find a way to escape into the real world. It could turn all of Equestria into a living nightmare!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Okay, okay, okay, I take it back! That does sound bad! Really bad!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: We've prepared everything exactly as you requested.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Good. As you six slumber here, I will pursue the creature into whichever of your dreams it infests.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ooh! It'll be like a princess sleepover!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Speaking of princesses, aren't you gonna ask Celestia for her help as well?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: There is nothing my sister can do. She has no power in the realm of sleep. Only I can move from dream to dream. I am afraid nopony can help me tonight.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Even us?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Especially you. You have all suffered so much because of me. You need only slumber while I hunt the Tantabus in your dreams.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I know you said nopony can help, but I'm no pony! I'm gonna stay up and watch over you guys just in case!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Aw, thank you, Spike!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yawns] One good thing about not sleepin' well last night <U+0096> shouldn't be too hard to fall asleep now.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, my! [gasps] This is simply divine! How avant garde!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It is here!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [gasps] It was such a pretty little chiffon...! What kind of monster would do this?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: The Tantabus.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Then let's stop it!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: No, please! I don't want you to suffer anymore because of me. I will catch it.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It has jumped into another dream! I am sorry, but if I am to stop it, I must follow it where you cannot.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Go! I should be able to handle things here. [gulps] I hope...!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: La-la-la-la-la! Whee! Whee, ha-ha!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: La-la-la-la-la!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I followed the Tantabus here. Now I need only find<U+0097>

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Sorry, can't help it! An idea pops into my head, it<U+0097> [gasps] Ooh, cake!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ew, cake!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [inhales] [grunts] No!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Sorry!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Who wants ice cream?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Mmm, it's so nice to be the pet for once.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: N-n-n-n-nice... giant... evil Angel...! [screams] Phew! Oh, thank you, princess!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [sighs] Now this is what I call an incredible dream.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I can see the Tantabus has already turned your slumbers into a nightmare!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What are you talking about? This is my favorite dream!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hyah!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Luna!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What happened? Are you guys okay?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: That... that was terrible! I-I never want to have that nightmare again!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [shivers] Me either!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But Luna caught it, didn't she?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I am so sorry, my friends. I failed. It will be back to infect your dreams the next time you sleep.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, no!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Yeah. I reckon I could live without seeing that thing ever again.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But you will. Again and again, every night, until it grows powerful enough to infect the waking world! After what I did as Nightmare Moon, the fact that I am once again responsible for harming others is more than I can bear.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It'll be okay! Everypony makes mistakes!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: As long as none of you dreamt about another pony, the Tantabus remains confined to your dreams. I still have a chance to catch it before it's too late.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Phew, that's good to hear! Although after you left, I did happen to dream that I was eating a giant ice-cream cone with all of Ponyville while taking a test we hadn't studied for. See, what'd I tell ya? Everypony makes mistakes!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But that means the Tantabus could be turning every dream in Ponyville into a nightmare!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It is far worse than that. Infecting all those dreams gives it more and more power. Soon it will be able to escape into the real world and infect Equestria with its nightmare plague!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Then you must let us help you stop it before that happens!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But how? The Tantabus was able to escape Luna when it only had six dreams it could get to!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It is true. With so many dreams to hide in, I do not know how I can catch it.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Hmm... What if everypony in Ponyville were having one dream?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I... can create shared dreams, yes, but for so many ponies at once? I have never done anything like that. The amount of power it would take...

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Well, it is worth a try, isn't it?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Of course. I will do anything to end this, including accept your help. I cannot allow the Tantabus to escape into the real world. All of you must now go back to sleep and hope that I can create such a dream.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [gasps] Princess Luna did it!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [shivers] Big Mac! Boy, I'm glad to see somethin' familiar!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Eeyup.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Ponies!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: There is no time for bowing, my friends! There is something coming, something terrible! No, it is already here!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I am so sorry! I brought this upon you! But I will end it now!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Princess, what's wrong?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [grunts] It... is taking all my strength just to hold this massive dream together! You will have to stop it! I truly wish I did not have to ask this of you!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Then you're in luck.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Yeah! We're already on it!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [yelping] Please! I'll pay you anything!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I got you!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, no!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Big Mac! You can do anythin' in a dream, remember?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Come on! If that Tantabus thing turns any more of this dream against us, we'll be too busy saving ponies to catch it! And it'll grow powerful enough to escape into the real world!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How are we even gonna know when it's able to escape?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Oh, I think we'll know.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [straining] Hurry, my friends!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: What the?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Please, we need your help too!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Fluttershy's right! We've all got to work together to stop it from escaping!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Mr. But how can we help? Nopony in Ponyville has your magic or your speed!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: That's true... in Ponyville!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But this here isn't Ponyville! It's a dream!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Eeyup!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: And not just any! This is your dream! Anything you can do in your dreams, you can do now!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [clicks fingers] Well, if you're gonna dream, might as well dream big, right? Hi-yah!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Whoo!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: It's working!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But it's not enough!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Then do more! This is a dream, remember?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [straining] I cannot hold this dream together much longer! Equestria will fall because of me!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Am I crazy, or did it just get even bigger after Luna said that?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I think it's feeding off your guilt, Princess Luna!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: If that is so, then perhaps that is how it grew strong enough to escape in the first place!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Say what now?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: I created the Tantabus to give myself the same nightmare every night... [pants] ...to punish myself for the evil I caused as Nightmare Moon!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But why would you do that?!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: To make sure I never forgave myself for how much Equestria suffered because of me! But it seems I have not learned my lesson, for now I have only made you suffer more!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But that means you might just be the key to stopping all this!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Yeah! If it gets strong because you feel bad about what you did as Nightmare Moon, then you just gotta stop feeling bad for what you did!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: How can I forgive myself? I am no better now than I was then. My creation is about to turn the world into a living nightmare!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: But look at what you're doing! Nightmare Moon would've wanted the Tantabus to turn Equestria into a nightmare! You're doing everything you can to stop it! Don't you see? That proves you're not the same pony you were then! Everypony who knows you knows that Nightmare Moon is in the past! We all trust you, Luna! Do you trust us enough to believe we're right?

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: ...I do!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Thank you. Thank you all.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: [gasps] Luna did it!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: She sure did! Only... I'm not exactly sure what she did.

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Luna created the Tantabus to punish herself! The worse she felt, the more power it had! But once she finally forgave herself for what Nightmare Moon did...

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Poof!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Shh!

title: Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep?
writer: Scott Sonneborn; story by Jayson Thiessen & Jim Miller
dialog: Huh. Wonder what she's dreaming about now.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [gasps] Was that the Pony Post?!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, it's just you, Opal.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Ohhh... Every other day he's here like clockwork! Not today! What could possibly be holding him up?!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [muffled] Strawberry cinnamon cilantro salutations!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: What?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: What indeed. I bet you're wondering what warrants such a welcome! Well, that welcome is warranted by a pony that whisked up a warm batch of strawberry cinnamon cilantro cupcakes!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [chomp] That strangely sickening flavor combination sounds just as bad as it tastes. [gulps] Ugh. So I came here to offer you some!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: After that visually descriptive and disturbing endorsement, I'll pass.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, I almost forgot! I have this letter for you, Rarity! The post pony was going to deliver it, but after a strawberry cinnamon cilantro cupcake, he was feeling kinda queasy. And since I was heading over anyway, I figured I could do it for him! Here you go!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [with mouth full] What's it say?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I got it!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Woo-hoo! Got what?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, I have been holding out for the perfect location, and it finally became available! So now I can fulfill my dream of opening a boutique in Canterlot!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Rarity's such a savvy businesspony. I'm so impressed she used the huge bonus she earned making the costumes for Sapphire Shores' Equestria-wide tour to open this second boutique!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I take it from your reaction that you like the boutique?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: It's lovely.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Gosh, Rarity. I know hard work when I see it, and it looks like you worked your hooves to the nub!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I don't know. Those hooves don't look nubby. They look scrubbied and buffied and pedied!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Well, despite my 'nubby scrubby buffy pony pedi, I actually have been working very hard! However, I never could have gotten the boutique ready for the grand opening without the help of my new manager Sassy Saddles!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Bust my buttons, Rarity! The ponies from Ponyville!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I knew I needed a manager for Canterlot Carousel, so when Sassy showed me her resum<e9> and I saw that she worked in all of the finest boutiques in Canterlot, I hired her right on the spot!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I then laid out this plan, or "pattern" as we say in the fashion biz, for Canterlot Carousel so that Rarity's boutique will be a guaranteed success and those doors will never, ever, ever close!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Wow, Sassy. Your attention to detail is truly impressive.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I've already put a pin in the first piece of the pattern <U+0096> Beautify the Boutique! But next was the very crucial pattern piece <U+0096> Marketing to the Mares! Turns out that everypony here loves royalty!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: So I created a collection that beautifully revolves around the royal element of Canterlot!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: And it just so happens there's a hot new princess in Equestria!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [to Twilight] In every poll Sassy Saddles took, you were the most popular princess! Coincidentally, one of my gowns is inspired by the window in Canterlot Castle commemorating your coronation!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: While I've always prided myself on paying attention to detail, I've taken my latest collection to a whole new level with "Rarity's Rules of TLC"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Judging by this baby, TLC stands for Tasty Liquorice Candy!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: TLC stands for 'Time, Love, and Couture'. And while I do agree that this dress has potential, I've not had enough time to give it enough love to become couture.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: But the rest of the gowns in tonight's line have met Rarity's Rules and are ready to be presented!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: My marketing research also confirmed that customers that viewed somepony famous wearing a gown wish to own that gown for themselves. I call this piece of the pattern Celebrity Status!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: So, Twilight, we were wondering if perhaps you might possibly wear this tonight?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: If being a princess and wearing that dress can help your boutique in any way, then I say stick a pin in it. It's done.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Alright, everypony! Let's set the stage!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Ever since I was a little filly, all I've ever wanted was to own a boutique here in Canterlot. Somepony pinch me! I'm about to open the doors to that very boutique!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Welcome to the grand opening of Canterlot Carousel!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: That Sassy totally stepped on your hooves, Rarity.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, no! Did she mess up that nice pony pedi?! [sighs] Okay. Phew!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, I don't think she meant to.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Rarity, are you ready to reveal the collection?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [under her breath] Is she sure she doesn't wanna do it herself?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [snorts] [under her breath] Yeah.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yes, I am. Fluttershy, could you help Twilight get ready?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, certainly.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Fillies and gentlecolts! I am designer and couturier Rarity, I'd like to welcome you <U+0096> again [laughs nervously] <U+0096> to the grand opening of Canterlot Carousel, and I'm thrilled that you are here to see my newest collection inspired by this regal city!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Fashion Plate of Cosmare magazine! I'm so honored that Cosmare was able to do a piece on the grand opening of my boutique!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, uh, it's called "Rarity's Royal Regalia".

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: My favorite part of being a designer is finding my inspiration, and that really wasn't difficult when it came to Canterlot. Everywhere I looked, the royal city just spoke to me! I call it "In-spire-ation".

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I spent hours by the lily pond on the castle grounds, which inspired this gown <U+0096> "Water Filly"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Watching Celestia raise the sun each morning literally lit up my day... [beat] This is "Tripping the Light".

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [giggles] And of course, Luna raising the moon guided me to sleep. I call this "Over the Moon"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: And for our finale, I have something very special. I was inspired by the stained glass window created in honor of Princess Twilight... I call this "The Reign in Stain"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yes!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, well, I think "The Reign in Stain" is too difficult to explain! [short laugh] Especially for the signature piece of a collection?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: But I rather like the<U+0097>

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Fillies and gentlecolts, I, Sassy Saddles, am pleased to introduce the grand finale of the grand opening of Rarity's Royal Regalia <U+0096> the "Princess Dress"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Everypony, please follow me and you can all place your orders for the Princess Dress!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yeah! Rarity's Royal Regalia is amazing! And everypony seemed to love the Princess Dress!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: You bet your saddle they did. Rarity now has one hundred orders for her signature gown!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [stammers] One hundred orders?! All at one time?!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: According to my pattern, the next piece is The Success of the Signature Dress, so I do not see the problem!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Uh...

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Cupcake?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [clears throat] First of all, Sassy Saddles, I would have appreciated getting to name the final gown from my collection myself.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [short laugh] My research shows that your "Reign in Stain" name was a play on words that was both very confusing and quite unappealing.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [disgruntled laugh] While I see your point, we should have discussed it prior to the grand opening, Sassy.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: My only goal is for Canterlot Carousel to succeed. That's why I changed the name, and that is why I took all those orders for the Princess Dress.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [stammering] But... But receiving orders for one hundred dresses in one day, [stammering] it's just too much too soon!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Are you actually saying we should... cancel these orders?!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Wha... But... [stammering] Uh, n-no, Sassy. Promises were made, and I shall sew my very best to provide each and every pony a Princess Dress full of TLC.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, thank you, Rarity, thank you!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, satin and silk, Rarity, are you sure you don't want your friends to help you make the dresses?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: No, Sassy. These orders are my responsibility. All I have to do is stick to my plan so I can deliver each and every Princess Dress in keeping with my Rules of Rarity!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: The rules of Rarity, guaranteed quality This I can assure For each and every dress I vow to give finesse With time, love, and couture

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Is that the customer who ordered this Princess Dress?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I'll take care of her. You keep working.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Uh, actually, I'd love to see her reaction to this particular dress.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Paisley and poplin, Rarity, look at all the orders you still have to finish, and you want to take a break? Now?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Well, it's just I made some really lovely changes to this dress<U+0097>

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: You did what?! But every Princess Dress is supposed to be exactly the same!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yes yes I know, but these gems just spoke to me, and<U+0097>

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Fine. Go see her reaction.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Hello, and welcome to Canterlot Carousel! I am so pleased to present to you your<U+0097>

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Well as an artiste, I did take the liberty to change a few minor details.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I, eheh, I saw these gems glistening in the light, and they just spoke to me. Aren't they lovely? And so unique!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Uh, no. No, they're not.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yes... Y-Yes, of course.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: The rules of Rarity Once stood for something But now it feels just like some factory Now every dress I make With every flaw and mistake Oh, how it makes my heart My heart just break

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Raving rick-rack, Rarity! You made two hundred Princess Dresses!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [deadpan] Yes. Isn't it spectacular?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: And I have a special surprise for you! The latest issue of Cosmare magazine just hit the stands!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [reading] "Canterlot's newest rising star"?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: And in the hour since the magazine's come out, we've gotten another hundred new orders for the Princess Dress!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [weakly] One... hundred more... Princess Dresses?! I'm the Cosmare cover pony... I have the most successful shop in Canterlot... I've gotten everything I ever wanted... but I'm miserable!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [short laugh] How could you possibly be miserable? My pattern is perfect! Cosmare Cover Pony <U+0096> done! You have your signature gown, the Princess Dress of Success!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I don't want to make another hundred Princess Dresses!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I have a piece for that! Assemble the Assembly Line! You'll never have to sew again!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: What?! No!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Yes! Then the Canterlot Carousel never closes! And Sassy Saddles' boutique succeeds!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Stop! This is not your boutique! And if this is what success in Canterlot looks like, I want no part of it! Now, make up flyers for a going-out-of-business sale! I'm closing Canterlot Carousel!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: What?! No! Oh, you can't, Rarity! I-I've worked too hard to make this a success! I can't be a part of another failed boutique!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [to a dress] Oh, don't you look lovely? Nice to see you out here again. [to herself, hushed] Seems Sassy Saddles isn't rushing to open the door this time. Hm.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Welcome to the going-out-of-business sale of Canterlot Carousel.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, no, I'm sorry, the Princess Dress has been discontinued. But there are plenty of other lovely dresses on sale today.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Certainly. The dressing area is right back there.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: And I'm sure you'll feel even brighter once you try it on!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, yes, I do. It's-It's right here.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Hmmm. Perhaps you'd be even more taken with this one. It was inspired by the fountain in the Canterlot Castle garden. I call it the "Fountain of Truth"!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh! Well, then I'll finish it, and the gown shall be yours! [to herself] How can I have forgotten? This is what I've been dreaming about!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: My favorite moment's when a pony sees it That special gown that she just adores That pony's now in style My hard work's all worthwhile Oh, yes, it makes my heart My heart just soar!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Attention, everypony! Canterlot Carousel will not be closing!

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [giggles] Yes, yes, of course.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Oh, Rarity, I'm so sorry. I focused on that one dress, and the rest of Rarity's Royal Regalia paid the price.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Well, so did the Princess Dress. The more I sold, the more each dress lost its time, love, and couture, becoming terrible, lackluster, and common.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I think I finally understand the Rules of Rarity... and will apply them at my next job.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I beg your pardon? The Rules of Rarity are only to be applied at Canterlot Carousel! Which is why you must continue to manage the boutique while I'm in Ponyville.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Ponyville?

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: Well, yes, I'll come to Canterlot with new designs and to see the customers of course, but Ponyville was always going to be my home base.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: [gasps] Bobbins and bodkins, Rarity! Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you! And I promise to run everything following your rules.

title: Canterlot Boutique
dialog: I would expect nothing less.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, Sassy Saddles, don't you just love my new Femme Mystique Chic line of gowns?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [gasps] Sequins and sashes, Rarity, they're exquisite! Where in Equestria did you find the inspiration?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, I modeled them after the adventures of Shadow Spade. Her stories are always full of mystery and suspense and, best of all... fabulous costumes!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: They're perfect! [beat] What are you doing?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [humming] Oh, uh, just making some minor adjustments. [blows on dress] Shadow Spade believes it all comes down to attention to detail. And so do I. There! Now it's perfect.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Hey guys, how's it<U+0097>

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [nervous laughing] My bad.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [groans] Sorry I messed up your dress thingy.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Nothing we can't fix in a stitch. What are you doing in Canterlot?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: I'm here for Princess Celestia's royal garden opening tomorrow.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, yes! Rumor has it the gardens are especially lush this season. I heard that the Wonderbolts will be kicking things off with an aerial display.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: You heard right. And Rainbow Dash is here to fly with them. So exciting!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Well, kind of exciting. Technically, I'm not flying. I'm just the lucky Reserve who was called in to be the backup flyer in case a Wonderbolt can't perform.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, don't be so modest. Out of all the Reserves, you were the one chosen.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: It is pretty sweet. And I do get to stay in the castle, hang out with the Wonderbolts, and eat awesome food at the dinner tonight. Speaking of the dinner, you're still coming, right?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Heavens, yes! A chance to dress up, be charming and show off my newest femme mystique couture? I wouldn't miss it for all of Equestria.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Great! See ya tonight!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Ooh, the rhinestones I ordered! [beat] Oh, my. Oh, there's been a mistake... I ordered dragon-cut stones, and these are hoof-polished.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Of course you don't. Your job is so difficult. Honestly, I don't know how you keep all of those orders straight.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, y<U+0097>oh yes, and I very much appreciate it. But if there was any way you could squeeze in one more little delivery, I would be eternally grateful.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Rarity, you could sweet-talk a filly out of candy!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, [chuckles], it was nothing. Nopony minds a compliment. Now, you simply must help me pick out an outfit for tonight. Something from the new collection, of course.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Let's grab some grub!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [sniffs] Mm, is that Juniper Phoenix I smell?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, mine as well. It's masculine and yet<U+0097>

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: <U+0097>soft with the barest hint of floral notes and<U+0097>

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [hushed] Rarity! Don't you know who this is?!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: A gentlepony with fabulous taste in colognes and scarves?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: It's Wind Rider!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh! So nice to meet you!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: You didn't let me finish! He's a living legend. He holds the Wonderbolt record in the Mustang Marathon!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Wind Rider, I see you met Rainbow Dash! She's one of our most promising Reserves. She just might beat your record.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Oh, heh, I'm nowhere near as good as you. I mean, I'm fast, but I don't have the endurance to go long distances.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Ah, don't be modest. A little practice and you'll be beating records in no time.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [sighs] Not as nice as it is to meet you, sir. [barely-contained laughter] I can't believe I just met Wind Rider!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [gasps] Really? That's incredible! Guess I'll just watch Wind Rider being awesome from the sidelines... Practice tomorrow is gonna be so boring.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: I don't suppose I could keep you company?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: You could! They always let friends and family come watch practices!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Mm, ooh!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Uh, no-no, it's almost impossible to get stains out of silk. But not to worry. I've come prepared!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: That dinner was absolutely divine. Thanks for inviting me! Ooh, you're staying in the east tower? Those rooms have the best view of Canterlot!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: How lucky are we? Well, we better get some shuteye before practice.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: See you tomorrow, Rarity!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Good night!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [sighs] Thanks for keeping me company, Rarity. If you weren't here, well, I don't know who I'd be talking to right now.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Eh, you'd be talkin' to me. Rainbow Dash, Spitfire's mom sent a message that she was sick. She had to leave to take care of her.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [gasps] Oh, no! I hope her mom's okay!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Me too. In the meantime, we need you to fly in her place.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: L-Like, in the actual show?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Unless Spitfire comes back, yes.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: I won't let you down, Soarin! [squeals] This is the best thing ever! Ohmygoshohmygoshohmygoshohmygosh! [sing-song] I'm gonna get to fly with Wind Rider and the Wonderbolts, 'cause I'm the bestest and I'm awesome and they know it! [continues under] Uh-huh, uh-huh, uh-huh...

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Uh... Rainbow Dash?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [hushed] Shh! Let her have this, darling.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Hello there! Friend or family?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Ooh, you're Spitfire's mum? But I thought you were sick.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Well, Spitfire got a note from you saying you weren't feeling well, and she went home to take care of you.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: That's so strange.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Stormy Flare? Aren't you supposed to be sick? 'Kay, what's happening?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Could somepony have sent Spitfire a fake note?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Somepony who wanted her out of the show, I suppose.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Why would anypony want that?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Me?! I would never do that to Spitfire! Why would you think it was me?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: We were room neighbors in the castle!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Yeah, but I didn't mean anything.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Spitfire came by my room and told me she had to go see her mom at around midnight. Where were you then?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: I was asleep at midnight... having this totally amazing dream. There I was at the arena flying with Wind Rider and the Wonderbolts, like I've always wanted to<U+0097>

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: <U+0097>ah, eh, never mind. Not helping.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Rainbow Dash, if you can prove that somepony else is behind Spitfire's disappearance before the start of the show, then you can still fly with us. In the meantime, Misty Fly, Blaze, head over to Stormy Flare's house and try to find Spitfire and bring her back. [to Rainbow Dash] I have to warn you, if you sent that letter, the bylaws are clear. I'd have no choice but to ban you from the Wonderbolts forever. Understand?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [sighs] I understand. But how am I gonna prove I didn't send a letter that I didn't send?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: With me! Detective Rarity is on the case, and we are going to get to the bottom of this faster than my costume change!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Yeah, what's with the getup?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: Obviously, I am channeling Shadow Spade through these gorgeous garments, and she would say that the best way to prove that you didn't send the letter is to find out whoever did. First stop <U+0096> the scene of the crime!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [narrating] We had a long road ahead of us, Rainbow Dash and I. Well, not too long because we didn't have much time, but the point is... I was up for the challenge.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [narrating] There I was, surveying the crime scene, and looking tr<e8>s chic while doing it. [normally] This must be the envelope for the letter Spitfire got! [sniffs] Hmm. These look like hairs from a rainbow mane!

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [gulps] That's not good.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [narrating] Rainbow Dash was getting antsy, but I had faith I could clear her name and find the real culprit.

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: What are you doing?

title: Rarity Investigates!
writer: Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco; story by Meghan McCarthy, M. A. Larson, Joanna Lewis & Kristine Songco
dialog: [stammers] Uh, just thinking thoughts. [narrating] Rainbow Dash was right. In order to solve the mystery, we had to be focused. Driven. One hundred percent in the<U+0097> [normally] Ooh!
