dialog: Welcome home, Twilight!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What are you doing, Starlight?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Where'd she go?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't know, Spike, but I think we better find out!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I guess we could start with this.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Spike, no! Don't touch that!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [continued screaming] Cloudsdale? Starlight doesn't even have wings! Why would she come here?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't know, Spike, but it looked like she could fly with just magic! Keep your eyes open. We don't know what she has planned.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Isn't that Rainbow Dash?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Did Rainbow Dash look really young to you? And I didn't see a cutie mark. You don't think...

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: ...We traveled back in time to when Rainbow Dash raced the bullies who made fun of Fluttershy and performed her first sonic rainboom?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Spike, only Star Swirl the Bearded could do something like that, and even his spell just went back a week! How could Starlight do more than the greatest wizard in Equestria?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: With this.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Star Swirl's spell! Oh, no!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Come on, let's go!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Go where?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: To watch the race. I don't wanna miss the rainboom! Whoa!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Whoa!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Hey!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Aw, sorry about this.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Hey! What gives?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What did you do?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: You are about to find out.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Ugh... I don't know what Starlight's up to yet, but we'd better figure it out before it's too late.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Um, Twilight? I think it already is.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Uh, Twilight? Where's your castle?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: The map pulled us back, but whatever Starlight did in the past changed things here!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: But why? And how did we get here? Where's here?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: More like when.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What do you mean?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Starlight altered Star Swirl's spell, then somehow used it on the map to travel into the past and change something! Once she did, the map pulled us back to the present!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: So we're back where<U+0097> I mean, when we started?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Not exactly. Everything's different. Look. The map doesn't even make sense anymore! The Crystal Empire takes up half of Equestria!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Plus there's the whole missing castle thing.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Right! This is too big to handle on our own.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: You think?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: We need to find our friends and get help!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I'm gettin' a bad feeling about this, Twilight.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I know, Spike, but this is Ponyville. How bad could things be?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Is that Sugarcube Corner?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't understand.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] [panting] Rarity?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [grunts] Rarity?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't think she's here, Spike. I'm not sure anything we know is the same. But I know one place that could never change!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Applejack?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What can I do for you?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: It's so good to see you! We couldn't find Pinkie or Rarity or Fluttershy or Rainbow Dash, but I just knew you'd still be here!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Of course I am. This is my home. But who in tarnation is Pinkie Bow and Flutterdash? Or you for that matter?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: You... don't know who I am?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Nope. Honestly, the only name I recognize is Rarity, but she left for Manehattan years ago.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Probably to become a world-famous fashion designer, I bet.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Not that I know of. Last I heard, she went to help with the cause like everypony else.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: The cause?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: The war against King Sombra and the Crystal Empire?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Where have you two been?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Actually, it's when.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I know this is hard to believe, but you and I and those other ponies I mentioned are friends!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Did you bump your head on a crate of cider or somethin'?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I'm telling you the truth! And if you come with me, I'll prove it.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Well, I'll admit. I've lived in these parts my whole life and I've never seen this before.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: There's also supposed to be a castle that goes with it.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: But I still don't see what this has to do with you and I bein' friends.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Another pony named Starlight Glimmer used this map to travel through time and change things in the past. For some reason, the map's here but everything else is different!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Different how?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Well, for one thing, where we came from, there's no war with King Sombra. Maybe you could tell us how the war started, then we can figure out when everything changed!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: That's easy enough. [sighs] When the Crystal Empire returned, it brought King Sombra back with it.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [voiceover] And it didn't take long for him to force every one of his subjects to fight for him against Equestria.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [voiceover] And even with Princess Celestia leadin' the charge, it still takes every last pony in Equestria doin' their part, workin' day and night, to keep up the fight.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I just can't believe it! We stopped King Sombra! You and me and all of our friends!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: But we aren't friends. At least not here.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Right.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Look. I hope all this helped, but I really need to get back to cannin' those apples.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Thank you. We're going to set things right.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [sighs] I hope you do.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: So... how are we gonna set things right?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't know! The only thing we know for sure is that Starlight stopped the rainboom.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: And that the map's still here.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] Spike, that's it! The map is connected to the Tree of Harmony! It must sense that something isn't right! That's why it's still here! I'll just use Starlight's version of the spell and go back a little earlier and stop her before she even knows we're there!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: All we have to do now is find Starlight and<U+0097>

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Well, finding her will be easy! But stopping her's gonna be harder than you think. Sorry to disappoint you, but I created that spell to send myself back in time. So even when you cast it, I still get sent back here. It wasn't difficult to change Star Swirl's spell. He'd already done the hard part. But figuring out I could use the map to go to any time or place and pull you along with me? [short laugh] I even impressed myself with that. I knew you'd try to stop me. You're so predictable. Why else would I leave the scroll behind? Touching it triggered the map to whisk you here and watch me erase the one thing that linked you with your friends! My village was a sanctuary of equality, where nopony's cutie mark allowed them to feel superior! It was a special place, and you and your friends took it away!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Now it's my turn to take something special from you! Without the rainboom, you and your friends will never form your special cutie mark bonds! Cutie marks for cutie marks! Sounds like a fair trade to me!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Twiliiiiiiight!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Oops!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: [screaming] Thanks!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: No problem, Spike. At least now we know exactly what we have to do!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Okay, keep your eyes peeled.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Right!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: We have to stop Starlight as soon as Rainbow Dash and those bullies race by!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Um, Twilight?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: So be ready.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I know, but<U+0097>

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Because she could pop up anywhere!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Like over there?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Just remember how you'd feel if someone said those things to you.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What's going on here?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Oh, I was just reminding these two colts how hurtful teasing can be.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Well, don't!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I mean... you were?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Of course! In a world where everypony is unique, some are bound to feel more special than others. But that isn't a license to be cruel, is it?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: No, of course not...

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Oh, isn't it a shame we don't live in a world where everypony is equal? No one would ever tease anyone there! Wouldn't that be nice?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: No, it wouldn't! I mean, it'd be nice not to be teased, of course, but that's not the same thing!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I know you only convinced those bullies to not tease Fluttershy to stop the rainboom!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Oh, that's not true. I convinced them not to be bullies because everypony should be equal. Stopping the rainboom is just a bonus.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Look!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: This isn't over yet!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: If you say so!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Hi!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Um... hi?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: You think you can stop for a minute?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Sure.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I hear you're pretty fast!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Pretty fast? Please! I'm even faster than that!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Okay, so, um, hey, you want to race?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Um, that wouldn't really be fair. I mean, you're a full-grown pony, and... Wait. Are you an Alicorn?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Come on, I thought you were fast!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Uh, actually, I just remembered I have somewhere I need to be.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Okay, listen. You don't have to race me. I just need you to fly fast enough for a sonic rainboom!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: What?! I can't do that! Nopony can! It's not even a real thing! It's just an old mare's tale!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: But it's not! I know it's not! I've seen you do it! In the future!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Ooookay... I'm gonna go now.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: No! Wait!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Gee, Twilight, what's the matter? Couldn't convince her to do the impossible? That's too bad.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Ugh. Well, that didn't work.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: This is gonna be harder than I thought. We'll have to try again!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Hey, Twilight?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't want to live in that awful future we saw!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: I don't think you'll have to!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Pinkie? Fluttershy?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: Silence, changeling!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1
dialog: All servants of Queen Chrysalis found in these woods must be... destroyed!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Starlight Glimmer?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I was sure I saw her, Spike!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Welcome home, Twilight!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: We traveled back in time to when Rainbow Dash performed her first sonic rainboom?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Without the rainboom, you and your friends will never form your special cutie mark bond!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: But whatever Starlight did in the past changed things here!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't want to live in that awful future we saw!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't think you'll have to.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: All servants of Queen Chrysalis found in these woods must be... destroyed!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Wait! We're not changelings! I'm a pony! And he's a dragon!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: A likely story! Do something dragonish!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [wheezes] That works!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The servants of Chrysalis will do anything to save their evil skins!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Stop! If they are changelings we'll soon see. Though I think they're not what they appear to be.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Zecora! Please, you have to listen.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Beneath this salve, no changeling hides, for it reveals the truth inside.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: What does it mean?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The meaning is far worse, I see, for it is we who should not be.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I think I can explain.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I'm sure you can, but let's not talk here. Chrysalis and her army will soon draw near!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The changelings took over not long ago. Though I'll wager in your world that isn't so.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Chrysalis and her army tried to take over Canterlot, but my friends and I stopped her.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Those friends as you know them are not here, alas. But tell me how all this came to pass.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Starlight Glimmer, a pony who traveled back in time to stop my friends and me from ever coming together!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And it is these friends you have in life that keep Equestria free from strife?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I guess so. But this is the second time I've come back and this world is even worse than the last one! If Starlight keeps doing the same thing in the past, how could the present be so different?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Ah. Time is a river, where even the tiniest changes seen can lead to a cascade of effects downstream.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: This part of the forest is dark and damp, but it's done well to hide our camp.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: This is cozy.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [shrieks] Please! You have to help us!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The changelings attacked Ponyville! We barely escaped with our lives!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The only changeling attack I see is the one that come here looking for me!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [laughs] What a lovely village you've chosen to stage your little resistance. It looks absolutely delicious! [slurping] Oh, come now, Zecora. You're vastly outnumbered.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I know you don't want your charges hurt. Come quietly to the dungeons of Canterlot and I promise to leave the others alone.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Why would she ever trust you?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Even if there's a chance Chrysalis will honor her word, shouldn't you try?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [hushed] Race to the map while we hold off their attack. Stop Starlight and put the whole world back on track!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Time to make a decision, Zecora!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Not bad, but it's gonna take a lot more than that!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Lucky for you, there's more where that came from!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: You've really gotta work on your aim.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: What are you doing? You have to finish your race!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: No way! This is way more exciting!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: See? You can't stop me no matter what you do.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Aw, man.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: That's strange.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Well, you obviously don't mean us falling, because that's becoming pretty routine.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: No, it's just the other times we've come back, it's been day! But look!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Why would the map bring us back to a different time of day than when we left?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Um, maybe we should figure it out later!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [gasps] The Castle of the Two Sisters!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Well, don't just stand here!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: This place looks a lot cleaner than I remember.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Rarity?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The castle isn't open for viewings today. The tapestries all need changing. Again.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Rarity, it's me!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't socialize with dragons. I don't know anypony who would.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Rarity, you have to listen to me! The future of Equestria's at stake!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't know how you know my name, but I am far too busy to entertain some tourist's ridiculous fantasies.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I have to get back to the map so I can stop Starlight from changing the past, because every present I come to is worse than the last!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Time travel, you say? Now that's something I would like to see.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [laughing] Tell me how you came by this magic to travel through time.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The princess asked you a question! And unless you wanna end up in the dungeon, you'll tell her what she wants to know!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Nopony in my kingdom but me should possess a magic powerful enough to change time.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Your kingdom?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Who else?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Um... Celestia, of course!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [laughing] My sister has been imprisoned in the moon for years! But it is no less a fate than she'd sentence me to! Now, reveal to me the source of this time magic!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: ...Alright.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Twilight, no!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: We have no choice, Spike. [to Nightmare Moon] I can take you to it, but you'll have to get past the timberwolves.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I am the ruler of all of Equestria. Do you think I can't deal with timberwolves?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: No. I know you can.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And if you were thinking of trying to escape...

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: ...it would be very unfortunate for your friend.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: How does it work?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: A pony from my time used this spell to travel back and change the past.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And now you will give this spell to me! With it, I will ensure that the Elements of Harmony are never found and my reign lasts forever!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: But it won't.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: What?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: In my world, my friends and I found the Elements and used them to defeat you! And I will do everything in my power to bring that world back!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: No!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Noooooo!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Now more than ever I know how important it is to stop you!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Well, good luck!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Whoooaaaa!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Up for another race-ending fight, Twilight?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: No. You were right. I can't stop you.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: But you can't stop me from trying, and we could be stuck doing this for all eternity!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: If that's what it takes to keep you and your friends from getting your cutie mark connection, then I'm game!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: What you're doing goes way beyond cutie marks! Everything we do here in the past <U+0096> even the smallest change <U+0096> can snowball into an avalanche of trouble for the future!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Oh, next I suppose you'll tell me that "the fate of all of Equestria hangs in the balance"!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: It does!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Spare me your overblown ego! No group of friends, not even Princess Twilight's, is that important!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Aaaaaaah!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't know how important other ponies' friendships are to the future, but I can show you what the world is like without mine!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Where are we?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The future. Or rather, the present.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: But there's nothing here!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I wish I could say I was surprised. But every world I come back to is worse than the last. I don't know why my friends and I are so important to Equestria, but we are.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't believe you!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Come on, Starlight, look around!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Like I said, everything in the past affects the future, even the tiniest act. And what you're doing leads here. I know I can't stop you, but I thought showing you this might change your mind.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Change my mind? You don't know anything about me! I was perfectly happy before you and your friends ruined what I built!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I don't know what happened that led you to make your village without cutie marks, and I'm sorry my friends and I had to take it away.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: You want to know what happened to me?! I'll show you!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Where are we?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: That map of yours is connected to every part of Equestria, and this part is my home.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Sunburst and I did everything together. In fact, I don't remember us ever being apart. Until today.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And just like that, my friend was gone. His family recognized his magical talent and sent him off to Canterlot. I never saw him again.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Well, why not?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Because of his cutie mark! He got his, and I didn't! He moved on, and I didn't! I stayed here and never made another friend because I was too afraid another cutie mark would take them away, too!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: That's ridiculous. A cutie mark can't take your friends away.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Not everypony's lucky enough to get her cutie mark at the same time as her friends!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: You don't know what it's like to lose a friend because of a cutie mark. But once I stop the rainboom, you will!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And when I destroy this scroll, there'll be no way for you to change it!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Starlight, you're right! I don't know what you went through! But I do know you can't do this! I've seen where this leads, and so have you!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I only saw what you showed me! Who knows what'll really happen?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I've seen it a dozen times! Things don't turn out well in Equestria without my friends!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Ugh! What's so special about your friends?! How can a group of ponies that are so different be so important?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: The differences between me and my friends are the very things that make our friendship strong!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I thought Sunburst and I were the same. But we turned out different, and it tore our friendship apart!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: So try again! Make new friends! And if something that you can't control happens that changes things, work through it together! That's what friendship is! And it's not just my friendships that are important to Equestria! Everypony's are! When yours ended, it led us here. But just imagine all the others that are out there waiting for you if you just give them a chance!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: How do I know they won't all end the same way?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I guess it's up to you to make sure they don't.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [kissing] One Castle of Friendship <U+0096> check!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: What in Equestria was that?!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Is everypony okay?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [squeals] Can you do it again?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: One group of amazing friends <U+0096> check!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Yeah, Spike. It looks like we're home!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Uh... what's she doin' here?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Actually, it's kind of a long story.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I mean, I knew my rainboom was awesome, but I never thought all of Equestria depended on it!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Or on us!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I think it's more than that. Friendship connects all of Equestria, and undoing one group of friends made its magic less powerful.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I can't believe y'all were able to travel through time like that.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: That Starlight must be pretty magical!

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: She obviously has more talent for magic than almost anypony I've seen. My magic couldn't stop her. I had to convince her to stop on her own. Once I realized that, everything fell into place.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: But if she's as powerful as all that, we can't just send her on her way, can we?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Actually, I kind of have something else in mind.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [gulps, exhales] I know there's no excuse for what I did, but I want you all to know that I'm ready for whatever punishment you think is fair.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I've been thinking a lot about how badly Equestria fared without just one group of friends. Because even when one friendship dies, the results can be disastrous.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I know first-hoof how true that can be.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: And that's why I've asked you here. If you're willing to learn, I'm willing to teach you what I know. You'll have the power to make Equestria an even better place.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: [hushed] How do I start?

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Starting is easy! All you have to do is make a friend! And you've got seven of them right here.

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: I never thought that I would find a place To step right in and start again I never thought that I could just begin Right where I left off and make a friend

title: The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2
dialog: Don't ever think that it might be too late You don't have to wait, there's no mistakes with the friends you make A friendship's only made of what you bring And if you do it right, you can do anything

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [sighs] Okay. Library... Library... Where did they put the library?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [sighs] This castle looked a lot smaller from the outside.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [muffled] Morning, Starlight!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Whoops!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Sorry, Spike! I guess I'm still trying to find my way around. You don't happen to know where the library is, do you?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [muffled] Next door on the left!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh. Thanks!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Acceptance, mm-hmm. Altruism, definitely. Starlight, good morning, come in!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Sorry I'm late. I got a little turned around. I still can't believe you're letting me stay here... as your pupil... after everything I did.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, I'm not one to dwell on the past, and neither should you. The castle is your home now, and as far as being my pupil goes, I was just trying to figure out what your first friendship lesson should be!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, well, it looks like you're really narrowing it down!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, these are just the A's. After this, I move on to the B's!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know I'm just learning about friendship, but I didn't think there were this many lessons for anything. How do we choose?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Maybe I should pare things down a bit before we go through them. Why don't you join the others in the throne room? They're planning our trip to the Crystal Empire when Shining Armor and Princess Cadance have their baby!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, I think we should leave ASAP. I don't want to miss the Crystalling!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: But, um, shouldn't we wait for the invitation?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Frankly, I'm not exactly clear on all the customs and traditions of the Crystal Empire, especially when it comes to a Crystalling.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What's a Crystalling?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, that's just it, darling. Princess Cadance and Shining Armor's baby is due any day, and we're still not sure. The Crystal Empire was gone for a thousand years. A lot of their customs are a bit murky.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: We know it's got somethin' to do with the new baby.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [quickly] And a party!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And the Crystal Heart.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [quickly] And a party!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And some kinda cool energy.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And... a party!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It's not hard to understand. Most things in the Crystal Empire aren't. Like how I'm a big hero there, for example!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Eh... plus, I've had to help Twilight do a lot of research on Crystallings. Whenever a baby is born in the Crystal Empire, the parents bring it before the Crystal Heart. They get the purest shard of crystal they can find, then pick a crystaller to present the baby to everypony who comes. Then they all share the light and joy they feel, feeding it into the crystal that joins with the Heart, and increases its power! And this is going to be a royal Crystalling, so pretty much the whole empire will show up. That hasn't happened in a millennia!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What do you mean it increases the Crystal Heart's power?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The energy it uses to protect the Crystal Empire, I guess.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Protect it from what?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I... didn't help Twilight with that part.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Hey, Twilight, can I ask you something about the Crystal Empire?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Huh! Funny you should mention it. Because I just narrowed your first friendship lesson down to three options, and one of them is in the Crystal Empire!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Really?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I found out that's where the first pony you ever cared about lives!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Sunburst?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Of course, that's just one idea. We could also go to Griffonstone. [begins fading out] Making friends with a griffon is a challenge all by itself! Or we could tag along with the CMC's the next time they try to help a pony figure out why they're special...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [normal] Starlight? Is something wrong?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What? O-Oh, no, heh, those all sound great!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know! I guess you were right <U+0096> it is gonna be hard to choose one!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [laughs nervously] ...Yeah.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Ugh! I am never gonna find my way around this place!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Gee, Starlight, what's wrong?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I don't know, Spike. Twilight's figuring out what my first friendship lesson is, and I guess I'm not exactly thrilled with the options. Well... with one of them.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Which one?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Reuniting me with my first friend.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What's so terrible about that?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [sighs] [narrating] When we were foals, Sunburst knew everything there was to know about magic. He always knew just what to do. And he was always there to help me. I guess it's not surprising that Sunburst got his cutie mark in magic and... went off to Princess Celestia's school. But when he left...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: You blamed cutie marks and stripped a whole village of theirs, and when Twilight and the others stopped you, you went back in time and almost destroyed Equestria.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Not really stuff I'm super eager to tell Sunburst about. I mean, he's probably some big important wizard now, and... I can't even find my way around Twilight's castle.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, if Sunburst is that good at magic, maybe he'd appreciate your, uh... [clears throat] exploits. You should talk to Twilight about it. I'm sure she'd want to hear what you have to say.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know. But I don't want her to think I'm not ready to learn or that I'm not grateful for everything she's doing.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Spike! Come quick!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It's a Crystalling invitation!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Shining Armor's a father! I'm an aunt! Well, this settles it! Since we're going to the Crystal Empire, your first friendship lesson is going to be... reuniting with Sunburst!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Great...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [yawn] Um, Applejack, what is that?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, just a little somethin' for the young'un. Made from genuine Sweet Apple Acres apple trees. We make 'em for all the Apples, and anypony related to Twilight is practically family.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Yeah, it's okay... But it's no Cloudsdale mobile! Bam!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Pretty!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, a mobile is real nice... as long as you have somethin' to lay in so you can look at it.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And a fetching blanket to keep you warm.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm sure Shining Armor and Princess Cadance will love all our gifts. But I think they're more happy we'll be attending the baby's Crystalling.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Ooh! I can't wait to see all that light and love make the Crystal Heart even more sparkly and shiny!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Actually, Pinkie, the Crystal Heart is an ancient and powerful relic. Without its magic, the Crystal Empire would be lost to the Frozen North.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Wow, this Crystalling sounds pretty important. I'd understand if you wanted to... you know... wait to do a different friendship lesson when we get back.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Are you kidding? This trip is perfect! Not only do I get to see the baby and take part in the ceremony that helps maintain the magic of the Crystal Empire, but I'm starting my new pupil off with the most amazing friendship lesson ever! I can't wait!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Right... Me neither... [beat] Actually, Twilight, I am a little worried about meeting Sunburst.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, trust me. I know what it's like to see old friends. But I'll be right there to help things along. I've broken the whole lesson down into a few easy steps to ensure this reunion goes off without a hitch!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [reading] Step one, head to Sunburst's house and get you two started on the right hoof. Step two, get to the castle with enough time to visit the ba<U+0097>

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] Shining Armor!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired] Twilight...!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I didn't know you were meeting us!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired] Of course I am! It's me, right here. Here I am. Why wouldn't I come meet my sister? Though we have met before, heh-heh...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Are you all right?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired] Never better! Being a father is amazing! And wonderful, and amazing, and confusing, and amazing, but surprising too, you know? I mean, not that you'd know. You wouldn't know, I know... You know? [beat] Sorry. I haven't really slept since Cadance had the baby. Come to think of it, she hasn't either. It sure would be great to get a break.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, of course! I don't know what I was thinking! You two probably need all kinds of help! I'm sorry, Starlight, but I guess combining your first lesson with this visit wasn't such a good idea.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, uh, don't be ridiculous! You're an aunt now! That's way more important than some friendship lesson.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I just wish there was a way to do both.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Maybe there is! You've already done the work for Starlight's lesson with this list. All we have to do is follow it!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Spike, you're a genius!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [through nervous laugh] Yeah... [through gritted teeth] genius.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Then it's settled! Shining Armor and I will head straight to the castle, and you two can head straight to Sunburst's!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Aye-aye, Princess!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [nervously] Uh-huh.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Alright, big brother, let's go see this amazing baby pony!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [snoring] Ahhh... the baby...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know you're a little worried about this reunion, but I'm sure Twilight's got everything covered.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Everything except how I'd rather do absolutely anything else.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, I bet she's taken that into account too. It's all part of the lesson. Trust the lesson.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Right... [beat] Hey, i-is that... you?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, yep, it sure is! Now, according to the list, Sunburst's house is<U+0097>

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Why is there a statue of you in the Crystal Empire?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Really?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Um, when were you going to tell me about this?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Nah, it's no big deal.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: That's it! We're not going anywhere until I get the whole story!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Before we go in, I should probably tell you. Seeing the baby might be a bit of a shock.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Of course, I could be wrong.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The baby is an Alicorn?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired] It looks that way.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: But... But... But I thought Alicorn wings had to be earned by accomplishing some great, princess-worthy deed!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Yeah. How can you just be born with 'em?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The birth of an Alicorn is something Equestria has never seen!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It is beyond even our understanding.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [hushed] That's not very reassuring.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Wow! A unicorn, and a Pegasus! So she could be a super-strong flyer and have crazy baby magic!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, I know all about super-strong flying!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And I can help keep tabs on her magic!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It appears her magic is more powerful than that of a newborn unicorn!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The crowds have already started to gather.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [inhales] [blows balloon] This Crystalling is gonna be some party!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Do you think we should call it off?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Um, we've all faced a lot worse than baby magic.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I can't imagine cancelling such a beautiful and important ceremony over something so potentially adorable!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: In light of the little one's abilities, this Crystalling might be more important than ever. [to Cadance] Perhaps you should address your subjects and remind them of that.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Shining Armor! Do you have everything you need for the ceremony?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired] Huh? Oh, no! I still have to interview the honor guards, choose the purity crystal, and pick a crystaller!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Alright, take it easy. Pinkie can stay here with me and keep an eye on the baby.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: And we'll all help you with everythin' else.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [snores] ...baby...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: That is, if you can stay awake long enough to tell us how.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: ...and that's how we found the Crystal Heart, defeated King Sombra, and saved the Empire.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, as much as I love reliving my heroic deeds, Starlight and I have an important lesson to do, by order of the Princess of Friendship!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Aw, come on, Spike! I want to hear about the Games too!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know you're nervous about seeing Sunburst, but it says right in step 3, to, uh, "Deal with your fears by facing them, not by putting it off."

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Ugh. Let's go get this over with.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Wait!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Huh? What?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Knocking on the door isn't the next thing on the list!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Seriously?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I know Twilight can be a little nitpicky, but this is your first lesson as her pupil, and it's important that we do it right!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Fine. What's the next thing on the list?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [clears throat] [reading] "Before they see each other, be sure to highlight the importance of the meeting."

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm pretty sure we can skip that.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I don't know... I mean if we skip it, the whole lesson could go south! And then you might end up taking a giant step backwards instead of forwards! Maybe you'll never be able to learn anything about friendship at all! It's almost like your whole future depends on this moment. [beat] "Highlight the importance of the meeting" <U+0096> check! I can't believe you wanted to skip that!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Sunburst?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Yes? What can I do for you?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It's... It's me, Starlight. We used to be friends?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [beat] Oh, of course! S-Starlight! My goodness, it-it's been a long time! What, uh, what have you been up to?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Me? Oh! You know, some of this, some of that, different... stuff. Right now, I'm sort of Twilight Sparkle's new pupil.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The Princess of Friendship?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Heh... yeah... that's actually kind of why I'm here. I mean, I know you're probably very busy.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What do you mean?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, I figured after magic school, you'd go on to do important wizard work, but...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh. No. Y-Yes! Uh, y-yes, that's me, yup. [nervous chuckle] Important wizard! Really busy with lots of, uh, wi-wizarding... stuff. [beat] Right. Uh, well... good to see you.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Huh. Maybe we should have skipped highlighting the importance of the meeting after all.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well, I guess that's that!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Starlight, come on! We have to at least explain what Twilight wants!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [tired, amplified] Dearest citizens, I am sure you are all just as thrilled and ready for this Crystalling as myself and Shining Armor.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [panicked breathing] I'm not ready!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Take it easy! Just pick whoever looks the most like honor guard material.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Right... right.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm sorry. Fatherhood is way more stressful than I ever thought.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I can only imagine.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Now, I know choosing the crystal of purity is a very important decision. So I have gone through the trouble of arranging them in order from incredibly pure to outrageously pure.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Um, Rarity, don't they all sort of look the same?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Oh, well, to the untrained eye, perhaps. What do you think, Shining Armor?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [incoherent stammering] I don't know!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: [hushed] I hope Twilight and Pinkie are having better luck with the baby!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Well... at least she's having... fun!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Whee!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Pinkie, hold her still!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm tryiiiiiiing!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: So... the Princess of Friendship wants you and I to be friends again?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Heh, I know. Weird, right?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Uh, I don't understand. Did something happen to you after I left for magic school?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: No! I-I don't see what that has to do with anything. W-Why would you even ask that?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I mean, did something happen to you after you left for magic school?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: What? Um, no. L-Like you said, I'm a, [clears throat] i-important wizard.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm sure there's something on Twilight's list that can help here.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: Okay. I chose the honor guard, picked the purity crystal, and I know exactly who I want to be our crystaller. So, all we need is...

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: The baby?

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: We're here!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: She's a really strong flyer!

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: I'm guessin' that's gonna make it harder to do the Crystalling.

title: The Crystalling - Part 1
dialog: It's worse than that. Without the Heart, the Crystal Empire's about to be buried under a mountain of ice and snow!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I still can't believe you're letting me stay here... as your pupil.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Shining Armor's a father! I'm an aunt!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Your first friendship lesson is going to be... reuniting with Sunburst!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Uh, y-yes, that's me, yup. [nervous chuckle] Important wizard!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The baby is an Alicorn?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: So she could be a super-strong flyer and have crazy baby magic!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Without the Heart, the Crystal Empire's about to be buried under a mountain of ice and snow!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: So... not only can we not take part in a fabulous ancient ceremony, but we're also about to be frozen solid!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Without the Crystal Heart's magical protection, the entire city's about to become a winter wasteland!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: But what about when King Sombra ruled the Crystal Empire and the Crystal Heart was missin'? The city wasn't covered in snow then!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The Heart wasn't missing. It was still in the castle. King Sombra had just hidden it.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'm afraid Twilight is correct, and the storm clouds are already forming.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I can totally fly up there and bust those puppies! No problem!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I wouldn't advise it, Rainbow Dash. Those storm clouds are not like the ones you know.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: This far north, the weather has a will of its own, and now it will only grow stronger, enveloping everything in its path.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Including the Crystal Empire!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: And us along with it!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: There's gotta be somethin'...

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I know Princess Twilight is keen on the two of us rekindling our friendship, but... it's been so long. I don't see how anything on that list is going to help.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I know, right? It's not like there's some spell that would magically compel us to pick up where we left off.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, actually, there's several. Mistmane's Material Amity, Rockhoof's Rapport, Flash Prance's Fellow... ship... [ahem] But I-I get the feeling the princess isn't looking for a spell.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [chuckle] Definitely not.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Got it! [reading] "And if all else fails, ask them to share an embarrassing moment from their past, maybe even something they regret!"

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Uh, I don't see how that would help.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Uh, yeah! We should just get out of your mane. It's pretty obvious this isn't going how Twilight hoped, and I'm sure you have plenty of important work to do...

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What? Oh! Right, yes, heh-heh! Uh, no rest for the wizardly.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Come on, Spike.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: There must be a spell that can restore the Crystal Heart!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Perhaps.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: But it isn't something that either of us know.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The library here at the castle is nearly as extensive as the one in Canterlot. There's a good chance we can find something there!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Can you hold off the storm?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Yes, for a time, but even our magic will eventually succumb to the power of the Frozen North.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We will do what we can, but you must hurry.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't know how long it will take to find the right spell, but you should probably tell the crowd outside to get somewhere warm!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: And try not to mention the Crystal Heart. We don't want to start a panic.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Yes, ma'am. C'mon, girls!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'm gonna need all of your help. The crystal library is enormous!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You can count on us, Twily!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Where'd she go?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: This way!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, Spike, looks like my biggest fears came true. I wouldn't be surprised if Twilight decides to give up on me entirely.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It's not the list, Spike. Or you. Or Twilight. I'm the one Sunburst doesn't want to be friends with.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't remember him saying he didn't want to be friends.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: He didn't have to say it.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, Twilight obviously thinks you're worth being friends with! And I do too!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Thanks, Spike. At least I have two friends, even if one of them has dragon breath.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [exhales] Uh, that's not dragon breath. It's freezing!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh, you're right! But I thought the Crystal Heart was supposed to keep the cold weather out.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It is... unless something's happened! Come on!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We're just saying that it might not be the best idea to stay outside!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Still, when you think about it, the view is just as good a little further back, like... inside your house?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Honestly, I don't know if there's gonna be a Crystallin'. The truth is, the baby's an Alicorn and her magic's plum crazy, so you might not wanna be that close after all.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Look, I am a hundred percent sure the Crystalling isn't happening.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Young filly... come back here!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Come to your Auntie Pinkie Pie!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Bridle Buck's Boat Chants, Hayhoof's Intonements, Mystic Maps and Mazes... [groans] Anything up there?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Not yet! I'm not even sure how these are organized!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Shining Armor, I thought you were taking care of the baby!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'm trying!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Gotcha!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh! Or not...

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Whoa!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What is going on?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You want the long or the short version?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Short?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [quickly] The baby's an Alicorn and she accidentally destroyed the Crystal Heart, so Twilight and Cadance are looking for a spell to put it back together and save the Crystal Empire from turning into a giant wasteland of ice and snow.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [gasps] What about this? Trotter's Tome of Reliquary?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I think this is it!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [reading] "Spell of Relic Reconstitution"! I can't believe we found it!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It's a good thing, too! Without this, I don't know what we'd do!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oops.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: That spell was the only thing we found in the whole library that was even close to what we needed!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'm so sorry, Twilight!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It's not your fault, Starlight. None of us were expecting any of this.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Do you think you can remember the spell?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I only read it through once!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, if anypony can exactly remember something she read for the first time two minutes ago, it's you, Twilight.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'll try. But I'm not sure how long it'll take.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Is quickly an option?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'll help if I can, but we should evacuate the city just in case! You need to lead everypony to the train station before the tracks freeze over!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We will. But between you and Twilight, I'm sure you'll remember the spell.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I only hope this spell is the one we need.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Is there anything I can do?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't think so. I'm just sorry about your lesson.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh, that doesn't matter now. Sunburst and I don't have anything in common anyway. He's a big important wizard! And I'm re-learning everything I ever thought I knew.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Sunburst? I don't recognize the name, but if he's an important wizard, you should bring him here. Maybe he'll know what to do if the spell fails.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [gasps] Of course!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You better go with her, Spike.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [straining] Sunburst! Haven't you looked outside?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Snow? That's... not right. The Crystal Heart<U+0097>

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Is gone! The baby <U+0096> Shining Armor and Cadance's baby <U+0096> it's an Alicorn!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Really?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Really! And her magic is a little berserk, and well, I guess she destroyed the Heart! But Twilight thinks she can fix it and Princess Cadance thought you could help!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Me?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Of course! You're an important wizard in the Crystal Empire! It just makes sense!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Right... right... right right right. You know, I'd like to help, I-I really would. I-I just have so much, um, important wizard work to do around here.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You can't stay here!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I really don't think it's going to happen.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Come on, it's freezing out here!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Not like this! We don't have time to argue! Princess Cadance has decided to evacuate the city!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't know if we'll ever have another Crystalling again! The Crystal Heart... is shattered.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [groan] That's what we've been tryin' to tell you!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Sunburst, I know you're busy, but did you hear what I said?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh, I heard you, but-but like I said, when you're an important wizard, the work just piles up.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Sunburst!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [sighs] Look, Starlight, I want to help. I do. But I can't. I wish I could.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What do you mean?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Fixing an ancient relic? I-I can't even come close to doing something like that!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: But I thought you were an important wizard!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, you were wrong, okay?! I'm not an important wizard! I'm not even a wizard at all!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I know it's hard for you to understand, but not all of us end up achieving greatness.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What? Why wouldn't I understand that?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Really? You're the prot<e9>g<e9> of the Princess of Friendship! I don't think she picks just anypony for that!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Technically, she's more of a student than a prot<e9>g<e9>.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Whatever. I'm sorry I'm not the big important wizard you were expecting.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Sunburst, I don't care if you're a wizard or not. I'm just surprised. You always knew so much about magic. I mean, look at all these books!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Yeah, well, reading about magic is one thing, but you don't know what it was like at magic school! To know so much and not be able to do any of it!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, you don't know what it was like to be left behind! And then getting so bitter that you steal the cutie marks from an entire village and then get defeated by Twilight and her friends, so you travel through time to get back at them, but they beat you again and teach you about friendship, but you're so terrified ponies will find out what you did that you can't make any friends!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Did you really travel through time?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: See? I told you he'd be impressed.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'm sorry we lost touch. Maybe if I had reached out, you could have helped me at magic school, and I could have helped you to...

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Not become totally evil? [sighs] Let's just say I know what it's like to have something you're not exactly proud of.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: When you showed up thinking I was some big wizard... I'm sorry. I should have told you the truth.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It's fine. At least we worked it all out. I think Twilight would be proud of us.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, if you ever want to tell her about it, we should probably leave now!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: [gasps] I forgot to tell you! They're evacuating the city! You need to get to the train station, unless you've got a spell here that will drive back the Frozen North and fix the Crystal Heart so the baby can have her Crystalling?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Crystalling...! Of course!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Push them back, my sister!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: This way!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Ugh!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Just a little bit further, y'all! The station's just ahead!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We have to go back!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I know how to stop this!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Uh, I think that's everything?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: It looks right to me, but... there's only one way to find out!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The spell failed. I don't know what else to do.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: An old student of mine believes he does.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The baby did this?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I tried putting it back together with<U+0097>

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The spell of Relic Reconstitution. No, that won't do it. The Crystal Heart's been around for millennia. Restoring a relic like this is way beyond one spell. You need to combine it with something else. Something unique to the relic itself. Something that strengthens it and provides it with power...?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: The Crystalling!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Combining that spell with the light and love of everypony gathered for the ceremony, together with... Somnambula's Weather Abjuration to clear away the snow... and a little Fledgling's Forbearance for the parents... Heh. That should curb the little one's power fluctuations.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You must be Sunburst. Starlight said you were a powerful wizard.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh, I'm no wizard.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: But he studied magic his whole life! You should see his house! And since nopony has any better ideas, what do we have to lose?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I had planned on asking Twilight to be our crystaller, but since it seems like she'll be busy...

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I'd be honored!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, what are we waiting for?!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Citizens! May I present the newest member of the Crystal Empire!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: For a pony who isn't great at magic, you did pretty well.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Indeed. I'm glad to see you've found a way to share your unique gift, Sunburst. You may be more of a wizard than you think.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Yeah, peaceful now, anyway.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I suppose that spell really did the trick!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We have Sunburst to thank for that.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I hope he takes his role as crystaller seriously. Something tells me the baby will need a pony like him to look to for magical advice.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: We were thinking... "Flurry Heart".

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You know, to remember the occasion.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Oh, goodness, how could anypony forget?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, I think you're the Crystal Empire's big important wizard, whether you like it or not.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't know if I'll have time for any wizarding. I'm a crystaller now. That's a big responsibility.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I can't think of anypony more qualified. Just... promise you'll stay in touch?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Hm, like I'd ever lose touch with my oldest friend.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What's wrong, Twilight?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: I don't know, Spike. I think I have a lot to learn about being a teacher.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: What are you talking about? Your lesson went perfectly! Starlight and Sunburst got over their past and rekindled their friendship!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: No thanks to me. I know a lot happened. I just wish I could have given my pupil the attention she deserves.

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Well, I know she needed to be put on the right path, but giving her the space to make her own decisions worked pretty well. Isn't that how Celestia taught you?

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: You know, I never thought about it! But I guess it is!

title: The Crystalling - Part 2
dialog: Maybe you're a better teacher than you thought.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [singsong] We're going to Manehattan, we're going to Manehattan, we're going to Manehattan...!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [nonplussed] Yes, yes, Manehattan, the height of sophistication, elegance, culture... Since my boutique in Canterlot has been doing so nicely, it only makes sense for me to open one there as well.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [squeals] We're almost there! Why doesn't your face look like this?! Eee...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, Pinkie, dear, this is just a business trip for me. I need to scour the city for the most perfect location for my new shop. And while it's lovely how excited you are, there's absolutely no chance of me getting swept into the<U+0096> [gasps] [suddenly excited] energy, the beauty, the majesty of the greatest city in all of Equestria!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] This city's simply a-ma-zing! It's just... everything, ever!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: And it's about to get everything ever-er! Because guess who I see! M-A-U-D! You know what that spells?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] It spells Maud.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud, Maud, Maud! Yay!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, you Pie sisters have just about the sweetest family traditions! Every year, you set aside a special day to spend with each of your sisters?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yep! I do separate trips with each one, and we make it super fun by picking a different location every year! We see the sights all day and then swap gifts at sunset! And since Maud's getting her rocktorate nearby, we figured this would be the perfect spot for PSSSD!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [hushed] Okay, what's the secret?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Huh?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You just said 'pssst'.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: No, silly! Not pssst, PSSSD! P-S-S-S-D! Pie Sisters Surprise Swap Day!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Boulder promised his cousin a postcard.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I'll just leave you two to your PSSSD. And now, I am off to scout possible locations for my new boutique!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Before you go, can I ask you a quick question?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, of course.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [loudly] Will you please help me?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [nervously] Only if you let go of my leg and stand up...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Every year, Maud's PSSSD gift always blows mine away! But this year is going to be different! For the first time, I'm finally getting her a gift that's as good as the one she always gets me! There's a specialty store here in Manehattan that sells nothing but rock pouches! A rock pouch would be perfect for Boulder, and I know Maud will love it!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Why, Pinkie, that really is the perfect gift for Maud!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I know, right? Problem is, I still need to buy one, and the store is downtown!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hmm, and you want to get a pouch for Maud without ruining the surprise... Well, luckily for you, I know exactly what you should do! Why not sight-see on a path that leads right to the pouch store? That way Maud won't get suspicious! I'll come with you to distract Maud, so...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Y-Yes, yes, yes, let's not get too excited until you actually get a pouch for Maud.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Of course. Got it. Absolutely.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Nothing moved him.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud! I'm giving you the greatest PSSSD gift in the history of ever!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, what a spectacular view! You really can see everything from here!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Especially the glaciation of the sloping strata. It's breathtaking.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: But not half as breathtaking as the gift I'm giving you!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I-It certainly is<U+0096> [grunts] <U+0096>cozy... but this simply won't do! Working in a space this small would make me lose my mind!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Just like Maud's gonna lose her mind when she sees the gift I'm giving her!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Whatever you were about to say isn't nearly as good as the gift I'm giving Maud!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] You'll be pleased with yours too.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Pinkie, put down that crayon! The Cantering Cook isn't that kind of restaurant!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh... A pony could get used to eating at places like this!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I know. It's the only restaurant in the city with nepheline syenite in their bathroom tiles.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [stutters] ...Well, isn't that something! [deliberately] You know what, Pinkie Pie? Uh, maybe you could help me figure out what to order!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [hushed] We're so close to the pouch store! It's just a block away! I could practically smell it from here! If I knew what a pouch store smelled like.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
