dialog: [hushed] Okay, remember the plan. I will stay here and distract Maud while you go get a pouch!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [hushed] Gotcha!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deliberately] Oh, why, thank you for the kind assistance, Pinkie Pie. And now I know exactly what to order.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deliberately] You are very welcome, Rarity! Now pardon me whilst I go wash my hooves!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Sorry!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: So, Maud... that Boulder of yours is such an interesting... ahem... character. You must tell me, how did the two of you first meet?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] It was a dark and stormy night. Little did I know that my life was about to change forever.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [gasps] Look at that hand-stitched ten-thousand-thread-count velvet-lined rock pouch! Maud will love it! I need it!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ungh! Huh, must be stuck! [reading] "Took a sudden vacation to Canterlot with my grandniece. Back in a few moons." Oh, no. Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no-no! Well, maybe, just maybe, he's already back from vacation and just forgot to take the sign down! [shouting and pounding on door] Hello, Mr. Pouch Store Owner! I'd like to hear all about your sudden vacation in Canterlot with your grandniece while buying a pouch for my sister please!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: But it can't be. It just can't be! If I can't get that pouch... then not only am I not getting my sister the greatest present in the history of PSSSD, but now I have no PSSSD present for my sister at all!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] ...and Boulder's been by my side ever since.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Wow. What a surprisingly suspenseful and compelling story. I completely get what you see in him now. [gasps] Pinkie Pie, you're back! [deliberately] Oh, your hooves must be sparkling clean!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Gar<e7>on! One super-deluxe two-mile-high hot fudge sundae, stat!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What happened? Did you get a pouch for Maud? Tell me everything!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, not to worry, dear! I'll just have to help you find a new present for Maud. We have plenty of time before your gift exchange at sunset and all of Manehattan to explore. We're bound to find something Maud would like. Maybe even more than a rock pouch!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You're right! Thanks, Rarity!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud, I can't help but notice you're staring at that marvelous giraffe. I was just wondering, any chance you could see yourself with it?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Only if I had a mirror.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Now, Maud, I know you're a big fan of rocks, so get your camera ready, because these are the most spectacular rocks in all of Manehattan! Surely there must be something here that catches your eye.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] [hushed] Boulder says they're all too... stuck-up.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I like... that.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What is it? You have to tell me! Was it this bike? This lamp? This grappling hook? What do you like?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I like that fissure in the sidewalk. It's an elegant example of thermal expansion and soil settlement.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Fissure in thhhhhhhe soil...? What?! But I...! All of this...! And she likes a crack?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Did she like anything?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [hushed] That sister of yours is simply impossible to shop for! There's nothing she needs or wants!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] [calling out] Boulder. Boulder. Where'd you run off to? There you are. Sure wish I had something to carry you around in.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: A rock pouch was the perfect gift for Maud! Aw, and I know she would have loved the one I saw in the window! It had double stitching, a red drawstring...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: ...and ochre-flecked velvet lining with reinforced triple-crosshatched seams?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yep, that's the pouch. [beat] Wait, how'd you know?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Because I'm looking at one just like it! Maybe if you can catch up with him, you could ask<U+0097>

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Excuse me, sir! I couldn't help but notice your nifty rock pouch! Is there any chance you'd be willing to part with it? I really need it. Like, really really really!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I believe I said really really really.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: So you'll sell it to me? And I'll finally be able to give my sister the perfect Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day present? Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [gasps] M-My... party cannon...?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Do you see the exposed chalcedony in the fissure?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Probably?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [despondent] What you guys lookin' at?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, you're back! [to Maud] Darling, I want to get one more picture of you with that astounding fissure in the sidewalk, and the inspiration just struck me for the perfect shot! Uh, be a dear and go stand behind it. Okay, now just, uh, back up a little bit! Little more! And now just a little... uh... twenty yards more! Perfect! Hold that pose! I think we found your new holiday card! [hushed, to Pinkie] So, how did it go? Tell me, tell me, tell me!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [despondent] Well, I got the rock pouch for Maud, and... that's really the only thing that matters.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, I am so glad to hear that! She's going to absolutely love it!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [despondent] Yup.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: "Yup"? That's it? You got your sister the greatest PSSSD present in the history of ever, and all you have to say is "yup"?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [despondent] Yup.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: But... you're Pinkie Pie. You're supposed to be all [quickly] "Oh, I'm so excited I bought the rock pouch! And I know I say excited a lot when I'm actually just kind of excited, but this time I'm really excited about how excited I am about being this excited over the rock pouch!" [normally] And then you fire off your party cannon. Say, where is your cannon? [gasps] Did you lose it? Is your party cannon lost somewhere in the big city?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I can clearly see that something's bothering you, and I want to help. But I can't help you unless you tell me what the problem is.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [despondent] Oh, there's no problem. It just turns out that the going rate for a rock pouch in Manehattan is one party cannon. Who knew?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You gave away your cannon?! But, but that party cannon is your everything! You absolutely love that cannon! How could you possibly part with something that means so much to you?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I finally got Maud a gift that's just as good as the ones she always gets me, and that's all that really matters.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I guess I understand... maybe.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud's going to be so excited. I can't wait to see the look on her face when she sees the pouch!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I know, the camera loves Boulder.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: After the day we've had, I'm probably looking forward to the swap part of the Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day even more than the two of you! [giggles] And I'm not even a Pie sister! I can't wait one more second to see the wonderful gifts you've gotten each other!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, you're going to have to. We don't just swap, silly. We always sing the Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day Song first! Ready, Maud?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] As I'll ever be.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: It's the Pie Sisters' Swap Day Sooooooong!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Hey.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [growls] Just open them already!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Thanks.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I knew you'd love it! It was all worth it! Look how happy she is! And I couldn't have done it without you. Thank you, Rarity. Okay! Time to open your present to me! Oh! You did it again! You got me the best present in the history of PSSSD! This is perfect! This is amazing! This is incredible! I love it, I love it, I love it! [beat] What is it?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] It's little pieces of cupcake-scented paper. You know, confetti. For your cannon.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You're right, that is impressive. But it's no fissure in the sidewalk.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] [to Boulder] Play nice.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, I'm so relieved to see that you like the pouch. Especially considering what Pinkie Pie had to give up for it. [gasps] Oh!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] What?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I mean... forget I said that! I'm, I-I-I'm glad to see that you like the pouch. You can remember that part. Just forget the second part. You know, the second part where I said that Pinkie Pie had to give something up<U+0097> [shrieks] Perhaps I should just stop talking now. Nothing!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hee-hee, yay! I love my sister and my new confetti!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Why isn't she using her party cannon?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Gahhhh...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deliberately] Ooh! Wow, look how filthy my hooves are! I really should go wash them!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Where's her cannon?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: No, no, stop, stop giving me that look! I can't take it! Nnnnn... [quickly] Pinkie Pie feels bad that the gifts that she always gives you are never as good as the ones that you give her!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] What?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: That's why she was willing to give up the party cannon for the pouch!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] She gave up her party cannon?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Pinkie Pie! You might want to come over here for a second!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I think I know what this is about. You guys wanna ride the swans. Well, there are swan boats, but there are real swans here we can ri<U+0097>

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] You gave away your party cannon?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [inhales] She broke me.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Nnngh, it's just... It's just... It's just... You always give better gifts than me! That's why I had to get you the perfect gift! [beat] Are your hooves dirty? Where're you going?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] To get your cannon back.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] There.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yep! That sure is the pony I got the pouch from!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: That's amazing! How did you know where he'd be?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Maud Sense.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Runs in the family!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I'd like to return this pouch for my sister's party cannon, please.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] [slightly more forcefully] I'd like to return this pouch for my sister's party cannon, please.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ooh, I've never seen her like this! Look at the fire in her eyes! You'd better do what she says!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh! Did she just clench her jaw?! I think she clenched her jaw!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, no! When she clenches her jaw... you know what that means?!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Trust me, you do not want to know!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] I'd like to return this pouch.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maud! I'm so happy you got me my party cannon back! Yay!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh-oh. I just realized something. 'Cause you gave back the pouch for my cannon, this is now the second gift you've gotten me today! And it's something I really, really wanted! You did it again! Your gifts are always better than mine! Next year, I'm gonna have to really step it up and<U+0097>

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] Pinkie, gift giving isn't a competition. It's an expression of love, and you always make sure to give your gifts with lots of love. That's why I'll always love them, and you, five-ever. That's even longer than for-ever.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Awwww! [to Rarity] There you are! You've sure been washing your hooves for a long time! We've got a train to catch here!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I know, but there is one more sight you two simply must see before we leave.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Voila! Welcome to the future home of "Rarity For You"! What do you think of the place? Is this the right location? Did I pick a good spot?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] No. You picked the perfect spot.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You know, I think this might be my favorite PSSSD ever! But I can't wait 'til next year's PSSS-D-W-R!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Wait. PSSS-D-W-R? What's that?

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: P-S-S-S-D-W-R! It's a new tradition that Maud and I came up with! Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day...

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [deadpan] With Rarity.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh! Ohhh! Why, that's the sweetest... Oh, no. Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no. I know how good you two are at giving gifts! I'm going to have to get you both something amazing, and I only have a year to do it!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, Rarity! It doesn't matter what you get us! As long as you give your gift with love, it'll be perfect!

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Why, thank you, Pinkie.

title: The Gift of the Maud Pie
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Josh Haber, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Buuuut now that you mention it... I could use more confetti for my party cannon. You wouldn't believe how much of that stuff I go through in a day!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Hear ye, hear ye! The first post-cutie mark meetin' of the Cutie Mark Crusaders is now in session!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh! I'm sorry, Apple Bloom. I was distracted by the radiance of my cutie mark... Did you say something?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I mean... it's pretty amazing how the colors just pop off your flank. It's kinda hard to look aw<U+0097>

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Look, I know our cutie marks are amazing, but is that all we're gonna do now? Just spend our days starin' down at our own flanks?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] I guess not.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, I suppose that could get real boring...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [wistfully] Yeah... [beat] This is ridiculous! We need to go out and do somethin'!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wow, you're right!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, we need to go try new stuff like we used to!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Exactly.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Like square dancing!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And the more things we try, the more chances we'll have to finally get our cutie marks! Come on!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Um... Apple Bloom?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wow... Did we really only ever do things just to get our cutie marks?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I don't know. Maybe?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Aw, come on! We did lots of stuff that didn't have anything to do with getting a cutie mark.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Of course we did!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Absolutely!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Huh. So now that we don't have to do stuff to get our cutie marks, what is it that the Cutie Mark Crusaders actually do?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: We do exactly what we got our cutie marks in!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Helping other ponies!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ponies without cutie marks!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Or ponies who've forgotten their special purpose!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Exactly! We just have to find ponies who need our help! Come on!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But are you sure you feel content?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Eeyup.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Not even a tinge of dissatisfaction?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Nnnope.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Not even the slightest naggin' sensation that you don't really know what your purpose is in life or why you have a big apple as a cutie mark?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [grunts] [spits] [annoyed] Nnnope.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: The important thing to remember is that there is no rush.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: The three of us tried for the longest time, but it just comes when it comes!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And it's totally normal to feel confused and maybe even a little lost. But being a blank flank is nothing to be ashamed of.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: So if you're having even the slightest problem...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...or concerns or questions...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...we want you to know that we are here to help.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Mrs. I... don't think they're too worried about it yet.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: This is gonna be a lot harder than I thought.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Who knew there were so few ponies worried about their cutie marks?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Kinda makes you wonder why we made such a big deal out of it for so long.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: The point is, helpin' ponies with cutie mark problems is what makes us special.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But if we can't find anypony with a problem...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...Maybe we're not special.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah! I know exactly what you mean. You can't find a cutie mark problem. I have a cutie mark problem. It's so confusing, and I feel like the solution is staring me right in the muzzle.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I see why you guys hang out here! It's cozy!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [straining] The Crusader Clubhouse is a safe place, Mr... um... Bulk.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: A place where we faced all kinds of cutie mark problems!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: A place where we'll go on to solve even more! Startin' with yours!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No matter how long it takes!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Or how hard it is!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: We'll solve it because that's what we do!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: So... what's your cutie mark problem?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, right. Uh, well, my cutie mark is a dumbbell, but I've lifted every dumbbell in Ponyville!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [nervously] Have you tried lifting other things?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You mean, not dumbbells?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oof! I mean... no. I hadn't thought of that. You guys are awesome!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But... what happens when I run out of other stuff?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...I guess you could teach other ponies to lift things?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah! Wow, you three really have a knack for this!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That was easy!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Maybe too easy.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What do you mean?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, it's lookin' like cutie mark problems are few and far between.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And...?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And what if we never find another one?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And even if we do, we could solve it so quick, it'll be like it never happened in the first place!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: So... then the Cutie Mark Crusaders don't have any reason to exist!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: The problem boils down to this <U+0096> we don't need to go out and do things anymore to get our cutie marks.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Right! And<U+0097>

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ponies with cutie mark problems are hard to find.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Exactly. But even when we find problems, we're so good at solvin' them that most of the time there's nothin' for the Cutie Mark Crusaders to do. So...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I thought we should start figurin' out ways to search all of Equestria for cutie mark problems!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That kinda seems like a lot.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I don't think Rarity would let me travel to the far reaches of Equestria looking for cutie mark problems.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, I'm sure we'll come across them in Ponyville. And when we do, we'll totally solve them because we are so awesome at it!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But... what do we do until then?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Maybe whatever we want?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: What do you mean?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, we used to only do stuff to get our cutie marks or fulfill our destiny, but now we don't have to.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: So... we can do things just for fun? Are you girls thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Just remember <U+0096> stomp, kick, and roll! After this, you two are gonna love scootering as much as me!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: If you say so.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ready? Stomp, kick, and roll! Whooo!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Ta-da!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [nervous laugh] I don't think I did it right.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [blows pitch pipe] Do... Mi... So... It's just a simple harmony.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Harmony, huh?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [tapping with baton] And a-one, and a-two, and a-one two three!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wow, that was simple!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's just a dash, and a drop, and a drip!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Just a dash, and a drop, and a drip!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...and even though Scootaloo thinks bungee jumping is the bee's knees...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: ...Sweetie Belle would rather keep bees.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [spits] Of course, I'm allergic. Who'd've thought it'd be so hard to find somethin' for us all to do together?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, I know this might sound crazy, but what if we didn't?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Didn't what?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Do things together. Well, do everything together.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But we're the Cutie Mark Crusaders!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And we always will be! But I really wanna bungee jump! The speed, the height, the fall!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And I know you two aren't interested, but I wanna try crochet.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Isn't there something you've always wanted to do on your own?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I don't know... I guess I figured we'd always do stuff together. But bungee jumping sounds just as scary as crochet sounds borin'.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That's okay. Sweetie Belle and I can do the things we like, and you can do whatever you like!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Just as soon as you figure out what it is.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I guess...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Great! Then we can meet back here and talk all about what we've done!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: But I don't know what it'll be.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You'll find something!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Something awesome!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] Well... I guess now I have to.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I never imagined myself out on my own Tryin' to find out what's next for me The Cutie Mark Crusaders have always been my home Maybe now there's more that I could be

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whatever kind of dancin' y'all are doin', you're doin' it together, and I want in! [beat] I-I mean, uh, [clears throat] Would it be okay if I enrolled in this dance class?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: That sounds an awful lot like friendship! And I'm ready for anything I don't have to do by myself!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whooooooa!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whoa, whoaaa!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Whew! I feel like that went pretty good, but let's give it one more whirl, because it's important that I do a good job partnering with my new group of friends.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I'm sorry, but doin' stuff on my own is exactly what I don't want.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Tryin' different things with my friends is always fun, even when we were terrible. Now it's just terrible.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [sighs] Thanks, but... without my friends, I don't think I'll ever feel again. Good luck at the recital.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [deadpan] Yeah, okay. Nice meetin' you.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Sweetie Belle! You are not gonna believe this, but I think I like bungee jumping even more than scootering!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Seriously?! That's amazing! Look what I did!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wow, uh, that's, um...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Horrible! But it was so much fun! Rarity showed me how, even though she says [imitating Rarity] "Crochet is knitting's poorer cousin", [normal] but I loved it!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Awesome!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh, hello, girls. Have fun pursuing your own interests?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Apple Bloom? What are you doing sitting in the dark?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah, we thought you'd be out looking for things you like to do.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [laughs] I did. I looked all over town. I looked... and I looked... and I looked... and you know what I found? Nothin'!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You tried every one of these?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And each one just made me feel more alone than the next! I don't see how I'm supposed to be happy that we're not hanging out anymore!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Wait, I never said that. I just said we don't have to do everything together.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Like when there's something one of us wants to do that the others don't.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Oh. [beat] Well, I guess that changes things.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I can't believe you thought we didn't want to hang out anymore.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I can't believe you tried all this stuff and didn't find one thing you liked!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, I kind of liked dancin', mainly because it looked like somethin' you couldn't do alone, but... I wasn't very good at it.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, you don't have to be good at something to have fun!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And being good doesn't always mean you will.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I know... I met the best dancer in the world, but he was so shy, he couldn't bring himself to perform, even though he really, really wanted to.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I don't suppose this dancing pony had a cutie mark, did he?

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You're here!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: You told me that you wanted to perform more than anythin', but I was too caught up in myself to listen. You're the best dancer I've ever seen, and I'm here to convince you to get out on that stage!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: We can go on together! No matter what, you'll look good dancin' next to me.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Leave everything to us.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Don't worry, you'll be just fine!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Here goes nothin'...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Can't be any worse than I was!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: No problem!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: It's what we do.

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: I only wish I'd realized what you needed right away instead of mopin' around for no reason...

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: [taps] You know, I just might! It sure is a lot of fun, and I'm pretty confident I can only get better. [to the Crusaders] I'm sorry I was so silly about us all doin' our own things. If we hadn't, I might never even have tried dancin'!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: With each of us going out and trying things on our own, we'll be three times as likely to find ponies to help!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: And trying new stuff might even make us better at helping them, like how I used my bungee jumping to change the sets!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Or my crochet to make the costumes!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Well, one thing is for sure. The Cutie Mark Crusaders will never be the same. We'll be better!

title: On Your Marks
writer: Dave Polsky & Josh Haber; story by Dave Polsky
dialog: Yeah!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] The last time I was here, I woke them and ended up with a mane full of bats! [sighs] Thanks for being my basket holder, Spike.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Basket holder? I thought I was your bodyguard.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] What? Oh, heh, yes, yes, that of course, too. Oh, for once I wish unicorn magic wasn't so... luminescent!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] Spike! You'll wake the bats! Turn that off!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I'm so glad you two could come!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Of course. We so rarely get a chance to relax and just visit.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: There's usually some crisis we have to deal with. Somepony always needs our help. But today<U+0097>

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [muffled, wailing] Help!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Twilight! There's something wrong with Spike!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: What's wrong?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [grunts] I don't know! Nngh! All of a sudden, my scales just started glowing and... burning!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Little is known about dragon culture, but this is a phenomenon we've seen before. It is the call of the Dragon Lord.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Dragons glow whenever the Dragon Lord has need of them in the Dragon Lands.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Great... H-How do I make it stop?!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: The only way to end the summons is to answer it. You must journey to the Dragon Lands and see what is expected of you.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: B-B-But the Dragon Lands are full of... dragons! And they're ghastly creatures! [beat] Oh, oh, not you, of course, Spikey-wikey. But remember that rotten Garble?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [gulps] How could I forget? He would have burnt us to a crisp if you weren't there. If I have to go to the Dragon Lands, would you two come with me?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Ooh! Oh my goodness, I'd love to! We are sadly lacking any information on dragon culture and customs. I could research them <U+0096> maybe even write an article! This could be my chance to make a great contribution to the knowledge of Equestria! [beat] And be there for Spike, heh, of course.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Be very careful. The Dragon Lands are particularly dangerous for ponies. It would be wise to be discreet.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I think we might want something a little more practical this time.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Hmmm... Well, it may be practical, but this disguise isn't flattering in the slightest!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] It's not supposed to be flattering. It's supposed to blend in!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Shh!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Hey-hey, look! It's our old friend Sparkle-warkle.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's Spike.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Are you sure your pony friends didn't give you a pony name?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's nice to see you too, Garble.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I didn't say it was nice to see you. It's not. I don't like you. Was I not clear about that?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Hey! That's my rock!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Oh, really? Then why aren't you sitting on it?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Who is that?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's Dragon Lord Torch, dummy.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: No, next to him.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: That's his daughter, Princess Ember. I wouldn't even look at her if I were you, unless you want Torch to eat you!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] This is fascinating! Dragons are notoriously reckless, but they do whatever the Dragon Lord says!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] When the scepter disappeared, the dragons stopped glowing! We are learning so much!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Uh, excuse me!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Ugh, you even sneeze like a pony!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I don't want to be Dragon Lord or dragon toast, and I stopped glowing, so let's sneak out of here!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Oh, uh, hi, your Lordship. Uh, I was just going home!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Dad, look at him. He's just a runt. Besides, he doesn't even wanna compete. Let him go.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Of course, your Lordship! I, uh, guess I don't understand dragon customs. Another reason why I shouldn't compete.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Thank you! [to Ember] And thank you.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: To prepare for the Gauntlet.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: But I'm smarter than most of these boulderheads and you know it!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [growls] I hate when he does that!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: That's nothing! When I'm in charge, the first thing I'll do is get revenge on those puny ponies! They'll regret they ever crossed Garble! We'll take whatever we want from Equestria and burn the rest!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] Oh, my gosh!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] Ooh, I can't believe I'm saying this, but I hope that burping dragon wins!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: None of them can win! Equestria's in big trouble if any of them are in charge!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: But what can we do?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: There's only one thing to do, and only I can do it! I have to win the Gauntlet of Fire!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: What do you mean you have to win the Gauntlet?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's the only way to protect Equestria from the dragons. You heard them! They have horrible plans for ponies if they win! So somehow, I have to do it!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: There has to be another way. It's too dangerous. Besides, if you win, you'd have to stay here!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I know, but there's no other way to keep my friends safe.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Well, if you're staying to compete, then we're staying to cheer you on!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I decided to compete. I am a dragon, after all.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Are you sure? You can't even fly!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Good luck! Just kidding. I hope you lose.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [gasps] [sarcastically] Thanks, Garble! I was planning on swimming anyway!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: You can do it, Spike!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: He's gonna drown!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Spike!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Hey, are you okay?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [gasps] Princess Ember!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: What do you think you're doing?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Only saving your ungrateful scales!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Did that seaweed just talk? Ponies?! What are they doing here?!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: They're my friends!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Friends? Dragons don't do friends.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Well, this dragon does.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Whatever. I don't care as long as none of you get in my way. I have a Gauntlet to win.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: But I thought your dad said that<U+0097>

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I don't care what my dad said! I'll show him and every dragon who thinks I'm just a little princess there are better things than being big and strong!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [scream] [grunts] Don't leave me here, Spike!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Ha-ha! Knew you'd do it. Your pony friends made you soft.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Uh-huh. You're welcome.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [gruff voice] Uh, that's just me. I, uh, robbed some ponies on my way over here.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Huh, I like your style. Have I met you before? You kind of look like<U+0097>

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: My, uh, old neighbor! Uh, Sandy... Rockbeach!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Stupid slingtails knocked me down! But I've wasted enough time making small talk. Get it? Ha-ha! Because you're too small to win this! I'm funny.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Why did you cover for me? You could've had one less competitor.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I could ask you the same thing. You could've told Garble about my friends.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Yikes... That looks rough. But that's what makes it a challenge.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Are you kidding? Those boulders are huge! Hey, what if we worked together? You fly me up there, and I'll help look out for boulders, like a second set of eyes!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Pssst!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] Spike! Are you sure it's a good idea to team up with Ember? You don't know her too well.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I do know she could've told Garble about you, but she didn't. I think we can trust her.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Her behavior does seem contradictory to everything I've noted about dragons so far.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Hey, you, little fella! I've thought about it, and your plan makes sense. Let's do it.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Really? Great! It's a deal!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Just so you know, this doesn't mean we're gonna pick flowers or exchange necklaces or whatever pony friends do.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Good luck. We'll meet you at the top.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Pull up! There's one on your tail!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Go left!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: So what do we do now?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I think we go through there.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [yelps] Oh, that looks scary! I mean, you can do it!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Listen, Spike. I wouldn't have made it this far without you. So I guess, if you want to, we could keep working together. I mean, just until we get through that tunnel.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Okay!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] We'll be right behind you!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [gasps] Oof!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Urgh!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Oh, you made it! Oh, we were so worried!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Wait. How did you two get through?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Rarity!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [yelps] [panting] Oh, thanks, Spike!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [sighs] It was nothing.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Nothing? You just risked everything to save her! And they're putting themselves in danger just to support you!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Well, that's just what friends do. Don't you have anyone who looks out for you?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Not really. Unless I count you. [beat] Which I don't! Because we were only helping each other get through the tunnel, and now we're through the tunnel, so that's it.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Wait, what do you mean?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Well, there's only one winner, one scepter, and one Dragon Lord. So I guess it's every dragon for themselves.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Oh. So we aren't really friends?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Maybe if we were in Ponyland, but like I said, dragons don't do friendship.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I can't believe Ember ditched me.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [muffled] Oh, you're better off. She was only looking out for herself. She's just like all the other dragons.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: She's not, though. I know it. She saved me, even when she didn't have to. I don't care what she says. That makes us friends.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Is it just me, or have we seen this crevasse three times already?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's kinda hard to tell. They all look the same. Except for this one! Look! We made it! I can't believe I'm the only dragon to make it this far!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: You're not! And I'm not losing to a puny pony-loving dragon like you!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [yelps] [muffled] We have to do something!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [muffled] Look!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [screaming] Ember! I thought it was every dragon for themselves! Why did you save me?!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: That's what friends do! And I am. I mean, we are. I never should have left you back there. Agh, please don't make me talk about my feelings!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [straining] Argh! Whoa!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [frustrated grunt] I'm sick and tired of you two helping each other! Dragons don't do helping!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [panting] Whoa...

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Leave her alone!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: What? You?! You have the scepter?! But that means that you're...

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: The Dragon Lord. Dragon Lord Spike.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [groans] [reluctantly] Dragon... Lord... Spike...

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: That's right! Uh... Now, go start your long journey home. And give every dragon you see on the way a hug. Don't tell them why.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Awww! But that'll be super embarrassing!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I command you to do it!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [annoyed noise] I can't believe this...

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Dragon Lord Spike. Hm, has a nice ring to it.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Dragon Lord Ember sounds a lot better.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: What? No. You're the Dragon Lord now.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: The Dragon Lord is whoever brings the scepter back to your father! Besides, you'll make a great leader. I was just doing this to protect the ponies. But I know you'll protect them just as well as I would have.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: You sure about this?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Absolutely. My home is in Equestria with my friends.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Well, you'll have at least one friend here too. What are you doing?

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: It's called a hug!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Oh. I don't know if I like it. But... okay.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Mmmmm!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: [hushed] Awww!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I know you didn't think I could do it, but I did.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I'm not big and strong. I know. But you know what? I won anyway. So maybe it takes more than just being big and strong to be a good Dragon Lord!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Thanks, dad. [to dragons] Agree with him! Just kidding! That's not gonna be my thing.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: I can't tell you!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: You did well, Spike. With Ember as Dragon Lord, the ponies will be safe and you've gained us a powerful ally.

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: And a new friend!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: Plus, Ember said I could write to her anytime I had questions about dragon culture! With this much information, I'll be able to write a whole book on dragons!

title: Gauntlet of Fire
dialog: And I gained tons of ideas for a new line of camouflage clothing! I think I'll call it "Camo-Maud"!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: First lesson of the day, we very carefully set the table without using magic, so that<U+0097> Yikes!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Did you...?! How? When? What?!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: What?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I said no magic. You were supposed to do it by hoof so I could work in a friendship lesson.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Oh, I heard "set the table" and just kinda went for it.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, if you hadn't used magic, you'd have heard me say, uh... this plate represents your head, this spoon is your heart, and the knives... are sharp! Always be careful with knives. [sigh] The metaphors make more sense when you're actually setting the table.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Should I... change it back?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I just want to make sure you're ready for this dinner. Princess Celestia will be joining us tomorrow night to see how the friendship lessons are going!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: If it's just you, me, and Princess Celestia, why are there four seats?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, the whole point is for you to bring a new friend. That way, the princess will see for herself just how far you've come. And how good a teacher you have.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, I can't choose. I like all your friends.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: That's the best part! You have to make a new friend!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: New friends? Hey, maybe I'll just force friendships by magically enslaving the entire population of Ponyville!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Starlight!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Let's see. Make new friends in Ponyville, the friendliest place in Equestria. Shouldn't be hard...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Need to make a new friend, huh? I know just the pony for you!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Miss Starlight Glimmer, meet Mrs. Cake!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Mrs. How are you, dearie?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Are you baking? Can I help?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Wow, Mrs. Cake! Look what your new friend made you!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Mrs. [chuckles] New friend. I like the sound of<U+0096> [gasps] Howza-wowza! A-Are you trying to put me out of business with your fancy magical-thingy-whatsit cake?!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Sorry...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I think I have just the pony for you, Starlight. Meet Big Mac!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Eeyup!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: He's not much of a talker.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Nnope.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Oh, that's too bad. I love a good conversation.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [motormouth] Eeyup-yup-yup-yup-yup-yup-yup-yup-y-y-y-y-you did something! Whoa! What's happening? I feel really weird! I'm talkin' so much! And I'm so articulate! Enunciating with such precise pronunciation! Annie Apple awoke and accidentally ate an auburn azalea! [screams] Make it stop!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I can't be friends with somepony who doesn't talk.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: ...And I guess my first instinct shouldn't be to magically command ponies to act the way I want them to?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Alright, I'll change him back!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: The trick to finding a new friend is to render yourself radiant. First impressions count a great deal, you know.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I'm glad you all got past my first impression.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, everypony deserves a second chance. Ooh! Now, I have a top-notch idea. I'm thinking pastel silk here and here with a crinoline underneath.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You really think a new outfit will help me meet ponies?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Oh, with the right outfit, you can do anything, darling!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: When will it be ready?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Three weeks.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Dinner's tomorrow.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well then, how about a hat from the... [clears throat] ...clearance bin?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Ugh! Maybe not.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Heh. Nopony's gonna make friends with you because of your outfit. The only thing you want a new friend draped in is coolness.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Like you?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Yeah, but you already know me, so... [gasps] [spitting] Spitfire! Heh. Sorry.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Who's that?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [gasps] Only the Wonderbolt-iest pony in the Wonderbolts! Come on, I'll introduce you!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You coming or what?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I guess my first question would be, "What's a Wonderbolt?"

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [gasps] You've never heard of the Wonderbolts?! Where have you been?!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [nervously] Enslaving villages, I guess...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Right.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You're adorable, but probably not what Twilight had in mind.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [groan] What is going on? This is Ponyville! If I can't make a friend here, there's gotta be something wrong with me! [sighs] Okay, calm down. Nobody makes friends with a total stresscase.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [to herself] Stop stressing... Stop stressing!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] This is just what I needed.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] Tell me about it.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You ever have one of those days?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: For me, they're all one of those days.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I'm gonna start coming here every time I visit Ponyville.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I'm not from here either. I've been trying to make friends, but it's not easy. They're not saying it, but I think everypony knows about my past. I may have been a tiny bit... completely and utterly evil?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Ponies judge me on my past too.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Finally, a pony I can relate to.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Twilight, guess what? I made a new friend!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: That's fantastic news!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: She's great!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Great!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: She's powerful!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Powerful?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Hello... princess!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Trixie?!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You know each other?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You could say that.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: We've had our differences. What matters is Twilight gave me a second chance, and I appreciate it.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: So, um, what brings you to Ponyville?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: The Grrrreat and Powerful Trrrrixie has come to perform a new stage show of grand illusion! I am calling it "The Humble and Penitent Trixie's Equestrian Apology Tour"!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [hushed] That's kind of a mouthful.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [hushed] It's a working title.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Starlight? A moment? Over here? [hushed] I know I said make friends with anypony, but, well, with Trixie's past, and your past, I'm not sure she's the best... first friend.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: But whatever she did, you've forgiven her, right?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Of course. It's just... She wasn't the nicest pony.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, you did say anypony, and I just assumed that you'd trust me to make my own friends the way Princess Celestia trusted you.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] You're right. I trust you. Just be back in time for the dinner.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Thanks, Twilight! You won't regret it!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: This magic show's gonna be the greatest thing Ponyville's ever seen!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Everypony always says they'll give you a second chance, but deep down, they never forget.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: That's what I'm worried about.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: What is it?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I heard what Twilight said about me, and she's right. I wasn't very nice. So I'd understand if you didn't want to be friends.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Are you kidding? You're the first pony I've met who has any idea how I feel!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Can you keep a secret?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: What are friends for?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [hushed] The things I've done? I did them because I was jealous of Twilight. She's just the best at everything, and I wanted to beat her at something!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [hushed] Your secret's safe with me.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Thanks. Want to help me unpack my wagon?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I spend a lot of time on the road with my wagon, so it might be a tad messy.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Maybe I can help. I'm pretty good at organizing stuff. Magic props, brainwashed crowds...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Pssssssst! Pssst! Psssssst! Shhhhhh!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Uh, I'll catch up. I think there's something in my hoof.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Sure. The wagon's right around the corner.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [hushed] So, how's it going with your new friend?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sarcastically] Great. Thanks for asking in a completely not creepy way.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Because you know, if it isn't working out for any reason, I could introduce you to my friend here.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [deadpan] Nice to meet you.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: No, no! You can come out now!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You like music, right? DJ Pon-3'd be the perfect friend for tonight's incredibly important dinner with Celestia. You know, if you decide to make a last-minute change. Heh.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: So back at your castle when you said "I trust you", you meant "I don't trust you".

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [nervously] Who can really say who said what? I know I can't! [to DJ Pon-3] Can you?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Starlight, I'm just trying to look out for you.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] I appreciate it, but you're wrong about Trixie. She's just like me. We have a real connection.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: That's kind of what I'm afraid of. Oh! What about her?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Please, Twilight! I know you're trying to help, but I need to make friends on my own if I'm going to become a better pony.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: But do you really think Trixie's the one to help you with that?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Wow. Trixie was right. You're not really giving her a second chance. I wonder what that says about how you feel about me.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Oh! Now he'd be perfect!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I was thinking. You said Twilight is better than you at everything, but that's not true. You're better at magic.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Only when I'm wearing a soul-sucking evil amulet, so I don't think that counts. Funny story. Don't need to get into it.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I meant stage magic.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, of course! Great? Yes. Powerful? Obviously. But I'm not the best. As great and powerful as I am, there's one trick I've never been able to do <U+0096> the Moonshot Manticore Mouth Dive!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [narrating] Only one magician has ever pulled it off <U+0096> my hero, Hoofdini! You are supposed to blast yourself into the open mouth of a hungry manticore! After the manticore chews you up and swallows you, you magically step out of a box on the other side of the stage!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Completely unharmed!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: That sounds very...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Dangerous?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I was gonna say cool!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I knew I liked you for a reason. I don't know how he did it! If I tried it, I'd get chewed up and swallowed by that manticore.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Not if you could use real magic.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Obviously. Way to rub it in.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: No, I mean, I could help! You could start the trick, and right before you got chewed up, I could use magic to save you...

title: No Second Prances
dialog: ...and make you appear in the black box!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I guess that would work... But if you made one mistake, I'd be a goner.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Hah. When it comes to magic, I don't make mistakes. Maybe I could be your... magic show helper pony!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: We call it "assistant" in the magician biz. And... nopony's ever offered to help before.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, I'd be honored.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You may have just made my great and powerful magic show even better! Which I didn't think was possible! We're gonna blow them away tonight!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [groans] I can't! Tonight's this incredibly important dinner with Twilight.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Oh.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Can I vent for a minute?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: What are friends for?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Even after Twilight says she trusts me, she clearly doesn't trust me enough to choose my own friends. [sighs] I guess you were right. No second chances.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Hmph, I wish I could say I was surprised. Well, lucky for Princess Twilight, I have my magic show tonight. If you have to go to the dinner, I completely understand. [dramatically] I just hope I find a way to survive the Moonshot Manticore Mouth Dive without my new assistant!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Starlight? Has anyone seen Starlight Glimmer? I'm looking for her! Trixie.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: So this is the Humble and Penitent Trixie's Equestrian Apology Tour?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Ain't that a mouthful of molasses.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: It's a working title! Oh, this is gonna be the greatest night of my life! Excuse me. Our lives.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] I'm so glad we're not at that boring dinner.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Ahem? You just decided to skip our dinner without telling me? Are you aware that, at this very moment, Princess Celestia is waiting for you at a table with exquisite silverware placement?!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Yes, but<U+0097>

title: No Second Prances
dialog: This is exactly why I didn't want you to make friends with Trixie.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: A-ha! You still don't trust me! But guess what, princess? It doesn't matter if you want to give me a second chance or not. Starlight had to choose between you and me, and she chose me! Your pupil chose me, so ha! I win!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: You win? That sounds like you just made friends with me to beat Twilight.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Exactly! [beat] Wait! I mean, no! I got caught up in the moment. I like you. Beating Twilight is just a bonus. [gasps] Saying that didn't help, did it?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Well, you won. I hope you're happy!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [sighs] Looks like the Great and Powerful Trixie is back to a solo show.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Trixie?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: ...Which is exactly the way she likes it! Thank you, Princess Twilight, for getting rid of that annoying pony who wanted to be my first friend! I am not sad at all! I definitely don't feel as if my heart is breaking into a million pieces!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [unenthusiastic] Come one, come all. Come and see the Pathetic and Friendless Trixie's "Way-To-Go-Dum-Dum-You-Really-Messed-It-Up-This-Time Repentance Tour".

title: No Second Prances
dialog: It's a working title! [unenthusiastic] Behold, your fears come true. A pony-eating manticore.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [unenthusiastic] For tonight, the Great and Powerful Trixie will be performing the Moonshot Manticore Mouth Dive.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [unenthusiastic] Now, now, save your gasps for when I defy the beast's jaws of doom and appear inside that black box. [dramatically] I was supposed to perform this trick with my great and powerful assistant, who was also my great and powerful friend!

title: No Second Prances
