dialog: Starlight, when I first came to Ponyville, Princess Celestia gave me room to make my own decisions and my own friends. I need to give you the same freedom. I shouldn't have tried to pick and choose your friends for you. Just like me, you have to make your own decisions and your own friends.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: But... what if Trixie really was using me just to one-up you?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: From what I've seen, she's the real thing.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: But it's not my place to judge. It's all up to you.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Starlight? If you're out there and you still want to be friends, let's be great and powerful together! [slightly echoing] Please?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [woozy] Behold, the Peat and Growerful Triskie...!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: [amplified] And now, I'm proud to introduce my great and powerful assistant! [normal] And best friend. [amplified] Starlight Glimmer!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Trixie!

title: No Second Prances
dialog: What do you want?

title: No Second Prances
dialog: I was wrong. I'm sorry. And I have to hand it to you. I could never have pulled off a trick like that.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: Thank you, princess.

title: No Second Prances
dialog: How do you get your hair to do that all the time?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hey! Rainbow Dash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hiya, Scootaloo! What's up?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: The Rainbow Dash Fan Club just decided <U+0096> everypony's coming to see you when the Wonderbolts' new tour comes through Ponyville!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Well, it's great that you guys are going to the show, Scoot, but I won't actually be performing in it. Reservists aren't in the show unless one of the real Wonderbolts can't fly. [chuckles] I'll probably be working crowd control or something.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: You're still gonna be wearing a Wonderbolts uniform though, right?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: A Reservist one, yeah.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hmm. That's good enough for me.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Whoa!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Rainbow Dash! Glad we found you. We need you in the show when we get to Ponyville. Flying.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: But she's only in the Reserves!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Not anymore, kid.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [slow gasp] You mean...

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [gasps] Rainbow Dash! You're finally a full-fledged Wonderbolt! Woo-hoo! [laughs] Yeah, Rainbow Dash! Whoo!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Heh. What she said.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Uh, anypony seen my wing balm? I don't want to be stiff when I show up at Wonderbolt headquarters.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Got it!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Do you have time to tell us what happened, Rainbow Dash?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, yes, we must know every detail!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Start from when you were a foal and you first knew your destiny was to become a Wonderbolt!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Heh. Well, not much to tell, really. Spitfire told me the Wonderbolts need me to go on tour with them.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That's really great. I know how long you've been waiting for a spot to open up.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yeah. Fire Streak decided to retire and teach full-time. Cloudsdale Flight School will probably be churning out Wonderbolts with him there. But guess who was at the top of the Reserve list.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Ooh, ooh, I know! Pick me!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: So what do you do now, Dashie?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I have to report to Wonderbolts headquarters this afternoon. It's only two days 'til tour starts, and I need to learn the routine.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: You're leaving already?! [gasps] But we barely started your congratulation party! I haven't even thought about your going-away party yet!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Pinkie, I'm not leaving Ponyville. I just have to train for this show.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I hope everything goes well. Sounds like an awful lot of pressure having to learn everything so quickly.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yeah. Good luck, Dash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Luck? Heh. Save that for the rest of the team.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Now that my awesomeness has finally been recognized, the other Wonderbolts will have to keep up or eat my cloud trail!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Everypony knows you're a great flyer, Rainbow Dash, but so are the rest of the Wonderbolts. It might be more challenging than you think.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Aw, you're right! I mean, do I show up wearing sunglasses or not? Sunglasses are automatically cool, but anypony can put them on. Maybe I'd stand out more if I didn't.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Team briefings are every morning at<U+0097>

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: 0720, because there were twenty ponies in the original E.U.P. Guard that became the Wonderbolts!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Right. And I know you've seen the academy bunks, but these are the official Wonderbolts barracks.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Built by Admiral Fairweather himself!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Don't forget rule number one, newbie. Always check both ways before crossing the runway.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Uh, sure, but... nopony else is here.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: They will be, and most of the Wonderbolts like to make a flashy entrance, so stay alert.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Right, no problem!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Whoa! Is that General Flash's cap?!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: And the original crest with the Wonderbolts motto on it.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Wow! [gasps] I mean, ha, cool.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Okay, newbie, we've got a show in two days, which means you gotta hustle your haunches to learn this routine. You got five minutes to get dressed and get outside to meet the rest of the team.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yes, ma'am! I'll have all of the moves down by the end of the day!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Let's hope so. We're all expecting you to make quite an impression.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Lookin' good! Okay, you're about to take your first flight as an actual Wonderbolt. [sighs] No pressure. [stretching groan] Just gotta go out there and knock 'em off their hooves. Okay, Wonderbolts, get ready to meet your most awesome member ever!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hey, look out!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Huh? Whooaaa!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Are you okay, Rainbow Dash?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Okay, flight school! Get ready for Rainbow Dash! Hah<U+0097>whooooa!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hey! You guys buzzed me on purpose!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Not quite. You forgot rule number one, newbie.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yeah, well, I was just... testing you guys!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Alright, nopony got hurt and we got a lot to do, so let's forget about this and get flying!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [through loudhailer] Higher, Crash! You're breaking formation!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Check your nine, Crash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Tighter, Crash, get in there!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [growls] My name's not Crash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Tough day? Please. If I can pull off a sonic rainboom, I can learn this routine. I'll have it down cold tomorrow. Probably even come up with a couple of improvements.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Rainbow Dash, over here!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yes, ma'am!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I'm glad you're still here.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, yeah? Did you want some ideas on how to make the show extra-awesome?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Not quite. I know you've been a Reservist for a while, but the 'Bolts have a few of their own rules you might not know about. Like worst flyer of the day has to clean up the whole compound. Better get to it, Crash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [sighs] [under her breath] My name's not Crash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: What?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hooray, Rainbow Dash! Our favorite Wonderbolt!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: We know you're probably tired, Rainbow Dash, but Pinkie wanted to throw you a real party.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Your best day [through megaphone] ever party!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [nervous laugh] Yeah. It was somethin', all right.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Well we can't wait to hear all about it!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Heh. And I'd love to tell you, I really would, but I'm pretty beat. [yawns] You know, from all the... excitement of my big day?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Um, is something wrong, Rainbow Dash?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: What could be wrong? I'm finally a Wonderbolt, which means everything has to be totally, perfectly awesome.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, no. Something is wrong. What happened, darling?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I told you, it's nothing! I mean, maybe some of the Wonderbolts started calling me Rainbow Crash...

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, no! Isn't that the same terrible nickname those bullies in flight school used to call you?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Why would they call you that?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Urgh.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Well, look at the bright side! At least they didn't call you Rainbow Trash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: So you started off on the wrong hoof. I'll bet every new Wonderbolt has a tough first day.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Mmm-hmm! What you need is to find a positive way to stand out. As soon as you're known for something else, that nasty old nickname will be forgotten.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Rarity's right. Why don't you think of the Wonderbolts like us? We're a team, but we all stand out in different ways.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That's it! I'm gonna stand out in a different way, just like you guys! Goodbye, Rainbow Crash; hello, Captain Awesome!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Pinkie Pie] Good morning, everypony! Who's ready for a fantastic day of flying? I know I am! I just couldn't be more excited for the big show tomorrow. Are you guys excited? I'm excited! Actually, I'm always excited! Some ponies even call me "Dynamic Dash"!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [sighs] [imitating Applejack] Well, of course I know that! But the truth of the matter is, you should be excited! It's the dream of near every little Pegasus pony to grow up and fly with the Wonderbolts! And here you all are doin' it!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Applejack] True! Go ahead and call me "Forthright Filly" if you want. But shee-yucks, I like to tell it like it is, and I believe a pony oughta appreciate hard work payin' off like this, because bein' a Wonderbolt is somethin' special!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Twilight Sparkle] You know, I was just reading about how dihedral wing angles can help increase stability in banking turns. It made me think that pre-flight checklists could really help increase our efficiency, so I went ahead and made them for everypony!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Twilight Sparkle] I'm always finding so much interesting information in books. In fact, a lot of ponies call me "Reading Rainboom".

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [through loudhailer] We all know how wings work, newbie! And we already have checklists! Now get off the runway!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Fluttershy] I'm so sorry. I was just trying to help because I care about all of the Wonderbolts oh-so much. Yessiree, just call me "Care Mare". [beat] Um, but if you're busy now, I can just come back later...

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Fluttershy] Or, you know, not at all...

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [to herself] Okay. [imitating Rarity] I must tell you how much I just love these uniforms. Why, ever since I was a foal, I've admired the mixture of bold lines and classic contours. They don't call me "Rainbow Fash" for nothing.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Uhhhh... huh...?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [imitating Rarity] The "Fash" is for "Fashion".

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Crash! I'm not sure why you're acting like this, but you need to stop.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I was just, you know, trying to show everypony all the awesome ways I can contribute to the 'Bolts.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I know you're excited to find your place on the team, but just focus on the routine for now, okay?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yes, ma'am.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Maybe this will help motivate you.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Crash?! Couldn't you just put my regular name on it?!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That's not how it works around here. We all have our nicknames on our jackets. Right, Clipper?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Clipper?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Right, boss!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [groans] If I don't come up with something unforgettable to add to the routine, I'm gonna be Rainbow Crash for the rest of my life!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: This is gonna be so amazing!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I know! I'm almost as excited as Pinkie Pie!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I can't wait to see Rainbow Dash's first performance as an honest-to-goodness Wonderbolt! I hope there's cotton candy!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: We should all remember to be extra supportive for Rainbow Dash too.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Excellent point. It's simply dreadful that she's had such a rough start after finally achieving her dream.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Rainbow Dash is a pretty resilient pony. I'm sure she's shaken off her tough first day and turned it around by now!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Speakin' of... Hey, Dash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Perfect! Hey, can I borrow Scootaloo?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Me? What for?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, heh, I just needed some help and figured the president of the Rainbow Dash Fan Club was the right pony for the job!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I thought the Wonderbolt Reserves were here to help.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, yeah, they're all busy doing, uh, official Reserve stuff. But don't worry! With Scootaloo's help, everything's gonna be awesome. Better than awesome!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Does... Does that mean practice went well yesterday?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Gotta go.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: What are we doing up here, Rainbow Dash?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I just need a small favor from you that's really gonna make this show something special. Now, the Wonderbolts are gonna fly over this ridge right before the finale of the show. I'll fly by last, and when I signal you, you zip up the ramp on your scooter and kick the storm cloud into my path!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: What?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That kick will shoot off a lightning bolt right behind me, making me look totally awesome! And then I'll do some incredible Rainbow Dash flying with it to create the coolest, show-stoppingest, lightning-tastic light show anypony has ever seen!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Are you sure about this?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Uh-huh! It's gonna be so awesome! And nopony will ever call me "Rainbow Crash" after this!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, gotta go! Be ready for me, okay, Scootaloo?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Um... okay...?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I hope Spike and Pinkie Pie are done getting their snacks, or they're gonna miss Rainbow Dash!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Oh, don't worry, Fluttershy. Nothing would keep Pinkie Pie from missing this!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Heh. Except maybe cotton candy.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Come on, Pinkie, the show's starting!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: One second! Just a little bit bigger please, but hurry! Bigger!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That was amazing! She's doing great!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Bigger!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I hope this works.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hope I'm not too late. [scoffs] I dunno what took that pony so long.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: That was amazing!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Way to go, Rainbow Crash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: You gonna tell us what just happened, newbie?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [sighs] I'm so sorry.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I should hope so. You changed the routine without consulting me and put other ponies at risk. I've drummed flyers out of the 'Bolts for less.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I know, and I'm ready for whatever punishment you want. You guys were right to call me "Rainbow Crash". I've always been a standout flyer, but since I joined the Wonderbolts, I've only stood out for making mistakes. [sighs] It's been my dream my whole life, but... I guess maybe I'm not Wonderbolt material after all.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Are you serious?! You're the most talented flyer we've ever had!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Of course you're supposed to be a Wonderbolt. We've been waiting for a spot to open up ever since you joined the Reserves!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: But... you guys all called me Rainbow Crash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Yeah, so? My nickname's "Clipper". You know why they call me that?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Uh... 'cause you're as fast as a ship?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Because I clipped my wing on a flagpole as I was landing on my first day. Heh.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Huh.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Whoa! That is so much worse than Crash.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Right?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: So does this mean I'm... still on the team?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Do you think you can be part of this team and not constantly try to showboat?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I promise! I spent my whole life trying to be a standout flyer, but now that I'm a Wonderbolt, it's time to be okay with fitting in!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Good, because I really didn't want to miss the chance to tease you for years about this catastrophe! I mean, that crash was epic!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: But you're on probation for a month. Got a problem with that?!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: [quickly] No, ma'am.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Hey. Rainbow Dash. We just wanted to check on you. Are you doing okay?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: I'm doing great, thanks!

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Sure you don't need any help?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Nah. This mess is my responsibility, and I've gotta clean it up myself. And after this, Spitfire's got me cleaning the Wonderbolts' compound for the next month.

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: So why are you in such a good mood?

title: Newbie Dash
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Dave Polsky & Dave Rapp
dialog: Duh! Because I'm a Wonderbolt!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Clouds arranged so they're just so

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Gonna make some awesome snow

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: A day that's filled with songs to sing

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Cakes and pastries we shall bring

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Decorations we shall make

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Perfection you just cannot fake

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Not one mistake Don't let that break Oh, goodness' sake!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Hey, Starlight! Ready to celebrate your first Hearth's Warming Eve here in Ponyville?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I was thinking I might just skip it.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Skip Hearth's Warming Eve?!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I just find it all a little silly. It's mostly a day dedicated to presents and candy, isn't it?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: And why would you deny yourself presents and candy? That's crazy talk!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I think what Spike means to say is Hearth's Warming is about more than presents and candy. It's a time to spend with friends and family when we celebrate a very important day in Equestria's history.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I think to most ponies, it's just an excuse for silly songs and fun, not a day to remember some old story.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Maybe you just haven't heard the right Hearth's Warming Eve story yet!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Earth ponies, Pegasi, and unicorns sing songs around a hearth to fight back an eternal winter caused by the mythical windigos? Ha! Every foal and filly knows that story.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Not that one. My favorite holiday story, "A Hearth's Warming Tale"!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Oh, I love that one!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: This is the story of a powerful unicorn named Snowfall Frost, who hated Hearth's Warming Eve. It all began many moons ago in Canterlot...

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] Every home in Canterlot was filled with holiday spirit. Every home... except one. It was said of Snowfall that she was almost as studied as Star Swirl the Bearded. Almost, since everypony knows that Star Swirl was an expert at everything from transfiguration, dimensional calibration, teleportation<U+0097>

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] We get it. Star Swirl's awesome.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] Right. The point is, Snowfall was also a powerful unicorn. She wanted to be perfect. Anything that got in the way of that was a waste of time.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [gasp] Well, that batch is ruined. Snowdash!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] Snowdash was Snowfall's loyal assistant.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: What do you need?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Get this mess cleaned up. Those foolish ponies were ringing those blasted bells outside the window and I lost my concentration!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [under her breath] Whoa, ponies actually enjoying Hearth's Warming Eve. Where did they get that crazy idea?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Today is nothing to celebrate. Hearth's Warming Eve is a menace. A dangerous day for all of Equestria.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Dangerous?! It's awesome! It's the day we remember how unicorns, Pegasi, and Earth ponies came together in friendship to defeat the windigos!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: That silly legend is the problem! Telling everypony that "singing songs and being nice" will solve anything? I've spent years studying magic, and that's not how it works.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I think you might be missing the point.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Work hard, learn, and use your skills to better Equestria. That's a worthy goal for any pony. [sarcastically] But, by all means, if you want to go home early, ignore all of the work you have, and spend the rest<U+0097>

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Sweet!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Ugh!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I hate Hearth's Warming Eve! All of Equestria would be better off if we just skipped the day altogether.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Happy Hearth's Warming, they say in the street Happy Hearth's Warming, they think they're so sweet Words said so often that they lack any meaning Why should I join in when I could be intervening?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Once the spell is cast, all of Equestria will be better off, and they'll have me to thank for it!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Wait a minute. Snowfall doesn't like Hearth's Warming Eve so she decides to cast a spell to get rid of it altogether? That seems a little extreme.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I think what Spike is trying to say is that everypony has their reasons for doing things. Even Snowfall. And if I could continue the story, we might just find out what they are.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Proceed.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Snowfall was all set to cast her spell that would erase Hearth's Warming Eve for all time...

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] ...when a voice from the hearth caught her attention.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: You sure you wanna go through with this?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Huh?! Who's there?!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: The Spirit of Hearth's Warmin' Past, that's who. And you and me have got to have us a little chat.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: A spirit?! [suspiciously] I didn't cast any spirit summoning spell. What are you doing here?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: You don't think a spell like that would get by without some powerful forces noticin'? You've got our attention, Snowfall Frost, and we've got some pretty strong opinions on this spell of yours.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: "We"?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: They'll be along in a bit. For now, it's just you and me. Let's get a move on. We got a ton to see and barely any time to see it.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I'm not going anywhere. I've got a spell to cast, and I don't need a history lesson about Hearth's Warming Eve.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: We aren't goin' to the past to learn about the holiday. We're goin' to learn about you.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: As a young thing, life sure is somethin' You go makin' choices large and small Always growin' like a seedlin' And playin' is like dreamin' And before you know it, big and tall

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Then some distress, words so careless Standin' there, you don't know what to do Feelin' helpless, you can't make it hurt less So you go and change your point of view

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: The seeds of the past We grow up so fast Some hurts never go away

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: The seeds, as they grow This we can't let go All tied to this one holiday

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [gasps] Spirit? What am I supposed to<U+0097>

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [reverberating] Snowfall Frost! It is I, the Spirit of Hearth's Warming Presents!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Um, don't you mean "Present", like the time?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: No! Toys, Hearth's Warming doll... Here, want a cupcake?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Fine, "Presents". All of the pointless things ponies waste their time on.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Oh, Snowfall, it's not what the gift is that matters, it's what the gift means!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: It doesn't mean anything. It's just stuff!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Exactly! Sometimes a cupcake means "I love you!" Or a toy means "Hi, how're you doing?" Sometimes a book means "Your mane looks amazing!" And sometimes a scarf means... Well, a scarf usually means you look cold. That one's easy.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I don't understand anything you're saying.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: What's happening to you?!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: My Spirit of Hearth's Warming Presents Sense is going off! That means a song is coming on!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Take a look at everything around you All the smells that surely will astound you Open up your heart, it will surround you In the magic of Hearth's Warming Eve

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [singsong, as Pinkie Pie] And the reason is to be with your friends! [normal] What?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: You know you're doing your Pinkie Pie voice, right?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I was not!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: So, what happens next?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Well, the party was<U+0097>

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Wait! Can we take a quick break? I need to refill my cocoa.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [groans] Fine. But hurry up! We're almost to the best part!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [blows] Okay, I'm ready.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: The party was in full swing.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Snowdash!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Hey, Merry.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Why, whatever is the matter, darling?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Was it the eggnog? Oh, I knew I put in too much cinnamon!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Oh, no, the eggnog was awesome, Flutterholly, I'm just mad at somepony who was complaining about how awful Hearth's Warming Eve is.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I don't suppose that pony's name starts with "Snow"?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: And ends with "Frost"?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: She said Hearth's Warming Eve is just an excuse to party, and we would all be better off spending time working to make Equestria a better place.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: What does Snowfall think a better Equestria looks like?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Ponies working hard, learning, and using their abilities for the benefit of Equestria.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [muffled] It looks like we've got everything on Snowfall's list right here.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I think a perfect Equestria looks a lot like a Hearth's Warming Eve party.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Spirit? What do you mean? What's going to happen?!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Who are you?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I am the Spirit of Hearth's Warming Yet to Come.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Are you here to show me what future Hearth's Warming Eves are like?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: No, for there are no more Hearth's Warming Eves for me to show.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Why not?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: You will succeed in erasing the holiday, as you wished.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: And what happens?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I see a cold wind blowing through I see days neither fun nor free I see a future caused by you I see a path not meant to be

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Windigos?! They aren't real! It's just a little filly's story!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: They are all too real, Snowfall, and your actions will allow them to return. The future of Equestria shall be bathed in a blanket of eternal snow!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: There's still time!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Oh, my.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Snowfall Frost?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I was hoping I wasn't too late for the party? I brought gifts.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [spit-take] Boss?!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I was wrong earlier, about Hearth's Warming Eve. It's not all about singing and presents. The singing and presents are all about celebrating the ponies in our lives. The ponies we should listen to more often: our friends.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Wow.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Dragon toenail? Uh... thanks?

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: I was in a hurry. I'll do better next time.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Ha. You kidding? No one's ever given me dragon toenail before! It's awesome! Now come get some eggnog!

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: [narrating] And from then on, it was always said of all the Hearth's Warming Eve celebrations, Snowfall's was the Hearth's Warmingest.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: The end.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Well, that's it! Thanks for letting me read you the story. Guess you can call it a night. Spike and I are heading downstairs, and if you wanted to, you'd be welcome to join us.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Welcome to the party! Happy Hearth's Warming, Starlight.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Happy Hearth's Warming, Twilight.

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Hearth's Warming Eve is filled with presents Some take you by surprise A story shared by your good friends That makes your spirits rise

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: All together, feeling great

title: A Hearth's Warming Tail
dialog: Can hardly wait We'll party 'til late Our favorite date

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [panting] Come on! If we hurry, we can get there before the paper's even delivered to Rarity's house!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Maybe she won't read the article.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm pretty sure Rarity's gonna read a review of her new boutique in Manehattan.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I still can't believe we all just blabbed everything that happened to that reporter!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I just hope it doesn't end up being an article about how her friends almost ruined the opening.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I think you're all overreacting. Rarity's our friend. If anypony is gonna understand, it'll be her.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [grimly] I was wondering when all of you were going to show up.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [excitedly] Now we can all read the review together!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Um, I have an idea. How 'bout we don't read it?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: What she means is, before you read it, we should probably tell you about<U+0097>

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: No, no, darling. Please, no spoilers.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: No spoilers!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Now, is everypony ready to hear what I'm sure is a stellar review that describes in stunning detail exactly how each of you contributed to the successful opening of Rarity For You?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [clears throat, reading] "Many a pony has tried their hoof at joining the ranks of the elite fashion trendsetters currently ensconced in the boutiques of Manehattan's famed Saddle Row." [giggles, continues reading] "Some might say it's the ultimate achievement in Equestrian fashion, and never before has a reporter been granted such unfettered behind-the-scenes access until now!"

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I wish it had been more fettered.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, uh... [mutters] Ah! [reading] "I sat down with..." [giggles, continues reading] "...Rarity and her friends after the opening to get the inside scoop, and what a scoop it was!"

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Well, I was wondering<U+0097>

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Well, I wouldn't say all over Equestria. I just have two other boutiques: one in my hometown of Ponyville, and one in Canterlot. Uh, still, when I decided to open this one, I was nothing but confident.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Let's just say that if I could choose, I probably wouldn't do it that way again. Heh.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Well, it wasn't the funnest party ever...

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: It was a plum-puckered, pig-pushin' disaster!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: After a lifetime of awesome, I think everypony's allowed to mess up every now and then, right?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Wait, are you writing this down?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Um, it didn't go exactly how I thought it would, but it, um, started out all right.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Welcome to Saddle Row, an entire street lined with the most fashionable boutiques in all of Equestria!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: If it's supposed to be the most fashionable block of shops, where's Stinky Bottom's Discount Hat Emporium?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I suppose it didn't make the cut. [gasps] Here it is! Rarity For You!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Rarity, it's lovely. But are you sure you'll be ready to open tonight?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: No need to fret over a mere moderate amount of preparation. My clothes arrive soon, my sales associate after that, and with a little... dusting, we'll be ready for the grand opening tonight.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Mr. Stripes owns the building. He's a very pleasant landlord. Although he can be pushy at times. [beat] Okay, all the time.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [chuckles nervously] It's just, I'm dreadfully busy preparing for tonight's grand opening, as you can see.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm sorry. I just don't think it's going to be possible.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, uh, welcome aboard.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Glow-in-the-dark teeth! What was she thinking?!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Aah! Fluttershy, your assistance is required in the stock room, posthaste!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Aw, hello.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: But what are they doing here?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Smoky made too much noise eating garbage, so Softpad's mother made them move out of the trashcan.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Then Smoky Jr. found a nice home in the crawl space behind the building. But Mr. Stripes demolished it, so they were temporarily camped out in the back until they found a new place to live.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: No, no, no! I can't have a family of rubbish-scented raccoons living in my boutique!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Uh, did you hear that?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [annoyed] Heh. Turns out there's a Club Pony Party Palace upstairs.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [excitedly] Turns out there's a Club Pony Party Palace upstairs!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm sorry. Could you please ask her to turn it down? Could you ask her to turn it down, please? [pleading] Turn it down, please! [sobbing] Oh, please!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Ugh! Foals today listen to their so-called "music" far too loud. I realize that makes me sound like an old mare. But this is business!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I wish we were having as much fun as they are.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Well, sweeping can be fun, too. [to the beat] Sweep, sweep, sweep, sweep. Sweep, sweep, sweep, sweep, sweep...

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Only Twilight could make a dance remix about sweeping. I mean, how lame is that?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Yeah. It wasn't even catchy.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Nope.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [to the beat] Sweep, sweep, sweep, sweep...

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Apparently, DJ Pon-3 has a residency at the Party Palace upstairs, but security won't let me speak to her.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Aah! What in the name of Celestia was that?!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [sighs] We'll have to do something about that, after I think of a way to quiet down that music. And after I finish designing the window display!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Gesundheit! Oh, Miss Pommel! I'm so glad to see you! Now, as the sole sales associate at Rarity For You, I hate to add to your already overflowing plate of responsibilities, but it looks as though we have just a tad more to do before tonight than I thought.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh? Why not?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Feel better, my sweet. We'll manage without you... somehow. And we'll manage glowing teeth and car horns and disorganized clothes and dance music! Am I forgetting anything?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [sobbing] What am I going to do?!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Well, opening a store in Manehattan is a pretty big deal. It's natural that Rarity would be a little stressed about how it was going. Since it wasn't going well. Still, I think she handled it all right.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: My dream is doomed! Doomed, I tell you! Doomed!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I know things haven't gone perfectly so far, but we've done this kind of thing before. If we all work together<U+0097>

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I appreciate the offer, but this is Manehattan. To make it in the fashion scene here, everything has to be perfect. The perfect location! The perfect clothes! The perfect opening!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Maybe we should just postpone.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Postpone?! Darling, tonight is the last night of the fall season. If we don't open tonight, it won't be...

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [sighs] Perfect.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Yes. I know what needs to be done. I just need more of me! Oh, how I wish I could make copies of myself!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Yeah... Making copies of yourself always sounds like a great idea, but before you know it, you're locked in a room with fifty Pinkie Pies watching paint dry.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: We can do this. And we can stay true to your vision.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: You'd do that? Fluttershy, you'll handle those... strong-smelling raccoons for me?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Of course.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Leave Plaid Stripes to me. I'll handle her and her, uh, "good ideas".

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Ooh, ooh, ooh! And I can go upstairs to that nonstop party and have tons of fun and eat some cake and set off party cannons and<U+0097>

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: And then make them be quiet.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm pretty sure I know somepony who wouldn't mind organizing this merchandise shipment for you. [beat] I'm talking about myself. [beat] [pleading] Oh, please, let me organize it!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: This all sounds splendid, but I don't even have a single employee, and I'll need the best of the best.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Leave the hiring to me.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh! This is it, my dears. If you can handle these problems, I'll focus on the designs for the front window display. We'll show Manehattan what Rarity For You is all about! Oh, what would I do without you?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: What would she do without us? Huh. Lemme think. [imitating Rarity] "Darlings, I'm absolutely doomed, doomed, doomed!" [laughs, normal voice] Heh, I sound just like her!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Hey, you're not writing this down, are you?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Now for the perfect window display. Hmm.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, I can't really stop a super fun party in the middle of mega-happy fun times, can I?! Oh, what would Rarity want?!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Really?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh! If you say so!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Obviously, DJ Pon-3 only plays the sickest of beats. I just wouldn't want her to miss out on the coolest new music straight from the back-alley underground, zip-zap party scene! [to DJ Pon-3] I'd play the whole thing if I were you, no matter what other ponies think.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Rarity For You is only hiring the best of the best. And to me, that means the fastest. Now, uh, before we begin, uh... [to herself] Am I doing this right? What would Rarity want? [to applicants] New plan!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Who can be the first one to tell me what fabric this is?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Are you sure?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I don't know the first thing about clothes. Pretty much all I can do is look at something and tell you if it's clothes or not. This chair? Not clothes.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Uh, fabric?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, no?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [sighs, to herself] What would Rarity want? [to Plaid Stripes] You know, I like you, Plaid Stripes. If it were up to me, we'd have a spoon clothes store right next to Stinky Bottom's Discount Hat Emporium. But it ain't up to me, so the answer is no.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Personally, I think spoon clothes ain't such a bad idea. Useful, too. Eatin' soup, stirrin' gumbo, diggin' little holes.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: There. Perfect. Although, what would Rarity want? Maybe she wouldn't like it done by color. Guess I have to start over!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: A window display is the first thing customers see, and if they like it, they'll walk inside and experience the glory that is my boutique.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [stammers] I don't know which one of you to hire! Just... keep guessing fabrics!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, no! Not a shopping music mashup!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: How's it<U+0097>

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Ooh!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Hello? The door appears to be stuck!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Yep. We're workin' on it!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Hmm. Well, shouldn't let this time go to waste.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: How did this happen?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I shut down the party.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I told Plaid Stripes no.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I asked the raccoons to leave.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I asked a lot of fabric questions.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Rarity asked us to help her with everything because she knows all of us so well. [to Fluttershy] She knows how much you care for animals. She'd trust you to solve the problem your way. [to the others] Maybe we should all do the same. Doing this our way is what Rarity wants. It's not too late. Let's all dig in and we can fix this.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Before Rarity finds out how bad we messed up.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm sorry I asked you to leave. The place is yours if you wanna stay. Though I would like to ask you all just one favor.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: I'm sorry I made you play that un-fun, super-boring music. But if you're up for it, I have an idea to make the party even better!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Okay, I don't get fabric, but I do get speed. And I need somepony fast enough to help all the customers Rarity's gonna have. So... first one to the river and back gets the job! [beat] It's a race! Go!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [clears throat] Mr. Stripes, I owe your daughter an apology. She's got good ideas, and I should give 'em a chance. So here's what I'm thinkin'.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Perfect!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [awkwardly] Wow, looks like we fixed that door just in time!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [gasps] Oh! What's all this?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: The whole place organized by style, cross-referenced by size, and reverse-indexed by fabric. She'll be able to find anything in three seconds flat! It was some of my best work.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh! I knew I could count on you! All right... I suppose this is the moment of truth...

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Rarity For You is now open!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Oh, dear. I wasn't quite prepared for such a crowd. How will I handle them all?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Right this way, everypony, and one of our talented salesponies can help you out!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Honestly, they were all pretty slow. But they finished the race. Plus they knew a lot more about fabric than I did. So, I hired them all!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: The way I see it, Rarity designs fashion, DJ Pon-3 designs beats. What better combination than a boutique/dance club?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: After a quick bath, they were more than willing to help!

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: Heh. Toldja spoon clothes ain't such a bad idea.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [reading] "In the end, Rarity's grand opening was a smashing success! True, it got off to a rocky start, but somehow this rag-tag group of ne'er-do-wells..." [to ponies] Oh, heavens, I think he means you. [continues reading] "...came together and created the perfect boutique. A vision of Rarity combined with the expertise of her friends! This reporter, for one, is a believer." [to ponies] Why didn't you tell me there were so many problems?

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: We all figured you had enough on your mind.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: And we didn't want you to think that the opening wasn't perfect.

title: The Saddle Row Review
dialog: [giggles] "Ne'er-do-wells" or not, I know I can always count on all of you. And nothing could be more perfect than that.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, dear. Is somepony else waiting?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh. Uh, well, I'm just waiting for Applejack. It's been so long since we've had a relaxing day at the spa together. I'm quite certain she'll be along any moment.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hey, there, Rarity. I really tried to get here earlier. I just can't believe how much time my chores are takin' up these days. At least now we'll finally get to spend some quality spa time together. Right?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Aw, shucks, Rarity. I guess I missed the whole day. I sure am sorry.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Me, too.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hi, Rarity!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Morning, Twilight, Spike. Good heavens, that's a lot of empty pie plates.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh... yeah. We were just heading to pick up some fresh pies. Heh. I don't know why we keep running out at the castle. [nervous laugh] What are you gonna get?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Applejack, actually. Although, I'm quite sure she'll be too busy once again.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What do you mean?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, nothing. It's just that Applejack and I haven't had one of our spa days in ages.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You two really should set aside some time.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Darling, I have been trying for moons! But Applejack is so busy these days, it's next to impossible.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Wow. I didn't realize Applejack had so much to do.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hey, Applejack! Another order of pies, please.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Sure thing, Spike!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Aah! Dah! Whoa-oa-oa!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I don't suppose those pies are the last chore on the schedule for today?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Gah! Land's sakes! Is it time for our spa day already? Rarity, why don't you go on ahead and I'll meet ya there?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh! Please, Applejack, let's not kid ourselves!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, it ain't 'cause I don't wanna. But the work on the farm has just been takin' up more and more of my time.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I hate seeing you two not spending time together. Can't you get somepony else in your family to take over for a bit?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Wish I could. But Granny, Big Mac, and Apple Bloom all have chores of their own. And today, they're all busy takin' the harvest to market.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I know we're not farmers, but I'm sure Spike and I could handle things for a little while.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Maybe...

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Is there one chore we could do?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well... I suppose if you two got started on feedin' the pigs, I could maybe leave for an hour.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oooh! An hour of spa perfection? I can work with that!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Perfect! You head out to the spa, and Spike and I'll take care of things here.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Whoa! Dah! Whoa!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh, yeah. We totally got everything covered.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Okay. This list pretty much covers everything you need to know to feed the pigs. But, uh, maybe I should go over it with you just to...

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Applejack, please. If there's a list involved, I am one hundred percent on top of it.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh, right.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: And don't worry about things here! Spike and I have totally got this! I mean, it's just feeding the pigs. How hard could it be?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh, Twilight?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Whoa.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I'm glad we're doin' this, Rarity. I've been puttin' work before our spa time for too long. I know we've only got an hour, but I can't wait to have a steam.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: A steam is just the start. I know exactly what we'll do, and an hour will be perfect.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Okay, Spike, ready with that list?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ready.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Let's do this!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [reading] "Step one: open the gate."

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Okay. [reading] "Step two: close the gate."

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Huh?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Mm. That's what it says.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [reading] "Step three: walk away."

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: "Walk away"? Really?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [intonation of "I don't know"] Mmm.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I just hope Twilight and Spike can handle things until I get back.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Now, Applejack, if we are really to enjoy this time together, you simply must give yourself over to the idea that you are off-duty and try to relax.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I know. You're right. I really am glad we're doin' this. And as long as it's only an hour, I'm sure everythin' will be just fine.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Exactly. Now kindly step this way. Relaxation awaits.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [gasps] Rainbow Dash! What are you doing here?!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yeah. I didn't think spa treatments were your thing exactly.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What?!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, they're totally not. At least, not the froufrou kind.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ah.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Huh.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yeah, I, uh, I think I tweaked something at Wonderbolts practice the other day. I just came in for a deep tissue sports massage.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh! [chuckles nervously] I-I'm pretty sure that wasn't what I signed up for.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: And it seems like you're really busy today anyway! I'll just come back tomorrow. [to Rarity and Applejack] Uh, see you two later! Have fun! [to Lavender Essence, whispered] But put me down for the same thing.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [chuckles] Too bad Rainbow Dash just hates those "froufrou" spa treatments. She could have joined us for a nice steam. Hoo-wee! I can't wait.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [laughs] Indeed. Although, if they couldn't fit Dashie in, I wonder just how far behind things are running. Obviously, we're on a very tight schedule.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [grunts, gasps] Well, maybe not everypony is waiting for the steam room.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: So everypony here wants a steam bath?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, the solution is obvious. We'll simply have to start our short time at the spa with something else.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [scoffs] Nothin' doin'. I came here to have a steam, and that's just what I'm gonna get!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: But, but, it'll take most of our hour just to get through this line!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I wish I could say the same.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Not without my steam!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Apparently, Applejack won't consider starting her time at the spa without a steam, and we only have an hour.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Applejack, where are you going?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Um, why are y'all just standin' here?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: So if you're not gettin' enough steam, that must mean there's not enough hot water.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ooh, Applejack, honestly, can't we just start with a hooficure? We're going to run out of time.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hmm.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ha! Now what do we have here?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: The laundry room, of course. And at this point, I'm considering soaking my hooves in one of the machines so my time here isn't a total loss!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, sure, but have you always run every single one of these here machines full bore all day, every day?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hmmm.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Looks to me like you don't have any left.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I think I figured out the problem. You've got a small leak, and that means the steam takes just a little longer to build up. And while ponies wait, they get cold. Cold ponies start wrappin' themselves in towels, and all those dirty towels have to be cleaned because Ponyville Day Spa prides itself on cleanliness.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Basically, losin' steam makes you use more towels. That means you do more laundry, which uses up the hot water you need to make more steam, so the problem just keeps gettin' worse.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Wonderful. Now that we've solved the great steam mystery, we can finally get back to our... significantly less than an hour of relaxation.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Rarity, are you kiddin'? I can't just leave things like this. I'm gonna need my tools.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Ahh!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Whew! Now that that leak's fixed, ponies won't get so cold they use up all those towels! And without all that laundry, there'll be plenty of hot water for all the steam anypony could want!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [laughs] No, thanks. I'm just relieved I can finally relax in the steam. What do you say, Rarity?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: It sounds lovely, Applejack, but... unfortunately, you spent so much time fixing the steam room, we don't have any time left to use it. Honestly, how in Equestria did it never occur to you to check for leaks?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You obviously need an outside eye to evaluate the situation. It's lucky for you Applejack is too stubborn to relax!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh, I'm sorry, Rarity. We'll just have to do this another day. Twilight and Spike should be done feedin' the pigs by now.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Twilight is a very capable pony. I'm sure she can figure out what to do next.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Look, I know Twilight's a princess and an Alicorn, but she isn't a farmer. I've been doin' farm work my whole life, and I'm not sure it's somethin' you can just "figure out".

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Of course. [gasps] Why don't we pop back so you could explain to Twilight what to do next, and then we'll come back here and pick up where we left off?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I suppose I could try... assumin' everythin' went well so far.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [laughing] Oh, Applejack, honestly! How could it not?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Wouldn't it be easier to just fly?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I'm sorry, Rarity, but I think I'm gonna have to finish these chores myself.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Twilight, darling! How in the world did you end up there?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Spike and I were just trying to follow Applejack's list as closely as possible.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Mmmh... Maybe not the best plan.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I'm sorry, Applejack, but we never even got started feeding the pigs.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: That's alright, Twilight. I know you did your best. I guess a list can't really capture all the ways I have of doin' things.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: At least you two got to spend some time at the spa together.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Yeah, that must've been super relaxing!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, if watching Applejack fix plumbing counts as relaxing, then yes.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What about your hour of spa perfection?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: As it turns out, the Ponyville Day Spa had a few problems with their steam room, and somepony refused to relax until she had fixed them.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I'm sorry, but I just couldn't let those spa ponies go another minute puttin' up with problems they didn't even know they had! Somehow they just got used to a huge bottleneck of ponies standin' around waitin'. An' I took one good look at that spa jam, and I knew I had to do somethin'! Sometimes the simplest things can just derail a whole operation. [babbles] Whether it's a leaky pipe or doin' too much laundry. You can't just stick to the same old way of doin' things and expect them to get better. [clucking] I mean, thinkin' you can is just plumb ridiculous. Right? [short laugh] It's funny when you realize the extra work they were doin' was actually makin' things worse!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
