dialog: I mean, I guess it's possible to get stuck in a routine where you're doin' all this extra stuff and not realize it, but I can't for the life of me think of how! [beat] Why are y'all starin' at me like that?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Um... Are you certain everything you just did is entirely necessary to feed the pigs?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: What? Of course! Why would I be doin' it if it weren't? See, this gate here used to squeak so loud, the pigs would run to the other side of the pen and never come out! So I open and close it to let them know it's safe.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: But it doesn't squeak anymore.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Of course not! I fixed that ages ago. Then I realized puttin' a little fright into 'em got 'em all hustlin' out of the pen.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: They don't look scared to me.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, no. They got used to it. Which is why I started doin' the chicken dance! To show 'em that if they didn't get to eatin' their food, the chickens would. 'Course, bein' a chicken, I couldn't very well open the gate. Gettin' the food bucket to spill into the trough was just a happy accident because one time I left it there by mistake.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh, Applejack? It seems like everything you're doing is to fix things that aren't really problems anymore.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, I'll be...

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Hmmm... Maybe it isn't so hard to get stuck doing extra work after all.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Huh. I wonder if I've been doin' that around here with anythin' else.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, there's only one way to find out!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Thanks, y'all. I guess I just got so used to doin' everythin' a certain way, I didn't realize there were any problems.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Having a friend look at what you're doing with an outside eye can really help!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Mm-hmm! And I suppose if it weren't for our unsuccessful time at the spa, none of us would've realized it.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Well, now that your chores are streamlined, what are you gonna do with all the extra time?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: I think I have a few ideas.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Think you can come up with enough things for us to do now that we have more time to relax?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, please. I could plan a week's worth of treatments!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Heh. Well, let's just start with the rest of the day for now. After all the work we just did on the farm, I am ready for some serious relaxation!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [sighs] Thanks for letting me know there was an opening. I don't know if I could make it without my pampered muscle massage.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Oh, absolutely! Sometimes a girl just has to pamper herself, am I right?

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: You certainly are!

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [gasps] [stammering] Oh! Hey! I was just, uh, uh...

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: [giggles] Don't worry, Rainbow Dash. We were just heading in for some pampering ourselves. You could always join us.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: That is, if you don't mind sufferin' through one or two "froufrou" treatments.

title: Applejack's "Day" Off
writer: Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox; story by Neal Dusedau, Michael P. Fox & Wil Fox
dialog: Uh... I suppose I could take it. You know, for you ponies.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm so glad you asked.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And it was super awesome of you to invite me too! Things have been so busy with the Wonderbolts lately, it's great to get a chance to relax someplace quiet.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, no! Not again!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wait, you don't mean<U+0097>!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Guess who's home! That's right, big sis, it's your one and only favorite little brother, moi.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Hi, Flutterbutter! How's the bestest big sister ever? Hey, where's the love? How about a little excitement to see your baby brother?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm just surprised. When you left, you said mane therapy was your calling.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, it is, sis, it is. You would not believe how much stress ponies hold in their manes. Everything gets limp and unmanageable. No offense, but brushing alone won't solve the problem.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What went wrong?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Nothing went wrong, per se. It's just the powers that be were so locked into their required styles, and you know me. I've got my own style! And I think they were a little threatened.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ugh.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Welllll, if it ain't Rainbows "The Best Flyer There Ever Was" Dash!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [flatly] Oh, this ought to be good.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Sorry, I shouldn't tease you. I know the whole super awesome flyer bit's just to impress me.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Still, thanks for showing up for my homecoming. It's, it's sweet.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I kinda thought there'd be more ponies here. I mean, what about your party planner friend, um... Sprinkle Pie! She could've turned this into a real house partay, am I right? I mean, this place could use it. [singsong] Drab!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Dad, please. When I get all my stuff back in here, you won't even remember what this boring old place looked like!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [whispering] Um, Mom, Dad, can I talk to you for a second?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm not so sure letting Zephyr move back home is a good idea. I know you both want to help, but don't you remember last time?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] I know. It just seems like his place always ends up being your place. And then he sort of makes you do everything for him!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And they were all like, "We love your free spirit, Zeph! And it would be wrong to cage that! Go follow your dreams!"

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zeph was just telling me all about the ins and outs of mane therapy school.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: It's all so political. I just could not take it!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Well, maybe if you stuck with it for more than a few weeks...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Sorry, sis, but when something's not the right fit, this pony's gotta fly!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [yawns] Anyway, good talk, Rainbows. I am so touched you came to see me, really. I hate to deprive you of my presence, but this breeze needs his Z's.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You know it's the middle of the day, right?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I know. [maracas in background] Siesta! I'm just gonna assume you made up my room the way I like it, right, Mom? Oh, I almost forgot! All my stuff is out front. Wanna grab that for me, Pops? [short laugh] Thanks.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] Same old Zeph.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I know you weren't expecting to see your brother, but you've been kind of quiet, even for you.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm sorry, but I am just so... so... peeved right now! [gasps] Excuse my language!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Rainbow Dash! Fluttershy! It's me, Pinkie Pie! Your friend!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, um, sorry about that.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: We just had lunch with Fluttershy's parents, and you'll never guess who showed up.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ooh! Mayor Mare? Cranky Doodle Donkey? Cheese Sandwich? Ms. Harshwhinny?!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zephyr Breeze.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, that makes more sense.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And from the look on your face, I'm guessin' it's for another one of his "extended stays"?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: She's a bit peeved.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zephyr's my brother, and I love him. But he's never learned to do anything for himself. I don't know why my parents keep letting him trot all over them!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Well, if your parents won't stand up for themselves, maybe you need to stand up for them.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You know, you're right!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zephyr Breeze!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, hey, sis. Come to see me work my magic and turn this place from drab to fab, huh? Well, watch and learn!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Can't you see what you're doing?!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah! I'm getting rid of this old stuff so I can turn the backhouse into my art studio! I've decided I'm gonna be a sculptor!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm talking about Mom's flowers!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: She's gonna move them so I can have my meditation patio here. She loves replanting stuff. Don't you, Mom?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And Dad's been collecting his favorite bits of cloud from the factory since before you were born.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You can't just fly in and change everything Mom and Dad have built here.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But this is the only place big enough for my studio/meditation garden. Ooh! Unless I do it in the living room!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [to her parents] I know speaking up for yourself can be hard, believe me, but Zephyr will never stand on his own if he can lean on you.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Don't be so dramatic, sis! Mom and Dad just wanna let me be me! Right? I can do plenty on my own.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I agree. Which is why you should move out.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh. Well... I mean, I-I totally would, but... I don't think that's what Mom and Dad want! It's not, is it?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [tearing up] Sure. I mean, I really just came back here to keep you guys company, but... whatever's best for the family. I just... I just gotta grab a few essentials.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Of course! There's plenty of ponies who'd love for a little breeze to blow their way...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So... where's Zeph gonna go now?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm not sure. Oh, I hope I did the right thing...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Are you kidding? One hundred percent!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [singsong] Hey, sis!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Your new roomie's here!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Okay, maybe like seventy percent.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Um, Zephyr. When Mom and Dad told you to find someplace else to live, I don't think they meant here.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Well, it's not their house, so by definition, it's someplace else. Am I right, Rainbows? Stop oogling me and help settle this.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] You know what? I totally forgot that I promised to help Pinkie Pie... sprinkle... something.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You said you had plenty of places to go!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ehhhh...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] Fine. You can stay here<U+0097>

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You're the best! We're gonna have so much fun.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: On one condition.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Totally. Anything.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You have to get a job.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Cracking the whip, huh? You always were kind of bossy.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [through gritted teeth] Zephyr Breeze...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Kidding! Get a job. Absolutely.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [yawns] Where are we goin' so early? You have no idea how bad morning sun is for your mane.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Remember how we talked about you getting a job?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: It was just yesterday, and it's totally on my to-do list, but you can't expect to find something befitting my awesomeness overnight.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I thought you might say that.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So I did it for you.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What?!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: These fabrics all need to be dyed those colors. Do you think you can handle that?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [muttering] Um, I don't know...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You get started while Fluttershy and I head to the store for more supplies. Ta-ta!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Good luck!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Thanks for giving my brother a job. I just hope he's up to the task.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, darling, dyeing fabric is the simplest thing!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You just dip cloth in a bo<U+0097>

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [humming to himself] Rarity, you're back!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What did you do?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Since you talk to animals all the time, I just figured it runs in the family, so why not outsource this stuff, you know?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Turns out the animal communication thing isn't genetic.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zephyr, I asked you to do this job! Not to pawn it off on innocent woodland creatures!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Okay, I guess you have some feelings about this. But you should know it's basically your cat's fault for walking by and giving me the idea. But I'm actually kinda into this look!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So I guess what I'm saying is... you're welcome?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [frustrated stuttering] Zephyr, this is just unacceptable!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wow. I guess I know when my efforts aren't appreciated.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ugghh!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Whoa! Those are tall!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm glad you noticed, because they're your new job.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wha? [to Fluttershy] You said you were taking me to tea with the princess!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Actually, I said I was going to tea with the princess. You're going to work.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Sis, c'mon!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Don't worry, Zephyr, it'll be easy. I just need a Pegasus pony to fly up and wipe each window down from top to bottom.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And I'm here to make sure you do it right.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wow, Zephyr! This looks amazing!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, you know, like you said, it was easy!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Where's Spike?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Up here!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You were supposed to supervise, not do all the work!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I was supervising! And then Zephyr asked me about different cleaning techniques and which one was best, and if I could<U+0097> Hey! I did all the work!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Don't let him fool you. Old Spike is quite the taskmaster.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, come on, sis. I had to ask Spike to make sure I was doing it right.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You didn't do it at all! [inhales] Well, I guarantee there won't be any fooling around on the next job.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Next job?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That's right, Zeph! You're coming with me!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You don't have to come up with some excuse to hang out with me, Rainbows! Let's just go for a fly and see where the day takes us.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [frustrated sigh] We're going to Wonderbolts Headquarters. And I am gonna give you a job so simple and straightforward, not even you can weasel your way out of it! [quickly] And the second you try, I'm gonna zap you with a storm cloud! Got it?!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, I got it. I can already feel the electricity between us.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Rainbow Dash is crazy, okay?! She expects me to do stuff right when she asks me to do it! It's insane!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So you just quit? Again?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Escaped is more like it. Besides, what was I supposed to do?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Keep trying? Finish something for once? Maybe that way, you'd actually find something you like to do!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That all sounds fine for your friends, but it's just not me.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Then I'm sorry, Zephyr, but I don't think you can live here.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Fine! I'll just go live in the woods like my foreponies before me! Guess the only breeze this zephyr can count on is his own!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Aw, cheer up, Fluttershy. I know it was hard, but you did the right thing. You couldn't let Zephyr pull the same stuff on you that he's always pulled on your folks!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I guess so...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, hello, Constance!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh? Oh, dear.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: See, Wigford? The Breeze needs nopony! We've got food, shelter. Just need to put the old kettle on...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Come on, sticky-sticky, make with the sparks!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ugh! What's a pony got to do to find a decent stick around here?!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I know he needs to learn to do things for himself, but...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh... I can't let him live like this.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Actually, I don't think he'd make it through the night.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [gasps] Fluttershy! Hey! I was just, um, cozying up in my sleeping bag! Ready to call it an early night! [mock-tired] Such an exhausting day, y'know?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: It's noon.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You know me! [maracas in background] Siesta...

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ugh... I can't do this. I can't do anything.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Zephyr, you're smart and talented. You could do anything if you just tried!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And what if I give everything I have and still fail? Honestly, I think it's better not to try at all.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But then you won't ever do anything.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I don't expect you two to understand. I mean, when have you ever failed? You've literally helped save Equestria, like, a dozen times.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And I was worried that I'd fail every time! Sometimes you have to do things, even though you might fail.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But failing is the worst!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And quitting doesn't feel much better, does it?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: No.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So here's the deal: You can come back with me, but you have to do exactly what I say. No exceptions.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [resigned] I will literally do anything you ask me if it means I don't have to stay here.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Okay, you know what you have to do, right?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Beg for help, then quit when I get frustrated. Just kidding! Total opposite of that. Got it.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You think he can do it?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Everypony has times in their lives When their hearts are filled with doubt

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Frustration builds up inside And it makes you want to shout

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But if you just take that first step The next one will appear

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: There are times when you want to give up When you think that you can't go on

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Everypony has times in their lives When their hearts are filled with doubt

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But if you just give it your all You'll start to work it out

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And I know I can't give up too soon Get myself in the zone And I find I can walk, then run

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I can do it on my own

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I can do it on my own I can do it on my own

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I did it! I actually finished something! By myself!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And it looks exactly like it's supposed to.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I knew you could do it, Zephyr.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I didn't! But I do now. Thanks for believing in me, sis.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That's what big sisters are for.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So, Zeph, now that you've accomplished this, what's next?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Anything I want! I mean, the sky's the limit, right?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But, y'know... I've got some baby steps in mind.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Thanks for dinner, Mr. and Mrs. Shy! Ha! It was great as usual.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Huh...?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Have you heard from Zephyr? Is he doing well?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Heh. That's great.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [singsong] Guess who graduated from mane therapy training?

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Hah, awesome!

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm so proud of you, Zephyr.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: It was only a matter of time before they recognized my true genius! But actually doing the work probably helped, and I wouldn't have if it weren't for you.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, I just gave you some encouragement. You did this on your own.

title: Flutter Brutter
writer: Dave Rapp; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And honestly, right now I feel like I can do anything... except find a place. I can still crash here for a few days, right?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: As you've all probably noticed, it's been quite some time since the map has sent us on a mission of friendship.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yeah! Ever since Starlight messed with it to go back in time and try to change history!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes. Since then. But, as part of her studies, Starlight's been assisting me. And together, we think we've come up with a spell that can get it working again!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [simultaneously] Ooh, well done!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Now without further ado...

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Fluttershy and Twilight in Appleloosa! No, me and Rainbow Dash in Las Pegasus! No, Rainbow Dash and Twilight in Yakyakistan! No, Twilight and Twilight in Twilight's castle! Oh. Me! Me! Oh, me... and Rarity! Ooh! I hope it's some faraway place that nopony has gone before!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [chuckles nervously] Well, maybe not too far away. An adventure somewhere that has modern conveniences would be preferable. [gasps] Canterlot! This is wonderful! I can check the boutique! Perhaps there'll be some social events that we can attend! [gasps] I'll have to pack extra outfits! What will I wear?!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Y'know, some ponies get excited about the silliest things.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [sighs] Now then, as far as finding a friendship problem, I suggest we start at the castle and begin to question the proper<U+0097>

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, Rarity, you don't find a friendship problem. It finds you. We just need to go with the flow, and eventually, kablam! We get friendship problem'd right between the eyes.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Well, this is a team effort, so if you feel we should go with the flow, then with the flow we shall go. But where's the flow saying we should go?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You know Canterlot. What do you think we should do?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Hm. Take your pick. Culture, couture, cuisine!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, my. Well, it sounds like your stomach is saying we should flow towards some lunch? I know just where to go.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Restaurant Row, the absolute best place for fine dining in all of Equestria!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Ooh, so many choices! Where should we go? This one? That one? Those ones?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Any establishments that have this <U+0096> the three-hoof rating.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Um, whose hooves?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Why, Zesty Gourmand, the Queen of Cuisine. When it comes to food, she is the ultimate authority in Canterlot and thus all Equestria. She judges a restaurant on cuisine, decor, and presentation. Without her approval, a restaurant simply cannot survive.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: What's so important about her approval?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Zesty grew up around fine dining, and everypony hangs on her every word when it comes to cuisine.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [gasps] Oh, my! Such presentation. Mm. Oh. [smacks lips] Ah. Yes. Very nice...

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Nom nom nom. [gulps, gags] Maybe, I'm not in the mood for... [whispers] whatever this is. Can we try someplace else?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Nom nom. Ugh. Maybe one more stop?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Blech! Nope.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Maybe instead of trusting somepony else's hooves, I should pick the next place?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Ugh! Very well.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: The Tasty Treat. It's very... rustic. [whispers] It looks like it hasn't even been rated.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Thank goodness! Hee-hee!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Are we sure they're open?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [sniffs deeply] Mmmm. It smells open.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes, indeedy!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: We're actually in a bit of a hur<U+0097>

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes, please!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: We'll take one!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: How can you say no to that?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, me? Oh, I'm fine. Thank you. [aside, singsong, to Pinkie] No rating.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Hiya! What's your name?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Are you a chef here too?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Then why are you stacking chairs?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [slurps] So good!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Um, Pinkie, perhaps we should excuse ourselves.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [muffled speaking] Oh, Rarity, try this!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [munches] Ooh!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [spits] Rarity, I think that friendship problem just kablammed us right between the eyes!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: These two? Oh, I don't know, darling. The food is excellent, but I'm not sure there's much you and I can do to help them.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: That's it!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes! Uh, what's it?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: The flow has led us here! This is our mission! [to Saffron and Coriander] We are going to get you a three-hoof rating and save your restaurant! I can get Zesty Gourmand here!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [gasps] And I can pack this place with ponies!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You really don't know Rarity.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [singsong] I've done it!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: See?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: It took all of my charm and cajoling, but I was able to convince Zesty Gourmand to come and try the food!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Ah, yes. Well, um, there is a bit of a challenge. The only time she could make herself available is tonight.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Zesty rates a restaurant on cuisine, decor, and presentation, and she has very specific tastes. If she's coming tonight, there is quite a bit of work that needs to get done.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Like what?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, a tweak here, a tuck there, some slight modifications to the menu. [laughs nervously] We just need the place to feel more cosmopolitan.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Why don't I stay behind with Coriander to get the restaurant ready for Zesty's arrival? You and Saffron can try and drum up some business.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: One packed restaurant, coming right up!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Coriander, I understand your trepidation. But I promise you, we will get those hooves by making this place feel just like all of the other restaurants on Restaurant Row!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: It'll be fine. Rarity's gonna make sure that The Tasty Treat is the most unique and beautiful restaurant in Canterlot! Not like all of those stuffy places on Restaurant Row.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Here' If you want to succeed You must follow the trends, that's the key

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Here' Your food is so good The flavor's so fancy and free

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You need to change If you want to compete But fear not, for I know what to do

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Don't ever change Being different is good Don't let what others do be your cue

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Be unique

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Just be the same

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Trust your heart

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You'll make your name

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Try harder! Fillies and gentlecolts! Check out the super stupendous and amazing cuisine of The Tasty Treat! Grand re-opening tonight!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Rrrgh! Stupid hooves!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes! Yes, it is!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [sighs] This is going to be exactly what Zesty is looking for!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Rarity, what did you do?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: I know. Isn't it perfect? Zesty is sure to love it.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: I thought we were trying to make this the most unique and beautiful restaurant in Canterlot! Not make it exactly like every other restaurant!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [short laugh] We want to help our friends by getting them three hooves. That will only happen if this is like every other restaurant.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Not that! Anything but that!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Rarity, how could you ruin the restaurant?!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, pff. Kch. Ts! We helped save the restaurant. Now, where are the other guests? How many other ponies are coming?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Just two?! I thought you said you could pack the place with ponies no matter what!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You said you would make the restaurant better...

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: ...so I guess we both didn't know what we were talking about!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: [gasps] Zesty Gourmand! Everypony, places!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: No-no-n-n-no, but that's not what Zesty wants!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: What kind of food expert doesn't want flavor?! That's insane!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: I'm taking this out there!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: No! Zesty will hate it! You are going to ruin this for them!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: No, I'm trying to fix it after you ruined it!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Zesty! Please wait! Allow me to explain!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Disreputable?! You mean a place with food that actually tastes good?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: I'm so embarrassed.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: I don't know that there are words to adequately express how truly sorry we are.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, my! This is truly delightful!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Mmm, this is the best thing you've made so far! And I thought the food before was the best!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You know what? Who cares what some stuffy unicorn thinks of the food here? It's exquisite.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: That's true.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: And you don't need three silly hooves in your window to prove it.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: That's double true!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You just need ponies in here to give it a chance! Ponies that will tell everypony else in Canterlot that The Tasty Treat has the best food in the city!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: That's true times three!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Ohhhh, yes, they will. Pinkie, we are the perfect team for this! We were just doing the wrong jobs! I will go out and bring the crowd! You stay here and make sure this place is every bit as unique and rustic as it was the moment we walked in!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: You two? You are going to cook! Make whatever you want, and make a lot of it! I intend to bring a crowd!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Would the owner of one of the premier boutiques in Canterlot put a stamp of approval on something that wasn't fabulous?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: It's almost time! Is everypony ready for the grand re-re-opening?

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Oh, you guys! Group hug!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Now come on! We've got a party to throw!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: No, we can't, and neither can you! Nopony has the right to tell these ponies what to think! Zesty, you have very... specific...

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: And very strange!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Yes, and very strange opinions about food, and that's your right. But just because you like your food a certain way, there is no reason to tell these ponies that they need to do the same!

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Zesty, are you sure you wouldn't like to try the food? Ignoring a unique and fresh establishment such as this could do serious damage to your social standing.

title: Spice Up Your Life
dialog: Nothing can stop the dynamic duo of Pinkie and Rarity!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Whoa! [gasping] Oof!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Well, don't stop there! You read, I pack! That's the deal!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I'm sorry, Rainbow Dash. I just keep thinking about how much fun you're gonna have at the Daring Do convention. I wish Princess Celestia didn't need my help with the friendship summit in Griffonstone.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Don't worry. I'll make sure A. K. Yearling signs your book. I can't believe she's gonna be there! She never goes to conventions!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Which, I guess, will be cool for all those other fanponies. But since you and I know A. K. Yearling personally, [hushed] and we know that she's secretly Daring Do herself, [normal] it's no big deal. This convention will be fun, but it's nothing to get too excited about.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: So excited!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: No thanks. Did that already. Ahhh.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: This is the...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Now this is something that only a true fan can appreciate.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: They even put the tiles in the right order.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Huh. Good catch. Oh, I'm Quibble Pants. Nice to meet you.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Rainbow Dash.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Nice costume.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: You, too.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Thanks. The hard part was figuring out the right...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: B-B-Because on page 84 of Sapphire Stone, i-it describes her dodging a, quote, "score of arrows shooting forth from holes in the very walls," unquote, but then on page 107, Daring Do says she, quote, "barely made it past the traps' barrage of arrows," unquote, but clearly, Daring Do is embellishing and the correct number of arrows is...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [sighs] I am so glad I ran into you. Even though I knew the convention would be totally awesome, it's more fun when you're with someone who really knows Daring Do.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I know what you mean. It's so hard to find a pony who really gets it.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Hm. That's weird. We've only done stuff from the first trilogy. After lunch, we should probably start working our way back through the other books.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Whoa, whoa, whoa. There are no other books.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Of course there are. Daring Do and the Trek of the Terrifying Towers, Daring Do and the Many Faces of<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh, p-please, please don't. Just don't even mention the titles. I-I'm not saying those books don't exist. I'm saying that I refuse to acknowledge them.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Why?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: 'Cause they're horrible! I mean, there isn't a single thing after Ring of Destiny that is even remotely in the realm of the possible!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What?! I know for a fact that everything in every one of those books is one hundred percent possible!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh, and how could you possibly know that?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Gyuh, uh, I just... do!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Well, that's a compelling argument.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Why would you even come to this convention if you hate Daring Do so much?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I don't hate Daring Do. The first series was smart and cool and an amazing nod to old-time serialized adventure books, that somehow manages to be self-reflective and ironic while at the same time celebrating the art form without a hint of cynicism. Which is why I came here to ask A. K. Yearling muzzle-to-muzzle why she sold out and dumbed down the rest of her books into just a series of impossible action sequences!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay, now I know you're crazy. A. K. Yearling is awesome, and every Daring Do book that comes out is better than the last!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Wha... Wow. Okay, yeah, I-I-I'm sorry, but I could never be friends with somepony who's willing to believe impossible stuff is possible as long as Daring Do does it.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: That's okay, because I could never be friends with somepony who's so focused on things being possible that he's willing to turn his back on the coolest hero of all time!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Fine!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Fine!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Look, just tell A. K. Yearling that Rainbow Dash is here, and I need her help to convince a know-it-all pony that everything Daring Do's ever done actually happened!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: A. K.! I gotta talk to you. It's an emergency!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What? No. But there is a pony downstairs who thinks everything you've written after the first trilogy is totally unrealistic and terrible. And I need you to help me prove to him that it's all totally possible.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Whoa!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Yes! Sounds like another awesome Daring Do adventure! But... what are you doing here?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: ...I can just blend in with all the Daring Do cosplayers.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: How can I help?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Just keep your eyes out for anything suspicious.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Got it!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Does a pony who only likes your first trilogy qualify as suspicious?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Heh, just checking.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. [sighs] I find all this fanfare around my archenemy... disturbing. [to salespony] I mean, where is the booth for Caballeron?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. I do not see the likeness. Come, let us find Daring Do and the Amulet of Culiacan. I don't want to spend any more time in this place than I have to!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Well, if it isn't the pony who know impossible things can happen because she just does!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Ugh! Sorry, Quibble, I've got more important things to do than argue with a pony who thinks awesome means unrealistic.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: No, wait! I want to hear more about how you're one hundred percent sure that in Curse of the Jungle Queen, Daring Do could survive a sixty-story drop from the top of a waterfall after sustaining a broken wing in a category-six rapid!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Ugh! Obviously, her wing wasn't broke<U+0097> Caballeron!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: See, now that's a great character. Solid backstory, good motivations...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: No-no-no-no! Caballeron is right there!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Of course he is. He's also over there, over there... Ooh, ooh, over there, and and over there. Where are you going?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: And we're out here because...?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Daring Do told me that Caballeron came to this convention to steal the Amulet of Culiacan, and I just saw him and his henchponies come this way!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay. I'm gonna head back inside. There's just a little too much crazy out here for the both of us.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. I do not know what Daring Do is playing at, but if she told you two fanponies of my plan to steal the amulet, you must work for her.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Caballeron! Hah! What do you have to say now, Quibble?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: This was your plan to prove the Daring Do books are realistic? You bought a Daring Do Experience Adventu-cation, really?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What?! No! Look around us! Henchponies, Caballeron, the jungle it took forever to get to? This is the real deal!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Right. We're actually being held captive by Caballeron. Please! This guy's accent is all over the place! No offense.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. I...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: So what's the setup here? You've... kidnapped us, and taken us to the middle of nowhere because...?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. The Temple of Chicomoztoc is somewhere in this jungle. When I find it, the Seven-Sided Chest is as good as mine! I just need the Amulet of Culiacan to unlock it.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh-huh, and Daring Do has the amulet so you came up with this over-complicated plot to lure her into the jungle and exchange it for us.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. I wouldn't call it over-complicated, but... yes.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay, we're done here. Great work. Seriously, very believable.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [grunts] Listen, pal, you can keep her money, but I'm not<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. Going anywhere! You may not approve of my plan, but I'm the mastermind here!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [aside] Debatable...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. And I say you will remain here until Daring Do comes to rescue you. And if she wants you back in one piece, she will give me the amulet! Tie them up!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: The Griffon's Lock!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. You know of it? Further proof that you are an agent of Daring Do!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Or an avid reader.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Listen, if I pretend to believe this nonsense is real, will you call off the henchpony repertory theater over there?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: They're not gonna listen to me. They abducted us both.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [unconvincingly] Daring Do. Thank goodness. We're over here.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [laughing] All four?! I mean, shouldn't at least one of them stay behind to guard us? Oh, oh, wait, the... No, because then it wouldn't be a terrible Daring Do adventure.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: It doesn't matter. We'll never solve the Griffon's Lock before they get back.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay, that was pretty good. Quick, we've gotta get out of here and warn Daring Do!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: No way. Just point me to the hotel and you can play fanpony and hunt treasure out here all day long.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [sighs] Fine. Let's just say this is a Daring Do Adventucation. The only way to get back to the convention is to go through it. So just follow me, and I'll lead you out. Deal?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I... [groans] Fine.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [under her breath] Maybe if I just leave you in the jungle, it'll convince you.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: ...which would make Daring Do left-hoofed, which we know is false, and that is everything that's wrong with Daring Do and the Trek to the Terrifying Tower. Now, the problems with the next book are even<U+0097> Oh, right. What Daring Do adventure would be complete without the precarious rope bridge?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Look, I'm all for making things feel as real as possible, but are these Adventu-cation ponies sure this thing is safe?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Is it too "realistic" for you? Wouldn't want that on a Daring Do adventure, would we?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: If this were really a real Daring Do adventure, I'm sure I'd step on the wrong plank at exactly the wrong<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Whoa!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [sighs] Good thing this is all just a pretend adventure. Least we know all of this struggling won't make the bridge fall apart.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: You need to get your money back.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Hah! How's that for not possible?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: That was... awesome! I-I-I thought we... and then you, and the flying...! Wow, and I was like, "Where are you going?!" A-a-and then you swerved, and I was, I was, I was on the water, and then [devolves into hyperventilating gibberish] Wow!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Yeah. If you read that in a book, you might even think it was unrealistic.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay, I'll give you that one. I mean we could have been done for. [beat] We could have been done for! W-What kind of Adventu-cation is this?! I mean, that's just, that's just bad business! What, what are these ponies thinking?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. Make sure they are secure this time! We can't have them escaping again.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [straining] You'll never get away with this!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. Won't I? You've led me to the temple, and Daring Do is too noble to let harm befall her companions, so the amulet is as good as mine. What? No witty remarks this time about how silly my plan is?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: This isn't the official Daring Do Experience Adventu-cation, is it.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Finally!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: It's some cheap knockoff run by a bunch of incompetent ponies that have no idea how to execute this adventure with any level of safety!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Ugh!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What was that with the bridge?! We were in serious danger! I-I'm reporting you all to... well, I don't know who I'm reporting you to, but it's gonna be somepony important! Oh, and this cut-rate excuse for an "Experience" hasn't proved anything except that I'm right! It has all the hallmarks of a lame Daring Do adventure!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh... Quibble?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: No, I'm talking! Generic jungle location <U+0096> check. Overly complicated villain plot <U+0096> check. Random coincidences that conveniently get us to the next big set piece <U+0096> check!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. Watch where you are stepping, you fool!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Listen, buddy, I don't take orders from some second-rate performer who learned acting from the Supervillain School of Bad Accents! The only thing this mess is missing is some giant Ahuizotl wannabe monster, and I have a feeling that would be a bit too much for you bargain-basement adventurers to pull off!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Huh?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Um... you're real. This is real. This is real!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I told you to warn me of anything suspicious, not run off on an adventure without me!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Wha... Whoa, whoa, y-you're real! You-you-you're friends with her?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh, we'll have to do introductions later. Right now we have to<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: G-Get out of here, yes! Thank you!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Actually, no.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: We can't leave without the treasure. And we should probably get to it before our friend gets any higher.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Whoa!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Seven doors, seven locks. One of them leads to the treasure. I'd rather not think about what the others lead to.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Yeah, yeah, the classic "Pony and the Tiger" bit. All you have to do is<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Um, maybe you should let Daring Do figure it out?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Oh, 'scuse me.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [coughs] Not that one.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Ehhhhh...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Is he always like this?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Yeah. But... he's usually right.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [sighs] Which lock do you think it is?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Ugh, finally. Look, each door has another door that matches. These two both have Earth ponies fighting serpents. These two have Pegasi fighting griffons. These two have unicorns fighting bears. But this one...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: ...has an Alicorn on it! It's the only one without a match! How did I miss that?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I've been asking myself that ever since book four!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: The Seven-Sided Chest of Chicomoztoc!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh, guys...?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh... The way out is totally covered! How are we gonna get out of here?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: There!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Seriously, do you ever not escape out of the top of a temple?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: We'll have to carry Mr. Adventure Critic out with us!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: We won't be fast enough! We'll never make it!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Guys! I think Rainbow Dash and I have this covered.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Go around! You can't go over him!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Go over him?! Are you crazy?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: If Quibble says go over him, we go over him!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: You two are insane!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: You said go over him!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I said go around him!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [hushed] And I said be quiet!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. This way! I heard them!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [hushed] Okay, I got it. Let's create a fake treasure out of mud and rocks, give that to Caballeron, and then we<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [hushed] Not every Daring Do plan has to be super-complicated.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. Rrrgh! I swear I heard them!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Dr. I'll get you, Daring Dooooo!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Meh. Not particularly original or inspired, but it worked.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Who were you again?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: He's a fan.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: [unconvinced] Uh-huh. [normal] There's some stairs on the other side of the temple that lead out of the ravine. I suggest you two take them and head west.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What about you?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I've gotta get this to a museum. Thanks for your help. I couldn't have done it without you. Both of you.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: So... maybe the later books are slightly more realistic than I gave them credit for. Still don't like them.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: What?! How can you<U+0097>?!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Wait, hold on. Before we get in another fight, I-I think I finally figured it out! I love the Daring Do that solves puzzles and uses her brain to get out of tough situations, and she did way more of that in the original trilogy! You love the Daring Do that is brave and awesome and comes out on top no matter what the odds!

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Okay...?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: And that's okay! We might never agree on what makes Daring Do cool, but you... are definitely cool. I-I mean, the way you saved me on the bridge? Wow! And escaping from the temple... you, Rainbow Dash, are awesome.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Well... I-I'm not the one who can locate a treasure in half the time Daring Do can! You may have terrible taste in books, but you're pretty awesome yourself. In a brainy, egghead, puzzle-solving kind of way. Heh.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: I guess we don't have to agree on everything to get along. Friends?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Definitely friends.

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh, do you think A. K. Yearling would consider letting me write the next book? I... I think I can make things way clearer. I mean, for instance, in the second adventure...

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: ...there's a side character. I don't want to kind of name it right now, because it's sort of this thing that I've already written a lot of fan fiction on. I don't want you to... Not that I'm saying that you would steal it! But I am saying this would totally go along my whole thing about puzzle-solving, except what if each puzzle that was solved, uh, unlocked a new karate move? Think of it that way, right? And I mean I'm kind of a "Yearlite" myself, so I'm sure she'd be open to<U+0097>

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Uh... Quibble?

title: Stranger Than Fan Fiction
dialog: Sorry!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Good morning, everypony! I hope you brought your thinking caps, because today we're going to learn about physics!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Physics?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Mm-hmm! Specifically, the use of force in energy conversions! In this case, using mechanical work to convert potential energy into kinetic energy!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: The what now?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Um, Miss Cheerilee? That sounds a bit over our heads.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yeah. Why would we even need to know that stuff?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, it's very important. In fact, you'll most likely end up using it tomorrow.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Tomorrow? What for?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Why, for participating in the... Applewood Derby!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, phew! For a second, I thought we were gonna have to, you know, learn stuff.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: We get to race in the Applewood Derby tomorrow? That's so cool!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: My family's talked about it for years, and now I'm finally old enough to race!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Now hold on to your horseshoes, everypony. You've got a lot of work to do before you're ready to race.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yeah, but... not schoolwork, right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: There'll be a block of applewood just like this one waiting for you at Sweet Apple Acres tomorrow, and you've got one day to turn it into a race-ready cart.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, yeah... That is a lot of work.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Mm-hmm. Luckily, you'll each get to pick an older pony to help you! But choose wisely, because they'll also have to ride in the cart with you during the race.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Hmmm... I think I know just the pony to ask.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Me too!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Me three!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Just remember, everypony. Your cart has to be able to finish the race if you want to win one of the awards. Fastest <U+0096> for winning the race, naturally. Most traditional <U+0096> for the best working replica of an original Applewood cart. And most creative <U+0096> for the cart with the best overall design.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [dreamily] Hoo-wee! Those ribbons are the bees' knees.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: All right then, class! You've got a lot to learn if you want to build a race cart.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Aww... I knew there was gonna be a catch!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Wow! Have you seen what the carts used to look like in the olden days?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yeah, I know all about them. When Ponyville started the Derby, they decided to use the wood from our apple trees for the carts. The race has been a part of Sweet Apple Acres ever since.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I just think these old carts look so cool! But I guess you and Applejack will probably win the award for the most traditional, huh?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: The Apples usually do, but honestly, I'd rather build the fastest cart there is and win the race!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But... I'm pretty sure Scoot and Rainbow Dash'll take that award.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You know, I race around so much on my scooter, being the fastest isn't such a big deal. Maybe I'll try to make the wildest looking cart I can think of!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Really?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Sure! If I win most creative, you can totally win the award for fastest!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And I can win the award for most traditional!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Sounds like we're all gonna try somethin' different. I can't wait to tell Applejack!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Let's get to it!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Go, Crusaders!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Are you kidding?! Of course I'll help with the Applewood Derby! I want you to have as much fun as I did when I was a filly!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Wait, Cloudsdale has a derby too?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Sure! Practically every town in Equestria has one! [sighs] I still remember racing my cloud cart...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: This is so awesome! Woo-hoooooo!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And lemme guess. You won fastest cart.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Heh, obviously!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: So what do you say? Will you help me make my race cart?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Help you? I'm all over it! I've got tons of ideas.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Don't worry, I've got a lot of<U+0097> Whoa. Ideas of my own. Um...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: What are you looking for?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: The blueprint for my derby cart, of course! I'll have to change it a little, 'cause this race is on roads, not on clouds. But trust me, your cart is gonna be amazing!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Um, okay, Rainbow Dash, thanks! How awesome is this? With Dash on my team, how could anything go wrong?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Well, I'm mighty flattered you wanna work with your big sis on your cart. I mean, the Applewood Derby did<U+0097>

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: <U+0097>start on our farm. I know.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Well, I couldn't be more proud to help my little sister take the prize for most traditional.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Actually, I was kinda thinking of somethin' else. Like... fastest?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [scoffs] Fastest? Apple Bloom, things aren't like they were in the old days. The fastest cart now has gotta be slick and modern and<U+0097>

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Exactly!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Not Apple at all. The Apples win most traditional. We have since the Derby started! Why would anypony want to win anythin' else? Now why don't you head off and get some chamomile vines, some hickory sticks, and some apple barrels, and I'll show you what an Apple family cart should look like!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I guess I do have a family tradition to uphold...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [gasps] The Applewood Derby?! [excited giggling] Of course I'll help!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Wow. Uh, Rarity, I didn't know you'd be this excited.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Me? Oh, why, I'm just itching to right an old wrong from long, long ago!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [narrating] I designed my own cart when I was just a filly, and I was positive I was going to win the prize for most creative, hooves down! But I came in second. Second!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You? Second in most creative? To whom?!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [narrating] But I learned a valuable lesson.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I learned to know my audience, and the race cart audience wants big! They want bold!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Chop chop! Everypony out!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: We've got work to do!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: ...but I will fashion the biggest and boldest Derby cart to ever win the prize for most creative!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Actually, I was sorta thinking of something more... traditional?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh! [tittering] Please, darling, leave tradition to the Apples. We're doing big, we're doing bold! [humming to self] Soon the prize for most creative will finally be in my hooves!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You mean my hooves.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yes, that's what I said <U+0096> my hooves. Darling, I hope you're ready to get an early start tomorrow!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Uh... how early?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [yawns] [groans] Rarity, the sun's not even up yet.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, apples, quit complainin'! In my day, we were up even earlier!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Hey, I'd get up in the middle of the night if it means my cart crosses that finish line first and wins fastest!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And my cart wins most creative!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And my cart wins most traditional! Hoo-wee, it's gonna be a good day!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You mean our carts, right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yes, that's what we said, darling.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yup.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Our carts.
