title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Their carts? It almost sounds like they're planning on building them without us.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I'm sure they meant "our" carts. Like, the team cart, right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Of course! I mean, they're all our older sisters. Practically. Plus, they've all done this before. I'm sure they know best. Let's just buckle down and get to work!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Scootaloo, where have you been? I've only got 'til noon to make the fastest cart ever!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Uh, about that. I was really thinking of going for the most creative prize. I mean, I know all about speed already, so...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Exactly! It's all about speed! You've gotta get across the finish line to win a prize, so we might as well get there first, right? Hey, I left a bunch of paint cans by the road. Bring them up here, would ya? Nothing as fun as painting racing stripes on the winning cart!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [sighs] Right... Fun...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Spendin' time buildin' a cart with my big sister? Why, this is just tee-riffic! Um... how can I help?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You can feast your eyes on... this! I-I mean, it ain't quite finished yet.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, good.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But don't it have the makin's of the best cart you ever did see? Uh... is somethin' wrong, Apple Bloom?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Actually, I was kinda thinkin' of somethin' a little more modern. And less rickety. With maybe a chance of winning?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I'm an Apple, but... what if I just take off this fringe?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: No, not the fringe!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Ugh! Why, shoot! Now I've gotta start all over from scratch, and it's almost race time!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh. So, maybe we can redesign it then? Just a little.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: No time! And who'd want to redesign somethin' that's already perfect?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Right... Perfect...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Okay, so I sketched out some of my ideas.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: How about a nice yellow fringe on top?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [muffled] Oh-ho-ho-ho, darling, [normal] the fringe is not exactly big! And that yellow is the least bold color I can imagine!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Well, it doesn't have to be yellow. But I really do love the old-timey style. Like this.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Sweetie Belle, precious face, "old-timey" is just another word for pass<e9>. Remember, big and bold! I do have a reputation to uphold! It was one thing to lose as a filly, but can you imagine if I didn't win the most creative now? Ponies might stop buying my couture!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But we're supposed to be doing this together!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [sighs] Right... Wonderful...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [tired] Hey, Crusader... How's it goin'?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [sighs] Rarity's definitely made the biggest, boldest cart anypony's ever seen.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Wow. Well, Applejack's built somethin' so traditional, it's practically an antique.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [sighs] No matter what I say, there's no talking Rainbow Dash out of making the fastest cart in Equestria.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Doesn't look like any of us ended up with what we wanted.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But... I'm sure our older sisters know what they're doin'. Right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Right...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Right.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And even if our carts aren't exactly what we had in mind, it'll still be fun to drive them to the finish line.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Sure! The race is the best part!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yeah! CMCs behind the wheels!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Derby racers to the starting line! Derby racers to the starting line!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: The race is about to start, Scootaloo! You better shake a leg if you wanna ride in the winning cart!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You, too, Sweetie Belle. There's only one seat left aboard this creative masterpiece, and it's just for you. Woo-hoo!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Whoa, ponies! Wait for me! This traditional cart handles at the exact perfect pace <U+0096> slow! And I got the passenger seat all warmed up for ya, Apple Bloom!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Passenger seat?!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [grunts] They're the only older ponies driving!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: First they built the carts, now they're gonna drive them?!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I know they were all excited to help, but I don't think they're really helping anymore.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: We better hurry if we wanna be a part of this race at all!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Um, aren't you all missing somepony?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: They'll be along.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And, uh, [hushed] usually the younger ponies drive the carts.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [chuckles] Darling, do these look like usual carts to you?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [blows fanfare] Racers! On your marks, get set, go!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [scream turns into a grunt] Can't we go any faster?!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Faster? Don't be silly. This is perfect!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Check me out, racin' the Derby Check out my old-fashioned cart

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Check me out, racing the Derby In my original work of art

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Check me out, faster than ever There's nopony can catch me now

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Let me out, I'd do it over If I only knew how!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: My cart's the most original Designed with imagination

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: My cart's the most traditional Just plain, no complications

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Look at me, I am the ace Might as well give up the chase

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Wish we could stop this race Start again and do it our way

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Having any fun yet?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Nope! Maybe if we could go a little faster!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Gotta get some attention If I want that ribbon

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Gotta push the limit further Blow away the competition

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Gotta coast on through Just relax, we're gonna cruise it

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Guess I don't really care Since we're clearly gonna lose it

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: See, everypony's watching Presentation is a glory

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Just passed you, even faster Speed is king, end of story

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Bigger, bolder down the track

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Love the view from the back of the pack

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Won't stop, we're on the attack

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Too late to take it all back!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Look out!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh! My beautiful swan cart is an ugly duckling!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And my old-time cart is a rootin' tootin' wreck!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [straining] It still counts as a win if I push my cart across, right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: They're not your carts!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: We were supposed to design them!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And we were supposed to drive them!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: The Derby was supposed to be for us, not the three of you! Now you've ruined it for everypony!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Mmmh...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yes, well, I suppose we might have gotten a teensy bit carried away...

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But I thought you all wanted our help.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: We did! We wanted your help to build our carts. But we all ended up with carts that are what each of you wanted!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: But why didn't you say anything?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You've all done the race before. I just figured you knew best!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Plus it's hard to speak up to older ponies.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oh, I certainly understand that. But you mustn't think older ponies automatically know best.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And we probably could have done a better job of listening to you.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Oof. I guess we owe all three of you an apology.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Maybe not just us.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [nervous laugh] Um, how do you feel about a do-over?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I think that's a wonderful idea! But maybe the older ponies should sit this one out.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Thanks for helping us fix up our carts. Pretty creative, right?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I know it's not traditional, but it sure looks fast, don't it?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: You know, darling, I can't believe I'm saying this, but that yellow fringe is rather bold after all.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Thanks, everypony. We couldn't have done it without you.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Yup, I sure am glad Miss Cheerilee agreed to run the race over again.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Well, it isn't every year I get to say this twice, but... Derby racers to the starting line! Derby racers to the starting line! Racers! On your marks, get set... go!

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: And it's probably best keeping all the grown-ups on the sidelines. But... what are we supposed to do now?

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: I think I have an idea.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: [sipping through straw] Ahhh! Much better! Honestly, I'm not sure why we wanted to race those carts in the first place.

title: The Cart Before the Ponies
writer: Ed Valentine; story by Ed Valentine and Michael Vogel
dialog: Seriously! [sighs] This is the most relaxed I've been all day.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm so sorry I lost track of time at our picnic. I didn't mean for us to get caught out here after dark. But there's really nothing to be afraid of. The forest at night is the same as the forest during the day.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Only... darker.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Still, maybe we should hurry back to the cottage.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Nothing to worry about. No reason to...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ruuuun!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [hyperventilating] That wasn't funny! You really scared me! I hope you're happy.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Nope. You're too easy. You're scared of everything.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That's not true.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Boo.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I mean, how could you not appreciate that?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Because I don't think being scared is very fun!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I do! Your heart gets all racy, your hooves get all tingly, your mouth gets all dry-ie! Actually, I don't like that part. But the rest is great!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: See? Everypony likes a good prank! They're just jokes!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Now, Rainbow Dash, I don't think Fluttershy would have called us all here to talk about this if she thought it was funny. Everypony has things they like and things they don't.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And scarin' Fluttershy is just lazy.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [scoffs] Lazy?!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: A prank isn't very good if you're the only pony laughing.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But what if it's really, really, really, really, really funny?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And I can do funny.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I know you can. I guess the trick is making sure that your idea of funny matches the pony you're pranking.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That way<U+0097>

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Good one, Rainbow! Ha-ha! You have to admit! That was funny!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Not really.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah. A whoopee cushion is like a joke shortcut.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Honestly, Rainbow Dash, if you are not willing to put forth the effort required to pull a prank that everypony can enjoy, you may as well not pull one at all.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Fine! If you ponies want effort, then that's just what you'll get.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'm not sure she understood what we meant.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I know you're excited about the Filly Guide Cookie Drive, but I still have to do a few finishing touches on your uniform.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [lips smacking] Hmm. Not bad.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Huh. [reading] "You asked for it."

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What does it mean?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Hmm. I assume this is Dash's idea of a prank, which can only mean she's rigged some kind of booby trap to your Filly Guide uniform up there.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So how do we get it down?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: We don't. If Dash thinks I'm going to fall for whatever she's got in mind, she's got another thing coming. There's more uniforms where that one came from!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Hmm. The sewing machine cake is actually better than the cake cake.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Rainbow Dash!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [laughs] Gotcha! Ha-ha! How's that for effort?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What's all this, Applejack? I thought you were gonna help me get ready for the Filly Guide Cookie Drive.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, yeah, sorry about that. But Rainbow Dash has been on a prankin' tear, and you can never be too careful.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Do you really think Dash is gonna try and prank you in your sleep?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Not if I have anythin' to say about it.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: See ya in the mornin', sugarcube.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Huh?!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Whoa!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ha! Still think I'm lazy? Gotcha! [laughing] Pigpen...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [grunts] Ugh! Rainbow Dash!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [laughs] Gotcha!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Gotcha!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Gotcha!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Gotcha!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pinkie! We need your help.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Okay! For what?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Are you honestly going to stand there and tell us you know nothing about all the pranking Rainbow Dash has been doing?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, no! She's been pranking up a storm!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Did she get you, too?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [laughs] Oh, yeah! She and Gummy both!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Boo!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: They got me good.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Well, she needs to stop.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Stop? But pranks are so much fun!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Not for everypony. And it doesn't seem like Dash is taking the time to find out who enjoys them and who doesn't.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, since you and Dash share such an, uh, affinity for pranking, we thought you might be able to get her to, um, uh... quit it!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Hey, Rainbow Dash! I have something very important to tell you!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pinkie, hey! I actually have something totally important to tell you!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You do? Ooh! You go first!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Okay, you know how I've been pranking everypony?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah! [giggles] It's been pretty funny! I-I-I mean, actually, that's what I have to talk to you about.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Here. Have a cookie.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So, I got to thinking <U+0096> why waste my time pranking everypony one at a time when I could prank everypony at once?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Mmm, wow! Everypony at once?! That sounds amazing!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Gah, wait! I mean, it's not.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You don't even know what it is yet! Pinkie, this is gonna be the best prank ever! I special ordered these joke cookies so the colors would match my mane.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: And I'm gonna switch them with the Filly Guide cookies. When Scootaloo and her friends sell them, everypony in town's gonna get a rainbow mouth courtesy of Rainbow Dash! Ha-ha! It's gonna be so awesome!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, I don't know. I mean, it doesn't really seem all that funny.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [gasps] What?!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Maybe this is a good time to stop pranking for a while. The other ponies in town really<U+0097>

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Stop?! No way! This prank is happening, Pinkie! And it's gonna be hilarious!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pinkie, what's the deal? I told you I needed your help switching out all the Filly Guide cookies for the joke cookies. But when you didn't show, I had to do it all by myself! Uh, Pinkie?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [chuckles] Wow. Your face is still pretty rainbowed.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah, I haven't really [coughs] been feeling well. And these joke cookies are the only thing that makes me feel better. You don't have any more, do you?!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, no. I just told you, I used them all for the prank.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pretty soon, the CMCs will start selling them to everypony in town. Ponies will open their boxes and start eating, then all of their teeth will turn rainbow-colored, and they'll know it was me! It's gonna be so awesome! C'mon, you don't wanna miss it!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Actually... [coughs] I don't think I can even... stand... up... [raspy] Unless you've got more cookies!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Aah! On second thought, maybe you better stay here and rest.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] Yeah. You're right. Sorry to miss out. I'm sure it's gonna be hilarious.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: All right, who's ready to sell some cookies?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Me!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Look here, Rainbow Dash. I know you promised Scootaloo you'd help out, but I don't want none of your pranks ruinin' these fillies' night.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Look, I'll be with you the whole night so you can totally keep an eye on me.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Come on, Applejack! Let's get started!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah! We've got a lot of ground to cover!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: We wanna hit every house in Ponyville!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I think you three should be real proud. Y'all did a mighty impressive job for your first go-'round.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You took the words right out of my mouth, Applejack. Isn't that right, Rainbow Dash?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [hushed] Any minute now.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh... "any minute now" what?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Huh? Oh, uh, nothing! Have you guys noticed how quiet it's gotten? I mean, it's still early, right?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Of course it's quiet. Ponies can't talk while they're eating those fabulous cookies, heh.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You think?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Of course. They're probably all in a cookie coma right now.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Huh... Maybe you're right. I'll go check.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What is going on...? Okay. Definite cookie-eating happening. But... where is everypony? They must have seen their rainbow mouths by now... They should all be running out into the streets! Unless everypony went to bed early...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pinkie?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: The whole town got the cookies, and now everypony is shut up in their houses! You don't think there's something wrong with the joke cookies, do you?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Mrs. Cake! Phew! Have you seen Pinkie? I was thinking I might have something to do with her not feeling great.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh... Mrs... Cake...?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Mrs. [droning] Cookies...! Cookies!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [whimper] Uh, I can see you're busy! I'll come back!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uhh!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Cookies...!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Mrs. [droning] More... cookies...!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Mrs. [droning] Cookies...!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] More cookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [pant] Twilight! [pant] You gotta come with me to Sugarcube Corner! Something's going on with the Cakes! Well, not something exactly. I mean, it may have something to do with these joke cookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Cooooooookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, no!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Coooooookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [whimpers] Fluttershy<U+0097>

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Cooooooookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [groans] [droning] Cooooooookiiiiiiieeeeeeees...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Cookies...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: You sure you don't mind us all comin' over?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, of course not. I think the girls have earned a little celebration for all of their hard work. And I have plenty of sewing machine cake left over. Unless anypony wants a cookie...?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Don't touch those!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh! There is certainly no call for that! There's plenty for everypony.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Come on! We gotta get outta here!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What in tarnation are you goin' on about?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: There's no time! You have to follow me!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Oh, Rainbow Dash, if you want all of those cookies, you will have to buy them, just like everypony else.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I don't want the cookies<U+0097>!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: But they do!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wh-wh-what... What's happening?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I'll explain later. Come on!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: We need to find somewhere to hide!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Cookie! Cookie!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: This way!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [spits, pants] Did we lose them?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [pants] Why are we running from the ponies of Ponyville?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What happened to all of our friends?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [sighs] I think it's something in the cookies.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Ugh! That's ridiculous! Filly Guide cookies haven't changed for years! It's not like there's a new ingredient that's turnin' the whole town into cookie-cravin' zombies.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh, unless there... is...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What are you saying?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What did you do?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Cover the windows!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [pants] Okay! So I may have switched all the Filly Guide cookies for joke cookies that were supposed to make ponies' mouths rainbow but somehow turned everypony into mindless cookie-eating zombies instead! I figure we just hide out here until the effects wear off, and as long as nopony else eats the cookies, we'll be fine.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: That's lovely, darling, except for one thing... [droning] We've already eaten theeeeeeeeeemmmmm...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Looks like your prank up and backfiiiirrrrreeeeed...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] Cooooooookiiiieeeees...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: No, no! Stay away! They're making you sick! You don't want these!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [droning] But we dooooooo... We want cookiiiiiiiieeeeeeees...!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Nngh! Please! Stop! I never meant for this to happen! It was just a harmless prank! It was supposed to be funny! But this isn't funny at all!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [normal] Exactly!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: What? Wait... What's happening?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Just delighting in pranking the prankster.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [chuckles] Yeah. How does it feel to get some of your own medicine?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: So... you're... not sick? None of you are?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Of course not, silly!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: This... was all... a prank?!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yep! And you can thank Pinkie Pie. After you told her about your plan to prank the whole town, she got everypony together and came up with a way to turn the tables on you.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Aw, shucks, it was nothing! Just a little something I threw together.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Uh...

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Wow! You should see your face!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [laughs] Talk about funny!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: [scoffs] Well, I don't think it's very funny! And I'm the one that got pranked! I was really scared! I thought I made everypony sick! You can't just go around<U+0097>

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: <U+0097>pranking whoever you feel like?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Without thinking about how it might make them feel?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Or if they'd even enjoy it?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Or think it's funny?

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Yeah! [beat] Ohhh. I see what you did there.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Pranks can be a lot of fun when everypony has a good time. I thought you just needed to see what it's like when they don't.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: I guess I did. I'm sorry, everypony. I haven't really been thinking about how other ponies feel.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Well, I hope you learned your lesson.

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Totally! You ponies pulled off an amazing prank! I'll have to work extra hard to top it!

title: 28 Pranks Later
writer: F.M. De Marco; story by Meghan McCarthy
dialog: Gotcha.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I hope Shining Armor and Princess Cadance don't think it's too soon for me to come back to the Crystal Empire for a visit. But I just know Flurry Heart's grown so much already. I wonder if I'll even recognize her.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: She's the only baby they have, Twilight. I think it'll be pretty easy to figure out who she is.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Sorry. I know you want to visit your niece as much as possible, and I'm excited to see Sunburst again. I just don't wanna fall behind on my friendship lessons back home.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Starlight, your work in Ponyville isn't going anywhere. Besides, I think we all know you can learn about friendship anywhere. Right, Spike?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [deep voice] "Spike?" Who's "Spike"?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Pfft. Uh, you're Spike, Spike. And why are you dressed like that?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [groans] [normal voice] Guys, you're blowing my cover! How'd you even know it was me?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Because you're you... in a coat, hat and glasses. Also, we're the only ones here.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Right.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike, why do you need a disguise?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Last time we came to the Crystal Empire, there was a lot goin' on with the new baby and the Crystalling, but I still got mobbed in the street.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I wouldn't say mobbed.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: And this is just a family visit. I wouldn't want the presence of Spike the Brave and Glorious to turn it into some kind of circus.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: We get it. The Crystal Ponies adore you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: He did save the Empire. Twice. But still, I don't think your presence will turn our visit into a circus.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Not if I find the right disguise, it won't.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Uh, disguise or not, Spike, I don't think you need to worry about being mobbed. Nopony's here.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It's like a ghost town.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I've got a bad feeling about this.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Yeah, this is weird.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I guess I don't need the disguise after all.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Save you from what?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Yeah, what's going on?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Why was everypony hiding?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Okay. Something strange is definitely going on.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [groans] Ya think?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Um, you don't recognize the Princess of Friendship?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It's okay, guys. They're with me. And any friend of Spike the Brave and Glorious is a friend of the Crystal Empire, am I right?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: We'll take care of things from here.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, Cadance, thank goodness! What's going on?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: We can explain, Twily... if it really is you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Sunshine, sunshine...

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It's okay, everypony. It's her.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Of course it's her! What's all this about?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: A changeling's been spotted nearby.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: A changeling?!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: That's not good.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: No, it's not. After Queen Chrysalis took my place at our wedding and invaded Canterlot with her army of minions, we're not taking any chances.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Changelings feed off of love. And ever since Flurry Heart's Crystalling, the Empire is filled with more love than anywhere in Equestria. It's possible they've come for the baby.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: That's why we posted the extra guards, and why we're<U+0097>

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Checking everypony's identity.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I'm sorry for all of this. Flurry Heart's really been looking forward to seeing you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, she's gotten so big! Starlight and I will do whatever we can to help protect her.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: To be honest, having you here is already a big relief.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Hmm. The royal guards were wondering if Spike the Brave and Glorious would like to join in the search for the changeling.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Really?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Uh, I don't know if that's such a good idea, Spike. It sounds dangerous.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Come on, Twilight, this is Spike the Brave and Glorious you're talking to. Have you ever known me to run from danger?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Um...

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: He'll be safe with our guards.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Or will your guards be safe with me?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, uh, well, they are changelings, so they can... change.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: And they could be anywhere.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: So we should cover as much ground as possible. You, search that way!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: And you, search that way!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Help! Help! Help! Help! Help! Help! Help! Oh! Uhh!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Phew! [kisses] Okay. Maybe it's time Spike the Brave and Glorious went back to, uh, protect those guards. Gah! [sighs] Just my reflection. Huh? Ha! Ha-ha! Hmm. Just my imagination, I guess.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: No, wait! Come back!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [screaming] This is unexpected.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: The ice is pretty slippery. I wouldn't want you to get hurt because of me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: You... saved me?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It's okay. I know you don't wanna be friends.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Wait! I don't understand. Changelings are supposed to be evil... right?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Evil? Oh, not me. All I've ever wanted is a friend.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [narrating] From the moment I first split my egg in the nursery hive...

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [narrating] I was part of the attack on Canterlot during the royal wedding, but I'd never seen true friendship like that! And I couldn't just steal it and feed on its love. I wanted to share it!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: After that, I knew I couldn't live with my kind anymore. I set off looking for love to share, but...

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: But... what?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I'm starving! And there's so much love in the Crystal Empire right now. It's what drew me here! But it's drivin' me crazy!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: That would be from the royal Crystalling. It's pretty much a giant outpouring of light and love for a new baby.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [hisses] Oh, sorry! I'm just so hungry! If I had a friend, maybe the love we shared could sustain me, but I don't think the Crystal Ponies want to be friends.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: What if I told you there was somepony they respect and admire so much, he could convince them to give it a try?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: If only that were true.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It is! I mean, I am! It's me, Spike! Spike the Brave and Glorious? I'm sure you've heard of me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Nope. But I was raised by an evil queen. I'm Thorax. I can't believe you want to help me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Why? Hasn't anypony ever just been nice to you?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [hisses] Uh! S-Sorry! Kindness like that kind of brings it out. Do you still wanna be my friend?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Of course! And I am one hundred percent sure I can get the whole Crystal Empire to be your friend too.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: But... maybe I should just, uh, talk to them first.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Defeating a changeling would be brave, but do you know what would be glorious?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Not having to fight the changeling at all! Because I made friends with him.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I am serious. He wants to be friends!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I'm not joking! The changeling is nice!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I'm sorry, but I don't think it's funny. The Changeling Queen Chrysalis kidnapped Cadance and cast a spell on me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: There's no such thing as a nice changeling.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: You're right, Shining Armor. Sorry. That was a... bad joke.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: So? So? Uh, what did they say? How many new friends do I have?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Well, it didn't go exactly the way I thought.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I think I might know!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike, if you're done searching for the changeling, Starlight and I could use your help. We're working on a protection spell for Flurry Heart, and nopony takes notes like you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Uh, actually, Twilight, I, uh, wanted to introduce you to my friend, uh... Uh, Crystal, uh... Hoof! Crystal Hoof! [chuckles] My good friend, Crystal Hoof.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Nice to meet you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh. Well, it's, uh, nice to meet you, too. How do you know Spike?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, uh, Spike and I go way back.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: To the Equestria Games! That's when we met. We've been pen pals ever since.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Pen pals? Spike! You could have been using my pen pal quill set! Why didn't you tell me?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Well, I... I pretty much only write to him when you and Starlight are... studying.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I like to brag to all my friends about my letters from Spike the Brave and Glorious.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Well, I'm sure Starlight and I can manage, if you want to spend time with your friend.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Great! Crystal Hoof promised to take me around the city.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, that was amazing!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I told ya.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [gasps] This place is everything I've ever dreamed of! [hushed] But I can't keep pretending to be a Crystal Pony forever, can I?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Relax. You're winning them over. Pretty soon, nopony will care that you're a changeling.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike! Twilight told me you were off with a friend.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: And any friend of Spike the Brave and Glorious is a friend of mine.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Oh, she's so beautiful! There's so much l-love around her...! I... I...!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I... [hisses] I'm so... [hisses] ...sorry...! I can't... Can't [hisses] ...stop!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike! Get away from the changeling!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Wait, no! You don't understand!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: This changeling replaced your friend to get close to the baby! What other explanation could there be?!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: ...I don't know.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I hope your friend is okay.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Yeah... Me, too.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I'm pretty sure he doesn't wanna see me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spread out! The changeling is probably still nearby!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Actually, I'm pretty sure he ran as far away from here as possible.... But I bet I know where!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Thorax! Hello? I just want to apologize! I should have stood up for you... Aw, come on, Thorax! I know you're in here!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [yelps] [panting] Little help?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Why do you think I would help you? I'm an "evil changeling"!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: It's okay, I know it's hard. Everyone in the Crystal Empire loves you. I couldn't ask you to give that up for me.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: You don't have to ask.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: What are you gonna do?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: What I should've done in the first place.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I know it's bad that there's a changeling around, but is all this really necessary?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: If there's one changeling, there may well be a whole army on the way.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: True. But Starlight has a point. This is getting a little out of hand.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: [sighs] I understand, but I don't know what else we can do.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: I do!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike! What are you doing?! Get away from that thing!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: No. He's not a "thing"! His name is Thorax, and he's my friend!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Would you say I'm a hero Glorious and brave If I told you something you wouldn't believe?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Spike, I'm so proud of you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: You are?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Of course! You're a celebrity here in the Crystal Empire, and you just risked all of it for a friend! I can't imagine anything more brave than that. [to others] As the Princess of Friendship, I try to set an example for all of Equestria. But today, it was Spike who taught me that a new friend can come from anywhere. I guess everypony still has things to learn about friendship. Even me! And if Spike says Thorax is his friend, then he's my friend too.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Thank you.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: On behalf of the Crystal Empire, I would like to extend my hoof in friendship, and I'm sure all of my subjects are eager to do the same.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Welcome to the Crystal Empire, Thorax. I'm sorry we didn't take the time to get to know you. Maybe we can change that now.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: That'd be so amazing! I want to know all about friendship, and maybe one day I can take that knowledge back to the Changeling Kingdom! If my kind learned how to create love for one another, maybe they wouldn't have to take it from others!

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Looks like you were right after all.

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Right about what?

title: The Times They Are A Changeling
writer: Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt; story by Michael Vogel, Kevin Burke & Chris "Doc" Wyatt
dialog: Friendship lessons can happen anywhere.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Tea?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Um, Princess Celestia's taking us on an overnight goodwill tour of Yakyakistan. I just found out.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [gasps] So what you're saying is no tea? Ugh. Well. [clears throat] That's fine. I wasn't thirsty anyway.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: If you're looking for something to do, you could spend the evening with Spike and Big Mac.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: You aren't kidding.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: They're very nice. They have a "top secret" thing they do whenever we leave Ponyville. Although everypony knows about it, so it's not a very good secret. I think you'd have fun with them.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Fun? With sidekicks? Oh, you must think that we're in a dimension where everything is opposite. [snap] "Da-dee-la! I'm Opposite Discord, and I want to hang out with Spike and Big Mac! I'm sure I'd have fun!"

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [snap] Let me explain it to you as simply as I can. Me? Amazing! Them? Well, I've already forgotten who we're talking about. You see?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: All I'm saying is it's an opportunity to expand your circle of friends. [coddling] Unless you're afraid they won't like you?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, please. Don't stoop to tedious reverse psychology. You're better than that.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: It never hurts to make new friends.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [scoffs] Consider it considered.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Couldn't I just come with you instead?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Discord...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [gasps] Well, it's not my fault the new train route leads into an active volcano. Guess you'll have to stay.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: I got my bedroll, parka, unattractive but functional hikin' boots... Uh, anything I forgot, Pinkie Pie? You're our resident Yakyakistan expert.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Nope! I brought yeti food!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Did I forget to mention there's a pony-eating yeti on Frost Field Glacier? We're gonna have so much fun!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Heh. If he messes with us, I'll turn that yeti into confetti!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Heh. Somepony's in an awful quick hurry to get us out of here. Don't y'all have too much fun without us.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: I bet you boys have big plans. Right, Spike?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about. Although if I did, I certainly wouldn't be allowed to discuss it with you girls.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Buh-bye!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Bye, y'all!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [whispering] Uh, I dunno what to say. I mean, I hope he comes but I kinda don't want him to think of it...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [hushed] Yup.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Fascinating article, yes? [nervous laugh] [hushed, to himself] Don't let them come over, please don't let them come over, please don't let them come over, please, please, please<U+0097> [normal] Oh, salutations, my friend! Wish I could stay and chat, but I don't want to.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Wait! Um, we were wondering... What are you up to tonight?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [to himself] Oh, here we go...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Do you wanna, I don't know, hang out? Is that, like, something you do?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, Twilight's friend and Applejack's monosyllabic brother, if only I weren't super busy this evening.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [to Big McIntosh] I guess guys' night will just be you and me.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: A guys' night? You mean a rowdy evening of reckless revelry? Zoot suits, fedoras, swing dancing?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Eh, something like that. [nervous] You should totally come. Three of us would be way better than two...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: That does sound fun, actually...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Too bad you're busy.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Well, I suppose I could squeeze you in if I move a few very important ponies around.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [gravelly accent] June, honey, be a dear. Reschedule Luna and Cay-Cay. [normal, aside] That's what I call Princess Celestia, what a hoot! [gravelly accent] In fact, clear the whole evening. Tonight is guys' night. These fellas invited me to spice things up and bring a little class to the whole affair.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [normal voice] Tonight will be the best night of your lives, and not just because you get to bask in my greatness.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: I do like basking in things. See you tonight. [hushed] Twilight's castle. The fun starts promptly at sundown.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Technically, the fun starts when I arrive, but I'll make sure it's around sunset. Adieu, fellas.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: And... we have sundown. Repeat, we have sundown. I declare tonight's guys' night ceremonies officially open!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Eeyup!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: It's guys' night.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Yup.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, yeah.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Yup.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Havin' fun now.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Yup.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, yeah!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, yeah!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: What the hay?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: So, shall we hop to it? I made a list of the rowdiest establishments in Ponyville. It's rather short.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Actually, we're staying here. I hope you like awesome games!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Games? I love games. I'm great at games.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Famous pony charades? Oh, this is an easy one. Who am I? Huh? Huh?

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, come on!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Uh... I'm talkin' about a real game.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, you mean like trapping best friend ponies in hedge mazes and turning them against each other. Those were the days.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Not exactly. Wait here.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Whatever it is, it can only get better by adding me to the mix.

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: [off-screen] Okay!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: In a world where evil reigns supreme, a small band of warriors stands tall against the darkness. This is... Ogres & Oubliettes!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Oh, this looks like...

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: The best game ever? You're right!

title: Dungeons & Discords
dialog: Yes...
