dialog: After Twilight remembered the journal, I had so much fun reading all the stuff you've all learned, I just had to have my own copy.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: And that brings me to the second part of the surprise. My idea. How would you girls feel about making our journal available for everypony? If we can get these lessons into other ponies' hooves, maybe they'll benefit from them.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Well, I think that's a great idea.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I'm in! Yay!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: W-We always said we wanted to.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Sounds fabulous.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: [laughing] I'm awesome.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, yeah. Uh, good idea.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Hey, girls. Couldn't help but overhear. You might want to take a breather, maybe read Rainbow Dash's chapter on Rainbow Falls? It might help.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Thanks, Twilight! The friendship journal's makin' us super popular!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: We were thinkin' of puttin' together a cutie mark summer camp. Now, everypony's definitely gonna sign up for it! This is gonna be awesome! [laughs] Cutie Mark Crusaders, whoo.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: A cutie mark camp is a great idea.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Yeah, but the purpose of the journal isn't supposed to be marketing.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I just hope those foals actually learn something from our lessons.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: They will! I'm sure ponies all across Equestria will<U+0097> Whoa!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Uh, hello! Can I... help you?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Wow! How wonderful! What was your favorite friendship<U+0097>

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, uh, I guess so. So, what did you think of the lessons?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Don't worry, Twilight. I'm sure lots of other ponies are being inspired to be better friends.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: But that's not what she was saying! Rarity!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, poor Rarity. She overheard all the mean things those ponies were saying. She must be devastated. I'm going after her.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Go ahead. I'm gonna have a chat with these two.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Rarity, wait!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Twilight! Isn't it amazing? Our journals are everywhere!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Pinkie, I've got to<U+0097>

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Ponies keep stopping by to tell me my entries are hilarious!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I even had somepony come all the way from Las Pegasus to say how much he liked my lessons!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I am so glad to hear some ponies are being inspired by the journal.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Giggly feedback is the best kind!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Well, at least you're getting a positive reaction. I just saw Rarity, and I'm afraid this whole journal thing really upset her.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Aww, that's too bad.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Wait. That wasn't even funny.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: O-kay. Well, I guess I'll catch you later.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Yup. Bye, Twilight!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: You've known me for years!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Maybe it's time to call it a day.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What do you mean you skipped the lessons? We've all had valuable experiences.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Hey, here's a great idea! Why don't you guys talk to Twilight for a while? So I can get back to things like working and napping and, well, pretty much anything else.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: [laughs nervously] Again? Haven't we already covered that one? A couple dozen times?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Uh... It's just that I, uh, really need to get those storm clouds back in their... pens.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, what's going on now?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Please, just leave me alone!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Fluttershy, what's wrong?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What is it, everypony?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What? Really?! Are you attacking my friend because you want to be in a book?!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It's okay. I got this, girls. [inhales] Listen up! I am more assertive! And yes, it took me a while to get there. But can you honestly say that you could learn something one time and completely change who you are? [beat] I didn't think so.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It feels like everypony in Equestria is missing the "friendship" part of the friendship journals.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What are you doing?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Why, I'm creating a gown, darling!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: For what?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Stress-sewing?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: When I overheard those two at the cafe, I suddenly understood why I've been getting cancellations for days!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What? Why are ponies cancelling their orders?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I'm sure if I go out there and talk to those ponies, they'll see that they're being unreasonable.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: [panting] I need a hundred blankets, and I need 'em now! Sorry, Twilight.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Right away, pony-who-still-likes-me!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I don't need nothin' fancy.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: What's the matter, Applejack?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I'm popular, Twilight! I'm popular, and I don't like it one bit!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: You go ahead. I'll stay here.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Applejack, who are all these ponies?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: They call themselves the Sweet Apple Admirers. They say they read my journal entries, and they felt like a part of the family. And now they actually wanna become part of the family!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Your journal entries?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Yeah, you know, all the stuff about how friends are like family and whatnot?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Can't you get rid of them?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: And kick out my own family?! Granny Smith, hang on! Let me help!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: [sighs] I wish we'd never released that journal.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: There you are! Okay, I just left Rarity. I think she's doing better, and<U+0097> Oh, boy. Window-staring, huh? Was it that bad at Sweet Apple Acres?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It's bad everywhere. I thought I was doing something good. I thought I was helping. How could our friendship journal have led to so much... anti-friendship?!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, Twilight, it's not your fault.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Of course it's my fault! If I hadn't had the big idea to make copies, none of this would be happening! I'm afraid I made life awful for my friends!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I really think you're being too hard on yourself.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Am I?!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I didn't know where else to go! I've got so much cookin' and cleanin' and family-in' to do... I ain't got time for anythin' else!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: At least ponies aren't laughing every time you talk! Not even I want to be funny all the time! I'm telling you, my days of hilariosity-ness-ness are over!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: You think you've got problems? I know I'm awesome, but I can't even go to the bathroom without somepony trying to tell me how cool I am! [beat] Uh, Rarity? What are you wearing?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: My emotions, darling! Stress couture!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I don't know what I'm gonna do if I have to defend myself one more time!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Hmm? Oh, uh, sorry, darling. Force of habit.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Okay, so maybe they are having a hard time with it. That doesn't mean you did anything wrong.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Yes, I did! Releasing the journal was my idea, and it backfired in ways I could never have imagined!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It's not your fault. It's everypony else's! They're just focusing on the wrong things, and<U+0097> [gasps] Wait here! I've got an idea!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I can't wait any longer. I've got to fix this.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Everypony, please stop!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I moved here to learn about friendship. That's why the journal even exists. It took some time for me to get the hang of it, but it was each of these ponies standing next to me who taught me the lessons in those journals. Applejack, Pinkie Pie, Rainbow Dash, Rarity, and Fluttershy, too. Then it was all of you. I've learned so much from<U+0097>

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: "Believable"?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: My character?! We are real ponies! This journal is a record of things that actually happened to us! We made mistakes, and we learned from them!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Wait a minute, everypony!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Listen to me! [amplified] Listen to me!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: I never claimed to be perfect My mistakes are all written in ink None of us claimed to be perfect And it's sad if that's what you all think

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: They say I'm a big shot That my ego's the size of a whale My confidence comes off as cocky But it gives me the courage to fail

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Sure, I can be a drama queen A bit stuck-up, it's true

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: And I can be too eager to please There's such thing as bein' too honest, too, 'cause

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Ponies think I'm all bubbles and laughter That I don't seem sincere I might joke around a little too much But I'm just so happy you're here

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It took me a while to be confident To really come out of my shell

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: But nopony has to be perfect By now, don't you know us so well? Because, yeah

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: So you see, everypony? None of us ever claimed to be perfect. Without our flaws, there wouldn't be any friendship lessons to learn. Without our flaws... there probably wouldn't be any friendships at all.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: So that just happened.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Girls! I found two ponies who have something I think you should hear.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Really?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Oh, I can't tell you how much it means to hear that. Thank you for telling us. We've had a tough couple of days, but knowing we've helped fillies like you...

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: It makes everythin' we've been through worth it.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Absolutely. Fads come and go. Friendship is forever.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: There are worse things than not being able to do anything without being told I'm awesome.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: And we can't change the way other ponies think about us. But we can change how we let it affect us.

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Or how we don't let it affect us!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: [giggles] Go ahead! Laugh!

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Reckon we still have to deal with them, don't we?

title: Fame and Misfortune
dialog: Stay in the friendship moment, Applejack. They can wait a little longer.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Is the banner even? Are the flowers in place? By which I mean "completely out of view". I'm pretty sure dragons don't like flowers. And what about the Ceremonial Dragon Fire Flame of Friendship? Is it still flaming?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Spike, everything looks great! You're getting yourself worked up for no reason.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I have lots of reasons. In fact, I wrote them down.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [sighs] You've been hanging around Twilight for too long.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Reason number one <U+0096> I invited Dragon Lord Ember to Ponyville today. Reason two <U+0096> the Dragon Lord is a dragon. Reason three <U+0096> she's coming here to learn more about friendship.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: According to Ember's letters, the dragons are trying to be friends, but competing is in their nature, and it's leading to more and more fights.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Which brings me to to reason number four. The Dragon Lord wants my advice, and as the new official Equestrian friendship ambassador to the dragons, I can't let her down.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know you feel a lot of pressure, but you've got this, Spike!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I... I just want things to be perfect.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [gasps] Thorax! You're in Ponyville!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Of course I am, silly! You invited me. And I'm not one to back out of an invitation. Hey, Twilight! Hey, Starlight!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oooh! I can't believe you did all this for me! Great banner! Love the stage! What's this flame thingy? Oh, it's pretty!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [whispering, to Spike] You invited Thorax over to Ponyville on the same day as Ember?!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Apparently.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: That doesn't seem like a good idea. How are you gonna entertain them both?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, maybe they'll like each other.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Probably not. Ember is tough and self-assured and intimidating. And Thorax is...

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Spike, I'm so glad you invited me! You are one of my closest, nicest, most caring, most understanding friends ever! Ooh! Is that ice in the shape of a dragon?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, I see your point. They might not get each other.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I'm sure that won't happen. Now pull it together.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: So, heh, Thorax, heh, everything good with you?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, honestly, no. Not really. I have indigestion. Not sure if it's the new diet or stress. Or maybe it's both.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, it really could be both. And it might be affecting my sleeping, too. I'm a real tosser and turner.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Sounds like you really need to unwind. Uh, how about a, uh... a trip to the castle? Heh. You can't miss that view.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yes, the castle! I'll give you a personal tour!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, aren't you coming?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, I'm just gonna... grab some ice cream for us and catch up. Heh-heh.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Dragon Lord Ember, as the official Equestrian friendship ambassador for the Dragon Lands and for Ponyville, I, Spike of Ponyville, welcome you to... uh, Ponyville. [quietly, to himself] I gotta work on my official speech.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Okay, thanks. [chuckles] Right. The hug thing.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: That's probably why.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Hey, Twilight!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Actually, I'm Starlight. Starlight Glimmer. Nice to meet you.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, sorry. I'm really gonna have to get used to these pony names. Lots of "-lights" and shiny things. So, where is Twilight?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: She's in her castle. D'oh!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: We should go visit her then. Part of friendship is saying "hi" to your friends, right?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You're making weird noises. Do you have a stomachache?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Dah. I think I feel one coming on.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, you know what us dragons say. "Push past the pain!" Now, let's go.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Or we could stay here.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Or I could go without you.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [laughs] Ah, I like her.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Ohhh.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Good. They're not here.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: What was that?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, I... I said, "It's all clean in here!" Uh, you must be hungry from your travels. Please, I'd love to present you with an official friendship welcome banquet.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Actually, that's not food.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [aside] Dragons love gems!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Fine, but you're telling Twilight what happened to her wall.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Just keep her here. [to Ember] Okay, yeah! [laughs] Enjoy all the, uh... crystal... things!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Where are you going? I thought this was an official friendship banquet.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Just gotta use the little dragons' room!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: So this is my comfy chair for fictional reads. [grunts] This is my studying chair because the hard back keeps me awake.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, Spike! I'm so glad you're here! [quietly] This castle visit is getting weird. Twilight really likes chairs. Oh, what happened to the ice cream?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: What? Oh, right! Uh, they ran out. Heh. Hey, I'm really sorry, but I gotta borrow Twilight quickly.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Aah!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Be right back!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Ember's here!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know. I saw you coming and had to distract Thorax by showing him chairs. Why did you bring Ember to the castle of all places?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I don't know! Ember was asking for you, Thorax wants to talk with me. We need to switch places! They might be getting suspicious.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: All we have to do is make both Thorax and Ember feel special and keep them apart for a few more hours. We can do this.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I think it's the map. It's calling... you. Apparently, you also have to solve a friendship problem!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: The map is calling me?!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, amazing! The map is really reaching out!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Not a good time? I get it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Spike, are you here? Ember's eaten all of Twilight's decorations, and<U+0097>oh! Hey, Twilight! [chuckles, gasps] Glowing map... [gulps] Glowing spikes... That's not good.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: At least your friendship problem is in Ponyville? Heh.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Okay, okay. To pull this off, I'm gonna need both of you to help. You two need to keep Ember and Thorax separate while I get ice cream.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You mean "find the friendship problem".

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeeeees! Go easy on me. I'm under a lot of pressure.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Friendship problem? Anypony gotta friendship problem here? Any problems to solve? Friendship problems? Friendship problems! Anypony got a friendship problem here? No? Okay.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Hmph.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yes! Fighting! Uh, I mean, what seems to be the problem?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Ember, there you are!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Okay, right. More pony hugs.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: How's your trip to Ponyville so far?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, I'm certainly learning a lot about friendship. I had no idea it was polite to decorate your walls in your friends' favorite foods!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [laughs nervously] Oh, my.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Nooooo. They're just making sure everything is perfect for your welcome party later. In the meantime, how about I show you around town?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Sounds good. I can't exactly learn about friendship if I don't make new friends.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, hey, Thorax. Um, Twilight and Spike had some boring official paperwork to deal with, so looks like you and I get to hang out. What would you like to do?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: But I wanted to talk with Spike. He said he'd be right back.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, you will. But first, how about we grab a bite to eat?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Huh. Well, you know, now that you've said it, I am a little hungry. Is there a dining room in the castle?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No! I mean, yeah, but that's castle food. If you want the good stuff, we gotta go to town. Phew!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: ...and that's why you should never let cupcake flavors get in the way of your friendship.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, come on! Glow!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Spike! There you are! Uh, done with your boring paperwork, I see.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [laughs nervously] Uh-huh. Uh-huh.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yep. [laughs] I am done with whatever Starlight says I was doing.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Thorax wanted to get out of the castle. I thought coming to town was a really, really great idea.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, maybe now we can talk.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, sssssure.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I'll leave you guys to it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: First of all, I want to say thank you for having me over. I'm in a bit of a leadership pickle, and I could use some advice.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, I definitely want to help you out as quickly as possible.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Usually when I do that, the dragons are eager to meet me.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: That's not how ponies make friends.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Ah, I get it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: This is a weird friendship thing you ponies do, right?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, you guys are in town, too?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: What are you talking about? You've been with me this whole time.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No. I'm Starlight.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Riiiight. I'm sorry, but you can't blame me. You both look and act so much alike.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: ...and they said to me they just keep saying the same thing. You know, I think my leadership problem started in childhood. I must've been three when... [crossfades] ...three's a different story, a-and you've definitely gotta hear it. But the story about my brother was when I was two... or was I one?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Thorax, uh, excuse me for a second.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Hey, that was really great advice. So what do you think I should do?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [gasps] Uh, actually, I, uh... need a minute... alone... to, uh, really come up with great advice! [pants] I'll be right back.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [sighs] Great. No problem. Leave me again. It's fine.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I'm just saying you're both purple ponies with purple hair. You both have cutie marks with sparkly things.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [chuckles] Mine's more of a glimmer. Heh.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: How is that different? Oh, good. Spike. Can you please tell these two I'm right? They look very similar.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh... Well, y'know, one thing friends do is let something go when it's upsetting somepony else.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: But I'm right! Besides, who are you to be telling me about friendship? I've barely seen you all day!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, well, I've seen you.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Are you calling me a liar?!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Hey! No one yells at my friend!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Spike, get away from the bear!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Actually, the bear is a changeling. And he's quite gentle.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [screams] My worst fears are happening!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Noooo!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [pants] Back away, Spike! I'm not gonna let this dragon harm a scale on your back!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You back away! I'm not gonna let you harm him! Wait. Did you say you're not gonna let me harm Spike?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: But that's what I'm doing!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, what?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, what?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [panicked] Equestria as we know it is over! The war that pits changeling against dragon is about to begin! And it's all my fault! My title of Equestria's friendship ambassador is a lie<U+0097>! Oh. Hey. You guys aren't fighting?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Why would we be fighting?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Because I accidentally invited you both over to Ponyville on the same day?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: So I... was trying to keep you apart because I didn't think you'd get along.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh. I get it. You thought he wouldn't like me just because I'm a dragon and I'm bad at friendship?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No, no, of course not! But<U+0097> Wait. Isn't that why you're here?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I can say I'm bad at friendship. You can't say it about me! You know what? I don't wanna talk about it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Wait, please! [sighs] [to Thorax] I'm sorry.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No, no, it's cool. You thought I would be too soft, and someone like Ember would never respect me. Just like my own changelings!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No, that's not it! Thorax, wait! Oh, no... What have I done?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Why are you still here?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [sighs] Because I'm having trouble leading my pack, so I don't really wanna go home.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Wait, you're in charge? [chuckles] Oh, boy. You need to be more assertive.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Well, that's my problem. I don't know how! I tried asking them to please follow my directions. I even offered a prize, and then<U+0097>

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Shhh! Stop talking.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: That's how you do it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Whoa! That just gave me chills.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know you have it in you. You turned into a bear to defend Spike.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Huh, I guess I can be tough when I'm defending my friends, but when I'm just enforcing my rules, I-I feel unsure of myself.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: There's nothing to be unsure of. You're the leader for a reason. Make a decision and let it be known that the decision is final. And if that doesn't work, turn into a bear.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, well, that's good advice.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know it is.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: So what's your deal? Why do you think you're so bad at friendship?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I don't want to talk about it.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Oh, you have to! How else are you gonna solve your problems?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, how does that help?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Crushing another dragon in competition establishes my dominance and makes me feel great.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Right, but, uh, how do you think they feel?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Humiliated! Ashamed! They'd probably wanna run away and bury themselves under a rock and... never come out. They're probably sad. Kinda low. Definitely not happy.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: That's because that kind of competition can divide you. And it doesn't get to the heart of the issue. Talking about your feelings does.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [sneezes] Ugh! I think I'm allergic to feelings.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You know you don't have to be sappy...

title: Triple Threat
dialog: ...or huggy-feely about it! But you should let your friends know how you feel.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Uh, I know where we can start.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Where? Ohhhh. Spike. Hah. I got there.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I think they're gone. They probably never want to see me again.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Or they want to see you now.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Guess what, Spike.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know. I'm so sorry.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Okaaaay... That's a good first attempt. Now maybe try to be more specific?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [cracks limbs, breathes deeply] I'm... [sighs] upset!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You have every right to be.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I know I do! And I know I need to tell you how I feel because my friend Thorax said it would make me feel better. And it does!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah! And I have no problem telling you what you did was wrong because my friend Ember is helping me be more assertive!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Whoa.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Nice.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You guys should be mad at me. I was so worried about how it could go wrong, I didn't even think about how it could go right. [sighs] Can you forgive me?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: I really do feel better. So, yeah. I'm good.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [groans] Again?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: No way! It's finally happening! I solved the friendship problem!

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Actually, you created the friendship problem by not trusting your friends.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, but then I solved it by learning my lesson. I should have told my two friends about each other immediately instead of assuming they wouldn't get along.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Good job, Spike.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Is this another part of pony friendship? Telling each other what you learned all the time?

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yeah, pretty much.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: Yup.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: [through loudspeaker] So, as a show of unity, I present the Dragon Fire Flame of Friendship to both Dragon Lord Ember and Thorax, leader of the changeling pack! May the flame of friendship burn for eternity.

title: Triple Threat
dialog: You should have more things made of rocks.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [straining] [muffled] Hey, kid, get over here!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Tents are lookin' good. And we made good time today. At this rate, we'll be at Winsome Falls by tomorrow!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We should do the annual Big-Sister-Little-Sister camping trip every weekend!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Then it wouldn't be annual. And if we did it every weekend, it probably wouldn't be as special.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: But the more we do it, the better we get at camping. Remember the first time we came here and Rarity had that ginormous tent?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I heard that! [giggles] I've gotten much better at "roughing it", haven't I?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Yup. This time, you only packed three suitcases.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I know what you're thinking. But I promise, I only brought the essentials.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Like those light thingies?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Of course. What is life if you can't make it beautiful?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Mmmm! These berries look good enough to eat!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Don't! According to my book, they're extremely poisonous!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: What?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I heard something, I stepped on something, and I saw that creepy cave... I guess I still get a little bit scared out here, even after the last camping trip.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Don't worry, kid. You've got a big sister this time.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: This looks amazing!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: This is gonna be the best Big-Sister-Slash-Little-Sister camping trip ever!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Ow! What are these things?! Aaagh!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Fly-ders! Everypony, run for cover! Don't get stuck in their<U+0097>

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: ...web.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [shrieks] Now what?!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Follow me, everypony!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Aaah! Not the scary cave!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Where did those terrible bugs come from? And why did they destroy our camp?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Ugh.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Flyders are from the Luna Bay area. Never seen 'em this far east, though. Probably attracted to the food. Best wait here until they're gone.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Oh, apple rot! What are we supposed to do now?! We had games to play and marshmallows to roast at camp! In here, we got nothin'!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Mm, that's not entirely true. We have each other.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: That's right! And if you girls want to, maybe we could tell some stories to pass the time.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: You want stories? I've got a ton of stories! Spoiler alert <U+0096> they're all about me and how awesome I am!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I was thinkin' more like campfire stories?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: But we don't even have a campfire.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I got this!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Wow. That was brave.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We aren't gonna tell scary stories like our last camping trip, are we? It's bad enough just being in here!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Don't worry, Scootaloo. I was gonna tell you mine and Apple Bloom's favorite legend.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Ooh! You mean Rockhoof? I love that one! He was so strong, and when he<U+0097>

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Apple Bloom, shhh! We haven't heard it yet!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Oh, okay. But it's so good! Heh.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Well, it's true. Rockhoof was known far and wide for his incredible strength. But he didn't start out that way. You see, Rockhoof was a tiny little fella, the son of a farmer.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Just like us!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: They lived in a village that sat at the foot of a gigantic volcano.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] And the village was protected by an elite group of guard ponies called the Mighty Helm.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Young Rockhoof wanted nothing more than to be part of the Mighty Helm.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] But he was told that he was too scrawny and weak to protect the village.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] But Rockhoof wouldn't take no for an answer.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Then, one fateful day...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...the volcano erupted!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Eeeeeeeeeeee<U+0097>

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [continued] <U+0097>eeeeeeeeee! This is my favorite part!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: The molten lava poured down the side of the volcano...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...and try as they might, the Mighty Helm couldn't figure out a way to save the village! They had to evacuate. But the village ponies didn't wanna leave their homes. They spent their entire lives there. They had nowhere else to go! So Rockhoof decided to do something crazy.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] He thought if he could divert the flow of the lava, he might be able to save his village. He started diggin' a trench!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Wait a minute. All by himself?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: It'd be impossible for one pony to dig a trench fast enough to stop the lava. I mean, even I couldn't do that.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Good thing Rockhoof didn't believe in the word "impossible".

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] He continued to work, knowin' the odds were against him, but determined to push through it. Then, somethin' magical happened.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Rockhoof got visibly stronger! But the lava was getting' closer.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Through his extraordinary determination and sheer force o' will, Rockhoof more than earned his place in the Mighty Helm.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Good story, Applejack! Even if it wasn't about me.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I love that story, no matter how many times I hear it.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Why don't we see if it's safe to head back to camp?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Uh, girls? There is no camp to go back to.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: All our hard work is ruined!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: There, there, Sweetie Belle. Not to worry.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: How? Our camp was so pretty, and this cave is so... not.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Oh, no-no-no-no, no, not true. There's beauty in everything. Even these blah rocks aren't really blah. If you look closely, you can see flecks of gold in them. And the way the firelight dances on the cave wall, shadow and light? Ooh, it's so gorgeous! Sweetie Belle, have I ever told you about my favorite legend?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: No. I didn't know you had one.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Her name... was Mistmane.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Mistmane? Isn't she the old wrinkly sorceress with the flower?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Yeeees, but did you know she used to be the most beautiful unicorn in all the land?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [flatly] No.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: So what happened to her?!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Well, Mistmane was a very promising young sorceress.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] She was as talented as she was beautiful and kind. Everypony loved her and missed her when she was sent to the finest magic school.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] While she was gone, she was delighted to find out that her best friend, Sable Spirit, was crowned empress. She couldn't wait to return home once she finished her studies.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] But once she arrived, she was devastated by what she saw.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] But there was no denying what was in front of her.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Sable Spirit took everything that was beautiful away from anypony else! And Mistmane was sure there had to be some explanation.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I'd assume there was, too. If somepony told me either one of you two'd gone evil...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Yeah, I'd never believe it.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I dunno. I've seen the way you two get when you miss breakfast.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [chuckles nervously] Just kiddin'. But I'd want answers too.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: So did Mistmane. She went to confront her friend.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Everypony thought Sable Spirit was defeated, and that was that. But Mistmane knew there was more she could do to help.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Beauty isn't everything. But Mistmane knew that it does have the power to make ponies smile.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] She made a huge sacrifice to bring that smile back to her friends' and family's faces... including Sable Spirit's.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Sable Spirit was so touched that she vowed to be more like her friend in the ways that mattered. From then on, she ruled with kindness and compassion.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Even though she gave away her physical beauty, she dedicated her life to spreading beauty all over Equestria. Any time you go out of your way to brighten somepony's day by doing something like giving them flowers, you're following in the hoofsteps of Mistmane.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I think she's my favorite legend too.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Ugh! These Fly-ders won't quit! What do they want from us now?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Well, like it or not, we're food, too.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: And I've got the bites to prove it.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [panicking] What are we gonna do?! They're almost here!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: What?! Now those bugs can't get in!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [hyperventilating] And we can't get out!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Let's all just stay calm. Let me re-light this fire...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We just have to wait until the swarm moves on. Then we'll think of a way out.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Scootaloo. You're focusing on the wrong things.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: You have a plan?!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Close. I have a story.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Lemme guess <U+0096> it's about you?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Practically. It's about my favorite legend, Flash Magnus!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Wasn't he the pony who took on the dragons?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Dragons?! Big, scary, mean ones or like Spike?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Oh, these were definitely the big, scary, mean kind!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: But not too scary. You can sit closer to me if you want.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: A long time ago, before the Wonderbolts were even founded...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...Flash Magnus was a lowly cadet in the Royal Legion.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] And the Legion needed to fly over the Dragon Lands to get to their comrades on the other side. But as they got closer to the dragons...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...the dragons attacked!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [shivering] You said this wasn't too scary!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [very muffled] Scootaloo, if you just hang in there<U+0097>

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: What?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I said if you just hang in there, I promise you'll like the ending. So, like I was saying, Flash Magnus and the Royal Legion tried to get past the dragons...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...but the dragons wouldn't let them!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Flash Magnus and a few other cadets were separated from the battalion. He managed to get away, but the dragons captured his friends and took them back to their lair!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: The commander was right. You can't outfight dragons.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: But you can out-think them.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] While Flash Magnus bravely flew for his life, Commander Ironhoof was able to get his soldiers back.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Flash Magnus flew like the wind...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] ...faster than the dragons!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] But he knew he couldn't do this forever. Luckily, he had a plan.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] He led the dragons straight into a storm that the Legion had planted!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] One taste of the lightning, and the dragons retreated.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [narrating] Flash Magnus' plan worked!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Wow! I did like that ending.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Told ya! He always inspired me to be my brave and awesome self.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Mm-hmm!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Yeah, I guess he kinda reminds me of you.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Tch! You guess? Come on, I'm just like him!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Hey, do you hear that?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Uh, I don't hear anythin'.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Exactly! Those gosh-darn Fly-ders are gone! We can get out!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Whoa!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Or not.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We're gonna have to see if we can get out the other way.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: You mean go further into the dark, spooky cave?!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Scootaloo, just remember the story. Gotta be brave like me and Flash Magnus, okay?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: I hear water!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: And if there's flowing water, then...

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: ...it might lead to the way out!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Whoa!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Okay, on three. One, two<U+0097>

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Woo-hoo!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Yeah-ha-ha!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Huh. Well, what do you know? We found ourselves a shortcut to Winsome Falls!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: [sighs] It's never looked so beautiful.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Well, almost.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We sure are sorry that our camping trip wasn't what we hoped it would be.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Are you kidding? This trip is awesome!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: It is?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We got to hear legendary stories and go on an adventure.

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Wait, you three wanna stay?

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: Of course we do!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We could turn those trees into a nice, little shelter!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: We can get you some big logs and branches to help build it!

title: Campfire Tales
dialog: And I bet we could find some more berries! Come on! I can't wait to see what happens next year!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ha! Straight to the changeling hive! I told you I could do it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, not exactly straight, Starlight. We've been popping all around Equestria, and we still have to walk.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [scoffs] It's like twelve steps away. Before Chrysalis' throne was destroyed, the closest magic would've gotten us was waaaaaaay over there. On a scale of one to ten, how happy do you think Thorax is gonna be about our surprise visit?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Definitely ten. I mean, who wouldn't be happy at the chance to marvel at the overwhelming talent that is the Great and Powerful Trrrrrixie?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Trixie, we're coming to offer Thorax encouragement and support. His letters make it seem like the responsibilities of being a changeling leader are a little overwhelming.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yeah. I know. That's basically what I said.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: He's dealing with the wants and needs of his subjects. Redesigning the hive, a dread maulwurf wreaking havoc outside...

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It does sound like a lot, but are you sure that last thing is real?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: The dread maulwurf? Sure it is. Thorax said it's like half-bear, half-mole, half-raging-pile-of-claws! But now that the changelings don't feed on the love of everything around them, plants have started to grow back. But this maulwurf keeps eating them all up.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: "Maulwurf". Uh-huh. You're just trying to scare me, but it won't work. Because not only am I the Great and Powerful, I am also the Unscareable Trixie!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [screams] Please tell me Thorax also mentioned a terrifying-looking changeling who greets visitors but is actually nice!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [meakly] Nope.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Starlight, you got us here. I'll take us home. Teleportation spell, go! Did I save us?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Nope.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: What are you waiting for?! Use some magic to get us outta here!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Calm down, "Unscareable Trixie". We have to find out what's going on. Thorax might need our help.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: We need our help! Teleportation spell, go! Teleportation spell, go! [gasps] Teleportation spell<U+0097>!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh! Why do you keep doing that? You know it doesn't work that way.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I know, but this is my process.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I've captured these trespassers!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Starlight! Trixie! It's okay, Pharynx. You can let them go.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: But they were lurking on our grounds! In the old days, I would've already feasted on their love.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, that's why they're called the "old days", because they're old. We don't do that anymore.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Dah! I liked the old days better.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Uh, what are you two doing here?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: We wanted to surprise you. [sheepishly] Surprise.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, it's great to see you! I'm sorry about the welcome committee.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I thought Ember helped you get more assertive so you could deal with all the renegade changelings who didn't wanna change.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, she did. Really helpful. I was able to convince all of them to change, except one of them... My brother.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Your brother?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yep. Pharynx is my elder broodmate.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, yeah. You guys have the same... um... eye shape?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: What a ridiculous comparison! We are nothing alike!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Stop doing that!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh. Well, how about I show you the rest of the hive where it's less loud and bangy?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: There've been a lot of changes since you were here last. I'm trying to start some new activities since the only thing we did before was hunt and patrol. There's theatre, swing dancing, a once-a-week potluck lunch. Ooh! And who can change shape and organize craft time? Hmm? [transformation noise] This guy!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I am really impressed, Thorax. The hive, all the activities...

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I am so sorry. I promise I'll talk to him.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, maybe not everything here is amazing.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Seriously, Thorax. What is up with your brother?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh. Pharynx used to be head of patrol. But now we're peaceful and there's no need to patrol, so he just stalks around the hive making everyone miserable. The other changelings are sick of it, and if I can't get him to accept love and friendship and change like the rest of us, everything I've done here is at risk.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Uh-uh.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [encouragingly] Hmm?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [sighs] Uh-huh.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: We know a thing or two about what it's like to be outsiders. Maybe we could talk to him for you.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Do you really think you can help?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Thorax, if there's anypony who can help your brother, it's me. And with Starlight helping, it might take slightly longer, but I guarantee you we can do it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, I have to head outside. You sure you're okay handling Pharynx?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Absolutely.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: So, how do you wanna play this? I'm thinking "good pony/bad pony". You yell and blast him with magic while my natural charisma will convince him that<U+0097> uh, Starlight?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Hey, Pharynx. I know when we first met, it didn't go so well.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Right. [clears throat] So... not a big fan of the vines, huh?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: They're a safety hazard. An enemy could hide in them or use them as weapons. I don't even know why they're here.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Because they're pretty?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: That's ridiculous.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, totally. We get you. But... [clears throat] maybe don't express how you feel by destroying them?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I don't take advice from ponies. The only thing I take from you is breakfast. At least, I used to.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: You know, you're a lot like us!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Doubt it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It's true. Do you know who Twilight Sparkle is?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: No.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, she's the most well-liked, studious, do-goodiest pony in Equestria.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh! She sounds awful.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, you'd hate her. I used to. She made me unsure about my place in the world, which led me to act out against her.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And I used to be a dictator who ran a village with an iron hoof.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Really? Hmm. Maybe you two do understand me.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yes! We do! But now, Trixie has come to terms with being second-best, and I no longer control ponies against their will. And our lives are so much better for it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Wow. So you're both losers. Stay away from me, or I'll do to you what I did to the vines.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, "Operation: Lead Maulwurf Away" is coming along. How'd it go with Pharynx?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Your brother is, um, challenging.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, that bad, huh?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It wasn't great.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: You wanna talk it out? You can come with me to the feelings forum.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: The feel-like-what-now?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, it's a place for changelings to express their feelings so we all gain a better understanding of each other. It's really helped bring the hive closer together.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Everyone, please! I understand Pharynx can be challenging at times.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It sounds like your lame "feelings forum" is for talking about me behind my back!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Actually, there is. The changelings used to be a fearsome swarm! Now we sit around talking about our feelings so much, you can't even stop a maulwurf from eating all your "pretty plants"! I could've sent that thing packing before, but I guess now we'll just try to lead it away and hope that keeps us safe!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I can't do that.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I... [sighs] I want to say something, but it goes against everything I've been taught as Twilight's pupil.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ooh! Then, by all means, say it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [sighs] I think Pharynx is a lost cause.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Mm. I'm all for second chances. Third, even. But he just seems like a bad bug.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And Thorax has a duty to the whole hive, not just his brother.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: If he keeps sticking up for Pharynx, the hive might decide they don't want Thorax as their leader.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I think he might have to kick Pharynx out. But I don't wanna be the one to tell Thorax that.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Me, neither. But somepony probably should. I nominate you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Thorax, we have something to tell you.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It's about Pharynx, isn't it?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [hesitating] Mmmmmmmaybe?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Look, I know he's an aggressive warrior type, but when I was little, every young changeling wanted to be like that.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [voiceover] ...Every young changeling except me. The others would pick on me for not wanting to fight.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [voiceover] But Pharynx never let them hurt me.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Aw, that was a really sweet story. Until the end.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I know Pharynx loved me in his own way, and I know there's still good in him. That's why I keep sticking up for him. Anyway, what did you wanna talk to me about?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Me? Oh, noooo. But, uh, Starlight has something she<U+0097>

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Actually, Thorax, um, never mind! C'mon, Trixie, we've got a... thing to do.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [whispering] What are you doing? I thought we agreed you'd tell Thorax he had to kick his brother out of the hive!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Maybe we don't have to. Get Pharynx and meet me at the hive entrance. I'll explain everything.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And how am I supposed to know where Pharynx is?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh! Well, that was easy.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Wow.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I know, right? Great idea? Where's Pharynx?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: He's gone.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Gone like gone to the throne room?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Gone like gone! One of the changelings said Pharynx left the hive for good!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [gasp] Then who's gonna stop the dread maulwurf I'm leading here?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [panting] Thorax, there you are! Pharynx is missing!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Wait for it...

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And the dread maulwurf is coming this way!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Told ya.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: That doesn't make any sense. The trail of plants should have led the dread maulwurf away.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [nervous laugh] I might have relaid them to lead it back toward the hive.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Why would you do that?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I thought if Pharynx saw you were in danger, the loving, caring side of him would come out when he protected you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: But instead, he's out there alone somewhere between us and that rampaging monster?! I have to save him!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I'm coming with you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Of course you are! This is all your fault!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [condescending] Oh, don't be too hard on Starlight. Her heart was in the right place.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: You're coming, too!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh. Right. I mean, I was gonna volunteer anyway...

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Who else is coming?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [groans] Fine.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, sure, you could all stay here, not help Pharynx and he won't bother you anymore. It's your choice. But remember when you didn't have a choice! When you were forced to obey Chrysalis! You might have been unstoppable, but you weren't free to choose! And now you are, because of Thorax! Well, it's his brother out there, and now it's your chance to prove you're just as strong embracing love as you were feeding on it! Now is your chance to show what changelings can really be! Not because you have to, but because you choose to!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: That was an amazingly epic speech, Starlight! I just can't believe not a single changeling was moved by it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I can't blame them. If he wasn't my brother, I don't think I'd be here. We're gonna have to face the maulwurf by ourselves.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Maybe it'll be long gone and we'll find Pharynx out here alone!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Or maybe not.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Pharynx!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: What are you doing here?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I'm here to save you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Get outta here! Let me handle this!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: We're not leaving you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [nervous] I may have forgotten to mention in my letters that maulwurfs have really thick hides!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I thought you said you could beat this thing!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yeah, with the rest of the swarm! Not alone!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I told you it was an epic speech.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It's no use! We're out of practice and he's too tough!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And strong! Too bad we can't get it to fight itself!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: That's it! Thorax, remember when we were young and I made you hit yourself?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Now is not the time to make fun of me, Pharynx!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh, right! Of course!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Why are you hitting yourself? Why are you hitting yourself? Why are you hitting yourself?!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yeah, maulwurf, why are you hitting yourself?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Why are you hitting yourself, huh? Huh? Huh?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ooh, that looks like it hurts.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: We did it! It's gone!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: What were you doing out here?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Leaving. I'm done with all of you.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh. It's just, why bother fighting the maulwurf then? You coulda left it alone.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, I couldn't just let it attack you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: But I thought you were done with us, and you didn't care.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I never said that. The hive is the thing I care about most.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, you certainly don't act like it.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Well, I'm sorry if I don't get excited about pretty flowers and feeling circles and<U+0097>

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: It's a feelings forum.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Whatever. It doesn't matter. Even if I do care about the hive, I obviously don't have a place there anymore.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: And who better to help us do that than the only changeling who never stopped protecting us?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: You all want me to stay?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Unless you still want to leave the hive.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Why would I want that? I love the hive!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: He did it! He transformed!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: I always knew you had it in you!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Really? Because I thought you said I was a lost cause and you were going to tell Thorax he should kick me out.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Oh! Starlight! How could you say that?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Ugh! What?! That's<U+0097>! I mean<U+0097>! But you<U+0097>!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Lucky for us, you weren't a lost cause.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Lucky for me, you didn't give up on me.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Soooo... glad everything worked out.

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Yeah! Let's talk about how you not only led the maulwurf to the hive but also drove my brother away from it!

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: Hey. Do you guys want to hear the story about how I used to make Thorax hit himself?

title: To Change a Changeling
dialog: [relieved] Oh, absolutely, yes, right now!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Fan-tizzy-astic! I just love to read about happy happenings, and it's always good to be a pony in the know, you know? And there's so much to know!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Eh, seems like a bunch of boring hooey to me.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Does "New Shrubbery In Castle Garden" sound like boring hooey to you?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Snooze.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: What about... "Parasprite Infestation In Fillydelphia Eradicated"? Ah! That's great news!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Eh. Another day, another parasprite hype story.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [reading] "Noodles Named Official Food Of Whinnyapolis". "Author A. K. Yearling Announces Retirement". "Cloudsdale Election Heating Up For Candidate In Favor Of Cooling It Down".

title: Daring Done?
dialog: What?! Let me see that!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I never knew you were so into politics, Rainbow.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: No, this! It can't be true...

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I'd have never have picked noodles as the official food of Whinnyapolis either, but here we are.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: No, Pinkie! I can't believe that the greatest author and secret pony adventurer of all time, A. K. Yearling... is retiring!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: A. K. Yearling just retired. Like, today. Are you sure she wants visitors?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Pinkie, the A. K. Yearling I know would never quit and retire out of the blue! Something could be really wrong, and we need to make sure she's okay!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Okay! Heeeey... You're not just trying to make sure she writes more Daring Do books, are you?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Of course not! But that wouldn't hurt either. Now, come on!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Uh, maybe she's not home. Maybe she went to the editor-in-chief of the Ponyville Chronicle to correct the misprint they've made.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Nope. She's home.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: How do you know?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Because she's right there looking all sad and alone.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [gasps] I knew it! Something is wrong! [knocking rapidly] A. K!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Now she's sighing with the weight of the world. Now she's hanging her head in utter despair. Now she's shaking her hoof and cursing the heavens like nothing could ever possibly be the same again. Why, oh, why did this happen to her?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: What?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: A. K., it's us! Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie! Your friends!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Oh, no. Did somepony ransack your cottage again and steal some ancient, mysterious relic that's the key to saving all of Equestria?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Oooh! Sparky!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Then is somepony blackmailing you and forcing you to retire? Cause if they are...!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: So you're just quitting and moving away? Why... would... you... do... that?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Oh, really? [reading] "Author A. K. Yearling announced yesterday that the next adventure novel in her popular series, 'Daring Do and the Curse of the Pharaoh's Tomb', will be her last. Yearling looks forward to her retirement." That doesn't explain anything!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: It just says you're giving up writing stories. But most ponies don't know that you actually are Daring Do and that the stories are real. So what you're really saying is that you're giving up being Daring Do, but you're not saying why!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Of course, if you don't feel like talking about it, that's A-okay, A. K.! As your friends, we completely understand. Right, Rainbow Dash?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Oh. Yeah. We just came to make sure you're all right. That's really why we wanted to find out what's going on.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [reading] "Wake Of Destruction: Daring Do Ruins Entire Village Marketplace!"

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [reading] "Dare Or Scare: Local Rogue Daring Do Involved In Frightful Fiasco"?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [reading] "Daring Do Leads Bull Into China Shop During High-Speed Chase<U+0097>"

title: Daring Done?
dialog: That's not true. They're not mad at A. K. Yearling. They're mad at Daring Do.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Then I guess it's a good thing you look so different as A. K. Yearling!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: So all we have to do is go down there and explain to these ponies that none of this stuff is true.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Easy-peasy-cheesy!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Then you are in a tricky pickle. But why is all this happening now?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Come on! For every one pony who's upset, there must be at least a hundred that know you're a hero!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Well, why don't we go visit this village "Som...nam...bu...la" and see for ourselves?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: But if we go there, the ponies can tell you in person just how much they appreciate you.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: And what a heap of rotten apple cores these articles are!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I know so! Let's go!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [squealing] This is so cool! It looks just like that village in your last book where Daring Do recovers the Doomed Diadem from the Wild Bunch Gang who chase after her through the desert!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: What happens? No, wait, don't tell me. I changed my mind! Tell me!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Daring Do thwarts Ahuizotl's evil plot to separate the Sister Crown Relics. And if it wasn't for her, the region would be cursed with eternal night, and the entire town of Somnambula would have sunk into the ground!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Ah, puh! There's no chance that these ponies don't think you're a hero.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Watch this. [to "Cortland"] Hiya there, mister! I was hoping you could tell me about a pony named Daring Do. I hear she's an awesome adventure-pony hero.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Indeed. Daring Do is a menace who destroys everything she touches!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: What?! No! Daring Do is the exact opposite of a menace!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Come on, A. K.! So we picked a bad example. That was just one angry pony.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Two angry ponies!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Come on! We gotta follow her!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I dunno. It really seemed like she doesn't want us cramping her saddle.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: But we have to convince her that ponies do appreciate her! As her friend, I have to make sure she believes that.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Look, Pinkie! It's the Get On Inn! Daring Do stays here all the time in her adventures. Which means there must be ponies here who love Daring Do! Maybe they can help us.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [sniffing] Mmmmm. My nose is telling me to help myself to muffins.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Come on...

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Ooh, she's fancy. I got this. [to Mrs. Trotsworth] A good evening to you, madame. We are but weary travelers who humbly wish to inquire on the status of a certain mare of intrigue taking residence here.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Is it true that Daring Do stays here?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Why not?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: No, no, no. You've got it all wrong.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Daring Do was trying to save everypony from the curse of the Doomed Diadem of Xilati. And she was only in a rush because she had to get the crown back to the Tiara of Teotlale before the curse took effect. [to Pinkie Pie] Chapter seventeen.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Hmmm...

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Daring Do ruined our town and stole our precious glowpaz! We need to make sure that if she turns up again, there will be consequences! Everypony who's with me, meet at the statue tomorrow!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Listen, A. K. After a good night's sleep, we're going to fix all of this. I promise.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Of course it will! All I have to do is go up there and explain to everypony how wrong they all are.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Yeah! And then I'll be like, "What she said!"

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Exactly!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Here it is! The remains of your<U+0096> I mean, our Somnambula statue! Now that Daring Do has destroyed it, tell me, where will we hang our glowpaz?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Daring Do would never steal anything! And okay, she destroyed your statue, but it was because she was trying to save you all from Ahuizotl!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Ahuizotl? He's about yea big? Long neck? Itty-bitty face? Weird claw thingy on his tail?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Ooh! Ooh! I know him! He's a baddie!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Trust me, if Ahuizotl had gotten away with the Doomed Diadem, your entire village would have been swallowed up! And that's a lot worse than losing some crummy old statue!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Who?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Wow. I had no idea how special the statue was to you. Somnambula sounds like a pretty cool pony. But I bet if she were here, she'd tell you how cool Daring Do is too, because they've both fought to protect this town!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. If Somnambula were here today, she would condemn Daring Do for destroying your<U+0096> our symbol of hope!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Hey, buddy! What did Daring Do ever do to you to deserve all this?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Only... everything!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Caballeron?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. Yes... Rainbow Dash. [laughing evilly] When I saw you, her closest friend, I knew that Daring Do would not be far behind. I really do owe you for leading her right to me.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: But I-I didn't mean to<U+0097>

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Help!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: He's got Rainbow Dash! Come on!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [panting] I'm... coming... Rainbow... Dash... [to Daring Do] Ah! I knew you'd come!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: You did? I sure didn't. What if I cause more trouble?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: You won't.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: How do you know?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I just do! You wouldn't let anything happen to Rainbow Dash. You care too much.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: You're right. Which way did they go? To the pyramid!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Somepony help! Somepony! Anypony! Pinkie Pie?! Daring Do?! Is that you?!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Don't worry, Rainbow! We'll save you!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [grunting] He's right! We'll never get to her in time!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: If this really is like Somnambula's story, then we just have to have hope that we can.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I think we need more than hope, Pinkie. There was a bridge in the story, and there's no bridge here. What are we going to do?

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Pinkie!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Aha!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Wheeee! [giggles] I knew we'd do it!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Thanks for reminding me to never give up hope, Pinkie.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: And I'm kinda "hoping" you ponies will untie me before we all take a bath in bubbling green slime!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: We're on it!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Not so fast, Caballeron!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: I should have known you were just trying to sully my name so that you'd be free to steal whatever you wanted.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. And with the destruction you leave in your wake, it didn't take too much to convince ponies you were a villain!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: You're wrong, Caballeron. And I won't let you break my spirit again. Because I'm never going to give up hope that I can protect ponies and ancient treasures from miscreants like you!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Dr. R-Remember! She ruined your statue! You're fools to believe in her! [growls] You'll pay for this, Daring Do!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Okay, okay, that's enough. [to Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie] Thanks for helping me come to my senses. You two are true friends.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Are you kidding? That... was... awesome!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: We're just glad you're back to your old self again.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: [chuckles] Me too. But I'm glad I realized that even if you're fighting for something good, you're still responsible for your actions.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: And if something bad happens that you didn't intend, you shouldn't give up hope or lose faith in yourself.

title: Daring Done?
dialog: Yeah! All you gotta do is make it right. Feel free to use that in your next book!

title: Daring Done?
dialog: You know, I think I will.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Hmph! Looks like I'm not the only one who left Mares Day to the last minute.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: There's just so many! How can I choose?!

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: How?!

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: What I would do...

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: ...is pick flowers that accentuate my mane. It makes for a captivating color story when you present them to whomever they're intended.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Oh, darling, I need a dozen lavender pieces for Photo Finish's shoot on the most beautiful manes in Equestria.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: I know you're swamped, but it's for Vanity Mare! She's going to take pictures of my mane, so color coordination is a must.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Have you a single big one? If the wind came from one direction, it would really intensify the effect.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Hmm. I do enjoy the windswept look, but other ponies might need to see it before they feel it.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Pinkie? I need to put Photo Finish in a good mood, and nothing creates a better mood than your confecti<U+0097> Ooh. Am I interrupting?

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: We were just celebrating the anniversary of the twins' first sneezes! [giggles] [clears throat] Just about one year ago There was a tickle in your nose You snorted through the nursery [snorts] Happy Sneeze-iversary!

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: [deadpan] Congratulations.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: [shrieks] Pinkie! I can't have Photo Finish shoot my mane like this! And this party string won't come off!

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: Oh, that's because it's not just party string. It's super-sticky celebration string!

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: [shuddering sigh] It'll be fine, Pinkie. I'll find a way to clean this up before the shoot tomorrow. [whimper] Actually, you might consider doing the same.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: [grunting, straining] If only we had some kind of super-sudsy mane conditioning shampoo for you and a magical cleaning remover potion for me.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: [gasps] That's it! We'll pay a visit to Zecora! She's a wonder with a cauldron. I'm sure she can mix up a fix for both of us.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: That's good, because it would take forever to yank all of those baked goods out of the super-sticky celebration string.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
dialog: I... think you may still have some baking to do.

title: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You
