dialog: Pinkie Pie, wait! I know now that I should've been honest with you from the start, because lying to your friends is wrong. And because getting rid of all those pies was a giant hassle. I mean, do you have any idea how many pies you've made for me over the years?

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Yes, I know exactly how many. I have a very detailed pie-ling system.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Of course you do. The point is I thought the hassle was worth it just to spare your feelings, but I was wrong. So to make up for it, I made this pie for you. Well, I guess I made it for me. To eat in front of you. Point is I'm eating this pie for friendship!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Wait. That smelly circular monstrosity is a pie?

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Yeah! I know I can't go back and eat all the pies you made for me in the past, so instead I'm going to eat this one giant one for you now. So here I go.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Ahhhh...

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Wait! I can't watch you do this!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: I mean, is that crust or some kind of concrete?

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Yeah, honestly, I have no idea.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Oh, I can't believe you're willing to eat this terrible pie for me. It's ridiculous, and this whole thing is overly complicated, and... [sighs] I think I finally understand why you lied.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Whoa! What's that?!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: [chewing noises] Huh. Guess it was nothing. Heh-heh.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: [squeals] I'm so glad you enjoyed my pies!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: [chewing noises] Oh, never mind. Heh. Great pies!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: No way! Check that out!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Oh, sorry. Guess it was nothing. [slurp] Mmm! But that custard was everything!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Seeing you eat my pies makes me the happiest pony in all of Equestria!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Heh. I know it does.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: You did a lot of ridiculous and overly complex things to get rid of my pies because it made you happy to see me happy. Just like I went to a lot of effort to make you the pies because it made me happy to see you happy.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Yes!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: And if you're willing to go through all of that, it really shows how much you're willing to do for your friends.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Aw, shucks. It was nothing.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Now get out of that thing and give me a hug!

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Just remember. In the future, you can always be honest with me.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: Uh, I could've told her that.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: [straining] Heh. Cool. H-How about this? Your hugs are too tight.

title: Secrets and Pies
dialog: [laughing] No, they're not.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oooh! Excuse me. When does the noon train from the Crystal Empire arrive?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Heh. Right. Sorry. I'm just a little excited because my friend Sunburst is coming.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: He's my oldest friend. I mean, we've known each other practically forever. We have tons in common.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: We both love magic and games and jokes <U+0096> everything, really. Now that I think about it, there isn't a pony in all of Equestria I have more in common with.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Starlight?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [gasps] Sunburst! You made it!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Of course! I've been looking forward to this visit for a long time.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [grunts] Whoa. How long are you staying?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, just a... little reading for the train.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [chuckles] Same old Sunburst. [grunts] It's going to be so great spending time together. Just like old times. You and me doing the stuff we like <U+0096> games, magic...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Antiquing.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Antiquing. You know I like antiquing.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: You do?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Um, of course! Historical knickknacks, ancient relics... Oh! You are so lucky! Ponyville is antique central!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: It is?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: How have we never talked about this? We are going antiquing, and you are gonna love it!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Okay. Let's drop your stuff off at the castle first.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: This is so great! Who knew I'd be the one showing you the cool sights of Ponyville?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I'm a little surprised myself.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Wow! What a difference between the hoof-molded bricks and the extruded ones, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh-huh... Ha-ha...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oooh! Check out all these chandeliers! Sometimes, the crystals have magical properties.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. Oh, that's cool. How do you<U+0097>?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Sunburst! I'm so glad you're here!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: In the antique store?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: In Ponyville! Starlight's really been looking forward to your visit. Though I'm glad you're in the antique store, too. I'm usually the only one.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: That's crazy! Who doesn't like antiquing, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [nervous chuckle] Right.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oooh, look! An ancient map of Equestria made by the Mighty Helm.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Without the help of unicorn magic or Pegasus flight, the Earth ponies of the Mighty Helm were able to map the entire coast of Equestria.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Coooool...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: You don't have to pretend to like all this stuff.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What? No! I do like it. I mean, if you like it, I like it. Besides, we've almost looked at everything, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh, wow! You have got to see this Saddle Arabian vanity!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: This shop looked a lot smaller from the outside.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Did you see this Palominian letter opener?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Wow! That goes well with this ancient phoenix feather quill! We could write to each other!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [joins laughter, sighs] Um, I-I really like this old-timey barrel.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Actually, the stuff I bought is inside the barrel. But I can't wait to see what it is!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Wait. You don't know what you bought?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Mm-mmm. It's a blind buy. Sometimes shops get too busy to go through everything, so they load up a box or barrel and sell it without knowing what's inside.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Buying one is sort of like a treasure hunt.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Once I found a first edition History of Equestria in the original Olde Ponish.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Hliet foresettan pliht!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: It's an Olde Ponish saying. "Reward prefers risk!" Uh, it loses something in the translation.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Why don't we look through this stuff later?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yeah. What do you want to do, Starlight?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Well, I don't know if you're gonna remember this, but...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [gasps] Is this...?!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Dragon Pit!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I remember that game. You two used to play it?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Pretty much any time we weren't working on magic. I can't believe you found a copy!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Sunburst would get so excited whenever his dragon got trapped, he knocked the whole board over.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: That's adorable.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, well, it's an exciting game. But I have a little more control over my horn now.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh-oh! Somepony's dragon's gonna get trapped!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Doesn't seem so exciting to m<U+0097>

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Huh. I guess it is adorable.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I hope you're enjoying your visit so far.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Are you kidding? I mean, first antiquing and then spending time with Twilight?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. Yeah. She's pretty great.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Right? I mean, I know she's a princess, but I never thought she'd be so fun to just hang out with.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Well, she is the Princess of Friendship.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [chuckle] Right. I guess that makes sense.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: So tomorrow I thought<U+0097>

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I suppose I'm just surprised at how well we get along. I don't have much in common with most ponies.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: You two are pretty similar. I don't know many ponies who are fluent in Olde Ponish.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Exactly! I probably have more in common with Twilight than any pony in Equestria!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Right...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [sighs] Anyway, I better get some sleep. [yawns] Ponyville might be small, but there's a lot to do. Maybe we should ask Twilight what she recommends we see!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Um... sure.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Great! Good night, Starlight.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Um...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: ...Good night.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [singsong] Knock, knock!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [yelps] Oh. Hi, Starlight. [yawns] Is it morning already?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yup! Maybe a bit early, but like you said, there's a lot to see in Ponyville.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh... Right. Okay.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Plus, I couldn't really sleep. I just kept thinking about all the stuff we have in common and how much fun we'll have today.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Great. Uh, is Twilight up yet?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Actually, I'm pretty sure she's busy with princess stuff today.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: But I've got a full day of stuff planned. Just you and me.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, great. Um, would you mind turning around or preferably... leaving the room so I could get changed?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: One genuine Sweet Apple Acres apple tree! Because we used to drink so much apple juice as foals?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, I don't remember that.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [yelps] Ow.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Trixie? What are you doing here?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Huh. I often seek the privacy of the orchard to practice new feats of amazement. And also, I fell asleep.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. Well, Sunburst and I were just catching up, so<U+0097>

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [gasps] I don't suppose the two of you want to see a never-before-witnessed magical marvel?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Sure!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [sighs] Why not?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Behold, visiting friend from Starlight's past, and be amazed by the Great and Powerful <U+0096> and current best friend of Starlight <U+0096> Trixie!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I give you... the Unicorn Escape! [grunting] Just... a sec... One more... [grunts] twist... and... [grunts] [straining] The Great and Powerful Trixie requires a little assistance.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I know this trick. There's a special link, but I could never hold the chain up long enough to find it.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Well, if I could do magic like that, I'd have a whole slew of new tricks at my disposal.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I always liked close-up magic because I knew I could do it if I just practiced enough.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Starlight, why didn't you tell me how much Sunburst and I had in common?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [sarcastic] Gee. I don't know.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I know Trixie's "magic" is, you know, fun. But the Mirror Pool is actual magic.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Whoa. This place is pure pony lore.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yup. I mean, it's supposed to be all dangerous, and I guess I shouldn't have broken the seal to get in, but you wanted to see the sights of Ponyville, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: So, Pinkie Pie just dove in and made copies of herself?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Mm-hmm. If we made copies of ourselves, we could get a year's worth of hanging out over in one day.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, not that we would.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Do you hear that?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. I hope it's not a leftover Pinkie Pie.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Not exactly.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Maud! How did you get in here?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] This cavern's actually connected to mine.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, what are you doing?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Tapping.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Maud isn't super chatty. I mean, you and I could sit around and talk all day, but she looks pretty busy.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Are you taking some kind of core sample?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Not exactly. I'm uncovering this section of strata for closer study. You might want to step back.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] I'm studying this area's metamorphic<U+0097>

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: <U+0097>foliation. Is this gneiss, phyllite, or slate? Wow. The pressure above must be pretty uniform to get the planar fabric to be this consistent.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] You know about geology?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Eh, I dabble. For example, by the speleothems in this cave, I kind of figured there was another way out.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Because of the calcite deposits.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Starlight? Where's Sunburst?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [mumbles "I don't know"] Doing stage magic with Trixie? Studying new rocks with Maud? You're here, so I guess you two aren't off translating some ancient Olde Ponish text.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What are you talking about? Why would Sunburst be doing any of that? I thought he came to Ponyville to see you.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I thought so, too, but it hasn't worked out that way. When we were foals, we had more in common than any two ponies in Equestria. But now, it seems like he's got more in common with my friends than he does with me.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. Everypony changes, but that doesn't mean there aren't still things you both like. You both love magic, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Magic?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Sure. You're really good at it, and Sunburst practically knows every spell that ever was.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [gasps] You're right! Thanks, Twilight! You're the best!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Heh. I try.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Starlight, what happened? Maud and I found some fascinating sedimentary stratum, but when I turned to show you, you were gone.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Maud does have a way of making rocks really interesting, but I wanted to work on something a little more "us".

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What's this?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Just a little something I made up.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Whoa! You made up this spell? Just now?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yup!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Wow.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I know, right? But wait, there's more!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What's going on in here?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Nothing. I was trying to have fun doing the one thing I thought we still had in common, but I guess we don't even have that anymore.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I don't understand. Starlight and I have known each other since we were foals, but that doesn't mean we have to be foals to hang out.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh, Starlight does have a tendency to overdo.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I mean, it is surprising how well I get along with all of her friends, but she and I still have tons in common.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Maybe you just need to remind her what those things are.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: That's it! That's exactly what I'll do! Uh, right after I think of them.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Uh-oh.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Obviously you and I hit it off. I am quite impressive. And we share a love for prestidigitation.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Right. And Starlight and I share a lot of things, too. I just need to think of them. What else do you guys have in common?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Well, we've both made not-so-great choices in the past.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: And we're self-conscious about everypony judging us, even though we've both changed and are trying hard to be better.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yeah, we don't really have that.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Hmph! I can think of something you have in common. You're both poor practice audiences.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Starlight and I don't really have a lot in common. Other than feeling different from most ponies. And comedy.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Comedy?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] I'm very funny.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Was that a joke?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] No.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Oh. Well, that's more than I can think of that she and I have in common.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] We don't really spend that much time talking about that, though. Mostly we're just comfortable around each other.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [sighs] We used to be. We did everything together. But now I'm wondering if we've spent so much time apart that we don't connect over anything anymore. And if we can't connect over anything, then maybe we're not even friends!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Well, at least it's not serious. That was a joke.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [sighs] I appreciate you trying to help, Twilight. But it seems pretty clear that Sunburst and I have grown apart.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I understand. But I feel like that only happens if you both let it. You still want to be friends, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I created a spell so we could relive playing a game in our childhood home... and bodies.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Right...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I'm just not sure Sunburst wants to stay friends, too.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I think you might be surprised.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Prepare yourself...

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: ...for the new and improved Dragon Pit!

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: We had to take out a few spaces to get it to fit, but you hardly miss them. Maud made the dice.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [deadpan] Pumice is the lightest igneous rock. It seemed the best choice.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: And I added the special effects. There's nothing like a little well-placed magic smoke.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Looks like somepony's dragon is going to get trapped.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I thought you didn't want to play this game.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Well, I didn't want to pretend to be a foal, but I know you wanted to play. I thought it'd be fun to play a version big enough for full-grown ponies. What do you think? Fun, right?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Actually, it's missing something.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: [giggles] Now it's fun.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: I don't know why I got so worried about us not having anything in common.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Yeah. I kind of think it doesn't matter as long as we enjoy each other's company.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: And that game was certainly enjoyable.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: What made it even better was getting to play it with all my friends.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: See you soon?

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: You bet. I want to hear if you find anything interesting in that barrel.

title: Uncommon Bond
dialog: Trust me, Starlight. You'll be the first to know.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [narrating] The best elements within us can spread light and virtue, and I know ponies who represent them all <U+0096> strength, bravery, healing, beauty, hope, and sorcery. Myself and these Pillars of Equestria were gathered together by another to maintain and share the light of these powerful ideals. But we soon came to believe the pony who brought us together only wanted that power for himself. Cast out and alone, this power-mad pony turned to darkness to satisfy his thirst. Transformed into a Pony of Shadows, he returned for revenge <U+0096> to extinguish the Pillars' light and rob the world of hope. To stop him, the Pillars and I must make a grave sacrifice. But we shall leave behind a seed in hopes that one day it will grow into a force to stand against the darkness for all time. We must now face the fiend with the only plan we have...

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [reading] "...I only hope it will be enough." That's the last entry. And maybe Star Swirl's final words before he vanished.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I've always wondered what happened to Star Swirl. This is quite a discovery, Sunburst.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: So it's genuine? You can verify that this journal really belonged to Star Swirl the Bearded?!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Indeed. From the looks of it, the last thing he wrote before facing the Pony of Shadows.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh... So, the Pony of Shadows was really real?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It appears so.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We never met the other Pillars, and we were too young to understand the danger they faced.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hold on a second now. All those legendary ponies were real, too? And they went off with Star Swirl to face the Pony of Shadows, and then none of them were ever heard from again?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh, yeah. Weren't you listening?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But what happened to them all?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They must have defeated the villain, since Equestria is still full of light and hope.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But how? And where did they go?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: My Olde Ponish is a bit rusty, but I wonder if the answers can be found somewhere within the pages of this book.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well, I just happen to be an expert in Olde Ponish. I mean, I've practically memorized every ancient text about Star Swirl there is!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Seriously. All of them.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We have fond memories of our old teacher. If you could discover what happened to him, we would be most grateful.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Solving a thousands-year-old mystery could take forever! Think of the research! The re-reading! The re-re-reading!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You might find you need help.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Luckily, she's got a whole bushel o' helpers right here.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Totally! Uh... how long will all this research take, exactly?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Let's get this back to my library. I'm sure we'll figure out what happened in no time.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [yawns] Figure it out yet, Twilight?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [yelps] What did you figure out?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What is it?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Twilight, we've been studyin' and referencin' and cross-referencin' for three days straight now.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Ugh. I haven't spent this much time reading since the last Daring Do book came out.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Perhaps it is time to take a break. This mystery is over a thousand years old, after all. Another day or two won't make a difference.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Two days?! I don't want to waste two seconds! I'm close to an answer. I can feel it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [reading] "Hearg sylfum se Ponhenge". What's that?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Temple of Ponhenge?! You can read that?!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The hornwriting's pretty sloppy, but it's nowhere near as bad as mine. [reading] "Toward dol grimlic of Fola Firgenbeorg"?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: "At the base of Foal Mountain"...

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [reading] "User endemest scield".

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [gasps] "Our last stand".

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: This is it. Ponhenge. I can't believe it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I've never seen magical runes like these before! Have you?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh-uh.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I don't think anypony's seen any of this for a long time. [straining] Whoa!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It'd take a whole team of ponies to clear away all this brush.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Even then, I'm not sure we'd find out what happened here over a thousand years ago.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [sighs] You're right. I suppose it was a long shot.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Cheer up, Twilight. Finding a whole set of ancient ruins is pretty impressive. Maybe you could write a paper on it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I guess I hoped we'd get here and the mystery would just magically be explained.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh... Twilight?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Star Swirl!? I... I've wanted to meet you my whole life! I can't believe you're here!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I don't think he is here. I don't think any of them are.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We did not come here to defeat you.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We came... to contain you.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [to Twilight] Well, you did ask for a magical explanation.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh... what just happened?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It looked like Star Swirl cast a spell that banished the Pony of Shadows.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Of course! Powerful magic like that would leave an impression on this place. Bringing the book back here let us see what happened.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Which was what?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Star Swirl and the rest of the Pillars sacrificed themselves to save Equestria.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It's amazing to think one of the greatest mysteries of Equestria was solved with a musty old book from an antique shop.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But I wouldn't say the mystery's solved. Star Swirl's spell was one of the most powerful feats of magic in all of history. It'll take years of study before we fully understand it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I think I understand Star Swirl's spell!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I know I've finished one of Star Swirl's spells before, but this one was on a whole different level! Was it an explosion of magical feedback? An evocation? A kind of incantation? It's Star Swirl, so the possibilities are endless! And once Starlight set me on the right track with his crazy hornwriting <U+0096> [laughs, snorts] I mean, he was a genius, so I guess we can forgive a little messiness <U+0096> I went through the journal again, and it's amazing!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Twilight, darling. We understand you're excited, but that's all we understand.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What exactly is so amazing?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Only how Star Swirl and the other Pillars sent the Pony of Shadows to limbo!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They did what now?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They used their magic to open a portal between worlds <U+0096> to limbo <U+0096> and pulled the Pony of Shadows inside.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Darling, your diorama!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I made more!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Star Swirl thought the only way to trap the Pony of Shadows in limbo was for the Pillars to take him there.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: So they got stuck, too!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Pony of Shadows must have been really awful for them to do that.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I suppose being trapped for all time with a super-duper bad guy in limbo might be okay if you were doing the limbo, but that's still pushing it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The thing is, I think I can get them out.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Twilight, are you serious? You can save the most legendary ponies of all time?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I-I don't know. Opening portals between worlds didn't work out well for me. Are you sure it's safe?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: First of all, you opened portals through time. And second of all, Star Swirl wrote the spell you used to do it. If he'd been here, he could have stopped it. Equestria would be safer with him in it. We have to save him.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But you'd be savin' all the Pillars, right? A-And they disappeared ages ago.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's the thing about limbo. It isn't one place or another. It's in between, so time stands still. If we can pull them out, it'll be like they never left. I actually built another model to demonstrate<U+0097>

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What can we do to help?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: If I'm right, we need to find items that are connected to the Pillars in some way.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You mean, like, stuff that belonged to them?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: How would we know what to look for? Or where?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Luckily, Star Swirl took a lot of notes. [reading] "My compatriots are as varied as the realm itself and hail from every corner of our land, bringing with them artifacts and talismans of great power."

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Um, Twilight? What are you doing?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I'm not doing anything!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Rockhoof's shovel!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Flash Magnus' shield!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Mistmane's flower!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Meadowbrook's mask!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: And the blindfold Somnambula wore when she faced that nasty sphinx!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I guess we don't need to figure out who should get what.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Oh, I can guarantee Rockhoof was as real as you and me.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Probably.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I bet if you told somepony else the story, it might sound... [gasps] "preposterous".

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Ow!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Perhaps it just seemed like your gardens were worthless. But a little pruning can work wonders. Of course you will have to look after more than just one flower now.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I can't believe Flash Magnus' shield ended up in the Dragon Lands.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Good thing you brought the official Equestrian friendship ambassador to the dragons to help you navigate our customs. Like our favorite sport <U+0096> gorge surfing!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Okay. That was awesome.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Whoa, fellas. As the official Equestrian friendship ambassador to the dragons, I have to say that's not very friendly.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well, what do you know? The puny pony-dragon's sticking up for his pony pal.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hey! That's an ancient pony artifact!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hooves off my gorge board! I found it in the desert, and finders keepers.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It isn't yours.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Huh. It sure looks like mine. But I might consider racing you for it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: No problem.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Um... No. I mean [to Spike] you.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Whoa! Whoa! Whoooooaaaaa! Aaah! [grunting] [painting] I won? I won! Woo-hoo! Give up the shield, Garble!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [grunts] Lord Ember only commanded us to be nice to ponies. She never said anything about pony-loving dragons.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh, s-since Dragon Lord Ember commanded you to make peace with ponies, you can't very well attack one of their friends, can you?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I guess we'll find out! [grunts] Aaah!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Ugh. Why is he always hiding behind ponies?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I wasn't hiding when I beat you down the ridge.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You fell.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Wow. You must be slow if all Spike had to do to win was fall down.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I'm faster than you.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Doubt it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Fine! I'll race you back to the top. If you win, you can have your pony junk. But if I win, you'll leave and I get to give it to him!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Fine. I'm pretty sure I could beat you anyway. But with that heavy hunk of metal on your back, it'll be a snap.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Huh? Oh, yeah. Thanks for the tip.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: See ya at the top, loser! Hey! That's mine!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Finders keepers, remember?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Just remember not to turn away from them, Cattail. Flash bees can get pretty aggressive. I guess that's why none of the other bayou animals can get to the water.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It would... if I didn't have to fly up here to move their hive. There!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Now the other bayou creatures can get to the water without the bees feeling threatened.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I know. [giggles] But I couldn't leave without helping.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I wouldn't give up hope just yet.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: This old blindfold was stuck in the drain.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Weren't you looking for a blindfold?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Oh, yeah!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I can't believe I'm gonna meet Star Swirl the Bearded! You know, outside of my dreams.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I can't believe you're actually going through with it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What do you mean?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I'm all for pushing the envelope, obviously, but this is pretty out there for you, Twilight.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What's "out there" about saving the most legendary ponies of all time from a thousands-year-old prison?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well... nothing when you say it like that. Unless "the most legendary ponies of all time" knew what they were doing, and we shouldn't mess with it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I'm sure Star Swirl and the Pillars did the best they could back then, but magic has come a long way. Mostly because of the work they did.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's true. And you did get your wings from finishing one of Star Swirl's spells.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Exactly.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But then I messed with one and nearly destroyed the universe, so...

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Starlight, Star Swirl the Bearded is the greatest wizard who ever lived. The chance to have him back in Equestria is worth the risk.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's good news.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Otherwise, we'd have brought this shield for nothing.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I hope you don't think you're the only one to find her artifact, because this here shovel says otherwise.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [laughing] Honestly, you two. Not everything is a competition. But Mistmane's flower is by far the most attractive of the artifacts.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You're just saying that because you didn't have to scuba dive in a pit of green slime to get yours!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Or move a flash beehive.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Good work, everyone. Let's do this!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What... What has happened?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It worked! We brought you back!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: To where?

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You and the others have been trapped in limbo for over a thousand years, but I figured out how to get you ho<U+0097>

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What?! No, no, no, no! You must undo what you've done!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What? Why? I mean, I don't think I can.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You cannot bring us back!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But I did. I brought all the Pillars back.

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You cannot bring only the Pillars back!

title: Shadow Play - Part 1
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Oh, no!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's the last entry. Star Swirl's final words before he vanished.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: All those legendary ponies were real, too? And then none of them were ever heard from again?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They used their magic to open a portal to limbo.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We need to find items that are connected to the Pillars in some way.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We brought you back!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You cannot bring only the Pillars back!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You must return us to limbo. It's the only way to stop him.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I only figured out how to bring you back.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Working on it! No table of contents!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You have studied my writings. Surely you have some other plan.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: No. I just wanted to save you. I didn't think<U+0097>

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: No!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Lucky for her, she's not alone!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Know this, fiend! We will not rest until we find a way to return you to limbo!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Um... where'd he go?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Over a thousand years.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Then my spell worked <U+0096> before it was meddled with <U+0096> and the realm has been at peace for a millennia!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Weeeeell... we did have to save everypony from Nightmare Moon and Discord and Chrysalis and King Sombra and Lord Tirek, and there was that one time when Starlight traveled through time and almost destroyed life as we know it! But that's all in the past.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We shall see. It is an easy thing to say you have saved the world. It is quite another to do it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Oh, we've saved the world, Beardo. And we can do it again.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Be that as it may, the problem of locating the Pony of Shadows remains, and this land is vast.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It sounds like you need a map. Luckily, we have just the thing.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Something about this magic seems familiar...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Did you know he can do that?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: He's Star Swirl! He can do anything!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: This map, and indeed this very castle, are grown from the seed we planted over a thousand years ago.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Then it did work!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What worked?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Y'all mean the Elements came from you?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You know, the sparkly crystal things that grow from the Tree of Harmony and represent each of us? Laughter, honesty, generosity, loyalty, kindness, and magic!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: More importantly, we no longer need Ponhenge to send our foe back to limbo. We can use the stored magic in this Tree of Harmony.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But doesn't a banishing spell take a lot of power? We'd have to sacrifice the Elements for that.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Mm-hmm.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They'd be gone... forever?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Star Swirl, I don't think the Tree can survive without the Elements. If it dies, Equestria will suffer.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: If the Pony of Shadows has his way, your land will not exist. So unless you have a better idea...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Our foe will seek dark places from which to draw power. I will prepare my spell so that we may strike as soon as you find him.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What are we waiting for?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: What about this one?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Seapony etiquette isn't going to help right now, Spike.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh, Twilight? Are you okay?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I just unleashed ultimate evil and doomed Equestria because I was obsessed with meeting my idol! Why wouldn't I be okay?!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [scoffs] You didn't know that was gonna happen.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But I should have listened to you and left things alone. Now the Elements of Harmony will be lost to fix my mistake!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Maybe there's another way.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: If there is, Twilight will find it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Portal gate... Portal keys... Portal spells... Yes! If the Pillars can hold open the gateway to limbo, a powerful pony can do the banishing spell herself! Do you know what this means?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [panting] I can stop carrying books?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Pillars don't have to leave Equestria! Even though we'll lose the Elements, we'll have the ponies that created them. And the Pony of Shadows will be banished for good!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's great. Heh. But I was thinking of another way that maybe doesn't involve banishing at all?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Star Swirl knew what he was doing when he cast that spell. If I can make it even better, maybe he'll see that I take magic as seriously as he does.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It seems the dark places Star Swirl indicated on the map have changed.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I bet the Pony of Shadows would've loved the Ghastly Caverns before a thousand years of erosion turned it into the Ghastly Gorge.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Appeloosian Wastes sure sounded dark and desolate.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Who knew they would become such a popular square dancing destination?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: And I get how this part of Equestria used to be cast in eternal night where the Pony of Shadows could draw power and wreak havoc while ponies were powerless to stop him. But...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [echoing] ...it's kinda made a comeback! Did I mention it's really bright?!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It seems there are fewer dark corners in the realm these days.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Isn't that a good thing?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Isn't there some way to banish him without losing all of you?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I don't think you'll have to! My spell isn't finished yet, but I think we can send the Pony of Shadows to limbo without all of you having to go as well!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: While I appreciate your enthusiasm, Twilight, this is hardly the time to take risks on half-baked spells.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Beggin' your pardon, Mr. the Bearded! But Twilight doesn't do anythin' halfway!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Especially not magic!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Seriously! She got her wings by finishing one of your spells!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I think you'll find her work is worth reading before you dismiss it out of hoof!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Mm-hmm!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hmm. I suppose there is a chance.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But we still have no idea where to find the villain.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Maybe we should try there?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Hollow Shades. I think a branch of the Apple family lives there.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: They'd have to be pretty distant. The Hollow Shades was abandoned eons ago.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hmm, that's odd. The only time the map's called all of us to one place was Starlight's village.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: So it's like a super-villain tracker! No offense.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Do you think the map could be trying to tell us where the Pony of Shadows is?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hmm... The Tree of Harmony acting to protect the light of the realm... Yes. A good thought, Twilight.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I will make my notes on this spell. Ready yourselves for battle.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh, I know I'm not as experienced as all of you, but is banishment really the only option? I mean, it's been a long time. Maybe the Pony of Shadows is ready to talk?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I doubt we can save our homeland with a conversation.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But we could try.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Starlight, I'm sure Star Swirl and the others did try.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Pony of Shadows was not interested in reconciliation. Once a villain, always a villain. Twilight, Sunburst, would you accompany me? I wish to refine this spell for our use.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Come. We must prepare for the struggle ahead.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [sighs] I know Star Swirl is a great wizard, but this whole plan seems... wrong. The map's only ever sent us to solve friendship problems.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Maybe so, but the Pony of Shadows doesn't really seem like the "friendship" type.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Honestly? We don't know anything about him.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well, nopony does.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That's not entirely true.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: You all knew the Pony of Shadows before he became what he is now. You must've been friends. So what happened?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The tale of our rift is a sad one.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [narrating] Stygian was a pony like the rest of us, though more scholar than hero. He recognized our emerging world would need champions to defend it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But why did he steal the artifacts from you?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Hmm...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: That looks like a lot of work.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It is what must be done, and it would be best if we were not disturbed.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I'm sorry, Starlight, but we can't stop to talk. The stakes are too high, and we have to<U+0097>

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Banish Stygian to limbo. I get it.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Uh, who?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Stygian was the name the Pony of Shadows gave up when he turned to darkness.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: And I'm just trying to figure out why.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Envy. He wanted more power than he had, and that desire led him down a path from which there is no return!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I know from experience that's not always true. When the map called you six to my village, it was for a friendship problem. Are you sure this is different?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Stygian wants to destroy all that is good in this world. There's no way to befriend a pony like that.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I guess I'm lucky your idol wasn't around when you decided to be my friend. I might've been banished to limbo, too.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: A necessary sacrifice. With the Elements' power, we will bind the Pony of Shadows in limbo. And thanks to Twilight, we will remain to watch over the realm ourselves.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Um... how do we use them?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well, you... Oh. I'm not sure. They simply work for us.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Elements are attuned to you. We must use their magic in pairs.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: No problem. We're used to banishing evil before breakfast.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: And it'll be an honor to save Equestria with y'all.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I really hope Twilight knows what she's doing...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I don't remember reading anything that said the Hollow Shades was like this.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Prepare yourselves. He is here. Stygian! Show yourself and face us!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [groans] I definitely would've remembered reading about this.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We did what we had to do. You tried to steal our powers for yourself.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Are you still sure this isn't a friendship problem?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Ready? Open the portal...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: ...Now!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Twilight! Push him in!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Huh? There's... a pony in there.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Are you... Stygian?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: But Star Swirl says you betrayed them. You wanted their magic...

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: This is all a misunderstanding! If the Pillars knew how you felt, I'm sure they wouldn't have turned their backs on you. The shadow isn't who you really are. Let me help you be Stygian again.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Because it's what she does. I wasn't so different from you, and Twilight helped me change. If there's one pony in Equestria that can save a friendship, it's her.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Fight the darkness, Stygian! You don't need it anymore! Revenge isn't what you want! Friendship is!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Twilight!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Ugh! The shadow won't let go of him. He wants to stop, but he can't do it alone.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Then we must help him!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Yeah! Oh, it felt sooooo good to do that again!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Friendship power rush! Whoo!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: The Elements! They didn't disappear!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Maybe because we used them for healing magic instead of banishing?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Look!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Long ago, you needed our help, Stygian. But instead of listening, we turned our backs on you. Pride clouded my judgment. I owe you an apology. Thank you for helping us see the errors of our ways, Twilight. It seems I never accounted for the Magic of Friendship.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Thank you, Swirlstar! Uh, Star Swirl!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [clears throat] Soooo... apparently a conversation can save Equestria?

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [chuckles] Something tells me I will be making a lot of apologies today.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: I simply cannot believe how tall you've gotten!

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Well, it has been over a thousand years. Will you stay here and teach magic once again? My sister and I have such fond memories of your lessons.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: As long as you don't ask for those essays we owed you before you disappeared.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: [chuckles] I'm not certain Canterlot is where I belong. The realm has grown, and I believe I'll have a look around before I settle in any one place.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: Then I hope you will return to Canterlot on occasion and share the wisdom of your great experience with the next generation of ponies.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: We would be honored. But if it is wisdom you seek, look no further than your own pupil. She showed me that the power of friendship is a magical force indeed. And that in turning away from others, you hurt yourself as well.

title: Shadow Play - Part 2
writer: Josh Haber & Nicole Dubuc; story by Josh Haber
dialog: It's funny. I thought meeting my idol would give me all the answers I ever wanted. But instead, I forgot what I already knew. Good thing I had a student of my own to remind me.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: This happened while we were gone?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Wow! Those are all the places we went when we left to save Equestria!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ugh! There's that horrid town where we were almost sold!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: The pirates! They were pretty awesome! Uh, once they decided not to throw us overboard.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: And Mount Aris! Ooh, Starlight! Did you know we made seashell necklaces for aaaaaa... [inhales] ...aaaaall the seaponies?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I... You... Really? What about that unicorn? The one who attacked Canterlot?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Tempest! I invited her to come to Ponyville, but she wanted to spread the word of the Storm King's defeat and share what she learned about friendship.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Y'all think that's why the map grew? Friendship quests beyond Equestria?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I hope not. I've had quite enough life-threatening adventures, thank you very much.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: How many friendship quests do you think we need to go on before we have to expand the throne room?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: We can't do it all alone.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Sure we can! We just need to knock this wall down, get some paint...

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: No. I mean, the world is filled with so many different creatures who know nothing about friendship. We need help if we're gonna teach them all about friendship. Lots of help.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Perhaps. But where does one go to learn about friendship?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Here! They can all go here! Because we're gonna open a school!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I think a school of friendship is a wonderful idea, Twilight! I'll help in any way I can.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I just have a few questions. What time should school start each day?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: It really d<U+0097>

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: What's the ideal length for class? Do you test regularly?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, well, that's<U+0097>

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: What about class projects?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: That's a very<U+0097>

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Assigned seating? Open seating? Or is that... too unstructured?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: [giggles] Oh, Twilight. You were my star pupil. If anyone knows how to run a school, it's you.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: There's a big difference between attending a school and running one. It's not like there's a rule book to follow.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Actually, there is. The EEA guidebook is very specific about how to run a school.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: The EEA? I've never heard of that. Should I have heard of that?!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Of course not. You've never run a school before. The Equestria Education Association is a board of learned ponies that oversee every school in Equestria.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Even your school? But you're you!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Not even a princess can do whatever she likes when it comes to shaping young pony minds. The EEA ensures that whether it's unicorns studying magic, Pegasi learning weather, or Earth ponies researching agriculture, all schools are held to the same high standard. They'll need to approve your plan before you can move forward.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Okay, Spike, looks like we have a presentation to make.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: [scoffs] After everything we've been through, how hard can that be?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I'm gonna go with "really hard".

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Uh, hello. My name is<U+0097>

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Princess Twilight Sparkle. I am Chancellor Neighsay. Equestria owes you a great debt. But princess or no, we expect you to do things by... the... book!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I think you'll find my curriculum meets all your requirements, Chancellor.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: And can we trust you to follow through with this plan? Will you leave the school unattended to gallop off on your... "adventures"?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: My journey beyond Equestria showed me firsthoof that the threats out there are greater than we imagined!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: If we want to keep our land safe and create a friendlier tomorrow, we need to teach the Magic of Friendship far and wide.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: A school for ponies to learn how to protect themselves.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Uh, more like respecting differences and communicating.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: The EEA concurs. Every pony should be prepared to defend our way of life. So, if your work is in order, provisional EEA approval is granted. We will need to observe your school up and running before it can be fully accredited.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Then please, join us for Friends and Family Day. It'll be the perfect time to see our progress!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: It's too much. Too much!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ugh, you think so? I had hoped dressing the part would help me feel the part.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Not your dress! This! Us! Teaching?! They're gonna think I'm an egghead!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Well, the students are gonna love my confetti cannon class. It's gonna be... a blast!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Um, hello there. I'm your teacher. I hope you enjoy class. But if you don't enjoy it, that's okay, too.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I don't know about all this.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: It's going to be fine. Everything about this school just feels right.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: See? If Twilight isn't stressed, you've got nothing to worry about.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: And you're sure you want us to be teachers? In classrooms?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: The EEA is very clear on how schools should be run. We have a huge responsibility, and I need you all to do this by the book. That means no cannons in class, Pinkie.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Awww. Not even a [high-pitched] teeny cannon?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I know it's not some big adventure against the forces of evil, but this could be the most important thing we've ever done. I can't run a school of friendship without my best friends. Can I count on you?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Of course you can, darling.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Call me Professor Egghead. I'm in!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: [screams] First day at school! So many new ponies!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: About that. One thing I forgot to mention. It's not just ponies.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: That was unexpected.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ooh! Students certainly traveled from far and wide to attend our school!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Princess Celestia helped me reach out to all the kingdoms. After all, friendship is something that needs to be shared with every... creature.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Welcome to the School of Friendship! I'm your headmare Twilight Sparkle. Please follow Guidance Counselor Starlight to sign in and get your class assignments. Then we can show you your living quarters.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Whoa, sorry! I'm Sandbar. Are you a student here, too?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Grandpa Gruff? What are you doing here?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Rainbow Dash, right? Gilda told me about you. You're a teacher? Huh. Thought you'd be... cooler.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ponies!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Prince Rutherford!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: This Yona Yak. She come to pony school. Hah. Make it better.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Yak can't wait to meet ponies and tell all about Yakyakistan!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Why don't I show you around before you destroy the place?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: But dragons are better than this! Why am I here?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Because as Dragon Lord, I'm ordering you to be here! Hey, Spike! Come meet Smolder.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Great to see you, Ember! Uh, which one is Smolder?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ocellus! What did we talk about?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: I told you, stay in your own form. It's the polite thing to do. Sorry, she's shy.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: What is that?! No way! I didn't know ponies could turn into... um... What are you?

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: A changeling.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Ponies can turn into changelings?!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: No, but changelings can turn into ponies.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Huh. That's confusing!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: This place is amazing! I've spent most of my life in a coral reef underwater. I was a seapony, but now I'm a Hippogriff. Long story. Anyway, wow! Is that a yak?!

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Thank you so much for supporting the grand opening of our school. I hope you'll all join us for Friends and Family Day to see the amazing progress your students are making.

title: School Daze - Part 1
dialog: Looks like school's in session!

title: School Daze - Part 1
