dialog: I don't think so. You can destroy my reputation if you want, but using your students' bits to expand your resort is wrong, even if the lessons you teach are good ones.

title: Friendship University
dialog: Of course they're good. We copied them from your book.

title: Friendship University
dialog: We just skipped every other page. All the lessons, half the time!

title: Friendship University
dialog: [groans] Fine. If you really want to call it even, give back the bits and stop charging for my lessons. Then you can teach them as much as you like.

title: Friendship University
dialog: Running a school is more work than we thought. Besides, we almost have everything we need.

title: Friendship University
dialog: I think not!

title: Friendship University
dialog: Plainity? My star pupil?

title: Friendship University
dialog: [affected voice] Not Plainity, but... [normal voice] Rarity!

title: Friendship University
dialog: Who?

title: Friendship University
dialog: We decided to bring somepony else here to listen to everything you just said!

title: Friendship University
dialog: [stutters] Hey, Star Swirl. We were just about to<U+0097>

title: Friendship University
dialog: Return the bits you've collected from your students and close your school?

title: Friendship University
dialog: [gulps] Yeah. That.

title: Friendship University
dialog: [sighs] It seems I'll never stop learning from your example, Twilight. It is a valuable lesson to stand up for what you know is true. I wish I had known it, too.

title: Friendship University
dialog: Well, I can refer you to a fairly reputable establishment just outside of Ponyville. I'm quite certain the headmare would consider letting you in.

title: Friendship University
dialog: [reading] "Of course, if I ever go to a school again, I'll make sure it's yours. In friendship, Star Swirl."

title: Friendship University
dialog: I still don't understand how Flim and Flam could have gotten a copy of your book.

title: Friendship University
dialog: Uh, I finished straightening up in the library. Professor Rarity, I just wanted to make sure you're definitely keeping these.

title: Friendship University
dialog: But of course, darling. If there's one thing I learned at Friendship University, it is not to give up when you know what's right. And I know teaching friendship through sewing is right! I just need to figure out how.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oh! Rarity! Just the pony I'm looking for! Can you come to Twilight's class with me? It won't take long.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oh, I'd love to help, but I have to meet Rainbow Dash for our day of fun together.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Twilight wants to use you as an example for the students.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Your example is here! [laughs] Oh!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I thought I was the example.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: You both are. Because together, you perfectly demonstrate my lesson on compromise in friendship. Rainbow Dash and Rarity have very different interests that keep them busy. But being friends is so important to them, they always manage to make time for each other.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [laughs nervously] Our day of fun was hard to plan, what with Rainbow Dash's extremely time-consuming and erratically scheduled Wonderbolts practice.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: And Rarity's weird fashion seasons. She's working on her winter collection, and it's not even summer yet!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: But you still found time to be together, and that's what counts. See, class? These ponies are models of true friendship in action.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Thanks for stopping by! Enjoy your day of fun!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh! Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh! What amazing stuff are you gonna do together?!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Aw, come on! I even said "shopping" that time!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Perfect! We'll go shopping first.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: But I brought stuff for buckball to<U+0097>

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Are we supposed to be learning something here? 'Cause this doesn't sound like compromising at all.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Yeah, you guys have nothing in common. How can you be friends?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Even though Rainbow Dash and Rarity enjoy doing different things, there are plenty of reasons why they're friends.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, like what?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [scoffs] We've always been friends.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Always?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Well, no. Not always. But for like a super long time.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: And we know all the same ponies.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Um, is that it?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, there was that time during the Cloudsdale Best Young Flyer Competition that I totally saved Rarity's life.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Yes! And I once proved Rainbow Dash's innocence to her beloved Wonderbolts when she was being framed for a mysterious incident.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Cool! What else?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, look. It may seem like Rarity and Rainbow Dash don't have that much in common when you try to put it into words, but sometimes friendships can't be explained. You just have to see them in action to understand.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Actually, that's a great idea!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Just go about your day of fun as you normally would. You won't even know we're here!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [singsongy] Game on!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Rarity! You were supposed to be holding your bucket!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Good! 'Cause this time, I'm gonna try something new and super-intense!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Rarity! Are you even paying attention?!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: What? Oh! I mean, of course! Uh, I held my bucket and everything!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: But you have to catch the ball!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Really? Well, that sounds dangerous.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [quietly, to herself] Oh, forget it. She's never gonna understand the point of this game. [out loud] Buckball time is over!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [sighs] Finally!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uhhh, see? They did something Rainbow Dash likes, so now it's time for something Rarity likes. Compromise!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Hmmm... I'm genuinely not sure. Are they too in style?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, isn't that what you want them to be?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oh, yes, yes. But they should be ahead of the curve. If they're in fashion right now, then they're practically already out.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: That doesn't make any sense.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Hmmm... Perhaps I should get the stilettos instead. What do you think?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [scoffs] Unless you like tripping with every step, heels on a horse are pretty useless.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [nickers] Au contraire. They're perfect in a multitude of situations. Formal functions, afternoon teas, evening teas, high tea, tea by the sea, royal tea<U+0097>

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Can they clean up glitter? Ew! It's on my hooves! Are we done yet?! [groans] This is sooooo boring!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Rainbow Dash and Rarity are just, uh, showcasing an aspect of friendship called "banter", the playful and friendly exchange of remarks. [laughs nervously] It's all in good fun.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh, I cannot wait! Collecting gemstones is my favorite!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Finally, something we can agree on! Treasure hunting!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: See, everycreature? That didn't take long. Now they're having a great time together.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh! Magnifique! This will be perfect for the emerald-encrusted romper I've been working on!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Cool! Now, what would be even cooler is if we could find a treasure chamber or something! Now, if I were a secret door, where would I be?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ugh, Rainbow Dash! Could you please refrain from all of that racket? It's muddying my concentration.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] Look! A lever! [grunts] It's stuck! Come help me, Rarity!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [sighs] Just a moment.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] You ruined my gems!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Yeah, well, you ruined my treasure hunt!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ugh! This wasn't about treasure! It was about finding gemstones for my winter collection!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Who cares about clothes?! We're supposed to be on an adventure together!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh-oh.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: That... is... it! This "day of fun" is officially over!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Fine by me! Maybe I can spend some time doing something I actually like now!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [laughs nervously] Surely, you don't mean that. You're just having a little disagreement. [to students] Sometimes that happens between pals. But no matter what, they can always get past the problem and stay good friends.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I don't think we can. [to Rarity] You don't care about any of the things I like! It's always about you and your boring fashions!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oh, puh-lease! You don't even give my interests a chance! You have absolutely no respect for the finer things! No respect, I tell you!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: ...And then there was the time Rainbow Dash called my Cloudsdale Couture Boutique idea "impractical"! Imagine that! Just because I needed Twilight to perform the butterfly wing spell on me whenever I wanted to deliver merchandise!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: ...And I told her a thousand times Pegasi don't even want restrictive heavy dresses! We need to be able to fly! Duh!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Not to mention the day I was wearing a really gorgeous hat, and Rainbow Dash didn't even notice!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: The Wonderbolts show was ruined! Rarity's hat was blocking everypony's view!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Enough! Guidance counseling is for talking out your problems, not telling me everything that's ever happened in the history of Equestria! [groans] But I've learned sometimes talking isn't enough. You need to put yourselves in one another's shoes.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: No way am I wearing those!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [groans] What I'm saying is we need a way to help you two reconnect. Follow me!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: The library? And this helps us how?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: You both love books. Rainbow Dash never stops talking about Daring Do adventures, and you're a huge fan of Shadow Spade mysteries.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Your point?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: The perfect way for you two to reconnect as friends is to read each other's favorite book. I'll read them, too. Then we'll all discuss afterward. It'll be a "Good Friends Book Club". Okay? I'll bring snacks.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ugh! Fine!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: If you insist.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Great! We're all here! To start, why don't you two share one thing you liked about each other's books?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Okay. I'll go first. Uh, I really enjoy the part in Daring Do and the Razor of Dreams when Daring used a vicious cragadile as a raft, and then<U+0097>

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [giggles] Please.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, what's so funny?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oh, sorry. It's just that I find those action sequences so ridiculously over-the-top.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: But they're real! You even met Daring Do!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Yes, but the book's descriptions just drag on, and what about those silly unpronounceable names? Doctor whozit-whatsit... [Spanish pronunciation] Caballeron?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, tea, anypony? Cucumber sandwich? [laughs nervously] Or we could go over some nice friendly talking points.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [scoffs] Seriously?! Don't even get me started on those clothing descriptions in Shadow Spade! What a yawn fest!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [stutters] But... the outfit descriptions are an integral part of the plot of The Colt in Crimson: A Shadow Spade Mystery!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: You see, if you didn't know that Sir Fluffingsworth von Radishfield wears only silk, double-breasted waistcoats, you'd never deduce that he, in fact, was the culprit!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: W-Wait. He was?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] You didn't even read it!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [quietly, to herself] I can see I'm gonna need reinforcements.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Not my fault it's so boring and put me to sleep!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: If you can't be bothered to read the thing I like, that just further illustrates the point that we have nothing in common anymore!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: At least we agree on that! From now on, I'm only hanging out with ponies who get me!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Your drama can wait! Twilight needs help! Now!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [panting] Any luck?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: No! It's goooone!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: What's gone?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: The Amulet of Aurora!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] One of the magical items you've been keeping for Princess Celestia?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: That amulet can reverse the tides and summon tsunamis! If it falls into the wrong hooves, Equestria will be in grave danger!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Don't worry, Twilight! I know tons about searching for lost treasure!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: And if I follow the culprit's clues, I'm certain I can find who took your amulet!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Thank you! I'll feel so much better knowing you two are looking for it together!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: While we work on a locator spell. It's the perfect solution!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: There appear to be no signs of damage to the surrounding artifacts, suggesting the thief did not leave in a hurry.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Rarity, your boots are leaving sparkles all over the floor!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Pfft! Those aren't from my boots. Mine are magenta, not blue. See?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I mean, really!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [panting] Turns out these boots were not "made for trotting," as advertised. Where are you going?! We promised Twilight we'd work together!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Don't you see? The Amulet of Aurora is made out of Azurantium!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Azurantium? You know! The same metal that the Amulet of Atonement from Daring Do book four is made from? It always leaves sparkles wherever it goes. Just like this, remember? It's from the book you just read!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [laughs nervously] That book! Yes! The one I-I just... just read! Ha-ha-ha!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Seriously?! After giving me all that grief, you didn't read mine either?!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Oopsie?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [groans] As soon as we find this amulet, we are done with each other!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Fine by me!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [panting] Ooh! Rainbow Dash, slow down! You're flying past important clues! Look, it's a print. But definitely not a hoof. Are those claw marks?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Who cares? I found a bigger clue!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I hope you don't expect me to... [shudders] ...wade through that.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Nah. It's too deep. We'll get stuck.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh. Clever. What Daring Do book did you get that from?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Actually, I learned it at Scootaloo's Filly Guides camp.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [sighs] At least you can fly across.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps, grunts] Nope. If one of those geysers burns off my wing feathers, I'll be out of the Wonderbolts for weeks. [groans] I could...

title: The End in Friend
dialog: ...try and slingshot my way through. But I'd need two perfectly placed trees, some stretchy rope, and a pith helmet. [groans] Too bad we can't do what Daring Do did in book four and find a cragadile for a raft.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ta-daaa! The S.S. Cragadile, at your service!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, that... is... awesome! Uh, I mean, it's all right, I guess.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: How did you know how to do that?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Mmm. We may have been friends for a super-long time, but you don't know everything about me yet.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] The glitter trail! It's gone!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: How are we supposed to find the Amulet of Aurora now?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [loudly] Sorry! What did you say?!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I think it's a Bufogren. They have really sensitive ears. [whispering loudly] Did you happen to see anycreature with a sparkly thingy go this way?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: His breath smells so bad, I can't think! But we can't hear him from back here. Now what?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Hmmm... [sniffs] Aha! I think I have the perfect solution. An old unicorn beauty trick. That is, if you can somehow procure us a tiny bit of cloud?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Now that I can do!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Ooh! It's adorable! [nose pinched] Um, excuse me, kind sir. I have a special treat for you in exchange for your information.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Sorry, sorry. Enjoy.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [sniffs, sighs]  Good. Uh, now, which way did the sparkly thing go?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Thank you! [to Rainbow Dash] Well, what are you waiting for? Go on! Fly up there and get that amulet!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, we're doing this together, remember?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Sorry, but I wasn't leaving you behind in that swamp.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [exhales] Thank you.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Huh. Maybe the key to unlocking this thing is in these inscriptions.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Or perhaps the key is right here!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I couldn't decide between the boots and the stilettos, so I got both!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: High heels could do that?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: And you called them "useless".

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [sighs] I shouldn't have said that. Or made fun of the other stuff you like to do. Some of it's actually sorta neat.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I... owe you an apology, too. Buckball may not be my thing, but it's something you enjoy. And you're very good at it. I never should've treated your interests like they were worth less than mine.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Soooo... does this mean we're still friends?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: I would very much like that. Now let's go find that amulet!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Wait! That tunnel leads to the... school? A secret passage! Awesome!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [gasps] Spikey-wikey! You stole the Amulet of Aurora?!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Not exactly.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: You mean, this was a setup to make us get along?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Sorry to interfere, but you both...

title: The End in Friend
dialog: ...reeeeeally needed it.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: So even though you don't like any of the same stuff, you two are friends again?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Heh. Always. I think we just needed a teensy reminder.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Yeah. We don't have to love the exact same things to have fun together. I mean, imagine if we did! How boring would that be?

title: The End in Friend
dialog: When we give each other a chance to share the different things we enjoy, it can be surprisingly wonderful! [sighs] Too bad we wasted our day of fun.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: We still have a little time left. You wanna... go hit the shops? I could actually use your help picking out some new buckball gear.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Do I?! But only if you help me choose some buckball fan attire, so I can cheer for my favorite player at the drop of a fabulous hat!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: Uh, yeah! Let's go already!

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [to students] See? Good friends always work through their differences.

title: The End in Friend
dialog: [laughs] Even if it takes a little help.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Huh? [gasps] Some poor creature's in trouble! We have to help it! Oh, listen to that suffering! It must be in horrible agony!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Ooh! It sounds like a herd of injured chimerae! [pants] Or it's Cerberus with snifflitis in two of its heads and kennel cough in its third. Or maybe it's<U+0097>

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Pinkie Pie?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Ugh. At least no animal is suffering. Right, Angel?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [laughs nervously] Well, until now.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: What is that thing?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: It's called a yovidaphone. It's from Yakyakistan, where it's actually quite popular.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Is it supposed to sound like that?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Not exactly. It's known to produce a fairly complicated, melodically rich, and harmonious tone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Are you sure we're talking about the same thing?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [panting] Phew! And that's with only a few days of practice! Can you believe it?!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yes. Yes, I can.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I can honestly say I've never heard anything like it in my life.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, if you enjoyed listening to my playing half as I enjoyed playing my playing, then I should totally play more! That way, we'll be even!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, I don't think that's necessary, Pinkie.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Please. Don't.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: There's a chance I may have missed a note or two here or there, but I just love playing so much! [sighs] You complete me.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, I, for one, am glad you're having so much fun with your new hobby.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [not listening] Uh-huh. Sure.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And it's great that you're learning a new skill, and... and you're just waiting for me to finish talking so you can start playing again, aren't ya?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs, to Angel Bunny] It's okay. She's gone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Anypony else think that sounded like an apple core cut up in a pulp grinder?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Apple-solutely! Uh, absolutely.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Okay, so maybe she isn't good yet. But she's our friend, and we should be supportive.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: She just started playin'. She's bound to get better. Right?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah, we just need to be supportive of her practicing... [groans] So the getting-better part happens as fast as possible.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] You're absolutely right, Spike. Sometimes it is nice to get out of the library and be in the sun.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Especially when you take the library with you.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [burbles, sighs] We need to do somethin' about Pinkie Pie's playin'!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Like, now!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Is it really that bad?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Does this answer your question?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uh, a trophy?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: For second place. Second! Place! All because of Pinkie's playing!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And thanks to her fruit-blastin' melodies, I got an orchard full of nothin' but applesauce! And it ain't even saucin' season!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And just look what her playing did to poor Fluttershy!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I mean, I know we said we should all be supportive, but Pinkie's been playin' for moons now, and she's not gettin' any better.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah! If anything, she's gotten worse!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Okay, maybe we can just pretend she's really good, and then I'll find a spell that will<U+0097>

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, no, no, no! We're not goin' through that again! Remember how well it worked out when you weren't honest with Celestia about her actin' ability?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [groans] You're right. We'll just have to tell Pinkie Pie she's not very good at the yovidaphone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, there's no time like the present.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Phew! Huh, that's weird. I coulda sworn this place was packed a second ago. Hey, guys! Can I favor you all with a tune? I take requests!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Actually, we do have a request, and yeah, it involves your yovidaphone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: You mean the thing I love more than anything else in Equestria? My sun, my moon, my stars, my everything? Ooh! Tell me, tell me, tell me!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: All right. In all honesty... Uh, in all honesty... Rarity has somethin' to say!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Pinkie, please listen to Rainbow Dash.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Ugh, fine! So, Pinkie, remember when we all were shocked to discover Princess Celestia wasn't so good at acting?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah, she was awful! But that's kind of a random thing to bring up. I thought you wanted to talk about my yovidaphone playing.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, it's, uh... It's just... You need to know, uh... Twilight?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] Pinkie, we all support you, but we're afraid you're just not good at the yovidaphone, and none of us want you to waste your time on something you can't do well.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh. [upbeat] Why didn't you just say so?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] We were all really nervous to tell you.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Why? It's just a silly instrument. Well, lunch break's over. Gotta get back to the bakery. Those apple turnovers aren't gonna apple themselves! [whistles gleefully] No more yovidaphone playing for me-e-e!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Wow. She took that so much better than I thought.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] Another beautiful day in Ponyville.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uh, Twilight, when was the last time you saw Pinkie Pie?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Hmmm, not since we told her to stop playing the yovidaphone. I'm still surprised with how well she took it.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I don't think she took it as well as you think she took it.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Is it morning? I hadn't noticed.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: That's not good.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: There you are! We've been looking all over for you!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: It turns out Pinkie may not have taken our critique of her yovidaphone playing in the spirit with which it was intended.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I saw.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: There's gotta be something we can do.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I'm sure there is, Spike. We just have to figure out what.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] I don't get it. So she's no good at playing the yovidaphone. What's the big deal? There are so many other things she's really good at doing.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah! Not bein' able to play the yovidaphone is nothin' compared to all the things she can do well.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And that's exactly what we'll show her! I bet if we get her to do the stuff she likes and is good at doing, she'll cheer right back up and forget all about the yovidaphone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Hoo-whee! That's a great idea!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Let's get started. Apparently, there's not a moment to lose.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: So, I'm guessing nopony had any success?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [sighs] My party cannon idea was a real dud.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Don't blame yourself. None of us did any better.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, not to worry. I came up with the perfect solution. Instead of trying to remind her what she's good at, we'll remind her what she's best at. And that's being our friend. We're gonna throw her a Pinkie Pie Appreciation Party!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: That's a wonderful idea! If anypony needs to know how much she's appreciated, it's Pinkie Pie.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: We can get the whole town involved, just so she can see what a good friend she is to everypony.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Then I hereby officially declare today Pinkie Pie Appreciation Day!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Now this is perfection!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah! If anything could help Pinkie Pie cheer up and make her forget about her yovidaphone, this is definitely it!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Sure is! Okay, who's gonna get her?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: No need. Gummy's on it. In fact, there he is now!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uh, Gummy? You were supposed to bring Pinkie Pie. What happened?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Is she still coming?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Fluttershy, can you understand what he's saying?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I could... if he was talking.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Let me try something. [slowly, loudly, and deliberately] Gummy! Where is Pinkie Pie?!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Maybe we should just go and get her.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: What in tarnation is goin' on here?!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: This decor is dreadful.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And all of Pinkie's stuff is... gone?!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: It is a puzzle.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] Excuse me.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, yes, of course.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Um, Maud? Can I ask you a question?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] You just did.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, can I ask you a question?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] You just did.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [groans] Fine! How about if I ask you a<U+0097> Wait.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, for goodness' sakes! Maud. All of your sister's things are gone. Explain.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] No, they're not. They're right here.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Have you seen Pinkie Pie?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Lots of times. I grew up with her.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Okay, let's try this a different way. Why did you pack up all of Pinkie's things?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] She asked me to.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] Pinkie told me to pack up her room and take everything to the rock farm.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] She said she wouldn't need them since she's moving to Yakyakistan.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Terribly sorry, Maud. Must've misheard you. It almost sounded like you said Pinkie's [chuckling] moved to Yakyakistan!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uh, Rarity? She did say that.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uh, terribly sorry, Applejack. Must've misheard you. It almost sounded like you said [chuckling] she did say that!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Maud, I don't understand. Why would Pinkie leave Ponyville?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah! Why would she want to go live with the yaks?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [deadpan] She said without the yovidaphone, her life had no meaning, and at least in Yakyakistan, she could listen to the masters play. She hoped that would give her some semblance of happiness.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, no! No-no-no-no-no-no-no! That will not do!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I say we go to Yakyakistan right now and make her come back home!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: We can't just march up there and tell Pinkie what to do.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [tearing up] But... we didn't even get a chance to say goodbye!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, we may not be able to go to Yakyakistan and force her to come home, but we could go say goodbye... and if we happen to mention how much her friendship means to us, and how much we'd miss her if she were gone forever, and then she decided to come back home on her own...

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Then what are we waiting around here for?! Let's get going to Yakyakistan!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: We're almost there.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Pinkie's gotta be around here somewhere.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: But where?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Is that...?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: The music of the yovidaphone.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Are you sure? Because that actually sounds kinda... good.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, I'm sure. Come on.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Huh. Not what I expected.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, sorry.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [hushed] I said I was sorry!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [hushed, gasps] There she is!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [gulps] [despondent] Gimme another.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I said, gimme another!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [grunts] Pardon me!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Excuse us.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, uh, sorry!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] I feel nothing.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Maybe we can help with that.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] Oh. Hey. What are you guys doing here?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Just hear us out.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: We respect your decision to move to Yakyakistan.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: But we just wanted to remind you how much you mean to us, and how much we'd miss you if you decided to move here for<U+0097>

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] Fine. I'll move back to Ponyville.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Wow. That was a lot easier than I thought. We're awesome!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Pinkie, what's wrong?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] That's what's wrong. I thought coming here and listening to real yovidaphone playing would make me happy.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] It makes me feel worse. I'm never gonna sound like that.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [despondent] Eh. If I can't play it, I might as well do menial chores for those who can.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Okay, so Pinkie Pie is obviously still miserable.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Oh, I can't bear to see her like this.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Indeed. But what else can we do?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Yeah, we've tried everything!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Maybe not. Look!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [stifled giggling] Whoops! Sorry!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: I forgot what an awful yovidaphoner I am.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Playing it makes you so happy.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [wistfully] [sighs] It sure does. I mean... it did.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Then you should never stop.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: So say we all!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Absolutely.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: But... you were the ones who told me to stop because I wasn't good.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And we were wrong.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Playing makes you happy.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And as long as it makes you happy, it doesn't matter how good you are!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: So get up there and show these yaks how it's done!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [stage whisper] I don't know if you've noticed, but the audience are all yaks, and they kind of have "issues" with things that aren't perfect! Like my playing!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Pinkie Pie, you get up on that stage and play. If these yaks don't like it, they'll have to answer to us!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well, okay... If you all say so...

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [clears throat] Ladies and gentleyaks! Performing for her very first time here, let's give a big round of stomps for... Pinkie Pie!

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: [clears throat] Um, hi! So, uh, any yaks here from out of town?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Uhhh, I kinda wasn't expecting this.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Me, neither.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: You think so? Even though it wasn't perfect?

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: Well if that's the case, lemme play you the song I just wrote two seconds ago! It's called "I've Got the Best Most Supportive Friends a Pony Could Ever Ask For"! [aside] It's a working title.

title: Yakity-Sax
dialog: And a-one...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [dramatically] I don't know, folks. She's been in there a long time!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Do you suppose the Terrifying Trunk Escape is too much for her?! What if the Great and Powerful Trixie can't<U+0097>?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Escape?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: But if you're there, who's in here?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Why, our volunteer, of course!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [coughs] Crabapple surprise! You shoulda oughta tell a pony before ya go a-poofin' 'em around the stage!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Trixie, that was an amazing show!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Flurry Heart and I loved it! I'm so glad we decided to come. You two have a real chemistry.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: The Terrifying Trunk Escape does require a grrrreat and powerful assistant.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: The way you two work together, it's like you've known each other as long as Twilight and I have.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: It was pretty fun.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Of course it was! There's nothing better than a bond with another pony. You can share all kinds of things.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I think we'll stick to the stage magic for now.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: The Great and Powerful Trixie doesn't chant.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] As much as I love my one-pony show, it's always nice to come to Ponyville and perform with my great and powerful assistant. Cadance is right. We do work well together!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Doing a show with you is almost as much fun as counseling students at Twilight's school! [gasps] Which I'm supposed to be doing right now!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: See ya later.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [giggles] Usually, ponies just call me Trixie. But "Ms. Powerful" has a nice ring.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I was just about to set out on tour. [grunts] But Saddle Arabia is much farther than my usual route. [grunts] Ugh!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [laughs] And, uh, my caravan might not be suited for an extended tour.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Trade it?! Heavens, no! This is more than just some great and powerful wagon you see before you! It is shelter. It is transportation. It is my only friend on the long and lonely nights on the road.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: "Many fans", you say? [laughs] Well, I suppose I could consider the trip.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Hmmm...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: It's just so far away. Of course, I love visiting new and exciting places. I am a traveling magician after all.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Hmmm. Sounds like your mind's made up.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Not quite. The road is a lonely place. And this trip even more so. I was hoping I might convince my grrrrreat and powerful assistant to come along?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Really?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Of course! You're not just my assistant and my counselor. You're also my friend. And what's better than a road trip with friends?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Nothing! This will be the best magical road trip ever!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I should probably get somepony to cover my student counseling duties while we're gone.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Trixie, are you all right?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: One caravan for two all set! Oh. You brought luggage. [nervous laugh] I mean, of course you brought luggage!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: You bet I did! Everything two ponies need for the road trip of their lives! Three one-thousand-piece puzzles, one copy of Dragon Pit <U+0096> the best board game in the history of ponies <U+0096> my famous collection of campfire spices, and an inflatable raft. Did I forget something? I could pop back to the castle and grab it.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, no. It isn't that.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Yeah, maybe we don't need the raft.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] We just needed a little great and powerful rrrrreorganization! [struggling] Now, everything... fits.. just... fine!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] Who am I kidding? My wagon is too small for us. I understand if you're having second thoughts.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Second thoughts? [scoffs] Are you kidding? This wagon isn't small. It's... eh... cozy. And there's no such thing as too cozy.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, all right then! I guess it's time to hit the road! [struggling] I'll... start us off...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [coughs] Okay. Maybe there is such a thing as too cozy.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: You're sure you wouldn't rather ride?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I'm sure.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: And you're not backing out? The two of us sleeping in that cozy caravan could get tricky.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Trixie, there's plenty of high-quality inns to stay at on the way. Don't worry about it. I'm not backing out of the greatest and most powerful road trip bonding experience two ponies could ever have.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, when you put it like that, I'm actually kind of excited!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Me, too! [sighs] Thank goodness we're not like Twilight or the others. They'd probably sing a song about it.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Beats walking though, eh, Trix?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: But road trips are a great way, we've been told, to get along

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I'm glad we're sticking to it, we've already got a song

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Our bond of friendship is stronger than this tour's demands

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Wait, what did he say?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Nothing!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Sure is great traveling with you, buddy!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: You too, buddy!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Yes, we are!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Any trip can be exhausting if you make a fuss

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: But we get on so well that's there no way that could be us

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Was that off-key?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: In summer, winter, spring, and fall, we're friends throughout the year

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: For untold seasons yet to come,  our friendship will be here

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: For nine, at least!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [quickly] Like a race where you tie your hooves together and you have to move in perfect synchronization to win!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [quickly] Or like a buddy movie where the two protagonists can't get away from each other because they're wearing hoof-cuffs!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Ooh, the marketplace. Perfect! I've learned the hard way that life on the road requires very specific supplies. And we only have so many bits. So we'll have to spend them wise...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] Sorry about wasting bits on street food.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, it's fine. Falafel bonding, right? [laughs] Besides, we still have enough for... haycakes and juice.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Um, why don't we go there?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, no-no-no. I always buy my haycakes here.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: So we're just going to wait in line for hours? Uh, which is totally cool! Waiting-in-line bonding! Right?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: After our falafel purchase, we weren't able to get everything on my list. But we are definitely set for breakfast.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: And I'm sure we'll find out that waiting in that super-long line was worth it.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: A few hiccups always happen. We'll be back on the road to friendship after a good night's sleep.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Uh, I'm sure we'll find something.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [laughs, to Starlight] You said there'd be plenty of places to stay. "Don't even worry about it," you said. Ya might've thought to make a reservation!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Um, I've been with you singing and standing in line. When would I have done that?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I don't know. But I'm starting to think you aren't as great and powerful an assistant as I thought!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: So you just brought me along to do your legwork?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] No. Of course not. I'm sorry. I'm just frustrated. I was really looking forward to a relaxing night in a nice room.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sighs] Me, too. But since there's literally no room at the inns, I guess it's lucky we've got the wagon.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [unenthusiastically] Sleeping-in-tight-quarters bonding.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Is there something I can do to make things more comfortable for you?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: You could get rid of this junk.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Yes, well, before we throw away the magical items it's taken me years to collect, we could try switching hammocks.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Fine.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [gasps] Hmm? [whispering] Starlight! Starlight! I think there's a wild animal outside!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Starlight?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Starlight!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [startled noises] What?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I'm sorry. Your snoring is a bit, um...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Loud? [nervous laugh] Yeah, I do that. I had my village convinced we were being attacked by bears every night.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [laughs, clears throat] But we probably need a better solution here.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sleepily muttering] Ladies and gentleponies... Great and Powerful Trixie... amazing feats...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Seriously?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [sleepily muttering] Prepare to be amazed...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [grumpily] Sleep well?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [grumpily] Sure did.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Is, uh, that the last of the haycakes?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [chomps] Oh. Yeah. Sorry.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: It's fine.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I don't suppose there's any more juice.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [glugs] Ahhh! Nah. I guess we'll have to resupply.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Is he gonna be following us for the whole time?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I do not know.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [flatly] She's been in there a long time. Do you suppose the Terrifying Trunk Escape is too much for a pony who drinks all the juice and talks non-stop in her sleep?! What if the Great and Powerful Trixie can't...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Sleep?! Because her roommate snores like an ursa major?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [flatly] But if you're there, who's in here?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: At least you don't have to sleep in it with another pony!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh. Would you like the last carrot? I know how fond you are of eating the last of things.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, no. It might make me thirsty, and we don't have anything to drink. So...

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: The good news is I'm so exhausted, I could sleep through a stampede of wild boars! Which, you'll be delighted to know, is only slightly louder than your snoring.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, I'm looking forward to rehearsing the act with you all night. So diligent of you to go over it and over it in your sleep.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [through gritted teeth] Practice makes perfect.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Not today, it didn't.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, I'm sorry you're so miserable!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Really?! Because if you wanted to make things more comfortable, you could always pare down a bit!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, since you're so concerned about space, you can have it all! I'll sleep under the stars, where at least the wild animals will be QUIETER THAN YOU!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [derisive laugh] Ya think?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [gasps] Where's my wagon?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I traded it to that pony from Saddle Arabia for his. He even threw in a pair of robes.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: You what?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I traded the old, worn-out wagon that was too small for us, for this nice spacious one that we can both enjoy.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [stammering] Who said you could do that?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Nopony. I just did it. [sighs] Now we both have plenty of room, and you didn't even have to give anything away.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Au contraire. I did give something away! I gave away my wagon... and my best friend!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh! I'm sorry! I didn't realize you were better friends with that beat-up old wagon than you are with me!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, it's easy when the wagon is a better friend! It would've never traded you away!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: That's ridiculous.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, it is ridiculous. In fact, this whole tour is ridiculous! I don't even know why I invited you in the first place!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Well, maybe I should just head home!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I think that's a very good idea! And you can take this horrible giant caravan with you!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Fine!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Good!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [grunting] Come on! Whoa!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Normally, that sort of flattery would suffice. But today, we must discuss your dishonest and unfair procurement of my wagon!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Unfortunately, it is more nuanced than that!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Ha! We'll just see about that!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [grumbles] Details!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [struggling] You all seemed... a lot less threatening when there were two of us!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: [gasps, yells] This place is awful! How did I not see it before?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Thank you. No.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: What are you two doing?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Taking a stand! By lying down! Not that you care, Wagon-Trader-Away-er!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Trixie, I came back to apologize. I should never have traded away the wagon. It wasn't mine to trade. It belongs to my friend.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Okay! Fine! We're friends! Best friends who share a deep bond who weren't prepared for the emotional challenges of traveling. Happy?!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: How?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Uh, we could do our friendship chant!

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Oh, right... Our world-famous chant of friendship that we do all the time because we're such great friends.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: So you'll give back the wagon?

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: That's fair.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I'm sorry your Saddle Arabian tour was ruined.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: Honestly, I don't think I could've stood one more second on the road. At a certain point, I don't even like traveling with myself.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: It is a lot harder than I thought. Still, I'm glad we tried. Mostly so we know not to do it again.

title: Road to Friendship
dialog: I think it's made our friendship greater and more powerful than ever!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Order, order, everypony! I hereby call to order this meeting of the Rainbow Dash Fan Club!

title: The Washouts
dialog: First order of business <U+0096> [quickly] Let's-celebrate-the-one-and-only-Rainbow-Dash-yay-she's-amazing-now-if-there's-nothing-else-that-concludes-this-meeting-of-the-Rainbow-Dash-Fan-Club-thank-you-all-for-coming-any-questions?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Huh?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Meeting adjourned!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I'd like to call to order the first ever meeting of the newest and most exciting club <U+0096> of which I am the president, founding, and only member <U+0096> the Washouts Fan Club!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Oh, hey, Scootaloo. I was just in the neighbor<U+0097> Oh! What's this? Did I interrupt your fan club meeting?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Hey! What are you doin' here?

title: The Washouts
dialog: I could ask you the same question!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Oh, uh, y'know... mmm... s-s-stuff. Uh, definitely not starting a new fan club or anything.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ha! It's no use pretending! I heard everything when I was outside eavesdropping, like I do for every meeting!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You eavesdrop on every meeting? That's weird.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Well, sure it sounds weird when you say it out loud. And I probably shouldn't because eavesdropping is wrong, but still. Why are you starting a new fan club?

title: The Washouts
dialog: I just think maybe it's time for me to explore other fan clubs.

title: The Washouts
dialog: [gasps] What is a "The Washouts"?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Only the newest, and greatest, and only stunt troupe in Equestria!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Stunt troupe?

title: The Washouts
dialog: "Twenty bajillion"?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: They do all sorts of extreme stunts that focus on daredevilry and sheer guts rather than boring old flight and formation junk.

title: The Washouts
dialog: "Boring old flight and formation junk"?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Are you just repeating everything I say?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Only because my brain feels like it's strapped to one of those rockets about to explode.

title: The Washouts
dialog: So you do get it! Aren't they awesome?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Can you believe she actually said that?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Pfft, well, yeah! Eavesdropping on every meeting is kinda weird.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I mean, she basically said that the Wonderbolts aren't cool! And... And it kinda sounded like she didn't think I was cool either. But, peh, we all know that's crazy! I mean, I'm definitely not worried about her looking up to somepony else. Heh. Nope. Not! At! All!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Well, I'd understand if you were. It'd be like if Apple Bloom started lovin' bananas more than apples. [laughs, sotto voce] Y'all tell me if that ever happens, ya hear?

title: The Washouts
dialog: But what could the Washouts possibly have that I don't?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Why don't you find out?

title: The Washouts
dialog: They're doing a show in Ponyville this weekend?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Wow! They do look pretty amazing... uh, -ly unamazing. [nervous laugh] Trying so hard to look amazing is what I mean.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Awww. I knew we shoulda lined up last night.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Look at this! It's a total Wonderbolts ripoff!

title: The Washouts
dialog: What do you mean? The show hasn't even started yet.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Yeah, but look at what we're sitting on.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Hello?! The Wonderbolts have bleachers, too! We practically invented sitting on bleachers!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ugh!

title: The Washouts
dialog: And look at that! Popcorn and cotton candy?! Ripoff!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Huh? Yeeeeeeeaaaahhh!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Mmmm! Quality confetti cannon work.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Oh, yeah!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Woo-hoo!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Lame.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Whoa. Come on, come on! She's not gonna make it!

title: The Washouts
dialog: That... was... insane! Woo-hoo!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I told you!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I mean... [clears throat] It was pretty cool. Who are these guys?

title: The Washouts
dialog: I can't just go up and talk to them.

title: The Washouts
dialog: You can if you're with me. After all, one of the reasons there's a Rainbow Dash fan club is because I'm fearless. Observe.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Hey!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Uh, so as a fellow aerobatic professional, I really enjoyed your show. Heh. Actually, you might recognize me since I'm a... pause for dramatic effect... a Wonderbolt.

title: The Washouts
dialog: O... kay...

title: The Washouts
dialog: No way!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Cool!

title: The Washouts
dialog: What's your story?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Uhhh... Okay. So, who's the leader?

title: The Washouts
dialog: [gasps] Lightning Dust!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Rainbow Dash!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Scootaloo. I'm Scootaloo. Hi.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Lightning Dust! I should've known you were the brains behind a crazy idea like the Washouts! Or should I say, "lack of brains"!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You two really know each other? Oh, my gosh! This is so cool!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Your "friend" got me kicked out of the Wonderbolts.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Oh. That's, uh, less cool.

title: The Washouts
dialog: And it was the best thing that ever happened to me! Great to see you, wingpony! I heard you're a full-fledged Bolt now.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Yeah, well, I'm still<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: Mad at me? Look, was it wrong of me to endanger the lives of your friends? Yeah. But, hey, now I only endanger these knuckleheads.

title: The Washouts
dialog: C'mon, you know you miss me. Me and her, we blew everypony out of the sky.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Really?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Actually, yeah, really! All that wind was totally dangerous, but we had fun, right? Two fastest times on the Dizzitron!

title: The Washouts
dialog: If I remember correctly, I had you beat by half a second.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Only because when I went, I cranked up the dizziness factor.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Well, I'm glad it all worked out. Your show was pretty dynamite.

title: The Washouts
dialog: [to Scootaloo] Wanna know the secret? We basically ignore everything the Wonderbolts ever taught us about safety.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Well, we do have safety rules for a reason.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Don't listen to her, kid. All their "rules" were just ways of keeping their little club exclusive so they could feel good about themselves.

title: The Washouts
dialog: It's not about making anypony feel bad. It's about finding the best flyers. The best of the best.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I started the Washouts because I believe anypony can be the best of the best. You know, Rolling Thunder is gonna be out for a while.

title: The Washouts
dialog: There's a spot on the team if you wanna join up.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I appreciate the offer, but I'm already a Wonderbolt.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I'll do it! Can I do it?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Uh, lemme think. No!

title: The Washouts
dialog: [scoffs] I wasn't asking you!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Awww, you're cute. But technically, you haven't washed out of the Bolts, which is kinda our thing.

title: The Washouts
dialog: And also, no!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Oh, what if I joined and dropped out super quick?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: That's it! You're comin' with me!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Where are we going?

title: The Washouts
dialog: To hear what the actual Wonderbolts think about you joining just to drop out for the Washouts!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Say hi to Spitfire for me!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ever seen two simultaneous inverse displacement rolls before?

title: The Washouts
dialog: [scoffs] Would've been a lot cooler if you had the Crushinator Jaws of Smashalot, patent pending.

title: The Washouts
dialog: You... What?! [to Spitfire] See? This is what I was telling you about.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I got this. [to Scootaloo] You know what happens when something goes wrong with the Crushinator Jaws of Smashalot?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Patent pending?

title: The Washouts
dialog: You end up in a full body wing-and-hoof cast drinkin' through a straw!

title: The Washouts
dialog: But with enough practice<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: Practice?! Well, la-dee-doodle-dah! Lemme give you a different scenario. You're probably saying to yourself, "I'm young. I'm strong. I'm gonna go out there and stunt some tricks with my new friend Lightning Dust!" Well, I'm here to tell ya that if ya play that game, you're gonna find out it's pretty hard to "stunt tricks" in a full body wing-and-hoof cast drinkin' through a straw!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I think she gets the poi<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: I'm not finished! Listen, I get it, kid. I used to be like you, tellin' myself, "I'm gonna touch the sky!"

title: The Washouts
dialog: I don't<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: Well, whoop-dee-doodle-doo! You think you got it made in the shade? Well, things are gonna be pretty shady indeed when you can't go out in the sun, 'cause you're in a full body wing-and-hoof cast drinkin' through a straw! Do I make myself clear?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: [shakily] Uh-huh...

title: The Washouts
dialog: Excellent. Have a hat.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Uh... Heh. Sorry that was a little... intense. I just wanna make sure you don't get hurt. That way, you can follow in my hoofsteps. Heh. Everypony's dream, right?

title: The Washouts
dialog: More like "follow your wingflaps".

title: The Washouts
dialog: Same difference.

title: The Washouts
dialog: [sarcastically] Thanks, super-talented flyer, for clearing up what I should do.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Clearing things up is one of my specialties. Now, come on. Let's go rip up all your Washout posters into tiny pieces and throw 'em off a cliff.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I just thought of a great way to raise awareness for your original fan club. You know, the one about me?

title: The Washouts
dialog: How about a silent auction where every item is just a picture of yours truly? [laughs] Nah! I'm just kidding.

title: The Washouts
dialog: That makes me seem too egotistical, doesn't it? Oh, oh! Maybe if they're framed, it's like, "Wow, she's so humble!" Ya think? Scootaloo?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Uh, Scootaloo?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Anypony seen Scootalo<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ow! My fault, my fault! Sorry, I<U+0097> Twilight?

title: The Washouts
dialog: [groans] Sorry. I was just... um...

title: The Washouts
dialog: Please tell me you got that stuff so you could rip it up and throw it off a cliff.

title: The Washouts
dialog: They were doing an autograph session before practice.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Seriously?! [groans] You haven't seen Scoot, have you?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Actually...

title: The Washouts
dialog: I can't believe Scootaloo ditched me to watch them practice! Why can't she see how dangerous they are?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: That's kind of the whole draw. It's exciting.

title: The Washouts
dialog: But it's like the harder I try to convince Scoot they're dangerous, the more she likes them!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You can't control her actions. Only yours. Teach her what's safe and what isn't, like a good role model. Then hope she makes the right decisions.

title: The Washouts
dialog: But what if she chooses them over me? She's gonna get hurt!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I think I know somepony else who might get hurt if that happens.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Um, maybe you're right. But this isn't about me. I'm just worried about Scoot.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Sorry, Dash. Autograph session's over. Unless you wanna buy Short Fuse's limited edition half-eaten tomato sandwich.

title: The Washouts
dialog: You haven't seen Scootaloo, have you?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ohhhh, isn't she that pony that used to respect you?

title: The Washouts
dialog: [growls] I'd appreciate you helping me find her so I could apologize for trying to make her quit liking you.

title: The Washouts
dialog: [laughs] Oh, I'm pretty sure she still likes us.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Lightning Dust, I know we go way back, but I can't let her do this!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I don't need you standing up for me!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Obviously, you do! Because you can't see how dangerous this is! Do you not remember what Spitfire said?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Ugh. Lemme guess. [imitating Spitfire] You'll be in a full-body wing-and-hoof cast drinkin' through a straw!

title: The Washouts
dialog: That doesn't even sound like Spitfire.

title: The Washouts
dialog: That's it! We're leaving!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Just because I look up to you doesn't mean I have to be you! But based on your definition of what makes somepony great, I have bad news. I'll never be the best of the best or a Wonderbolt! Because I! Can't! Fly! Is that what you wanted to hear? But not being able to fly doesn't mean I can't do something awesome! Like strapping my scooter to a multi-stage liquid-fueled rocket and jumping twenty-two wagons lined up in front of a roaring crowd!

title: The Washouts
dialog: That was awfully specific.

title: The Washouts
dialog: That's 'cause it's what she'll be doing in the show tonight. Half off for princesses! [whispering] Bring your friends!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Scootaloo, are you sure that's what you really wanna do?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Absolutely. [to Rainbow] And there's nothing you can do to stop me!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You're right. You're your own foal, and you have to make your own decisions.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Good! Because I already have!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Hoo-wee! Looks like all of Ponyville is here. Except for Rainbow Dash.

title: The Washouts
dialog: In just a moment, the newest member of the Washouts will be rocket-sledding down that hill, up that ramp, and over all twenty-two wagons to land on the other side in one piece! Heh. If she's lucky.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Put your hooves together for Half-Pint Dynamite!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Lightning Dust, I have to tell you. I actually started Equestria's first Washouts fan club! As far as I know. So this is a real honor, ma'am! Uh, do I call you "ma'am"?

title: The Washouts
dialog: You land this jump, you can call me whatever you want.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Wow. That sure is...

title: The Washouts
dialog: Dangerous? Nah! Well, maybe a little.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Has anypony tested it before?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Where's the fun in that?

title: The Washouts
dialog: There's m-more?!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You're not thinking of backing out, are you?

title: The Washouts
dialog: No! I'm just thinking about drinking through straws.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Are you the president of my fan club or not?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Of course! It's just<U+0097>

title: The Washouts
dialog: You wouldn't wanna get impeached for dishonoring my wishes, would you?

title: The Washouts
dialog: I... Is that a thing?

title: The Washouts
dialog: Light it up!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Okay. Now I am thinking about backing out.

title: The Washouts
dialog: Too late!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I know I was supposed to let you make your own decisions, but that doesn't mean I can't swoop in and save you from time to time.

title: The Washouts
dialog: If I'd known you were gonna bail, I would've done the trick myself!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Great! So you won't mind how that rope's about to coil around your hoof.

title: The Washouts
dialog: RIVALS FOR LIIIIIFE!

title: The Washouts
dialog: Wouldn't have it any other way!

title: The Washouts
dialog: I'm sorry for joining the Washouts. Lightning Dust wasn't who I thought she was. She didn't care about me being scared or putting me in danger. She only wanted a good show, even if it meant I got hurt. That's not the kind of pony I wanna look up to.

title: The Washouts
dialog: I'm the one who should be apologizing for not acting like somepony who deserves a fan club. I've been lucky enough to have somepony who thinks I'm the coolest. But there's nothing cool about making you feel like you'll never be as awesome as me. I think we should cancel the Washouts Fan Club. Because I know a fan club that could use some new members.

title: The Washouts
dialog: The Rainbow Dash Fan Club!

title: The Washouts
dialog: [clears throat] Welcome to the first ever meeting of the newest fan club for the awesomest, previously under-appreciated pony in Ponyville! With founding member and president Rainbow Dash presiding, it's the... Scootaloo Fan Club!

title: The Washouts
dialog: You know, Rainbow Dash was right. Eavesdropping on your own fan club isn't weird at all.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [grunting and laughing] You're going to have to work faster than that if you plan to dig up my whole village, lass. Let me help.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye. This place is full of memories. Did I tell you about the time our chieftain knocked down five boulders with the kick of a wee ball?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But... [stutters] That's what this is for.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Agh! Next you'll be sayin' I shouldn't have used the old sweat lodge.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Of course, Professor Fossil! We'd be honored to have a Pillar of Equestria on our staff!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [slurps, crunch] Ugh! [spits, groans] That apple's made of wood! What a horrible trick to play!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hmm. Has anypony seen my decorative centerpieces? They were right here.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: So, join me in welcoming Professor Rockhoof to our faculty!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Thank you! Thank you, all! I know I'm new to your world, but there's one thing I learned when I saved my village from a rushing river of hot lava. There's nothing you can't do with hard work. And a shovel!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Except maybe stand on stage.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: So, um... everycreature dismissed. We'll... see you in class!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: You think that new pony is gonna be the weirdest teacher at school or just one of the weirdest?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yona like new teacher. He big like yak!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: And he smashes things like a yak, smells like a yak...

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yes! He perfect!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Guys, he's one of the Pillars! He's like... pony history!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hello, class!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Eh, um... [clears throat] I'm, uh, your new "Theory and Defense of Friendship" teacher.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But, uh, I haven't had a chance to look at Headmare Twilight's notes yet. What have you all been learnin'?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: We just studied all about how Princess Celestia and Luna used a spell to trap Discord in stone sleep for hundreds of moons.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Ohhhh-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho! So it's a class about stories, is it?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Stories! Yeah! And we never, ever, ever get homework!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Good! The best way to teach colts and fillies is by experience. Like the time I was in the woods and I ran across an ursa major!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Really?!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: We're not doing that, right?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: You fight ursa major? All alone?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye. And I defeated her, too.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Now this I'm interested in!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: How Professor Rockhoof win?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Well... that's quite a tale.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: From what Professor Fossil said, it sounds like Rockhoof just hasn't settled into modern times yet. Our school is the perfect place for that. Plus, we get a new teacher.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [chuckles] This may be the fastest friendship problem you ever solved.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Dodge! Thrust! Shovel leap! Shovel throw!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Shovel whack! Now you lot be the ursa major. Lots o' growlin', mind?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Maybe classrooms were less breakable in the old days?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Ooh-ooh-ooh! What happened next?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [laughing] The huge beastie jumped out of the moonlit mist, her fearsome fangs at my throat! But I rolled clear.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Then what?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: She backed me up against a wall, ready to pounce!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I looked at her. She looked at me. And I say<U+0097>!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Uh, Professor Rockhoof?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Nope! Guess again! [clears throat] Uh, oops.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Sorry to interrupt. Class, why don't we go ahead and take lunch early today? Rockhoof, can we take a walk outside?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Our school is about finding your own special way to teach.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But maybe you could do a little less smashing in the classroom?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I know it's a big change. But I think you're gonna fit in just<U+0097>

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Fire!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Rockhoof, wait!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No time! The building's ablaze! We have to get everypony out!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Professor Rockhoof best teacher ever! [sighs] Day cannot get better.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Let's get you outside, wee ones!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Day just got better!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Alley-oop!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Rockhoof?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: What are you doing?!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Savin' the school!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Just like fightin' a volcano in the good old days!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Would somepony kindly explain what is the meaning of all this water?!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I'm not sure. But I think it's surf's up! Woo-hoo! Cowabunga!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Sorry, Rarity, but I had to put out the ragin' inferno.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Inferno? Where?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Did you not see the smoke and flame?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yeah, that was us. You know, dragons? Having a fire-breathing competition?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: You, uh... what?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [panting] They do it all the time. That's what we were trying to tell you.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: We know you're used to bein' a hero, Rockhoof. Only what we need here is a teacher.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: One who doesn't ruin an entire class's friendship quilts. Do you know how hard it is to stitch a pineapple pattern?!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [sighs] My deepest apologies. I'm not used to living with dragons or much else in this modern time. Professor Fossil made it clear I'm not welcome back in my old village. Seems I don't belong here either.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Wheeeee!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: So apparently, finding Rockhoof a new job is a lot harder than we thought. Has anypony had any luck?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I-I thought you were gonna try him out at the post office.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: We did.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [yelling] Do you know where I can find Cranky Doodle Donkey?! I need to deliver his medicine! He has a rash in a very embarrassing place!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [shudders] I did not need to hear that.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yup. Rockhoof's time as a spa masseuse didn't work out either.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Now just let me know if this is too much pressure!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: W-Well, at least Rockhoof's really strong. Maybe we could find him a job carrying heavy stuff?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I tried that already. Zecora needed somepony to help her get supplies, but...

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I know you said you only needed a few leaves, but I figured why not bring you the whole thing?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Oh, how horrid.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: None of the other Pillars seem to be having trouble fitting into the modern world.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Then maybe they can show Rockhoof how they did it. Get him used to livin' in this time.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Great idea! Rockhoof's old friends would be happy to help. And I bet he'd love to visit them.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [sighs] Even Canterlot looks different from the old days.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aww. I'm sure once you see your old pal Flash Magnus, you'll feel right at home.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Flash Magnus, as I live and breathe! Is this your squadron?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Princess Celestia was happy to find a new drill sergeant for her guard!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Uh... that's great. She really put you in a job that big so soon?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: They made you the royal landscape artist for the Crystal Empire?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Wow...

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Your work is beautiful.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
