dialog: You always could find the beauty in things. But there's not much demand for shovel ponies like me nowadays.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [whispering] Somnambula's a motivational speaker. Bet they didn't even have those back in your time.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [whispering] Because we didn't need them. Ponies knew what to do with their lives.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Guess he wished he could take a nap?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Mage Meadowbrook, your home looks just the same as the old days. Wish I could say the same for mine.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Thing is, I can't do my old job like Flash. Or adapt like Mistmane. Or succeed at something new like Somnambula. Or go home, like you.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yeah! And I bet Stygian took plenty o' time to fit in.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hey, look what I found! Me and My Shadow, the third hit novel by former villain Stygian! I'm impressed! He's really thriving!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Rockhoof? Where are you going?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I'm not sure. Maybe I just don't belong in this modern world.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Now this here's a right mash of apples. 'Stead of solvin' Rockhoof's problem, we made him feel even worse.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I'll tell you the real problem here. We haven't given Rockhoof the chance to be who he really is.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: A pony with a metal shovel and a heart of gold?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Ugh. A hero! What we need to do is find him a job that's as epic as he is!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hmm. I might know just the thing.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I'm honored to serve in the Hippogriff Navy, General Seaspray! I promise I'll prove my worth.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Like you didn't fit in, no matter how hard you tried?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: [whispering, to Twilight Sparkle] Uh, why do the Hippogriffs need ships if they can turn into seaponies?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Maybe they just like cruises?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Wait, General! We can navigate the same way my Coltic ancestors traveled through the Selkie Mists! We'll look to the stars! There in the northwest sky is the constellation O'Bridle's Pelt! Steer the ship toward that!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yee-haw! Rockhoof did it!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But... I don't understand! The stars have always steered me true!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Oh, no. Stars can move slowly over time. They must look different now than over a thousand years ago.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hey, mistakes happen. We'll think of something else for you to do.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Oh, there's no need, lass. I already know what I want to do next.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Really? What?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I heard there's a statue spell that sends creatures into stone sleep. I want you to cast it. On me.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yes!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hey, guys. Need me to help you decide something?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Rockhoof wants me to cast a spell to turn him into a statue! The answer is no!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Whoa. I thought you were arguing over ice cream flavors.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: The answer is still no! Why would you want to be turned into stone?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Because I'm a relic of a bygone age. I belong in a museum. Safe. Preserved. Untouched. I don't belong in this time. It's up to you to make that right.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But there has to be a better way!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Twilight, please understand. I want to be remembered as the hero I was, not the disappointment I've become.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But you're not! Rockhoof, wait! Spike, can you teach my class today?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Uh, you're not really going to turn him to stone, are you?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Only because it's temporary. As soon as I think of a new solution, we'll wake Rockhoof up. I know he has more to offer the world as a pony than a statue.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Did you hear Rockhoof caught all the bees in the Everfree Forest and gave 'em to Zecora as a gift?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Wow! Terramar said Rockhoof called down the stars and sunk the whole Hippogriff Navy!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: He's definitely weird, but in a fun way. You never know what's gonna happen next with him.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Professor Rockhoof best pony!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hey, class. Welcome to the Theory and Defense of Friendship.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Another sub? Let me start by telling you we don't get homework and we only do field trips.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yeeeeah. Nice try. Twilight sent me to tell you she won't be in today 'cause she has to cast a stone sleep spell on Rockhoof.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Like Discord?! But why?! Rockhoof isn't a bad guy!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: ["I don't know" sound] Your instructions are to write an essay on heroism and what it means to you.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Oh, don't worry. It doesn't have to be a long essay.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Maybe like this? Or on three legs? Hmm. What will give the wee birds fewer places to, uh... decorate?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Professor Rockhoof! Dragon said you want to turn into stone! Yona not believe it!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye, I'm afraid it's true, lass.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But... pony need finish ursa major story for class!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Oh, it's sweet of you to try to get me to stay, Yona. But I'm afraid old stories like mine aren't worth anything in this day and age.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Fine! If pony no want tell Yona story, then Yona tell pony story! From class report! [reading] "When Yona come to pony school, Yona not fit in. Pony ways strange. But Yona find friends! Yona meet Professor Rockhoof! Pony brave and strong as yak! Not afraid! Hero! When Yona grow up, Yona want to be just like Professor Rockhoof!"

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Well, uh, since you went to the trouble of writing something that nice, I suppose the least I could do is tell you the rest of the story.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Yona tell whole school Rockhoof is best! Now all want to hear story!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Okay, I have the spell. But will you please reconsider? Rockhoof?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: The ursa major tried to grab me by the gullet! But I ducked her claws!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: She had me cornered. So I look at her. She looks at me.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: And I say, "Sorry you won't be having any dinner tonight, lass! Guess you'll just have to... grin and bear it!"

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: And then I tossed her away with my shovel high into the sky! And she's been a constellation up there ever since! Or so I'm told. And that's the end of my story.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: No, no. Thank you for listening. But it's time to say goodbye.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Wait. You said there wasn't anything in this time you were good at. What about telling stories?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: It was just a tall tale.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: One that captured the hearts and imagination of everycreature here.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Plus, pony story super fun!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: As the Princess of Friendship, I'd like to appoint you as Equestria's official keeper of tales!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Can you do that?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Eh.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: I, uh... That's very kind of you. But I still think these old bones are more suited to a museum display.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: You are a living record of our history. Your stories can inspire and teach generations to come. If you're a statue, that's all lost.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: But will I ever really belong in your world?

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Rockhoof Yona's friend. So Rockhoof belongs!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: You know... That reminds me of another story. Once, there was a small yak that knew more than a great hero.

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Hey, don't forget the dragons in this one!

title: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
dialog: Aye, there were dragons. And ponies. And plenty of Hippogriffs. Plus a changeling and a griffon...

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Tree of Harmony remains one of the most powerful sources of magic known to ponydom. And though it has been at the "root" of magic and friendship from the moment it was planted, its ways are mysterious. Almost as if it has a mind of its own.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Mind? [scoffs] It's a tree.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: A tree that grew a castle.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Was that before or after Discord made chocolate rain?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [whispers] After.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm never gonna learn pony history!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You can all show me what you've learned on tomorrow's test <U+0096> "Friendship's Effect on the Course of Equestrian History".

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Remember! Study groups are both fun and effective!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: So, who wants to study together?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: With other students? This is Equestria! If you want the real scoop, there's only one place to go. Hello, oh maaaaagical Equestrian tree! Can you tell me everything I need to know about friendship?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Elements of Harmony grew the Tree?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: No! The Pillars grew the Tree.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Tree grew the Elements, and then the box with six locks.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: But our professors found six keys and unlocked the box.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm so gonna fail.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You guys! Check this out!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: That's a plumbing diagram on how to fix a sink.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What does that have to do with Equestrian history?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Nothing. I just can't believe that's how sinks work! Where's Yona?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [laughs] Apparently, [imitating Yona] yaks no love study groups!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [snoring] Spider! No!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Hey, Cozy. What are you doing here?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I volunteered to help Professor Sparkle organize these books. So, experts on Equestrian history yet?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I think I'd be better off studying the plumbing book. This stuff is impossible.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Oh, come on, Gallus! With good friends and solid study habits, anything is possible!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: How about you just tell us what's on tomorrow's test, professor?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Now, hold on a sec. I can't give y'all a sneak peek. That there wouldn't be honest.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [clears throat] Golly, it's so inspiring how relaxed you all are about studying friendship, considering your disadvantage.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What cute pony mean?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Just consider where you all came from. If Sandbar hadn't sacrificed so much of his time to get you up to speed, who knows how behind you'd be?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: That's... not what<U+0097>

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [to Ocellus] I mean, growing up as a love-starved changeling? [to Silverstream] Or hiding underwater from an evil king all those years? Trusting anycreature must be so hard for you. [to Gallus] And griffons never want to be around anycreature, even other griffons. [to Smolder] And dragons are so fierce compared to us. There must be days you can't wait to get away from all us cute ponies. [to Yona, imitating Yona] "Everypony know yaks think yaks are best!" Making friends with any other creature must seem like a step down. It's just so impressive how you keep trying to understand friendship, even though it isn't in your nature. Oh! I'll let you borrow my notes! It's what friends do. I'll be right back!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We... should... get back to studying.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Could you stop that clicking?! I'm trying to focus!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Dude!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What? We have a test. I don't know every detail about every adventure the professors went on like you do.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: That's why we're studying together.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Right. To help us "disadvantaged" creatures.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yona confused. Why we all upset?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I only glanced at that plumbing book, but I'm pretty sure this isn't supposed to be here.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What are you doing?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Dragon. Strange magical cave. What do you think I'm doing?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Did we know this was down here?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I don't think anypony knows this is down here.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Headmare Twilight? Where are we?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Uh, Yona confused.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We were studying friendship's effect on history, but then...

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Since friendship just isn't in our nature, what's the point?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Our headmare is glowing, you guys. What is going on?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We should probably get back to studying for the test.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Ooh!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Mount Aris? Headmare Twilight sent me home? Wait. Am I suspended? Hello? Anygriff here? Hmm. They must be topside.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Storm King?! He's back?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Big room. No exits. Big deal.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Nothing for yaks to be afraid of. Just empty cave. Nothing in here can hurt<U+0097>

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: ...Yona.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Ugh. Things like this just don't happen in the Dragon Lands. Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: No. On so many levels. No.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [gasps] Why do you look like that?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Not me.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [whimpers, gasps] Nooooo!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [gasps] My first friendship adventure! Yes! Count me in! Oh, I've been waiting for this<U+0097> Wait! The others!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Aah! Come on, Gallus. Get it together. Deep breaths. [inhaling and exhaling] Ah... Ahh... Achoo!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [panicked whimpering] Okay. If this is a test, there's got to be a way out. It's just a puzzle... that will squash you if you don't figure it out.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Oops.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [groans] Look. I have to get out of here and find my friends. So just tell me what I have to do to pass this test. I'm not afraid of anything.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Just this once. [clears throat, cute voice] May I have some tea, please?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Okay. But let's keep this between us.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yona... no mean to scream. Yona love making friends. Spiders friends?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Wait. What little spider say?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What happened to you?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What happened to you?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You never saw any of that. Got it?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Maybe the others got out already and we're the last ones?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [sarcastic] Yeah, that totally seems like something they would do.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [groans] Any other dragon or griffon would save themselves and get out of this crazy cave.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Guess we aren't just any dragon or griffon anymore.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Guess not. You go that way. I'll check over there.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Wait. I really should find my friends.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Huh? Ocellus?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Go away.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We're still in those weird caves beneath the school. We've gotta get out of here. [gasps] Chrysalis! Where's Ocellus?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Hello?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Where are<U+0097>? Whoa!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Shhhh! The Storm King will hear you!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Storm King? He was defeated. We're still under the school. This is all just some crazy test.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Okay, that's horrifying.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I can't find any Hippogriffs or seaponies. They must all be captured! Gallus! Get back down here!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: It's not real.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yes, it is! He's back, and I'm never gonna see another sunset or fly through a cloud bank or study plumbing! He's gonna take away everything I love! I'm gonna be trapped down here forever!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm afraid of being trapped, too! I'm scared of small spaces.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Really?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yeah. And I was stuck in a room that kept shrinking. But I realized I had to face my fear, and I found the way out. This is your test. He isn't really here.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: But what if he is?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Then tell him exactly what you think of him.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Ha-ha! I did it! I told him!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Okay. Heh. Hug time later. W-We still have to get back to the library.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You're a changeling. Just change back.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I can't.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Maybe my past was so horrible, it's still inside me just waiting to come out again.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: That's ridiculous. That's not who you are anymore. You've changed.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Maybe we can't really change that much.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [muffled] I like cute, silly stuff.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm sorry, what?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I like cute, silly stuff! But ever since school started, I've realized that sometimes I kinda don't mind cute stuff.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: If a dragon like me can admit she likes tea parties, that's proof we can change. I was gonna invite you to a top-secret tea party with me, but if you want to stay down here...

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Oh! No! I want to come!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I thought that might work. Come on, let's go!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Where's Yona and Sandbar?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The way out is closing!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We aren't leaving without them!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yona find you guys!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Hey, Yona. Who's your... spider army?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yona always scared of spiders. But then Yona meet Spindle.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yona realize no reason to be afraid. Spiders and yak friends! So Yona ask new friends to help finding old friends!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Do you think your new friends can help us find Sandbar?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Of all the strange things that have happened tonight, that's the strangest, right?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Okay, enough! I'm not going anywhere without my friends!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I've always looked up to you. You would never turn your back on each other, and that's what makes you strong. Now I have a group of friends that I think is every bit as amazing as yours. If I have to give up on them to make you proud, then you aren't the ponies I thought you were. I don't care if I disappoint you. You disappoint me.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Did you just tell our professors you were disappointed in them?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Something tells me those weren't actually our professors. Besides, they tried to get between me and my friends.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: That's all very sweet. Now, can we please get out of here?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [grunting] You! You're not Headmare Twilight, are you?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [gasps] You're the Tree of Harmony!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Tree of Harmony turned into a sparkly version of our headmare to talk to us? Did I miss a chapter in class?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm a bit rusty on pony history. But since when does the Tree of Harmony trap creatures in a cave with their biggest fears?!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [gasps] Our friendship got us past our fears!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: W-We just learned a friendship lesson from a tree, didn't we?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You're all right! I came back with my notes and saw this and didn't know what to think!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We're better than all right! We just got tested by the Tree of Harmony! And we totally passed!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: The Tree of Harmony? Here?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yeah! Well, below here. Under the school! We found this and went down and met the Tree, and Gallus was all, [imitating Gallus] "Friendship is not in our nature." And the Tree was like, "Whaaaaat?!" And it tested us!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Long story short, friendship is in our nature. The Tree said so.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I guess we should tell somepony there's a giant magical hole in the library.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Or not.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: We have to tell our professors about this! They won't believe that<U+0097>!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You can't!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Why no?

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Because... it's my fault. You were all getting along so well, and I felt left out. I was jealous. And it upset you so much, the Tree of Harmony had to test you. [gasps] Oh! I'm gonna get expelled for sure! [crying] Please don't tell anypony about this! Especially the professors! Please, please, please<U+0097>!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Okay! [yawns] I'm actually too tired to do anything right now.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: Yeah, but we can't go to sleep. We'll miss the test.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [yawns] The test! I almost forgot!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [yawns] We're all gonna fail.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: What if I tell Professor Sparkle I needed help organizing these books, and you were all kind enough to pitch in? I'll get you an extension!

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: [yawns] Thanks, Cozy. That's nice of you.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: I'm just so sorry I caused all of this. You're such good friends. I'm sorry I ever doubted you.

title: What Lies Beneath
dialog: You get some rest. Don't give any of this another thought. Just let Cozy take care of everything.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I can't believe you two are going on a friendship quest! This is amazing!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: What do you mean, Twilight? We've been on one together before.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Exactly! This is the first time the map has teamed up the same ponies for a second quest!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: That is special.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Heh. Must be 'cause we're extra good at solvin' friendship problems.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I hope so, 'cause it looks like this one might be a little tricky. You're going to the Peaks of Peril.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: The Peaks of... P-P-Peril?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Aw, it's just a name. It doesn't mean anythin'.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Like how Cloudsdale is in the clouds and the Crystal Empire's made of crystal?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Fair point. So, what can ya tell us about the place, Twilight?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Only what Rockhoof told me. Back in his day, nopony knew much about the Peaks of Peril except for the legend on this ancient shield. It says a group called the Kirin used to live there, known for their kindness and truth-speaking.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Now we know why the Map called us.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Unfortunately, other creatures also lived there. The Nirik, fearsome beasts of pure fire.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Sorry, Fluttershy. Flanks don't lie.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Aw, I'm sure the two of us'll get that friendship problem solved, no matter what kind o' creature has it.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Guess nopony else is goin' out as far as we are.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Maybe they know something we don't?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Now, Fluttershy, I've told you a dozen times. There's nothin' to be sca<U+0097>

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [screams] You really startled us.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: We get the picture. Why?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, maybe there's a little somethin' to be scared of.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Yah!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: There. That should be enough flowers to keep your tree cozy.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Fluttershy! What are you doin'?! This is no time for visitin' varmints! We're on a friendship quest, remember?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Yes, but actua<U+0097>

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Come on! We're burnin' daylight!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I know, but what I found out is that<U+0097>

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Now, we gotta get up that peak! I figure if we use some rope and elbow grease, we can make it up half<U+0097>

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Applejack! Can you please listen to me?! [clears throat] What I'm trying to say is the squirrels told me a shortcut they take to the Kirin village.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Oh. [chuckles] Sorry, Fluttershy. I suppose I got a little too caught up in the adventure.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: That's all right. If you hadn't come back to get me, I probably would've talked to the squirrels all day. Heh.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Show yourself!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, hi. I'm Applejack, and this here's Fluttershy.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: If you have any friendship problems, we're here to help.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Huh. [to Fluttershy] Quiet bunch, ain't they? [clears throat] We're from Equestria, and we're plumb tickled to meet y'all.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: S-So, uh... what are your names?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [stressing] Ap-ple-jack! Flut-ter-shy! Remember?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [whispering, to Applejack] Maybe they don't understand us.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [stressing] Do. You. Un-der-stand. Ponish?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Oh! But you don't speak?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Don't or won't?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Will you excuse us for a moment? [to Applejack] You have to ask yes-or-no questions, or they won't answer.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Like talkin' to Angel Bunny?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Not exactly. I can always tell what Angel is feeling. But these Kirin don't show anything.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, how are we gonna solve a friendship problem if none of 'em will tell us what it is?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: These Kirin are quieter than an apple blossom on snowfall. Still, there's gotta be some way to make 'em speak. [chuckles] Beautiful day, ain't it?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [whinny] Knock, knock! Now you say, "Who's there?"

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Police. "Police who?" Police [please] say somethin'!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Uh-oh! I feel a sneeze comin' on! Aaaa-CHOOOOO!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Gesundheit.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [groans] Don't any o' y'all talk?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Now we're gettin' somewhere.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: A dark spooky path that leads into unknown territory?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Tell you what, sugarcube. You stay and see if you can get anythin' outta these here Kirin. I'll go and try to find one that talks.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Phew! Be careful. And watch out for Niriks!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [yelps] Phew! [yelps] Oh. Have you seen a Kirin that talks?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Any idea where I should look?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Oh, for the love of Celestia! Can't ya just say somethin'?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: That... was somethin', all right.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Oh, wow. [gasps] This... is amazin'.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I was gonna say it's pretty. But yeah.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Whoa there. Vow of silence?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I hope it's not a sore subject, but... you mind explainin' why y'all went quiet in the first place?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [sighs] You'd rather not talk about it?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I-I under<U+0097>

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [gasps] I can't believe it! Nopony should give up feelin'... their feelin's just to keep from gettin' angry!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [gasps] I bet this here's the problem that Fluttershy and I came to help y'all with!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Right... Well, I'm thinkin' if we just go talk to the other Kirin, we can get 'em to welcome you back proper-like. Maybe even convince 'em to take your cure.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: There's no cure left?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [sighs] Well, this wouldn't be a friendship quest if it was easy. I'm gonna start by gettin' your friends to welcome you back!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [panting] Fluttershy! Guess what!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Bet that's a problem the Kirin never have.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [giggles] No.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Anyhow, we gotta get 'em all talkin' again.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Oh, no-no-no-no-no! We can't ever let that happen!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I thought you said you figured out the friendship problem. Was somethin' lost in translation?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: The Kirin are usually peaceful and kind. But when they get mad, they turn into Niriks, creatures made of fire and vengeance!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Heh. That seemed less scary when it was in a song.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: The last time they all argued, they got so angry, they accidentally destroyed their whole village. So the Kirin decided to make sure it would never happen again.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: But that's no reason to stop talkin'.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Yes, it is! Fire is dangerous, especially in a forest like this. Why, think of all the animals it could hurt.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Not if they don't turn into fire-breathin' Nirik in the first place.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: And how can you be sure that won't happen?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: There's gotta be a better way than givin' up all your feelin's!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Applejack! You're not listening!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: 'Cause you're not talkin' any sense!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Um, what are they doing?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [grunts] Maybe they got worried because we were arguing with each other.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Aw, shucks! We were just havin' a normal, civil disagreement! Honest!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: To the Stream of Silence! If we hit that water, we'll never be able to talk or feel anythin' ever again!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: It's all right. I think I know this one. And she's tryin' to help.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: She talks?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: You have no idea. Fluttershy, meet Autumn Blaze.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, thank you for that... um, wall of fire. But I thought Niriks were dangerous when they're angry. How did you know you could control your temper?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: And givin' up happiness to keep away anger is no kind o' life.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I never thought of it that way. I can't imagine not being able to talk to my animal friends.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I know you're worried about fightin'. But friends can disagree without causin' a ruckus.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Everypony gets mad sometimes. Even Applejack and I argue.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: What?! When do we ever argue?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [clears throat] On the way here? And about the Kirin being silent? And right now!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: We don't always see eye-to-eye. But we never let that get in the way of our friendship.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: And if you're really angry, then take some time away to be a Nirik where it won't hurt anypony.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I-I think they're tryin' to say somethin'.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: That's wonderful! Uh, isn't it?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, it would be. Except there aren't any flowers left to make the cure.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Are you sure?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Hmm. I wish she'd told us what kind of flowers she's looking for.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: They're called foal's-breath.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: I've never heard of that.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Uh, Fluttershy? A little help?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [gasps] He says he knows where to find more foal's-breath!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Well, what are we waitin' for? Lead the way!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [gasps] That's what foal's-breath looks like?!

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Autumn Blaze never would've made it past the Peaks to search here. I owe you an apology.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: Why?

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: 'Cause if your kindness hadn't made you stop to help the squirrels, we never would've found this here flower.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: And if your honesty hadn't convinced the Kirin to talk, we wouldn't need to find it.

title: Sounds of Silence
dialog: [chuckles] Guess it's a good thing the map sent both of us, huh?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Woo-hoo-hoo!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Whoa! Ta-da!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Okay, Spike. Now let's try a flip. Remember <U+0096> two flaps, then straight up!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Got it!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You're doing great, Spike. Now let's see the big finish!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Whoa-oa-oa-oa!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [grunts] I don't know about "big", but I am definitely finished.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Maybe I should get Rainbow Dash. She's the one who taught me advanced flying techniques.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: No, thanks. If I'm gonna mess up, I'd rather do it in front of you. I just don't understand why none of your advice is helping.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Because she's teaching you to fly like a pony instead of a dragon.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What's the difference?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, we don't have feathers, for starters.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Ye-he-he-hes!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Wow! Thank you so much! How did you know I just needed to bend my wings?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Honestly, this is Dragon 101. Usually dragon parents teach this stuff.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Spike, I've been thinking about our flying lesson.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh-huh...

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I can't believe I overlooked something as simple as feathers. It's no wonder you were having trouble. I wish I had more "dragonish" knowledge to give you. Do you think being raised by ponies has affected you in other ways? Spike?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Did you say something, Twilight? Sorry. I'm just finishing up this "thank-you" throw pillow for Smolder. And you know how I get when I'm in the embroidery zone.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: It's a pillow! But not for your head. Although it could be. It's a throw pillow. They're more casual. You can use 'em anywhere. You don't like it.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh, it's not that. It's just dragons don't really use pillows. At all.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hey, what's that?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I don't know. But it's... heading right for us!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Okay. Now I really owe you for the lesson.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You all right?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Yeah. What happened?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: To what?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Ow...

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Maybe not. But you're hurt and need help. So I'm taking you to Twilight's castle whether you like it or not?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm glad Spike brought you here, Sludge. I understand you made quite the impression in town.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Literally! There's a hole and everything!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: It doesn't look like you're in much shape to do anything.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Darling, do be careful.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm... [groans] ...fine.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I can't watch!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You're not the first stubborn dragon we've met, you know?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: And sometimes, even dragons need help.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I promise. My friends and I will only do enough to get you back on your claws.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I know you had your reservations, but it's good to see you feeling better.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: T-Thanks, I guess.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: That's what friends are for, darling.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You're pretty lucky to have friends like these, kid.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Actually, I was orphaned as an egg, and Twilight raised me. So these ponies are more than my friends. They're my family.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: We try our best, but sometimes I worry that maybe Spike is...

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Missing something deep down and dragonish.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Really? Wow. I-I can't tell you how glad I am to hear that.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Why in Equestria would you be glad to hear that?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I wasn't gonna say anything since your life seemed so perfect, but I have a confession to make. Coming to Ponyville wasn't an accident. I was looking for you. Spike... [sighs] I'm your father.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [continues gasping] Sorry.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: So you crashed in Ponyville on purpose?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, the crash part wasn't on purpose, but heading here was. I've been searching everywhere for you, kid.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Did you ask in the Crystal Empire? I'm kind of well-known there.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Actually, Spike's well-known everywhere. Not a lot of dragons were hatched by the Princess of Friendship.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Mm-hmm.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [choked up] You make it sound so simple. I wish you'd been there to help me search.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I can't believe it. I have so many questions.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, ask away. Answering questions is what dads are for.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I guess my biggest question is simple. Why was I an orphaned egg?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [stammers] You sure you don't want to ask something else? [choked up] It's a lot of painful memories. [sighs] Your mother was the best dragon I'd ever met.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [voiceover] The Dragon Lord even picked her to scout for the Great Migration, and-and even though she just laid your egg, we knew she'd have to go. But finding the Migration route could take a lifetime, and you deserved a chance to know your mother. So I went looking for you, carrying your egg to places no dragon or pony has ever been. Past Mount Aris, the abandoned home of the Hippogriffs...

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Ooh! Did you visit Klugetown?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You've been to Klugetown?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Also, the Hippogriffs returned to Mount Aris after we helped them defeat the Storm King.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh, well, have you heard of the Land of the... Scale Collectors?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh-uh.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [to Spike] Because that's where your mother's trail finally led.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [voiceover] To a prison world of dragon hunters, where I was forced to choose between surrendering myself or surrendering your egg.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [voiceover, choked up] Of course, there was no way I was gonna sacrifice my boy. So they took me instead, and that's where I'd been ever since.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Locked up somewhere not even the Princess of Friendship has heard of.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Whoa... How did you know I was a boy?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Whatever happened to Spike's mom?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: And how did the egg make it all the way back to Equestria by itself?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hmm?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, that's all in the past. The only thing that matters now is that we're together. And I'm gonna make up for lost time.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I hope you don't mind, but I have a list of all the things I always wanted to do with my dad?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Mind? Spike, my boy, with you by my side, I feel like we could do anything. What do you want to do first?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, I've kind of been working on a list for a long time.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Dude, you want to do all of this?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh. I mean, w-we don't have to.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: If you think doing everything on this incredibly long list is gonna fill the hole where your dragonishness should be, then that is exactly what we're gonna do!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Woo-hoo!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh, yeah!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I can't believe we got so many things done. But this is all my stuff. Is there anything you always wanted to do with me?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Not really.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uhhh, I mean, uh, I'm happy to do whatever you want. But if I had a castle like this with all this stuff, I'd probably just lay around all day doing nothing like a real dragon.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Like a real dragon?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Sure! I'm not surprised you don't know any better. Twilight basically raised you as a pony. You're barely a dragon at all.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Huh?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hey, Spike! How are things going with Sludge?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Honestly, I thought having him around would make me feel more dragonish. But I kind of feel less.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh, I'm sorry. I wish I could help.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Awww, shucks. [chewing noisily] I guess I shouldn't have said anything about you being more pony than dragon. I just wish we had more in common.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Maybe you two can come up with ways to turn up Spike's, uh, dragonishness.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You think that's something we can do?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You know what, son? I think it is!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Spike, I'm gonna teach you a thing or two about being a dragon. So, listen up, my boy, because I'm only gonna say this once.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: It's pretty sweet, right?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You can't be a dragon here

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh, I can't?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Look at these books up on the wall

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hey, I just finished organizing those!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: This treasure pile's not right, I fear

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What do I do?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Just grab it all and give to me After that, then you'll be free You just can't be a dragon heeeeere!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Ha! You're right! I feel better already!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: See? What did I tell you? You're very lucky that I found you. Now, go get me some more.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You got it! I'm gonna go get you all the cushy pony stuff I've got... Dad.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Great! Go get 'em... son!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Spike? I just thought I'd check to see if you and Sludge had any luck turning up your dragonishness. It's hard not to feel like somehow I let you down all these years.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh! I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to barge in on ya!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [grunts, sighs] Ah, don't worry about it. Mi castle es su castle.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Right. Well, I'll just get out of your way.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh! Spike! I'm so sorry. My morning is not going well. What is all this? Why'd you leave the castle so early?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I didn't leave. I spent the night outdoors to get in touch with my dragon side.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Outdoors?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Yeah! And Sludge asked me to bring him the best breakfast Ponyville has to offer so he can show me how a real dragon would eat it. See you later!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: ...And that's why I thought we could use the map to<U+0097>

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hey, gang! Dad was just showing me how a real dragon would act in a throne room.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Dragons like to sprawl when they get their claws done. [blows] Now, if you'll all excuse me, it's time for my bath.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [sighs] Isn't he the best?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm not sure that's exactly the word I would use.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh, Spike? The bath isn't gonna fill itself, son.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Be right there... Dad.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm glad you're not spending the night outside again.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh, I am. I'm just looking for a good bedtime story to read to my dad first.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: It's nice that you have somepony to show you dragon culture. But are you sure that's what Sludge is doing?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What do you mean?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, taking over your room, making a mess of things...

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [scoffs] That is dragon culture.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You never acted like that.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: That's because you raised me. Now I finally have a chance to see how I'm supposed to be.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I don't think you're supposed to be any different than who you are.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Maybe you just don't like that I have a real parent now.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: That's not true! I'm glad Sludge is here. I-I just wish he wasn't such a<U+0097>

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Dragon? Of all ponies, I can't believe you would have a problem with that.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What happened to you?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Just sleeping outside like we're meant to. It's not like dragons are supposed to live in castles.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I... guess not. But I live in the school. Nothing says we have to live outside.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [sighs] I'm so confused. It's been great having Sludge show me how to be a real dragon, but Twilight just doesn't get it.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What do you mean?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: She can't handle how good at being a dragon Sludge is. Maybe someday, I'll be able to lay around doing nothing as well as he does.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Well, not now, of course. I'm too busy bringing him pony stuff so he can show me what a dragon would do with it.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: So, Sludge just lays around while you wait on him claw and tail? Uh, dragons are rude and rebellious, but they aren't lazy lumps who take advantage of their kids.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Huh. Now I'm really confused.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Me, too. Why don't you tell me everything Sludge said about being a dragon?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [chewing noisily] Hey! What's going on, son?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Twilight doesn't like having real dragons in the castle, so I told her we're moving out.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: [coughs] You what?!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Spike! I found the perfect cave where you two can live! There aren't even any comfortable rocks inside!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: That does sound perfect!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: No, it doesn't! I-I-I mean, uh, I'm not sure I fully demonstrated all the ways a dragon would live here.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: But we're not gonna live here anymore, so it doesn't matter.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: It matters to me! [stammers] I want to make sure you have all the knowledge you need.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: But I do. Dad, you've already shared so much. [singing] This bed is much too soft Just take that silk robe off We can't be dragons living here

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Stop! I'm not your father!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: What?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I just said that to get in on this sweet castle life.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: So... you... pretended to be my dad?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Now-now-now-now-now, don't look at me like that, kid. I did what any dragon would do.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: No. You didn't.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Hey. I saw an opportunity, and I took it. That's what dragons do.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: No. It isn't.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: You know what? I don't need this. I'm out of here! Enjoy lovin' pony town!

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm taking this pillow.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I can't believe I thought somepony like that could show me how to be anything.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Uh... it must be hard growing up not really knowing who you are.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: That's the thing. I know exactly who I am. And how I got that way.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Um, Twilight?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh. Hi. Where's your father?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: He's gone. Turns out he wasn't what a real dragon should be after all. He also wasn't my real dad.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Oh, Spike. I'm so sorry.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I'm the one who's sorry. You were just worried about me, and I lost my temper. Sludge was just a great big phony.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I have to say, I'm not surprised. There's no way a dragon like that was related to you. But if you still want to search for your real family, I'd understand if you spent more time in the Dragon Lands.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: I don't think so. I already know who my real family is.

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Aww! It's me, right?

title: Father Knows Beast
dialog: Mm-hmm! Besides, there's no way I'm living without pillows.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Thank you for the mail delivery. Have a wonderful day!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You're new here, right? I'm Cozy Glow, Professor Sparkle's friendship assistant. Welcome to our school! Your first class is just down that hall.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: A seven-letter word for "teamwork". Have you tried "synergy"?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That's it! Thanks, Cozy!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: What are friends for?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Good morning, Professor Sparkle!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Don't worry. I asked Professor Rainbow Dash to cover for you.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: And she said yes?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Uh-huh. I told her how busy you are and how much her loyalty meant to you. I also color-coded your teaching schedule by friendship element and catalogued all the magical artifacts in the school. I hope that's okay.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Okay? Cozy, that's amazing! You're like my right-hoof pony! I don't know what I'd do without you.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [giggles] It's like you taught me. Helping is what friendship's all about.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Exactly. And hopefully my class is learning that on their field trip right now.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I heard they might do some sightseeing first.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Ta-da! The Pegasus Weather Factory! Every drop of rain or flake of snow from Cloudsdale comes from there.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I know, right? Hey! The cool stuff's over here!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Wow! I've never stood on a cloud before!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You can't normally. But for our trip, I cast a spell that lets us walk like Pegasi.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Hey, Yona! Come check out this view! Unless you're too scared.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [teeth chattering] Yona not scared! [screams] Now Yona scared!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Come on! We gotta catch 'em!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Gotcha!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: It's okay, Yona! You like flying, remember?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Flying, not falling!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I don't understand. It-It's like my spell stopped working. That's... never happened before.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We have an emergency!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: The students dropped out of the sky!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Slow down. What happened?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I cast a spell for our field trip to Cloudsdale, but my magic just failed.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We barely caught everypony in time!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I'm glad you're all okay, but I'm sure it's nothing to worry about, Starlight. Maybe you did your spell wrong. Let's take a look.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I didn't drop that book.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [sarcastically] Maybe you did your spell wrong?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Ow!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Rarity ran into the door.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [sobbing] My magic is go-o-o-one! I even had to use my hooves to coif my tail!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Still think there's nothing to worry about?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: This doesn't make any sense. Magic can't just disappear. Something has to be causing this.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Um, didn't we learn in class about a creature that eats magic? Ter, Tee... Tir-something?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] Tirek!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Isn't he trapped in Tartarus?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Spike, what's wrong?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [gagging, belches, sighs] Thanks. I've never had a letter get stuck before. It's from Princess Celestia! We've all been called to an emergency meeting in Canterlot! Look!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Pretty sure I know what it's about.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Throughout our city, ponies have been reporting tales of their magic failing. Spells going wrong. Potions not working.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Even raising the moon has become difficult. Are there similar troubles in Ponyville?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We experienced it first-hoof.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: It's the same in my kingdom. The Crystal Heart seems safe for now, but I worry if this continues.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Ah! It is even more terrible than we feared! Magic is disappearing all across Equestria!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Star Swirl believes the power will drain from our land in three days. First, unicorn magic and spells will fail.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That's what's happening now.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: On the second day, creatures will lose their magic abilities.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] Oh, no!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: And finally, magical artifacts will stop working. When the sun sets on the third day, the magic in our world will be gone forever!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: But why is this happening now?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That's the worst part. We have no idea.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Has anypony checked on Tirek?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You mean the big, red, scary centaur who eats magic? Why would we wa<U+0097> Ohhhh. Riiiiight.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: If he has found some way to escape his prison or work from within it, he could be responsible for this.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That is the best explanation so far. Somepony should investigate.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We'll go.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no. Not without us, you wo<U+0097> Wait. Did you say "we"?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I've finally learned that it's okay to count on your friends for help. Um, you do want to come, right?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Uh, duh!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Thank you, all. We will search for ways to protect Equestria in your absence.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Be careful. Tartarus has changed since you were there. It now holds many dangerous creatures, and you won't be able to rely on your magic.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: With her friends by her side, she won't have to.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Okay. I left you my lesson plan, all my student files, and my annotated syllabus notes. If anything goes wrong, get Celestia.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Got it!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Maybe I should just close the school and send my students home.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [sighs] Would you go save Equestria already?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Okay. Cozy packed us all up for a trip to bad guy central.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Don't forget the sandwiches. I marked whose is whose, just in case. [whispering, to Spike] Starlight can't stand mustard.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That's so sweet of you, Cozy. But Twilight has asked me to stay here to run the school.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh. I thought that after what happened last time<U+0097>

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Once she's survived Discord, anything else is a piece of cake.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Plus, she'll have you to help her.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, golly, yes! I promise I'll be the best assistant ever! Come on. We can start working on your substitute headmare plans right now, if you like.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Wow. Uh, okay.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: See? Nothing to worry about. Tell me there's nothing to worry about.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Good morning, friendship students! I know we're all sad Professor Sparkle is away. But don't worry, because she left me in charge to do things just the way she would.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Uh, I thought Starlight Glimmer was gonna be temporary headmare.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: She was, but she left me this note. [reading] "I have to go. Twilight needs my help. I know the school is in good hooves with you, Cozy." [giggles] Isn't that sweet? We won't let Starlight down, will we?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: It's just kind of weird, isn't it?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I don't know what you mean.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Like, why'd she change her mind? Why did Starlight write a note instead of saying goodbye to us herself? Doesn't make any sense.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [giggles] Oh, Smolder, you forget. We're not scheming dragons. We're ponies. Sounds like somecreature needs to do a little extra friendship homework.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Yak not pony either! If Smolder get homework, Yona get homework.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Me, too!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I'm in!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Yeah! [laughs] Homework party!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [groans] Fine.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: What loyalty. Professor Rainbow Dash would be so proud. You are such good friends. You all are. And I'm grateful because it will be awfully hard running a whole school alone. Can I count on each of you to help me?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Thank you so much! It's just like our professors taught us. Together, we can get through anything!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Ow! Ugh! I have had it with these horrible flies! [whines] I miss my magic!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Have you tried using your tail to shoo them away?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [gasps] Bite your tongue! It's for decorative purposes only!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Hey! I didn't know we packed green cupcakes.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Um, we didn't. They must've gone bad without magic to keep them cold.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: "Magic" this, "magic" that. We don't need magic to go on a little hike.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You were saying?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You just need to think more like Earth ponies, y'all. Granny's "Apple Core No-Bite-No-More"! That'll keep the flies off.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [sniffs] Ugh! It smells just like it looks!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Even if our food's spoiled, these blueberries are still good to eat.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Too bad we can't do anything about the rainstorm.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I can't stop that storm by myself, but I can still help!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I think we have all the magic we need right here. Not that I don't want to get it back. Heh. Let's go!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Uh, temporary headmare? Right, guys?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Finally! We thought you forgot about study club.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Sorry I'm late. Cozy Glow gave our class tickets to a Sapphire Shores concert in Ponyville tonight.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You get the feeling Cozy's trying too hard to make us like her?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Or maybe she just wants to help us keep our minds off of how scary it is that magic's disappearing.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I don't trust her. What's she up to behind those big eyes and bouncy curls?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: And why Cozy pony coming out of catacombs so late at night?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Let's go ask her.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: This is the only door to Tartarus. The good news is the seal isn't broken, so we know Tirek didn't escape.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Let me guess. You got bad news, too?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Last time I was here, I had to use magic to get in. And according to Star Swirl, all unicorn magic was gone by yesterday's sunset.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Maybe he was wrong.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Don't worry, Twilight. I got this.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Free pizza delivery!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Huh. Always worked before. Oh, well.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Did any of y'all pack somethin' that could actually help?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: These all do magic, but not the kind we're looking for, I'm afraid.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: How about this?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: The Key of Unfettered Entrance! Where did you find this, Spike?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: In your bag. Cozy Glow must've packed it for you.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: She really did think of everything.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Um, what does it do?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: It can magically open any door. And since artifacts like this haven't lost their power yet...

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I guess it only works once.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Cockatrice!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Do something, Fluttershy!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Don't look at it! It'll turn you to stone!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I don't feel like stone.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Unless it's really bouncy stone.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I think he lost his magic, too. All the creatures here must have.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Star Swirl said that would happen on the second day.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I know it should make me feel safer, but it just makes me sad. We gotta fix this!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Where is Princess Twilight?!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, golly. She's away on a quest. I'm watching the school for her.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Magic is failing across our land, and she left a foal in charge of this facility?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Yes, sir! Is there anything I can do for you?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That won't be necessary. Twilight's folly stops here. As of now, I am headstallion. And I have quite a few changes to make.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: If all these monsters lost their magic, then getting past Cerberus should be easy-peasy!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Look out!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I'll talk to him.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Um, excuse me, puppy?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You're a very good guard dog. Yes, you are. But, um, we were wondering if we could get by to check on Tirek.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That looks like a yes.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I'll get you a towel, darling.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: The Princess of Friendship here for a visit. What have I done to earn the honor of your company?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We want answers, Tirek. Magic is disappearing from Equestria.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I know. What a waste of such... [slurping] ...mmmm, delicious power.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: So you are behind this!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Silly filly, if I had all of that magic, you think I'd still be locked up in here? But I might know something about it...

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: What are you doing?! Those are Twilight's student files!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: These aren't. Not anymore. With Equestria under attack, ponies must stand together. Twilight has endangered us all by skipping off on friendship trips while these dangerous creatures run loose.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You don't think they're the reason magic is disappearing, do you?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Yes, and I came to warn Twilight. But since she is gone, it falls to me to protect you foals from these monsters.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Did you hear something?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: It sounded like it came from over there!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: You again. As I suspected.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: From now on, this school is pony-only! As nature intended.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Since you refuse to explain your plot against Equestria and return the magic you stole, you will stay here while I summon your guardians to take you home.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Wait! You were right about them from the beginning, Chancellor. I see that now.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: What are you saying?!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Sandbar?!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I don't want anything to do with creatures that could threaten Equestria!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Wisely put, colt.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Everypony will come to their senses eventually.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: What in tarnation?!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Sorry. I ran out of apples. I need the Cutie Mark Crusaders. My friends are in trouble. Chancellor Neighsay locked them up.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Huh? I thought Cozy Glow was in charge.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Not anymore. But you guys are good buddies. If you can convince her to distract Neighsay, I can break out my friends. Will you help me?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Do mulberries have seeds?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: That's a yes.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Where is Equestria's magic going, Tirek? What's making it disappear?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: If you let me out, I'm sure it will jog my memory. What do you say? I scratch your back, you scratch mine?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: How about you tell us what you know or you'll be stuck here forever, because we're out of magic keys and nopony can open the door?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, dear. I hadn't thought of that.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: We're just as trapped as Tirek?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: [chuckles] What a pity. Well, for you. Sweet revenge for me. It seems my little prot<e9>g<e9>'s plan worked after all.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Which little prot<e9>g<e9>?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, we've never met. We're pen pals. Each letter had so many questions about draining magic.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: And you answered them?!

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: I was bored. So I simply pointed my pen pal in the right direction.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Can't you just tell us your pen pal's name? I mean, since we're stuck here anyway?

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Oh, why not? The irony is too perfect. Her name is...

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Cozy Glow! I-I could've sworn I saw her come down this way when she left her office.

title: School Raze - Part 1
dialog: Enjoying yourself in there, Starlight? I'm sorry I had to push you in. But what else could I do? You were going to ruin all my plans.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Magic is disappearing all across Equestria!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Didn't we learn about a creature that eats magic?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Somepony should investigate.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We'll go.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I thought Starlight Glimmer was gonna be temporary headmare.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: With Equestria under attack, ponies must stand together.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I need the Cutie Mark Crusaders. My friends are in trouble.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: It seems my little prot<e9>g<e9>'s plan worked after all.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Cozy Glow is behind all of this?!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Um, there's seven of us.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I knew we shouldn't have left!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: But Starlight's in charge at the school. If anypony can stop Cozy Glow, it's her.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We have to get out of here. Her students can't handle Cozy on their own.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Not everything can be solved with brute force. We need magic to escape.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Maybe there's a way to get out without magic. Like a secret lever or a secret button or a secret admirer who knows a secret about you but is all, "Your secret's safe with me because I put it in Tartarus and I have a key!"

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I'm afraid not. The most powerful villains and monsters of all time are trapped here. And without our magic, so are we.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Unless... These creatures might be losing their magical powers, but there's still a magic that makes up what they are. Maybe we can borrow some of that.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Uh, excuse me? Um, Chancellor Neighsay?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: You might as well get used to calling me Headstallion Neighsay. I plan to be here for quite some time.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Gee, it sure is a relief to have somepony in charge, what with the magical crisis going on. And we're all so grateful to you for taking care of those... non-ponies. But doesn't the EEA need you?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: What the EEA needs is somepony to protect this school from the threats at Equestria's borders instead of gallivanting off on adventures beyond them.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Twilight didn't just run off willy-nilly. She left me in charge. I'm her right-hoof mare!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Another in a long list of mistakes the Princess of Friendship has made. Rest assured, from now on, this school shall be run according to strict EEA guidelines.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: The way it always should've been.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Well, that sounds just peachy<U+0097>

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: ...Headstallion Neighsay.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Cozy Glow did all of this? How? Why?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I don't know. But come on, y'all. We gotta get Starlight out of there before she comes back.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Wait!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Sweetie Belle!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Help!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: That's gotta be what's suckin' up all the magic in Equestria.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: But if that's true, then Twilight and the others went to Tartarus for nothing. And if all of Equestria's magic's getting sucked up in there, there's no way for them to get back!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We need to get help!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: But Starlight's trapped here, and there's no way to get word to Celestia or anypony else!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I guess we're on our own.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Still locked, huh?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We gotta at least try to get out.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Why? If Sandbar's turned his back on us, every other pony probably has, too.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Sandbar not turn his back! Sandbar is our friend!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Uh, did you miss the part where he said he didn't want anything to do with us?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Maybe he just said that so one of us could be free to snoop around and figure out what's going on.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I dunno. That sounds too clever for a pony to come up with.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: [gasps, laughs] Yona knew Sandbar was still our friend!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We all are.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Except for Cozy Glow. That pony is not who we thought she was.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: She's the one draining magic out of Equestria!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: We'll explain on the way. But right now, we gotta get to get to Chancellor Neighsay.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Huh?

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I know he doesn't like non-ponies. But if we tell him what's going on, he'll help.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: I am sure you are all concerned about the magic situation. But I want to assure you that this institution is safe, despite the absence of your headmare. As your new headstallion, let me be the first to say that the reign of Princess Twilight is over! From now on, this school will adhere to EEA doctrine, as it should have from the start!

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: [claps] Thank you, Chancellor Neighsay, for that rousing speech. I know you're a stallion who truly believes what you say. And when you say this school will be run according to EEA doctrine, I know you mean it. And when you say there won't be any more lessons from the Princess of Friendship at the School of Friendship, I guess you mean that, too.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: That's not exactly what<U+0097>

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: But Twilight decided to run her school outside of the EEA guidelines. And even though you tried to stop her, Princesses Celestia and Luna trusted her enough to support her.

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: Well, I-I wouldn't say that<U+0097>

title: School Raze - Part 2
dialog: So, since I know you mean what you say, my question is really for the students. Are we going to give the pony who already tried to wreck Twilight's school once another chance to do it?

title: School Raze - Part 2
